This review if for a certain waiting staff. We had our Marine Corp Ball at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel last Nov 10. It was a big event and there were a lot of people. Some of the waiters and waitress are not smiling. Understandable because of all the work to be done and people to serve. Even though its a buffet, still so much to do. But this waiter stood up among the rest. His name is Humberto Aguilar Fajardo. I asked his name because he is part of our memorable evening. Marine Corp Ball, for me it is a big thing because of the sacrifices our spouses makes and thats the only time we could dress up nicely and honor our love ones. And this waiter was all smile serving us, asking us if everything is ok. Even though I could see he was so busy, he still has that beautiful smile and joyful personality. I truly appreciate it because it completes the experience. The customer service is a huge part of what you pay for. So thank you Sir! Keep up the good work and keep on smiling.

It's very much Paris alright -- even though half the time it feels more like someone had watched An American in Paris and cribbed the movie's idealized ways than actual France.  But they're rather nice, even if I did trip over a cobblestone more than once.

The creepy overtanned "Anthony Cool" staring at you all over the casino in adverts is unnerving!  It's like he's judging me for not being the color of a Thanksgiving turkey.  

The rooms are nice and clean.  The restaurants in Paris, even that buffet that costs $25+ without alcohol, are pretty delightful.  Try Mon Ami Gabi at night, outside dining, to watch the Bellagio shows.  

Be scared of the turkey colored guy...

Great location on The Strip.  The rooms are clean and the front desk is friendly.  Both the brunch and dinner buffets are delicious however be prepared to wait in queue if you are not a Diamond\/Seven Seas member.

By far my one of my favorite hotels on the Las Vegas strip.  Clean and pristine room comfortable beds and linens.  The replica of the Eiffel Tower is always a nice sight...but at night, it becomes spectacular.  The only negative thing I have to say is, I really hate the faux cobblestone streets - they're not good to walk while sober or after  drinking.  I hated the real things cobblestone streets in Paris and really REALLY hate the faux ones at this hotel\/casino...but when you're sticking to a Parisian theme, I guess it's OK.

ROOM: 1\/5
Beds: Lumpy and loud. It sort of felt like we were sleeping on dry rice balls instead of the plush mattress we were expecting.

Cleanliness: Pretty filthy. Dust on and under every surface, dark stains splattered across the carpet, more stains on the drapes... ugh. A nightmare.

Decor: Horribly outdated. I'm sure it would have looked very spiffy in the '60s, but it's way past time for a remodel. True Paris hotels haven't looked like this in decades.

Bathroom: In a word: uncomfortable. It was small, it smelled nasty, and the water pressure was awful.

CASINO: 2\/5
Atmosphere: Fun, but it's incredibly crowded, all the time. Breathing room? Forget about it. Even if you can afford the tables, you'll have little luck finding an empty spot to squeeze into.

Decor: Colorful and fun. The Eiffel Tower ride is a wonderful way to get some decent snapshots of the Strip.

Machines: They're missing most of the newest machines (Blackjack, Poker). This is very disappointing. If all you care about is playing the cheap slots, though, then you may not mind as much.

Tables: They're very short on tables, and what tables they do have are always overpriced -- $25 is a typical minimum for most nights.

FOOD: 4\/5
Paris sports one of the best buffets in Vegas, and the little cafes and eateries are wonderful. It's rather limited in the way of hearty dinner options, though -- this place is mostly big on breakfast.

FINAL NOTES
The rooms are awful; I will never, ever stay here again. I also never bother gambling here because of the table prices and the crowds. The buffet, however, is definitely worth braving said crowds.

Save your time and money. This is a place to avoid, especially for the LGBTQ community. We purchased tickets for NYE which to put it lightly was false advertising. 

The tickets were for open bar 9pm-12am. We got there at 8:00pm and didn't get in until after 11pm!!! And that's only because we had to argue with security to let us up in front of a party bus group that cut in front of us who had been waiting so long. 

Once inside we waited in line for the rooftop. We waited 30 minutes for the lift. Half of my party made it up. While my friend and I were just about to the front of the line the security told us that no one else was allowed up unless you had a certain color band. My band I received with my ticket was yellow and they were only letting up green bands. Many of us in the crowd were obviously upset. 

We waited hours to get in to an oversold event where the customer service was poor. When we all asked why ,the answer given by the security was that "The rooftop is past capacity" and "No one else will be allowed up unless you've purchased a table". This was a common theme we heard from Chateau as when we received our tickets from Will Call they said the event had been oversold and they were expecting over 2500 people there. 

My other half of my group was able to make it back down to us before midnight which was a good thing but we were upset to hear they had to complain in order to be let down. They tried to leave via the stairs to be told to use the elevator and then told they couldn't go down, essentially forcing them to stay up there which is illegal to not give proper exit for someone. 

The other disappointment came when I was dancing with my fiancÃ©. Being a gay couple in Vegas you'd think it would be a safe place from discrimination, especially at a club at the Paris, however we were wrong. We were getting a bit close on the dance floor and ended up dancing against an empty couch. One could visibly see other couples doing the very same. Then a staff member came over to us and told us we couldn't be doing that. I wouldn't have minded that, if they had done that to the opposite sex couples as well, however they didn't. 

This was a horribly disappointing and very unorganized event and club. I can't stress enough to stay away. The "open bar" was a scam as we didn't even get in till 11:30pm and even then the bartender told us they were only serving us two drinks and we couldn't just drink there all night because of our wrist bands (which gave us open bar btw). We complained and told them "we've waited hours to get in and purchased an open bar and we only have till midnight, so what do you mean we can't keep drinking?" The bartender wouldn't answer and walked away. We hadn't even been intoxicated since we had been waiting to get in. 

Sadly, the only positive remark is that we did receive two drink tickets to use after midnight to compensate, however they only allowed for basic drinks and not the ones we could have received from the wrist bands. 

As a hotel and club I would hope they would change their staff and management or offer trainings on professional ways of handling people.

Paid 600 to stay at this hotel for 3 days. Wow what a disappointment. The room was too small, the hallways smelled moisty and they charged for wifi unless you pay for some resort package.  The pool are was great, their pool drinks were 18 each cocktail.  Overall the experience was not what I expected.

My wife and I stayed at the Paris for our 1st anniversary, because we went to Paris for our honeymoon, and we couldn't make our way back to Paris, so we decided to stay at the Paris hotel. This is my second stay at this hotel, and the Caesar Group does a good job in making your stay pretty enjoyable. The hotel is a little dated, but it works, because if you go to Paris, it's an old city. Maybe a fresh coat of paint in areas that's chipping off may be warranted, but the facilities otherwise is good as any on the strip. The decor in the room is fairly plain with mid-century type furniture and digital temperature controls. You get a roomy bathroom and a fridge. Obviously, we didn't spring for their best room, but still, was great. Everything worked, and the housekeeping did a great job. We'll deifnitely be back. I kept losing my Total Rewards card while I was gambling, but they were happy to make me a new card everytime. Haha. Love this place!

disclaimer: this rating is for the buffet restaurant at Paris.
i didnt stay at the hotel...but heard about the Le Village Buffet from my brother.

we had to wait for about 30-45 minutes. but it was worth the wait, seriously.

we came in just between breakfast and lunch. (around 9:50 am or so). so we were able to enjoy a bunch of stuff!
the crepes are deeelish...
so was the roast chicken during lunch. service was very good too. they topped off our drinks as needed. 
wish i could go there again!

I loved the Paris and had no complaints at all about it.  
The whole theme with the Eiffel tower was beautiful and romantic.  I come to vegas alot and when my boyfriend and I stayed it was the 2nd most romantic time we had there.  The first was our first ever trip.
I felt like a princess the whole time.  Clean rooms, clean casino, the Buffet was AMAZING for Breakfast!!!  Loved the whole experience we stayed over New Years and got an upgrade to a room with a view of the strip and the Bellagio Fountains which was awesome to see from that far up.
Only complaint was Valet,  it got full fast but of course we were there at a busy time of year.  
The Eiffel tower experience was beautiful.  Highly Recommend it and the Paris!
The location on the strip is great also easy access to alot of things.

We will definatly be back once we do our rounds at some of the other hotels on our list.

Checking in to this hotel was a nightmare!!   We had our wedding, reception, and guests at Paris, and we felt like they didn't care about service at all.  We paid extra for a view of the Eiffel Tower, then paid an additional fee for a room upgrade, and the woman at the desk neglected to tell us it looked over the parking lot.  She said it was our fault because we were having a conversation during the check in process, and she was unwilling to fix it, so we called the supervisor.  I hated starting my wedding trip with complaints, but we paid a lot of money for a great experience.  The supervisor Jaylee was awesome!!  Jaylee put us in a beautiful room, overlooking the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio water show.  After that the stay was pretty decent.  

Suggestion - if the view matters to you, confirm it at check in, and if you can get the Calais suite, it is worth the extra money.

It served the purpose, a mid priced hotel room in Vegas.  I like that there isn't a long walk from the front to the rooms, for a casino it's a short walk.  The rooms are clean and well appointed.  We had 8 people in our room drinking at one point and between chairs and beds we had enough room for everybody.  The soundproofing is terrible, I could hear every conversation in the hall.  Quick check in and check out, no major problems.  It's not fancy; they don't recycle, no robes, and no in room coffee or amenities.

Thought $42 a night with a $25 food and beverage coupon was a bargain, but not so. First there is the mandatory $20 "resort fee" for the fitness center and one-device-only wifi. Then there are no complimentary toothbrush\/toothpaste which means going to the gift shop and paying an arm and a leg for what would normally be a free amenity at most hotels. Finally, the restaurants in the hotel are so overpriced the food and beverage coupon basically equals to a free sandwich.  Oh, and the ATM fee is $6.

Not planning to return for a stay here anytime soon.

I have been to Vegas a number of times but this is the first time I stayed at Paris. 

Pros: location - fabulous location, right in the heart of the strip and an easy walk to most places; pool - there were lots of chairs and ample space, it was pretty to look at the Eiffel Tower as well; cost - we were able to find a great rate on hotels.com; bathroom - it was HUGE, dated, but HUGE

Cons: dated - the room felt old and musty and the linens and pillows could definitely use some upgrading; thin walls - we could hear our neighbor coughing up a lung the entire time, I guess we were lucky we only heard coughing ;)

Overall - recommended if you can get a good deal, do not pay full price for this one, there are other ones that have been upgraded and you can always get a deal at Planet Hollywood right next door if you are looking for that location

Don't think you can get out of taking your wife or girlfriend to the real Paris. That being said this is a fun little place with good restaurants, great people watching and a good size casino. It is connected to Bally's so you can walk quite a ways without having to brave the heat of the Las Vegas Strip. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Disgusting. Rooms dirty, chairs have stains, mirrors caked in dust, bathrooms have terrible towels and not enough for 2 people. Maid service non existent and we did not deny it st check in. Even the beds are old. We stayed here about 5 years ago and it was much nicer. Never again.

In terms of Strip hotels, the Paris Las Vegas is a mid-range hotel.  It certainly is not on the same level as Bellagio, Wynn, Aria yet I it is the ideal choice for those looking to avoid the stuffiness associated with the the top hotels.

I booked a Red Premier Room (Rm#2805)  which faces the Bellagio fountain and the Eiffel Tower (Rooms offer a couch that can turned to face the Bellagio fountain).  I don't think you'll find a room with a better view anywhere on the strip at any price point and I loved the 52' flat screen TV.  I would book here again and again as I could find no fault with my accommodations.

Onsite restaurants were adequate and the booked entertainment was of no interest (Manilow and some 3rd rate hypnotist yet I was not there for that.)

I am a frequent visitor of LV. Typically, I like to stay on the northern end of the strip, but because of the pleasant experiences i've had at Mon Ami Gabi and Sugar Factory, i thought the Paris hotel would be a great choice. Wrong.

The entrance and casino ambiance is inviting and pleasant to the eye. To be honest, this is why I chose the hotel. The decor won me over but due to the reasons I am about to list below, i will not be staying here again. 

1. Checking in: The employee who helped us (Corinne) did not: greet us, thank us for choosing Paris Hotel, make eye contact when speaking to us, During our 15 minute encounter she managed to over charge, then under charge us. She almost gave us money back because her math was wrong before i corrected her. She was incredibly rude to us and her surrounding employees who tried to help her because it was obvious she needed it. Tried complaining to the Manager (Fransisco), he offered $100 credit and sent us on our way.

2. The minute you leave the casino the hotel appearance dwindles before your eyes. The walls have old wall paper peeling off, the doors and baseboards are scuffed and there were two holes in the walls on my way to my room.

3. The bathroom has no lock, the furniture was old with no cushions, not enough towels, carpet is dirty, sheets were stained. It looks like a room from the 70's. 

The worst of all was the service. All employees, black jack dealers, receptionists seemed bothered, or completley clueless. Id rather stay at excalubur. Thats saying ALOT.

My husband and I stayed at Paris for three nights (Fri-Mon) last week. Our room was beautiful and clean, with a view of the pool. Paris' pool is lovely--not huge, but gets great sun, has a DJ and a food\/drink bar. The location really can't be beat. It's dead center of the strip, across from the Bellagio, with a CVS right up the street for all your alcohol and hangover needs. Vegas, in general is expensive, and Paris is no different. We ate in the hotel restaurants once, breakfast for 2 was $50. Staff were very nice and accommodating, and when there was a mix up with the price of our third night, the front desk was helpful in clearing it up. Also, there is a $40\/day resort fee, which can bring up your price, even if the room price is low. You can't avoid this fee in Vegas though--every hotel charges it. Parking was easy and $10\/day for self-park.

Overall, I would recommend Paris when you stay in Vegas.

We were very unimpressed with our stay at Paris. We stayed only one night with the kids on our way to Ca. The valet guy was rude-expected a tip no matter what the service! The air condition went out in the casino area- and when I called front desk he just says it happens there in summer. The crepes were way overpriced...three crepes, 2 slices of pizza, 2 beers, 2 sodas $65! The room was cramped, armoire broken, TV not viewable from both beds, and the shampoo sucked. Only one pool, 3 ft in all areas- just for toddlers. My hubby & I recently stayed two nights at Venetian- so much better. I plan to write management a letter but realize gone are the days when great food, drinks and service were a Vegas given - plan to be stripped of your last dollar before you even get to the tables!

This is one of my favorite hotels to sleep naked in. I especially love standing naked in front of the window with the Eiffel Tower directly in my face. Makes me feel like I conquered the world.

Casino itself is a bit small but is connected to Bally's so it's not too bad.

I've been to vegas I don't even know how many times, too many! but I've never stayed at paris until my most recent trip, for some reason I always thought of it as a "ghetto" hotel. I decided to give it a shot this time since the prices were so low and I really didn't care much for the hotel on this trip. 

to my surprise it was actually pretty nice! I would put it in similar level as TI, of course this isn't as nice as venetian\/wynn\/ecore but if you can get a great deal this is definitely a great place to stay, rooms were roomy and clean and the pool is actually really nice! (the Eiffel tower overlooks the pool)

my biggest complaint is the staff, checking in and checking out, SLOW AS HELLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL honestly the lines were all the way to the casino, and they aren't the nicest either. I highly recommend checking in and out at non-peak hours so you don't have to wait
Beautiful, opulent.  Would have given it 5 stars but the shopping selection is pretty minimal.

Good place to stay but don't gamble here! The payouts are horrible compared to Freemont Street, Tropicana, and the Station. Nice pool on top of casino area. Beds weren't that great. Shower was pretty nice. Great central location. Not bad for the price. Nice lively atmosphere. Good bang for buck hotel.

The check in desk lady who helped us named yourko or something like that was a VERY rude Asian lady. She said no room with a king size bed available when that was what we reserved. I understand that sometimes these things happen it's just how she expressed it. "Oh you came in on allegiant" very snarly. So if YOU come in on allegiant expect to be treated like a rat!!! We were then passed onto some manager Francisco who mysteriously found a room with a king size bed. Wow!!

i'm really surprised by all of the low star ratings. Paris has turned out to be one of my favorite hotels in Vegas aside from Bellagio. 

My husband and I stayed here a couple days before our wedding I loved it. Yes, they charge a resort fee, yes they charge you to check in early, yes the mini bar items are expensive- Welcome to Vegas!

I location was awesome, the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were nicely decorated and clean and spacious! I would highly recommend checking it out if you're looking for a nice place to stay in the middle of the strip.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Wish I could give it no stars. 

It was my first stay at this hotel. We checked in the 8th and checked out the 10th. On our arrival at 2pm on the 8th the front desk  let us know they didn't have a room available for early check in so they asked us to come back at 4pm. Perfectly fine, this was always a possibility. At about 3:30 we got back in line as the line was at least 20min long. When we finally got to the desk they once again let us know our room was not ready and to come back in 10min....what could possibly change within 10min?

After waiting til about 4:20 they once again let us know our room was not ready. Front desk then apologized and gave us an "upgraded room". We arrived to our floor only to find food trays on the floor. Once again I'm optimistic. Maybe the food has just been put out. The next morning we walk out to go to the pool and food trays are still there. On out way back from pool, about 4 hours later, food is still there. 

I walk in to take a shower and notice my shower wasnt working. I called down stairs and asked someone to come check it out. I then go back into bathroom to wash my hands only to find out we HAVE NO WATER. Let me repeat NO WATER. I was all oily from sun bathing all morning and hot. I called front desk again where they tell me there was an emergency and they had no other option but to shut off water. By this time it was 2pm. I was told water would come on at 3pm. Not to mention our sink was clogged and my husband and I had to wait for the water to go down. Of course the water didn't come on at 3:00pm and When I called front desk again the manager told me he would give me a call back. Which he never did. 

In the end I was comped my resort fee and a 30 gift card which I had to fight upon check out because Chris, the manager I spoke to over phone didn't leave notes about what he promised me. The manager upfront Robert swore I got a memo in my room advising me of water shut off but we didn't. And even if we did the day before the front desk staff kept telling me it was an emergency. So then it was planned? Or was it an emergency? The staff was unprofessional, they couldn't give me any straight answers, gave me no help or alternative for a wedding I had to get ready for and lied in process. 

In the end the room wasn't that great, the plumbing. Made noise all night and morning. Staff didn't care about it. And management didn't handle it properly. I would NEVER stay here again.
Un excelente hotel. Gran ubicaciÃ³n y limpieza. Buena relaciÃ³n costo-calidad. Falta wifi libre.

After the cleaning service stole from my room the claim company CCMSI would not pay for the stole item or give me a reason to why they would not. I had to deal with Ann Jirousek and she does not know what she is doing. She would not explain to me how they came up with the fact that it is ok for someone to take from another person. I asked her if my lawyer could talk to her about it. She first said yes and then when I asked again, said well no I can't speak to your laywer, then went to you have to have the case subpoenaed. She has no idea what she was doing and speaks in circles. I used to be a claims specialist and this women can't handle anything. Don't stay at Paris unless you want your stuff stolen.
Rooms need to be updated. Feels older and more rundown then other hotels on the strip.

Okay hotel, nothing remarkable about this hotel. It is obviously thematic, and if you're in for cheesy victorian decor, you'll love it. The room was clean, service was average. Again, nothing remarkable.

First off... the room smells like an animal hoarders room.  Gross. 

Our shower drain was backed up so we called the front desk.  Their solution was to send a plumber whenever one became available.  Never came.

The pet relief area is pathetic. It's a small piece of fake grass that isnt even clean.  I saw dog poop smear.

The view was also terrible.  It was the backside of the building or somr garage.

For the extra fee to stay in the pet stay room, i at least expected it to be clean.  Save your money and stay at flamingo instead.  They are cheaper and have a proper pet relief area.

I've now stayed here twice, but I'm not sure they'll be a third.  While some aspects are very nice, there are also some disappointments. 

First, the nice parts.  The hotel, rooms, and casinos are very nicely decorated.  The steakhouse is outstanding, with great food and great service.  The pool area is pleasant.  The spa offers a great massage, manicure, and pedicure.  The valet service is good.  The location is great.

However, there are lots of disappointments.  First, the casino.  The blackjack is expensive, at minimum $15.  Many are dealing the new 6-5 blackjack, which I refuse to play.  Slot machine selection is average at best, and the video poker pay tables are bad.

Second, the room.  While nicely decorated, it's small.  There is no actual closet, just some cupboards for hanging clothes.  The bathroom is nicely decorated, and has a separate bath and shower.  But the bath tub is just average size.  The desk has high-speed Internet, but it's pricey, and there is no power outlet on the desk. I preferred the room I had at the neighboring Bally's.  

Third, the food.  The cafe, lounge, and creperrie were all disappointing.

All in all, a mixed bag.  I feel I can find better value elsewhere, and I can find nicer rooms elsewhere.

Only three stars because of the lack of luck in the casino. I thought at least 1 person would hit a little luck but none. The rooms were very nice and the room service food was average at best. The walkways throughout the casino floor and main drag in the hotel are quite narrow. The floors are concrete and slightly uneven which can be a hazard. I am staying at MGM Grand next visit. It is a HUGE hotel that is wide open. PS - DON'T bring your kids to Vegas please.

When you get into this hotel, check in on Facebook. A coupon will pop up for a Buy one, get one free drink in any Paris hotel bar. Go to the rewards counter, show the screen and get the voucher. I did this two days in a row and went to the bar next to the sports book. The bartender said that if I used the video poker machines, he could keep giving me drinks as well. 

I haven't stayed here but will consider it for my next trip. The inside is lovely and the location is fantastic.

I stayed here from 5\/17-5\/19:

The king suite was semi-nice.  Being that it was a suite, I expected the bed to look more updated, but it was kind of outdated.  The bed was comfortable enough, but not as nice as what I'd expect for the price that a person would normally pay if they didn't have a player card.

The bathroom was really nice and big though, but I didn't make use of the jacuzzi since I was only in my room for a total of about 10 hours the entire trip.

The casino area looks more updated than my room, that's for sure.  But I guess I shouldn't complain too much since the room was comped by my cousin's player card, after all...

From the looks of it, they didn't have very many food choices either because we ended up eating out at other hotels and in Chinatown.  I'm a foodie so if a hotel doesn't have a decent restaurant in-house, I usually won't stay there in the future even if they comped my room...

We ended up with this hotel after booking on Hotwire. We arrived hours before check-in, and we were tired, do we paid $20 to check in early so we could nap. There are kiosks available for check-in, and it was easy & quick. We got up to our room and saw housekeeping there. We were quite irritated since we just paid $20 to check in early. We went back down 4 floors to the reception desk to figure this out. Apparently there is a room 448 (ours) and a 448P, right next to each other. Housekeeping was in 448P, but from where their cart was, our door had been blocked and we weren't able to see it. Anyway, we got that figured out and got into our room. It was clean but that's about it. It was nothing special at all, and our view was a rooftop. Since we didn't plan on spending much time in our room, we didn't really care. 
     As for the hotel, there wasn't much there. A few restaurants, a smoke-filled casino, some shops. We walked the strip for most of what we wanted to do. The next two days, there was a really nasty, putrid smell in our hall, so anytime we came and went, it reeked. Since we were at the farthest end from the elevator, we had to smell it quite a bit. All in all, for the price it was acceptable, but I definitely wouldn't stay here again

We stayed at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas for the first time in early October 2011 for our wedding. Our room was Le Mans petite suite. The room was spacious, bathroom was amazing and bed was comfortable. it seemed clean, however the mini fridge hardly kept cool, the wet bar sink was lose,  and the trash bins were tiny.  We had requested early check in, and kept going to the front desk, our room was not ready for us until 5pm! I had hoped spending thousands on a wedding at this hotel would grant us a smoother check in, guess I was wrong. Be prepared for a 5pm check in. 

Our wedding: we did the deluxe poolside cabana package wedding. We upgraded to three cabanas, holding 25 guests. This area was fun and perfect for a casual yet pretty setting. The ceremony was short, I was disappointed that the Minister had to whip out his notes and ready them, not well prepared, but a nice guy. My husband wore a mic, but not a single guest could hear us exchange vows or anything...the audio was horrible.

Photography; our wedding photographer was a girl named Nick, she was nice, but we felt very rushed. After the wedding we met up with her the following day to pick out and view all of the pictures. It felt like being greeted by a sales person trying to make a sale, not show us our photos. This was very uncomfortable. The photos were pretty, but we were not blown away...considering we picked the Paris hotel for our wedding...not a single photo included the Eiffel Tower, even though we were right by it. This made me sad. The photos were very traditional...I recommend to speak with the photographer before the ceremony so you are able to specify what you want...we were not given this option. We did not meet the photographer or the minister until the big day, which made it hard to ask questions, and  communicate needs and expectations etc. 

Poolside Service; our cabanas were served by Stephanie, who was very nice and accommodating. It was not her fault that the Wedding Chapel had not explained enough details for us prior. I was told verbally by the Wedding Coordinator that we got bottle service with our cabanas. This was not in our contract, so I kept and open mind and asked questions. When introduced to our server, she told me the same thing so I felt safe. No one specified what additional fees this may include. Next the server took our food orders, guest ordered lunch from the pool cafe. The food took over an hour long!!! Stephanie apologized, but that was it. We requested to do separate tabs for food being that some guests had to leave at different times, we didn't want it all on our room. She was kind enough to do this, thank you Stephanie. Left on our bill was our lunch and a bottle service fee of $18 per bottle....interesting. have no idea what this was for...maybe gratuity for bottle service? I wish this had been broken down to us writing so that we knew what to expect financially prior to our event! The servers were very kind, and deserved to be tipped, I just wish we had been warned in advance in our contract of how everything would work. My mom was kind enough to handle the bill so that we wouldn't be bothered by this. Thank you Mom.

The Wedding Coordinator; Sandra Dee Valentino; very nice, very busy...hard to get a hold of. Communication and accuracy of information and timing was poor. It all worked out fine, I tried not to get bogged down by details. I did feel like I had to bug for information that should had been given to us from the beginning. This was frustrating. For example, payment; we were told upon booking our wedding in July and putting down a deposit that we would be able to pay the balance in person when we arrived for our wedding, or in a payment plan. She also explained that we would receive a detail worksheet to fill out by the end of August (music, flowers, vows etc...) By the end of the first week of September, less than four weeks until our big day, I hadn't received anything. I sent an email. Once I received the details worksheet, I had little time to fill it all out now, but got it done. Along with this she also sent us a 30-day in advance payment worksheet, that apparently is a requirement not an option. We were not informed about this at all previously. Not only was the balance due, but it was given to us less than 30 days before our wedding!  Luckily we had it in our account and were able to pay the full balance. This was annoying, and could have been a disaster!
Sandra informed us that she had been working overtime, so I imagine that the Paris Wedding Chapel may have been understaffed, but still! Get it together! On our big day she brought me a bottle of Champagne in the bridal room, thanks. She was also very patient when the guests who were in charge of our rings were a little late for our ceremony, thank you Sandra for being flexible.

Overall, it was a very special day and a fun weekend. Don't get tangled up in details, just smile :) and have another glass. I would stay here again.

Love the slots here. I always seem to come out ahead (or just slightly under). I also love the Parisian feel of the area, especially the buffet eating area that looks and feels like the courtyard of a small French village.

I am not really sure whether to give this hotel a 3 star review. The location is great. If you just want a place to crash that is in the midst of everything, stay here. That being said, the basic room we stayed in was small and not fancy. I noticed five or so things that made it look shabby (peeling wallpaper, chipped paint, etc.) which gave an overall not-too-nice feel to the place. It reminded me of a French Holiday Inn. The bathroom was big, which is always nice, with a separate shower and tub. 
The staff was not very pleasant. The front desk staff was ok when we checked in, but we had to wait a long time which seemed ridiculous because they only had one person working. Not great management in my opinion. The housekeeping staff was rude to us a couple times. When I had to squeeze past a cart in our hallway when we were checking in, she moved the cart a tiny bit and when I said "Excuse me! Thank you!" and smiled at her, she just huffed. RUDE. Needless to say, I didn't tip the housekeeping staff.
The little shops and restaurants downstairs are just meh. But right outside, we went to Mon Ami Gabi for breakfast, and it was GREAT. And we went to The Sugar Factory next door for a goblet drink and it was really good, if expensive. The hotel is located right across from the Bellagio fountains.

The wise would spend their dollars elsewhere. I honestly can't  remember feeling more unwelcome and I literally travel every single week. From check in to check out, my experience was the same. I had a view of the roof, the the TV looked like it was from the 50's and the beds were NOT good. Would pass on this one since there are so many good choices in Las Vegas.
Hotel itself is great, however check-in takes minimum 45 minutes on weekends. They def. need a faster service or faster check-in options.

PROs:

* Cozy, comfortable, and clean room. The bed was comfortable and I didn't want to wake up in the morning because it was so comfy.

* The shower is separate from the bathtub, so it makes the bathroom bigger than regular hotel's bathrooms.

* Awesome location right in the middle of the strip. It connected to Bally's and if you were lucky, you might even will get the room with Bellagio's dancing fountain view.

* Cute gift shops and I just love the feel of the common areas of this hotel. It's very European (dooh it's Paris).

* Friendly staff from bellboys to housekeepers. 

Cons:

* I wish there are more of the general areas (more shops and entertainment).

* No night club, so if you are looking for night time entertainment, you will need to venture to other hotels.

Reviewing the Casino only.  If you like a Casino on the strip that is pretty mellow this is it.  However, dealers on the craps table were very rude and looked down-right grumpy.  The craps table itself is actually a medium sized one.  I didn't enjoy the club music playing loudly in the background.

I loved paris..but not the ppl who works on spa..!! Malory ( hope to spell her name correct) was awful..so rud,& not understanding at all..we had very nice time in spa on my birthday with my daughter,but she made our last day of trip horrible..)): unfortunately I didn't have enough time to report it on registration same day,, every other things were good,,village buffet was perfect,,we loved the food...

This place just feels like home. Anytime I stay anywhere else I feel way out of place here in Vegas. The beds are awesome and the rooms are great. I am sure if you spend 4 or $500 a night you can get a better place but if you are looking for a great place to stay when you can rest and a great place to be able to gamble or hang out this is definitely the place!

Bonjour, Paris Hotel!"

That is how all the employees greet you.  Hilarious.  My friends and I stayed here during a weekend getaway.  Our room was super cool and very red.  I love red so it was pretty cool.  There was a huge TV and an Ipod dock.  The bathroom was large, clean and had a huge tub.  Made me wish I had been there with my boyfriend instead of my girlfriends. ;) Sigh.

My one complaint is that there was no floor length mirror in the room.  Annoying when you are going out and want to check yourself out.  

All of the staff was very nice.  The valets were especially kind when my friend left her shoes in the car and we needed them to drive them up.  I would stay there again anytime.  Hopefully then I will get to take a nice bath.
Going to the top of the Eiffel Tower ride, in Paris Hotel, 20 dollars for the ticket, I would suggest night time take in Vegas at night. No time limit you can stay as long as u want.

My boyfriend and I were searching for a reasonably-priced hotel in the center of the Strip, and Paris was exactly what we were hoping for.  We stayed May 27-31, 2013. 

The room itself was pretty standard - nothing nicer than a typical Comfort Inn really.  We were on the 10th floor - I'm sure some of the upgraded rooms are nicer.  The casino was nice, although nothing special compared to the rest of the Strip.  There are lots of dining options in the hotel - the buffet was FABULOUS!  There's also a creperie, a sandwich\/pizza shop, convenience store, etc.  The pool is really nice as well - really relaxed and wasn't very crowded during our stay.

I give the room itself 3 stars, and the overall experience of staying at the hotel 4 stars.  The location simply cannot be beat - you're right in the middle of all the action on the Strip.  

Note:  Beware of the resort fee of $20\/night.  Unfortunately, all the Vegas hotels seem to charge some type of fee, so it's probably not avoidable.

One of the nicer places I've stated at over the past 18  years I've been going to Vegas. The rooms, are very nice. Room service is great, especially after hitting the  casinos! The casino is  very nice as well as the shops and restaurants. Highly recommend!

U know I came in hear 4 years ago it was. The bast place the bast customer service the bast of everything I came to this hotel 4 time this will be my last . 
But I will come back for the pastry for sure they r the bast of Las Vegas . 
Other then that the customer service is suck . 
I'm sorry to say that .

Location, Location, Location is the best part of the hotel.  I've stayed here once before two years ago and my room was upgraded quite a bit over this past stay.  The room was clean but the decor was a tad dated.  The pillows in my bed felt like a bunch of wadded up lumpy socks for stuffing, I couldn't get comfortable to save my life......oh well.  The bed is hard which I like, but if you do not be ready.  I have to say the $29 daily resort fee is an absolute scam, but since all hotels have it........well it isn't going away.   Included in that fee are wifi capabilities, but there are umpteen million people logging on that it is bogged down and slow.  I would stay here again based on location, price and cleanliness, just don't expect to get blown away by the hospitality.

If I could give fewer stars I would.This is hands down the worst hotel in every possible way.  The rooms are disgusting and the management is terrible.  The hotel is run down and has no customer service.  We checked in on the 22nd of December.  Upon entering the room, I was immediately turned off.  The carpet was old, torn and has rust stains.  The bathroom cabinet had peeling paint and was dirty.  The bathtub had a screw sticking out of it that could have been a safety issue had I allowed my child to go anywhere near the tub (I didn't notice that until the morning).  We arrived late, ran out to dinner and show and came back to the room to sleep.  The beds and pillows are awful.  We described them as low rent motel quality.  That night the television was pixellating and we couldn't even wind down to tv.  The next morning I called the front desk to let them know that I was going to move hotels.  It wasn't until I went down there and spoke with Leslie (a manager) that they told me they were going to take that room out of circulation and upgrade us into another room.  The upgrade was also not wonderful.  The beds were slightly better, the pillows still sucked.  On the morning of the 24th, I noticed that the air vent in this new 'upgraded' room was fully clogged (that explained my sneezing and respiratory issues almost immediately upon checking into the room.  I spoke with manager M. Eric Holmes, who told me he would send maintenance up to fix the issue.  Housekeeping came hours later and stated she couldn't do anything to fix it and she would send maintenance.  When we returned from dinner that night it had still not been taken care of.  The manager was rude, arrogant and exacerbated an already tense situation with his complete and utter lack of professionalism.  We ended up leaving the hotel and checked into a much nicer property.  Trust me when I tell you that Motel 6 would be a step up.  In addition,  we had Christmas Eve dinner at the pricey Eiffel Tower restaurant which had the audacity to charge $46 for a piece of fish (a la carte) and then serve it cold. Never, ever, ever will I stay or recommend this property to anyone.  Not fit for a dog, but please don't take my word for it, judge for yourself by the photos below.
Beautiful themed hotel , restaurant is 4 stars at least  good food good environment and the jersey boys play was amazing

This was our first time staying at Paris. I'm a Total Rewards member, so I booked a special mid-week rate. Even though they are in the middle of a renovation, they did an excellent job of shielding guests from the noise and dust. Someone at this hotel is doing a great job with customer service training. Every single person (valets, front desk, bartender, janitor, pool attendant, maintenance worker, dealers) was outstanding; pleasant, helpful, friendly. Kudos to whoever is setting organizational culture here. An example: After checking in, we left the registration area and, as in most Vegas hotels, the elevators weren't easy to find. Without having to ask, a woman carrying a broom and dustbin saw us, asked if we needed help and cheerfully directed us to the elevators. Love that kind of attention to detail.

A while back, we had an unpleasant experience at the Linq. There's a loud nightclub that goes until 4 AM that they didn't tell us about. At Paris, the front desk person saw that we were booked in a room facing their own club and asked if I wanted to move to a quieter room, which we did. Really appreciated that.

The rooms are super comfortable and spacious. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we've ever slept in. It prompted us to research the brand. We also rented a cabana at the pool and spent the day there. The staff is outstanding. We never had to flag someone down. They were supper nice and attentive.

The only thing keeping this from a 5-star review is that the room wasn't as clean as it should have been when we arrived and the hot water didn't work. To their credit, they sent a maintenance worker up right away to fix the water, but finding a dirty Q-tip in the bathroom was no fun.

Lastly, the location is perfect, right int he middle of the Strip. We've decided we'll definitely stay here again.

Ugh...overflowing toilet...kind of a worn out room...no real sympathy for walking around in the toilet overflow...yuck, yuck, yuck.
The bed was comfortable.

On my last day in Vegas, I decided to stay on the strip.  I've always wanted to stay here because of the location, enormous casino, iconic balloon and Eiffel tower replica. Looked in Hotwire and got a ridiculous deal. $120 per night including taxes and resort fees. Lucky!

For several years, most LV hotels have ridiculous long check-in lines. This hotel has the new electronic check-in machines. Just scan your DL, enter confirmation then comes out your card key. No more waiting. Same process for check-out. Just drop the key in the box and off you go.

The room selected for me by the machine was the red room #2560. Fantastic! I was looking at pictures online and really liked the red theme decor so I got lucky again! The modern room was spacious with a view of the dessert. The king bed was comfortable, the double armoire featured a hanging closet, dresser, mini fridge and a flat screen tv in the middle. Room also has a writing desk, loveseat, and small coffee table. Bathroom has separate shower and tub and necessary toiletries plus a blow dryer.

This hotel also offers several restaurants on the casino level including Mon Ami Gabi (good brunch), Martorano's, Gordon Ramsey Steak and casual restaurants. I enjoyed hanging out at the bustling bar La Central and meeting friendly professionals that attended a convention. The bartenders also know how to make mean dirty martini's :)  Overall, I had great stay and will consider again if I see another good deal online.

We got a slick deal using Southwest Vacations and I was very impressed! We had a view of the pool, Bellagio fountain, and Paris Balloon. While it isn't the most fancy hotel, it is a step above many others on the strip. And to top it off, it's smack dab in the middle of all the action. We spent a lot of our time over at the Bellagio and Aria which were right across the street :P Overall--a great experience.

I travel to Vegas for work and play on an annual basis. What can I say about Paris - meh. It does have a great location on the strip but wasn't my favorite place. 
Front desk had an attitude problem and some parts need an upgrade. Granted a good majority of people don't go to Vegas to stay in their room but I felt the room could be cleaner. The week I stayed there, there were a lot of people in their 70s-80s. So if you are looking for a younger, hipper crowd I would suggest elsewhere (Planet Hollywood is next door). 
Viva Lost Wages

CASINO: This place was SO COOL. I loved all the little details in the casino that made it look and feel like you were in Paris. 

Had a great time gambling with the little french girls in the blue outfits. Our gal..Missy I think her name was, was totally awesome and lots of fun. 

To Michael aka Will Farrel's twin. I wish your boss would have lowered your table rate to $15 because you looked like a lot of fun to gamble with...DANG. Next time.

Got a good deal with our stay.  Got 3 bedrooms with 2 queen bed for $125 per room per night.  We arrived a little earlier so the non smoking rooms are not yet available.  

All rooms are good enough for 3 people but too small for 4 it would be very crowded with just one bathroom.

Anyhow,  the rooms are clean and service whenever we need anything was fast. 

I just have a few complain and I'm hoping management can address the issues.

Room 1016 is having problems with hot water.  Shower has cold and warm water only.  Showering is not fun during winter when you don't have hot water.

Also,  the key that was given to us does not work.  It's a hassle going back and forth in the lobby to let someone know.  Not convenient at all.

The hotel is very nice however and it's situated near to all the happenings.  So majority of the time we just walked.  Shopping, 24 hour buffet restaurants, shows, and drinking are nearby.

See pictures for more details

This has to be the worst hotel on the strip. Got our reservation wrong. When we tried to talk to the girl at the counter, Brandi, she was of no help. As a matter of fact very rude. It takes us several attempts to get her to even look for another room. Now this morning no hot water in the room. And it has been an hour since we called for someone to look at it. And yet nobody wants to help. Awful management as well. Nobody wants to assist.

Two stars for friendly service, and that's it.

I was in vegas with some friends for a concert that was taking place in Paris, so we decided to might as well stay in the hotel just to make things easier.  Usually when I come to Vegas I stay at the Venetian\/Bellagio and more recently the Palazzo. Paris can't even compare. First of all, the rooms are fairly small (~460sqft I believe in comparison to Bellagio's standard 510) and the beds were uncomfortable. Like the experiences of some previous reviewers, I also saw hairs on the bed. The sheets and\/or mattress also had an weird stench to them. Thankfully we didn't really stay in the rooms at all, and when we did, we ordered new sheets from housekeeping to lay on top of. Also, when someone called Housekeeping to ask for more blankets and pillows, they said they ran out. What kind of hotel, especially in Vegas,  runs out of blankets and pillows? We found this quite odd, and therefore, will not be staying in their rooms anymore.

The hotel itself is alright. The employees are really nice and hospitable. They do have some decent eateries like Madeline's for dessert and Cafe St. Louis for typical American fare, but there isn't much else to do besides that. I don't think the hotel does the city of Paris justice.

I didn't stay at Paris (stayed at Ballys) but I spent a good amount of time there.  Everyone was very friendly & helpful the entire trip, and we swam at the pool.  The only complaint about the pool is that I wish it was heated.  Going from the 110 degree weather into an unheated pool makes for a chili experience lol!  The view of the Eiffel tower is cool but makes a lot of shade at the pool.  We ate at the buffet here a couple of times (we got the 24 hour buffet of buffet passes) I want to give a shoutout to the manager of the buffet.  Her name was Laura or Lauren.  We got a devastating call that one of our pets had passed away, and had to leave in the middle of our dinner.  My friend called & spoke with her and she let us come back an hour later to the buffet to be able to finish our dinner, no questions asked.  They really care about their customers here and they make it known.  I was treated poorly at the bellagio over a broken game, and this was very refreshing to actually have some one who cared.  Thanks Paris!  I would visit this hotel \/ casino on future trips.

I didn't stay here, but I did spend a lot of time eating, walking around, and enjoying the pool here.  I loved the way the place was decorated.  It gives you the illusion that you are outside walking on the streets of Paris.  Super cute!  We had the dinner buffet at Le Village and it was the best buffet we had on the Strip.  We also had lunch one day at Mon Ami Gabi.  That was the best meal we had in Las Vegas, maybe ever.  We spent an entire day in one of the Villas at the Soleil Pool and it was wonderful.  Again, they make you feel like you are really in France.  The Villa was like a private little house on the outside of the pool.  Our server, Autumn, was great.  She took care of us for hours and made sure we had cold, alcoholic beverages at all times.  The pool was a great way to spend a day relaxing.

Paris hotel Las Vegas is not a 4 star hotel it is 3 star  hotel all the way...  If the customer service was better it might be a 3.5. But the customer service is just as awlful as the hotel. Please pay the extra money to stay somewhere nice like Venetian or Bellagio.

After being to the real city of lights I can say this place is a total replica of the real city!
It is beautiful on the inside! 

The eiffel tower on the outside is 1\/2 the size of the real one.  The designers wanted it to be an exact replica, but its proximity to the airport prevented that from happening.

We had two meals at the Sugar Factory at Paris and both were awesome!
Very fun place - get the groupon for it!

This review is based on the gambling components of the Casino.  The dealers are un-focused and I had to help 3 Blackjack deals do simple math on the deals.  I don't think I would ever consider this place a gambling destination.

Seriously the rooms need a proper cleaning! I am so thankful that I am in the habit of traveling with Lysol wipes, they have never come in handier than during my stay at Paris. The interior of the hotel and especially the rooms definitely need upgrades, they are old and worn to say the least. Found A few random hairs in our room which grossed me out, there was mold on the outside of the shower door and the bathroom door for some reason was really dirty, I don't even want to guess what it was that made it so dirty. The lampshades in the bathroom had a thick covering of dust on the rim. I would not even stay here for free. We did the breakfast buffet for $22 each, the food was barely warm and not a lot of choices and definitely nothing of quality ingredients to say the least. We tried the little sandwich cafÃ© across from the buffet but it was no better, the glass on the section where they  made the sandwiches was dirty and they hardly put any meat on the sandwich. Nothing good to report here.

Awful. Really just awful. 

-Staff members were extremely rude. For example, we were standing by the bar waiting for drinks for 15 minutes. Not one bartender acknowledged us. So, I politely asked the bartender who was cleaning glasses, if he could help us. He told us he was busy and we should go to the other side of the bar. 
-Rarely saw a waitress in the casino. So, we had to go back to the bar and get our own drinks. Lame.
-The rooms felt like a cheap chain motel, rather than a Vegas experience. The room really wasn't clean. When we opened the armoire to watch TV and found old food and snacks. Gross! Super loud at all times of day or night. Old room service trays sat in the hallways for more than 24 hours. I even watched hotel employees walk right by the tray and do nothing about it.
- Their activities fee is lame. You pay to use their gym and pool through this fee. There is not an option to skip thee fee by not using the gym or pool. 
-Overly aggressive sales people every ten feet. After we checked in we had to walk through the casino\/shopping area to get to our room. I was hassled by this woman (who had a leathery wrinkled face) trying to sell me a makeover and her anti-wrinkle products. I said no thanks and walked away. She followed me, yelling how I should get this makeover. She just wouldn't let it go. I swear I thought she would follow me to my room.
- Their internet is a joke. It only somewhat works in the room, but mostly not. Plus, you can only use it one one device. I just used LTE. 
- Hubby got bad food poisoning from the mussels he ate at one of their restaurants (LaProvencial) . We ate and drank exactly the same things except the mussels. I was fine. Just a rotten way to end a vacation.

Will never, ever be going back here again for any reason.

The best thing about Paris is their perfect location in the center of the strip. I also love their restaurants. Mon Ami Gabi is quite possibly my favorite Vegas restaurant. (check out my review). Their buffet is also one of my favorites. (I will try to get that review up soon). And then of course is Sugar Factory (yep, you guessed it, I reviewed it). In other words, Paris has so much going on that I love. 

Now let's talk hotel: if the Parisian style is for you, you will find a clean, modest room, and probably be happy. I, however, prefer contemporary, sleek decor, so this place isn't really for me. One thing about our room that WAS amazing, was the view. We were directly in front of the BELLAGIO fountains. One strike against Paris?  Housekeeping was pretty lax when it came to cleaning up the hallways. When you leave your room and see someone's room service trays in the hall, and come back several hours later and they are still there, that's a bit of a turn-off, and really not OK.

WI-FI:   Hotels that still do not offer free wi-fi drive me crazy! There is no excuse for it, and I see it as pure greed on their part! In fact, this bothers me so much, that I am now refusing to stay any place that does not have free wi-fi! Paris is charging, but if you go to the little cafe' in the lobby, you can get it free there. I think it's only a matter of time before most places offer free wi-fi.

If I could give 0 stars I would. First off the Black out from the power outage, the hotel didn't really care that it affected our trip, because we didn't have anywhere to stay. I had to beg and then get angry for them to arrange something so we would have shelter. I was promised that I will get $200 in comp for food and drinks at the hotel, also the resort fees will be taken care of. Also 2 free nights extended stay... That sounds reasonable until I try to redeem all of that. I tried to stay 2 nights longer, that was a hassle because they said they didn't promise that. Then the $200, none of my food and drinks were covered until I saw the hotel bill, and brought it up, then I had to speak to a manager (ALLEN) and waited outside in the line for 30 mins to get that resolved. Not to mention on the day of check out, my bill went up $80 on resort fees that were charged on the day of the power outage. How are you going to charge me resort fees when I couldn't have stayed there. I had to call and wait on the phone for 20 mins to get that resolved. I would've been happier if they didn't promise all of that and I just pay for it. It's about the principle. 

Oh not to mention, when we came back they assigned us a room where construction was going on from 7 IN THE MORNING. Called down to the front desk and they just say oops.... Really?!?!? 

NEVER WILL I STAY HERE AGAIN! WORST HOTEL TO STAY IN VEGAS. GO TO THE LINQ, AT LEAST THEY'RE RESPONSIVE WHEN YOU HAVE AN ISSUE.

Hmmm....don't even know where to start from...Me and my husband decided to stay in this hotel for our 2 year wedding anniversary. Huge mistake.
As soon as we entered our room, the strong smell ( like cat's urine...no joke) hit us. I turned on the AC and we left our room, 7 hours later we came back. Same strong smell.
I could figure out what  was it, because the room was pretty clean. 
Later I was preparing to go to bed to sleep. I pulled out the duvet and stepped behind the bed next to the wall, and the carpet was all wet. Wow. That's why there was that smell. I don't even know what it was. Probably a sink water leakage behind the wall.
Nasty. 
I made a reservation 3 month prior for a standard room with a king size bed and we got a room with 2 queens. Seriously?  The beds were awful. Mattresses and pillows were extra firm. 
You don't deserve to be called "Paris

I am local Las Vegan and I have rarely gone inside the Paris. Perhaps I've popped in once or twice, but never have I stayed here and I have never heard much said about the place, save for the restaurants. I ended up coming here because I was having lunch with friends at Mon Ami Gabi.

I'm giving two stars because just from walking around inside the casino it was pretty "meh".

First off, the parking garage is horrible and is shared between Bally's and Paris. It's hard to get to, it's annoying to navigate, and it's placement is not helpful. Secondly I really dislike it when casino's parking garages push you out into a long hallway you have to walk down in order to get to the actual casino. Whoever decided it would be a great idea to put a long, cobble walkway between the garage and the casino floor... well, let's just say, not the brightest architectural genius out there. 

The signage, although cute like little street signs, makes navigation throughout the casino hard. I found myself walking all the way up to the little signs and making circles around them in order to read where they were all pointing and what they were all pointing to. The sign for Mon Ami Gabi is non-existent until you get right in front of the restaurant and by that time you've found the place out of sheer luck anyway. 

The casino itself is somewhat out-dated. I could definitely see room for improvement and renovation. I realize casinos on the strip age quickly, especially when newer ones burst onto the scene (IE: Cosmo, Aria, etc.), but that's just the way it goes. Paris should consider a new idea and get rid of the damn cobblestone flooring.
give me my rooms.. will all the money i lost here shit.. u should name a floor after me..

Came here to celebrate my bf's birthday. Hotel looks nice from the outside so I thought I would give it a try. The hotel is very convenient as it is centralized in the middle of the strip. Upon checking in, we were offered a suite upgrade for additional $75 a night. Not bad considering the price is normally $900 a night for 1000 square feet. Upon entering the room, it smelled a little like sewer and the jets didn't work in the tub, but once you get passed that the room was overall clean, outdated, and spacious. Lovely view from our window, but don't think we will be staying here again.

My husband and I decided to stay an extra night at the last minute and we found a deal for $42.00 so we couldn't pass up the chance to stay here.  Although there was a long line at check in (expected) the line moved quickly and all available check in windows were open. The lady who checked us in was very polite and friendly. The hotel itself is very nice, the decor is beautiful and it was very clean. The bartenders were super friendly and fun. When you step outside the Bellagio is right across the street and the water show is visible.  The location of the hotel was great. 

Our room was really nice, the bed was comfortable, the AC got nice and cold, there was a refrigerator and a TV on the wall. The bathroom had both a shower and a tub which was nice. 

Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the walk from the garage to Registration is kind've far and not fun with bags. Every time you want to go to your car it's a pretty long walk. I would recommend using valet when you check in. If your there for a few nights use the garage and then valet again the night before you leave so you can take your bags straight to the front. Much easier!

As always a great stay here we have had a red room before this time we had a basic room which was fine but alittle stained and dated. Construction was going on above us starting around 7am which kinda sucked but I understand. The band's downstairs were amazing, great hotel and casino it's not so big you get lost like some of the other resorts! They also were great about delivering a birthday cake for my wife which was great!!!

Worst customer Service ever! Lady at the front desk was super rude and disrespectful. 
Somehow they added a pass to the High Roller to my room, I went to the front desk to ask them to remove it and they lady told me next time to not order things I don't want. 
I tried to explain to her that it must have been a mistake, she rolled her eyes and acted like she was extremely bothered by me. Keep in mind, this was their "Platinum member line". Never have I been so mistreated by a hotel employee, I asked to speak to the manager and he was no help either. Botton line, stay somewhere else.

This is for the Casino only as I've not stayed in the hotel.

The casino floor is alive with the sounds of bells and whistles, the whirl of a thousand different lights and the cheers of people from everywhere. To me, it was, really, just another pretty casino.  

I liked the attention to detail, loved how the ceiling was painted in the soft blues with the cloud cover, to appear like a spring time day.  Of course, since you can't really tell what time it is, you spend So much more money.

The slots?  Well, they weren't terribly loose, but I did fine a machine or two who liked me. I found a few more who really resented me. *chuckles.* That's Ok though, I went in with money to burn.  

I also played roulette for the first time, having been given an assingment from a friend.  When I placed my bet (Black 4, $10) One of the other players put his token there too. *grin* Saying that if I'd been told to do it, there must be something to it. Sadly, we both lost our bet. :) That's ok, I get lunch out of the deal when I get home. 

All in all, I found the casino floor to be nice, if convolutedly laid out.  I think that the person who designs them needs to spend more time on FLOW. 

The shops at the back were nice, I noticed that many of the shop keepers seem to have "french" accents. I could be wrong.

Lord Jesus, please upgrade this ventilation system so people who don't smoke or only smoke a little can fully enjoy this casino!!! Paris is way too nice of a casino for people not to get the most out of it. It's also kind of dark in this casino. Can yall get a little more lighting? Lastly, the cobblestone walkway may be a hazard for folks in heels and the elderly. The escalators were also not working. 

However, the customer service is really great. I will not forget the manager who actually walked us over to our restaurant instead of pointing and giving directions. This same manager even gave us his name and engaged us in conversation as we were walking. This is the type of customer service that'll keep you coming back. To that end, the restaurant we ate at (Mon ami Gabi) was INCREDIBLE. The french theme is very nice and they have employees who can speak the language for guests who prefer it. That's really cool!!

The room was nice and clean. It was a Friday night and we needed a new iron because the one we had had crap all over it. We expected to wait hours for a replacement, but it took ten minutes. I was happy with that service.

The casino was cool. However, every time we sat at a table they checked out IDs for 10 minutes. We were all under 25, so I get that, but it was a hassle. 

What I did love is they had the card game War. My girlfriend loved that because she doesn't like card games. It was a fun way to gamble because it is literally just turning your card over, and whoever gets high card wins. The chances were pretty good. I lost a lot, but my girlfriend won a lot and so did my buddy. It all balanced out. Plus the dealer was amazing! We tipped her a whole lot. 
Most the dealers were blank faced machines, but this lady was bubbly and got us to stay there for a long time and got the waitress to bring us top shelf tequila shots. 

My buddy was really mad at this casino, and he gambles a whole lot more than me, but overall, for a casual gambler it wasn't bad.

Pros:
-Easy to navigate
-Clean rooms, nice decor
-Big, brilliant chandeliers
-Centrally located on the Strip
-Great view of Bellagio water show (well, our room had this view)
-One particular bartender poured like his hand had weights attached...nice

Cons:
-Cobblestone floors are not easy to walk on with heels & while intoxicated
-It's constantly daytime in this place and unless you're from Alaska or are prone to using crack, this is a little strange at 1am.
-Everything is in "French" (I use this term loosely--putting "le" or "la" in front of something does not make it French) Look, I know it's the Paris Hotel but that shit gets annoying. Can you say "le douchebaggery"?

If I got a sweet room rate I'd stay there again.

We decided to celebrate our anniversary in Las Vegas this year and my thoughtful fella booked us a room at The Paris. We had a really wonderful experience. I was surprised by the level of service we received from everyone starting with the valets all the way up to the concierge. Every single person we dealt with was helpful, courteous & kind.

The room itself was lovely with a nice big bathroom. It had a nice-sized vanity, large tub & free standing shower. The view of the Strip was just beautiful at night. We ate in a few of the restaurants there & had a great time. Mon Ami Gabi in particular was delightful & had excellent specials. I probably had 4 crepes at the little crepe cafe while we were there too - don't miss them.

I had zero complaints honestly. The staff was amazing, the food was delicious & the room was just right. We didn't spend a mint but I definitely felt like we had a luxurious vacation. We'll definitely be back.

The hotel itself was fine. Nothing extraordinary about it. I went with a group of friends. We rented 2 rooms for 3 nights. We checked in in person upon arrival. We waited in line about 30 minutes to do so. We were told the rooms weren't ready and that we could leave our luggage while we wait for our key. No problem. We checked out 3 days later. No problem. Then we receive the bill and realize we were charged for "early check-in" even though we didn't even get our key early. Several of us tried to call to explain the problem and we were all appalled at the way the staff (including the managers) treated us. They told us we checked in online and that the online check in warns about a fee for early check-in. We distinctly remember waiting the 30 minutes in line and were not informed of the fee and how can you even charge a fee when the key wasn't given early?! We literally were called liars and hung up on several times. We had no option but to pay the money b\/c no one would listen to the story and actually remove the fee that shouldn't have been there in the first place. $60 is a lot of money! Because of this, I say this hotel is the biggest piece of shit and I will warn anyone I know going to Vegas (as well as all of you) not to stay at this hotel that employs total assholes who know nothing about customer service. I will literally never again step foot into this hotel when I go back to Vegas.

I'll start this review with giving you a little background.  I stayed at Paris last May of 2016. We went with good friends. The hotel itself is beautiful. Modern, Updated, Clean ! The Casino area itself looks like the sky with cobblestone and accents of France all over. The Shoppes are great, and they have two of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Gordon Ramsey's steakhouse and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The Brunch there is absolutely to die for. The rooms are amazing and have a wonderful view of the strip. So many cool things to say about this place. Why then am I giving this only one star?? What they DON"T have , is good Customer Service. As a matter of fact...They have HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE ! Let me continue to lay the story our for you. One of my friends that was with me, and might I add IS a Diamond Player, and goes to Vegas no less than 4x per year, not only came with me in May but also stayed at Paris in July of 2016 with his father.   Cut to - Friday December 9th, 2016 we went to Vegas for his Wedding Renewal and his Birthday. There were 8 of us, including 1 Diamond , and 2 Platinum Players. Yeah, we're not high rollers ...but for certain drop a ton of cash at the casino several times a year. We started out at Flamingo, Bally's , and decided to head over to Paris to hit the tables. The second I set down at the Roulette table and started talking to the young lady running the table, I was greeted by a nasty uptight Pit Boss. She was  approx 50+ wearing a suit, glasses, and pissed off. She didn't smile, she didn't say "welcome to Paris, is this your first time playing"? Nothing. If she had been listening to my conversation, with her employee, she would have clearly heard me asking questions about how to play. I was pleasant, in a good mood, and had my lovely wife by my side cheering me on. I was having a great night. This Nasty ( I'm being nice ) Pit Boss looked at me with a scowl. The only words out of her moth was " You can't say the F word ".  Ok...for one, we are in Vegas, their was someone puking on the ground and a half naked girl in front of Paris with tassels on her breasts..I don't think anyone cares. I am not a vulgar person, I'm 45 and not a kid either. I had a few drinks and was an enjoying a celebration weekend with my friends. Is this the way your greet a guest ? You don't know anything about me. Who I am, what I have or don't have. What you should know is that there are multiple casinos in your town and most of them would love for you to keep treating people like that. It's good business for them.  I said " no , problem" as I am not a rude individual. I cashed in my chips and moved to the Black Jack table where my friends where playing. three of us were sitting at the table playing, laughing , winning , losing , Not Swearing, but having a great time. My friend took me into the diamond lounge to get a dink and we returned to the table. We played and were honestly having a great time. Out of nowhere over came the same Pit Boss. She walked up to the table pointed to me and said " He's done playing" . I still don't know what I did. Not a word , not a warning, not an explanation. They pushed my chips back to me and told me I couldn't play. Now, I had been drinking so I assumed that perhaps I looked like I had been drinking and it was their job to protect my money. However, you should at least have the courtesy to explain to someone what they did. My friend sat beside me and said "I'll play then" I gave her my chips - Keep in mind the rest of the table was with me with me. She looked at us and told her that " she can't play either " . Still no explanation on what we had done. Not only was I embarrassed , but felt like I was ruining the time for my friends. I got up and left the table with my wife. Although everyone at the table objected, she stood her ground. We all collected our chips and went back to Flamingo to let them take our money. I know for a fact that myself and my friends will never play at Paris again. That woman was more than rude. She was nasty. This is a Pit Boss, A BOSS . Shouldn't a Boss\/Manager be the shining example of customer service ? I am giving you my money !! The least you could do is greet me when you meet me for the first time, ask how I'm doing, perhaps let me down easy if you are going to ask me not to play there.  You my friend, by your actions have cost your facility thousands in lost revenue, but worse than the money , shown that you have a reputation for horrible customer service. I would not advise anyone to visit, stay , or play here. With all the Casinos in Vegas, do yourself a favor and pick any other place. You would get better service at the 7-11 slot machine attendant than you will from Paris Casion. 

It's a shame that such a beautiful place, could have such an ugly personality.

To you Pitt Boss Lady- Shame on you . You are the worst example of Customer Service I have ever seen.

I was impressed with Paris, though I wasn't surprised by anything. In order to get the full experience for the hotel we were staying at, we spent a fair amount of time walking around and partaking in all of the things it had to offer. 

The view from the top of the "Eiffel Tower" was lovely, and a great way to start our night at Paris. 

We ate at the steakhouse in the corner of the Casino, seated outdoor with views of the Bellagio fountains. Delightful drinks, great food. Another check!

We walked around the casino floor. Nothing to write Yelp about. 

The room could have been transplanted from a Comfort Inn or Holiday Inn or something, and I wouldn't have known the difference. Granted, I didn't splurge for the nicest room, but didn't settle for the cheapest view. My middle of the road room was slightly below expectations, but maybe my expectations were too high. This isn't the newest, most modern hotel, and it suffered from some of Las Vegas' history. The room was a little smokey even though it was non-smoking, and looked well-worn. 

But the bed was comfortable, and after countless hours walking the strip and casino floors, that's really all that matters. I would come back again with a great deal, but otherwise, try something else for the modern Vegas experience.

Paris Hotel was mediocre at best. We stayed here 4 days and 3 nights. When you first walk in, you are greeted with the casino which is standard if you're staying on the strip. Then to the right, the concierge and check-in are Parisian themed clothed with all-white marble and chandeliers. Since we were celebrating an anniversary, we asked for a room upgrade -- we didn't get a room upgrade, but we got a view upgrade instead. 

Our room was facing the pool and the Belagio water show. Aesthetically, it was nice but at night, we could hear the music from the club until the wee hours of the morning. Not particularly relaxing if you still want to get some sleep. This is likely due to the fact that the rooms are very old and outdated. We also used the pool and the gym which were both OK. Pool was a little murky so we didn't stay long in there. And the gym, again, needed some upgrading. 

We also had the option to valet our car each night but as you can imagine, it gets very busy on the strip, especially on weekends, so sometimes it would take 10-15 minutes for our car to be brought up. Because of this, we were late to a few of our dinner reservations. However, the valet workers were all very courteous.

I will say that the location is very convenient, but all in all, the hotel was below average. As for us, we will be staying at a different hotel next time, perhaps venturing off the strip.

Paris is our favorite strip hotel.  The food is exceptional especially at Mon Ami.  The gambling and atmosphere is fun.  The location of the property (Central Strip) is ideal.  The rooms are nice - but a standard hotel room in terms of size and amenities.  The shape of the hotel means you can have varying views depending on room location.  Competition among Strip hotels has lowered the average price for the Paris - so check it out.

Magnifique!!  Paris Las Vegas spoiled us during our stay.  Yes, you pay a resort fee but it's worth it!  The spa has both a steam and dry sauna.  Gym is clean with gear needed to stay current on any exercise program.  The pool is beautiful, clean and staff courteous, prompt with drinks & food.  Paris is one of top five choices for our next convention stay in Vegas.

My boyfriend and I stayed here over Valentine's weekend and were pretty disappointed. I now understand that this is a family hotel, definitely not for anyone young looking for a fun experience.

We reserved a red room with a king size bed but upon arrival, we were told that they had booked all their king size beds prior and we would be stuck in two doubles...on Valentine's Day...cool. The room service tasted like microwaved meals you'd find in the frozen section of the grocery store but cost an arm and a leg. The pool was full of old people and children.
