The online bargain wasn't worth the wait just to check in! We have been standing in line for over 30 minutes and I am maybe halfway there. At least at a restaurant they tell you the wait time and you can decide to wait or not. With a hotel reservation, you are a captive audience. Never again here at this hotel.

Not impressed with dusty beds in suite room. Security procedure is below average. Visited this place numerous times and did not paid attention to details previously. Nicely decorated appearance but otherwise on details. Would recommend to visit one but once would be enough.

Great hotel and came here Dec 11-14, 2012. I had a good deal for a premier red room on the 30th floor with a view of the water fountains on the other side of the road.  The red rooms are their newest renovated rooms on the top floors of the hotel. The room was very large with king size bed. It is true what others say about the other rooms on the lower floors. They are older and not very nice looking. The hotel should renovate them.  The interior of the common areas is looking a bit dated. 


There is a good theatre in the hotel and good restaurants. Gordon Ramsay Steak is a good choice but is pricey.  If you come here, take the ride up the half size replica Eiffel tower.  The location is very central.

Stayed here one night with my boyfriend. We like to treat our selves to sexy nights and staycations. Got this on a deal for 60$ on groupon. The hotel and casino are really nice. Front desk lobby is pretty gorgeous with huge sparkling chandeliers. 

The rooms are a little out to date. Reminding me a a grandparents house in the 90s. Tacky blue carpet and frilly printed couches. I was cracking up at the style. Tacky but at least it was clean. Everything worked and room service and housekeeping were fast and friendly. 

Four stars only Bc the out of date rooms and tv did not have DVD input.

This will probably be shocking for the romantic community out there, but I was very disappointed with this hotel. My friends and I travelled from San Diego to Vegas to watch Britney Spears in concert. We drove straight to the hotel and checked in around 2pm. We thought we could hit the pool and get some relaxing time before the show at 9pm. We were very disappointed when we were told that the pool would be closed at 4pm because it was winter hours. Seriously! The sun was out there burning hot in the middle of the desert and the pool was pretty full of people. Are you kidding me? We had no other choice but to going out of the hotel and walk around the strip to  "kill" some time off. I wish we were told about this situation. I would've happy to stay somewhere else that were more customer driven than Paris Hotel. The rooms were outdated and the fridge is located where the TV normally is: inside the double door closet! The hotel needs some serious upgrade.

I stayed at the older room this time, which hadn't been renovated and still had the small 32" TV.  The bed was so uncomfortable that my back was so stiff when I got up in the morning.  The comforter was also very thin and I got cold at night.  I asked the housekeeping for an extra blanket the next day.  But when I got back to my room at night, there was no blanket!!!  I called the housekeeping again and was told that they were out of blankets and were expecting a shipment but didn't know when it would arrive.  WTH?????  It was already 10:30pm!!!  What kind of cheap hotel is this that you can't get an extra blanket?  There should have been an extra one in the room to begin with!!!!  I had to crank up the heater which totally dried up my airway in the morning.  

If you must stay here, be sure to book the RED room.  Those are the renovated rooms with modern deco and big flat screen TV and nice comfy bed(s).

The hotel is classy but ok. The check in wasn't pleasant. Theybwere getting frustrated at a family member who didn't speak english. And then when we asked if we could be on separate floors, they said, 'of course', but we all ended up on the same floor. 
The basic room felt shabby and a little dirty or run down. For the price, Inwas thinking it would feelt out dated but not run down. The wallpaper was too busy and to my modern eye, the patterns didn't match. I know I don't have an eye for this hotel's type of style but if you prefer modern, Inwould suggest an updated room or a different hotel. 
Overall, I enjoyed my experience but won't be coming back to Paris. I've enjoyed other hotels on the strip with better customer service.

A few reviews I had read were less than stellar, so I had my reservations about staying here when my partner-in-crime and I decided to go to Vegas; however, I was immediately impressed.

We got a good deal through Hotwire, and soon found ourselves in the opulent check-in area of the Paris. It really only got better from there. Our room was clean, smelled nice, and came with toiletries that made my skin feel nice and soft in the usual dry-as-hell hotel air.

The 24-hour cafe does its job-- it's reasonably priced, and its food doesn't give you the usual creepy-crawly feeling that 24-hour cafes give you.

The buffet: FANTASTIC. For what seems to be the usual price of buffets now (a whopping $20-$25 a person... yikes!), you get a RIDICULOUSLY huge selection of food, and not just your usual buffet fare-- Great food! Steaks, crab, seafood, more pastries than you can wave a stick at... everything!

And speaking of pastries, they have what may have been the best pastry shoppe I've ever seen (yeah, yeah, I know, I've never been to the REAL Paris, so shut up.).

Service was always spectacular, even when I had some peculiar requests (such as a humidifier). Since we went through a deal website, our view, while less than amazing, was still a decent strip view. Our friends, who went through the same site, had an amazing view, to be fair. It was kind of luck of the draw.

All in all, I'd like to see this place again, and hopefully I will. 

PROS: Excelllent service, good food, decent prices, great position on the strip, clean rooms, expedient housekeeping service, comfy beds

CONS: Smallish casino floor (attached to Bally's, so that helps), the buffet is kind of pricey (but you get what you pay for).

VERDICT: Seeya again, hopefully soon, Paris!

First time staying here for our week's vacation. 

Pro & Con: Registration on a Sunday afternoon was crazy busy with very long lines. We had just finished a five hour drive to get there and the line was a PIA.   Having gotten through the line, weren't we impressed that we got an upgrade to a parlor room for a standard rate room. Yay!

Pro's: Having been to Paris, France on a number of occasions we really liked all the special French touches throughout the hotel.  Look around at the ceilings and the moldings, really beautifully done.  Great lobby artwork, took us back to fond memories of prior trips.  The lobby and the halls are kept beautifully clean and free of trash and debris.  The wait for an elevator was quite impressive considering how many people stay at this hotel.

Con's: I brought all my workout gear and headed straight for the spa\/gym the first morning.  I was not happy when told use of the gym would be a $100 (for the week) added on to my room.  Needless to say, I passed on that and did lots of walking to make up for the lack of going to the gym.

Con:  There was no free wifi in the room. If you want it added, this will set you back $15.00+ p\/day. One thing you will find with Vegas in general,  is that nothing is complimentary\/free.  

Pro & Con: We can recommend the cafe called Madelines on the ground floor.  It's convenient but in the morning has very long lines (seems everywhere there are long lines to wait in).  The coffee and the pastry were very delish but also expensive.  2 medium coffee and 2 croissants were around $15.00, I think that's expensive. Note: I do pay close attention to details, I couldn't figure out how we ordered the same selection every morning and yet the total on the bill varied each morning.  What the?

Pro: Our parlor room was very spacious and as I stated earlier had beautiful French artwork on the walls.  The king sized bed was very comfortable and there was plenty, plenty of closet storage room for our clothes and luggage.  We had a seating area for snacking\/coffee in the morning, a couch area for our friends to sit on when they came to visit as well as a separate "bar" area for drinks and appy set ups.  The bathroom was bigger than both of our back home bathrooms.  The marble on the sinks and the shower were a light orange in color and really quite unique.  We had a state of the art flat screen TV (although we didn't use it much) offered a great picture and sound quality.  

Pro: The ride up the Eiffel Tower was so much fun at night.  Bring your camera or iPhone and have a ball.  The view up and down the strip was all lite up and magical.  As a suggestion to Paris Hotel, I understand that you never allow your paying guests to ride for free but maybe you could\/should offer a free VIP express line.  It seemed to me that as a paying guest at your hotel,  I shouldn't have to wait in line with the rest of the world to take the ride.  Just saying would have made me feel like I was "special" without it costing you anything. 

Pro: the pool area is big and spacious with waitress service all day.  Get there early to reserve your table and chairs as it does fill up quickly in the morning and people scramble later in the day to secure a chair.   

Pro: Gorden Ramsey's Steak restaurant is right there on premises and we had a really great meal on our last night in Vegas.

Con: don't visit the Paris on the last weekend in March as it hosts the International Karate Kids Exhibition and with it 5,000 kids, families, coaches and judges.  The actual competition happens on premises.  

Pro: Every single one of the staff members was helpful, friendly and intentionally nice.  Our needs and questions were answered swiftly and courteously and that was important to us.  Valet service was hopping and quick.  Bellman got our bags delivered  upon check in and picked up super fast when it was time to go.  

Lastly-

Pro: Paris is a pet friendly hotel.  This was a big consideration for us because we like to travel with our small dog.  There is a charge but the cost of a kennel vs a stay at the Paris was a no-brainer for us. For all of the pro's AND being pet friendly, you have our vote Paris and a promise of our repeat business. Thanks for a really nice stay.

Just came back from a 5 day stay at the Paris Hotel.  We were given a renovated room.  The room was a little on the small side compared to other Vegas hotels that I've stayed at.  Never encountered the paper thin walls experience.  We never heard people in other rooms.  The crepes were delicious!  Dined at Mon Ami Gabi, a restaurant in the hotel, and had the best french onion soup possible.  The casino was standard issue casino.  We were fortunate to be able to enjoy the Diamond Club Lounge where we enjoyed free cocktails and free appetizers daily from 4-6 pm.  Extras such as first on the shuttle to the Rio to check out the World Poker tournament was a luxury with the Diamond Card membership too.  No complaints here with that one in the 108 degree heat!  I've been to bigger and more luxurious pools, but the Paris pool does the job.  We rented an air conditioned villa by the pool for a day.  It was sweet!!!  Juice, water and soda were provided and went well with our bottle that we brought in for the day.  Much better than the fake slushy cocktails all the hotels serve. Of course the testosterone male in the group enjoyed having sports on the big flat screen tv in the villa.  I loved the misters to cool down and make it tolerable to spend an entire hot day poolside.

As someone else mentioned-used to be lovely. Gone all the way downhill. We were there during Christmas. Due to "sale" pricing, filled with underaged, drunk teens with fake IDs. It was very unpleasant. And prices for this and that were ridiculous. $17 for 2 coffees and 2 plain pastries;$40 for 2 sandwiches. Checkin staff was lovely but restaurant staff was surly. We were so disappointed . Internet in room barely worked and NO cell reception. TV didnt work. We called for repair. Worker said this was his 18th call, so he would now, finally, call cable provider. We wont be back.
If you are a grown up, stay in Bally's or Bellagio.

Terrible service. Management is terrible to say the least. We got to our room and it was 80 degrees. A maintenance gentleman came to our room and had to make some repairs. We explained the situation to Darrin (front desk manager) and he refused to comp the night even though we slept in 80+ degree weather! Little does he know we review hotel rooms for a living...the BAR will definitely be hearing about this as well as his boss, Gary Austin. Don't stay here!

Worst customer service ever! We tried this hotel to do something new and kind of romantic, but we will never go back!!!! 

* Corinne, the front desk lady is very rude, has an attitude, and doesn't know how to communicate with customers. I was asking how to pay for parking upon checkout and instead of simply giving me a straight answer, she started a rundown of Parking-Hotel Lessons 101, trying to lecture and school me about how the parking structure works! Please, learn to communicate better and treat customers in a non passive\/aggressive way if you want to work in the Hospitality industry...

*Pool is not the best. Yes, you have the Eiffel tower in front of you, but it is small and gets overcrowded.

*Hotel is old!! It took us 1:26 minutes to open the door. When calling front desk they said, "just keep on trying... ".
It looks like Paris is one of the hotels under the Total Rewards chain that hasn't been remodeled yet. 

Remember that there are plenty of other options that will make you feel welcomed, take good care of you, and is worth your hard earned money!!

2 stars because at least they have a good location.
Don't stay here unless you are either over 40 or have children. Anyone younger and single should stay elsewhere. Perhaps Aria or Venetian. Even Planet Hollywood. The casino was filled with old folk. That's fine and all, but I wanted more energy, and let's be honest-- eye candy. Rubbing elbows with elderly and kids in Vegas? Not my thing.

The pool is there so they can say they have a pool. It was filled with leaves from nearby trees. Our bathroom smelled like pee. And when we asked them to clean it again, it smelled like pee + chemical disinfectant. I wanted to puke.

Plus when we checked in, they said they only had a handicap accessible room available for the non-smokers, but they could switch our rooms tomorrow. We made our reservation weeks ago. Why would they suddenly not have a room for us? Methinks Paris is shady. We didn't switch because it was a pain in the ass. The next day the check in line was huge. I bet they just told us we could switch knowing that we wouldn't.

I wouldn't ever stay there again and certainly would't recommend it to anyone but my grandma.

Also, $25\/day to work out and $15\/day for wifi. What a rip off. Go downstairs to one of the cafes, they have free wifi.

The La Femme show is perfect.  I was expecting the worst and ended up amazed.  This show is more than just naked ladies--it's very artistic and the dancers are outrageously talented (and perfect).  I felt like a total cow after watching 100 perfectly lithe women traipse around for an hour, but I'm glad that I saw it.

My goal is to stay at each hotel on the strip at least once and this time it was Paris turn. I stayed here the weekend of 5\/13-5\/15 for both of my sisters birthdays and it wasn't too bad. I was emailed for early check-in at 4am Friday 3\/13 and thank the lord I did because all I had to do is pick up the keys and be on our way. If you use the self parking be prepared to walk through the shops and part of the casino to the front desk. It's definitely not a short distance. I had reserved a 2 queen room and upon first arriving I was pleased then I looked closer and I can see why the bad reviews are on here. There was rust or some black stuff on the light switch in the bathroom, mold in the shower, the wallpaper was peeling off in the room and bathroom, and the furniture was chipped up pretty badly. When I spend a lot of money on a "5 star" hotel I expect to see very little to no imperfections. My hotel view was ok; I could see the Bellagio lake (well some of it). 

If you have a chance check out the pool! The Eiffel Tower is in plain view and I really enjoyed it. The DJ could be better but I was getting drunk so I didn't care. There is a bar with drinks priced at Vegas prices. So I'll leave it there. 

I will say the staff was pretty nice and fabulous. The check-in agent who helped us with the keys was really helpful and even did his best to find us a suite with 2 beds when he found out we we're celebrating birthdays.  That Saturday night, my friend that was with me lost her wallet and they called me on Wednesday 5\/18 to tell me they found it with everything still in it! That's awesome because I was sure they weren't even looking for it and somebody made off with her stuff. So for that the staff gets 5 stars! 

Overall, I would go back if the other hotels on the strip were booked up or this hotel has a good deal going on because $250\/ night is not worth it to me.
Always the place to go to release some stress on the casino floor always great when you win had a great time just me and my mom

Dear Paris,

Your front desk staff ruined my stay at Vegas. I was there a month ago and I am still mad now. 

So here goes my story:
We made reservations for 2 nonsmoking rooms. My family and I arrived early, we tried to check in at 1pm but was told by the staff at Guest Services that our rooms were not ready and to come back at in 2 hours. Fair enough. We walked around for 2 hours, my mom started to feel ill, we returned to the front desk at 3pm. We were again told the rooms were not ready. We informed the front desk that one of the members of our party is not feeling well and we want to know how much longer is the wait. We were told in a very unsympathetic tone "I don't know. Come back in half an hour." We came back at 3:30 and was again told in a very monotone "Your rooms are not ready." So when can we expect our rooms? I asked. "I don't know. It's not ready yet." By this time, my mom was really feeling ill. The smoke in the casino was bothering her so she was literally sitting on the floor in the lobby. Which brings up another question, why are there no chairs or sitting area in your lobby? I guess that's because you want us to go and sit in the casino right? We again, informed the staff that someone is not feeling well. We have two rooms, can we check into one. We got a very unenthuastic "Sure". She found us a room. How long has that option been available? And then even more puzzling, she handled us one set of room keys and then a few seconds later, handed us another set of room keys. No explanation what-so-ever but apparently, we got both of our rooms. 

The next day, I decided I wanted to speak to management about this. Certain family members tried to talk me out of it saying "Don't bother, they have our money only. They don't care. We're not high-rollers." I thought about it but then thought it's not fair to you if we don't even give you the opportunity to make things better. So the next day, my sister and I went down to Guest Services and asked to speak with the manager who's on. We spoke with the manager. We told her what happened. She gave us a fake smile and without looking into anything said she can explain to us what happened. She states that they usually try to accomodate early check-ins but sometimes it's just not possible. I can understand that but wait, isn't the check-in time suppose to be 3pm? Apparently not, she said their check-in is at 4pm. Bellagio, MGM Grand, and many other hotels on the strip have a 3pm check-in time but at Paris it's 4pm. This was also information that we never received at the front desk. She also apparently didn't feel that our complaint of lack of communication with the front desk was justified. We were sent back and forth three times but she said rooms are constantly being turn-overed and said "at a click of a button on the computer, things change... We might have no rooms available one second and then the next second we have tons of rooms all clean." The tone of the manager was condescending and patronizing. I was even more upset after talking to her than before. 

Okay, so maybe I shouldn't have said anything, I'll just write you a nasty yelp review. 

I can deal with you old and smelly rooms but I cannot deal with you snotty attitude. 

So in conclusion, I am not coming back to this hotel again. There are better hotels on the Vegas strip. Apparently, the staff here thinks they are true Parisians.

Our stay at the Paris started off with my plane being delayed and the hotel not allowing my husband to check in because the room was under my name.. Despite having all the confirmation documentation and the room being paid for already. It got worse when the toilet wouldn't flush and we had to call the front desk three times before anyone got sent up.. So pretty much spent our whole night unable to use the toilet. They only sent someone up after we told them it was flooding the floor. All in all.. Not impressed and won't be staying here again. Spend a little extra and go the the Venetian... They have excellent customer service and the rooms are so much nicer.

love this place.
will always return here... this place has all the games that i play.
service is good and people are nice.
good job paris!
the rooms can stand to be a little more upscale.
also, a guard at the elevators would keep some rift rafts out.
Tired rooms, marginal beds, and the rooms smell of smoke.. Time to remodel the rooms...check around

If you can get a good price on this hotel, I'd say go for it. It's cheaper than Caesar's and better than Bally's. I stayed here three times, and I tried the $20 trick twice and it worked! Both times, I got great views. Overall, if everything go accordingly, this hotel is my preferred place.

I had reviewed them initially on TripAdvisor and already had a semi-poor experience but my recent interactions with them makes me wish I had given a lower score on that site. The *only* good thing about them is their central location. Even the Total Rewards program through the Caesar's properties no longer makes up for their *appalling* lack of service. I have been waiting nearly 2 weeks for an issue to resolve (1 week of which I'm already at home!!) They were unhelpful while I was there and continue to be unhelpful now as I still await a resolution to my problem with a tour I booked. The biggest issue? Their utter lack of any seeming care for their customers. Don't stay at the hotel (daily room cleaning service was also inconsistent). Your money would be better spent elsewhere at a more trustworthy hotel that offers *real* customer service.

I arrived early September 2016 and used the "automated kiosk check in machine". A couple of days after I have a problem when I used my TOTAL REWARDS VISA because there were FRAUDULENT charges. I reported to TOTAL REWARDS VISA that was issued by COMENITY BANK and initially I was happy because the charges were reversed late September 2016. Then in mid-December 2016 they charged my account again, They could not even send me proof that I signed off on the receipt of goods\/money.
I like to report NO STAR or NEGATIVE STAR until I get my money back. 
WORST EXPERIENCE IF A PLACE CANNOT PROTECT YOU FROM FRAUD.
BE CAREFUL IN GOING TO "PARIS CASINO IN LAS VEGAS"
I hope I can connect with other people who experienced the same thing and maybe we can jointly ask for our money back.

Had a great pretty inexpensive weekend at the Paris hotel!! Big daddy made the best drinks at the bar right by checkin and breakfast at Madeleine's was amazing!!! Best cheese Danishes I've ever had!! Can't wait to come back

I love Paris! Everything from the chandeliers to the sky ceiling in the casino to our room on the 15th floor. I can see where a lot of people might have complaints but it didn't really affect me when I was there. I liked the decor, it may not have been as up to date and current as other hotels but I thought it was pretty classic and timeless. 

The only thing I had a problem with was the $15 for 24 hr WIFI internet. Then again, why would you need internet when you're in Vegas right? To yelp of course! All jokes aside, if i didn't have an application I needed to turn in, I wouldn't have purchased it but it was only $95 for all three nights we stayed so it balanced out well. 

Overall, I really liked this hotel and I would gladly stay here again especially with the good price. It's also in the middle of everything! Across from Bellagio and the fountain, next to Planet Hollywood and across the street from that is The Cosmopolitan. Definitely a good area to stay when you don't want to take a taxi everywhere!

I was very disappointed with the hotel. The restaurants were good. Booked an Eiffel Tower view. Got to my room and there was no view. (I paid extra for the view) so they put me in a room with a view 18th floor. I was very excited. But! The pool plays very loud music. Fine. I called down at 2 am asking them to turn the music down. They said it goes off at 4! 4 am! Loud booming music till 4? Who does that??? And then the blow the pool area at 7 am. So here's the deal if you just need a place to shower and keep your clothes this is ok, pricy at $200 a night, but if you want to actually rest up for the next day, pick somewhere else. It really ruined my night.

I hate those freakin' mimes in the lobby.  You just do not sneak up on someone who is hungover and barely containing themselves, barf-wise, and scare the hell out of them before they've had an egg mcmuffin.  And that's another thing.  There is nowhere in the Paris to get an easily-accessible emergency hangover breakfast.  I had to settle for a pain au chocolat (hardly the pain au chocolat you had in the real Paris, more like a Costco croissant with a squirt of dried up Hershey syrup inside) and a mocha from the "boulagerie" in the lobby, which was full of screaming kids and 0% BAC adults.

The casino staff was not amused when we wanted to gamble at 5 a.m. in our jammies.  I was not amused by the price of the room and those f'ing mimes.

4\/5 for casino\/restaurants, etc.
2\/5 for hotel room and service

I love the way this hotel looks interior\/exterior\/waitress\/etc.
Bet limits are not so high and not so low.  Slots seem to do pretty well here.

My dissatisfaction comes from the hotel room.  I used the frontdesktip.com to get a free upgrade from luxury to a premium.   The view of Bellagio was blocked by the eiffel tower and quality of the room was decent.  Problem is my neighbors were super noisy at 6am, I can hear everything and I kept getting mistaken phone calls at 6am from the neighbor's friend. 

Now.. after the second night of no sleep, I was really frustrated so asked the front desk if they can move us.  The clerk was a jerk and told me there's nothing available even before he looked it up.  I told him I would even pay for a suite or take a downgrade and that I just needed sleep and then he went "Sir.. THERE.. IS.. NOTH...ING.. AVAIL.. ABLE.." like I was a dumbass.  His sorry ass could've called the noisy neighbors or called security for me or something.

Tip : when you check in, make sure you are not next to a suite.  When you have something like #### and there is a ####P next to it, you got screwed and have them move you out that moment.

Tip2 : Use frontdesktip.com to get a free upgrade.

I'm a fan of this place. I brought 5 girls here for my bachelorette party and it was a great center of it all hub for all of us! 

The hotel is a bit older, so the ventilation isn't always great, and i felt like the lobby smoke was a bit much sometimes and easily came up to our non smoking floor. 

But that aside, our room was decent and definitely did the trick for us. The bathroom has no vent FYI, so no going #2 lol. We did have a great view of the pool from our room, which was also nice. 

They were happy to accommodate our late check out time and gave us a turn down when we asked.

You are welcomed by a lavish front desk and casino area only to be disappointed by an outdated and poorly maintained hotel room. Room was small, poor amenities, hairdryer blew up on first use. Many dints and scrapes on the walls. Good location on the center of the strip. If only they cleaned and maintained the rooms better.

Yeah it's not exactly Paris but you can almost tell what it feels like, ok maybe not. Still you have to admit it is kind of fun to look up at the Eiffel tower (which is only 5\/8ths scale of the real thing), the Montgolfier Balloon made into a neon sign, and the Arc de Triomphe (only 2\/3rds of it). Even the front of the building is done up to look like a Paris Opera House and the Louvre. Inside it feels like you're walking on streets of Paris, ok kidding, but the painted walls (which include buildings, people, so on), iron wrought street lamps, and the cobblestone walk ways are a nice touch. 

There are a lot of good restaurants located in the Paris hotel, even some familiars from back home in Chicago like Mon Ami Gabi and La Creperie. But what you really want to check out is the Eiffel Tower Restaurant located 11 stories up and what a view. Just a tip, a dress code is enforced here. 

I don't know about staying here but I will always visit.

Whew...What day!! I have been in Vegas for less than 12 hours and boy I have been busy. I left Los Angeles around 5am on Monday and didn't get to Vegas until 4pm?! Well, I stopped over Primm Valley Resort because its damn good to gamble over there. Any who, Paris is why I am writing about. 

I arrived to Paris Las Vegas around 4:30pm. I am staying at the Premier Guest Room. However, I asked if I can get a complimentary upgrade with "THE SANDWICH". Corinne, was my Host and she found me a Red Room Premier on the 30th Floor, Room #21. When I got the room, I headed over to my room which is the top class elevator. Most of the other guest don't have access to 26 and up. When I arrived to my room, the cleaning lady was still working in our room. WTF?! I thought it was already done?! Well, I had to go back downstairs and get another room. They gave me the 26th Floor, Room #21. Hmmm, 21. I guess thats a good number. 

My room has a beautiful view overlooking The Eiffel Tower and the Paris Pool. I can watch the Bellagio Water Fountain and hear of Celine Dion and Frank Sinatra through the windows. They call it the Red Room because the headboards of the bed are red and the floor is kinda funky looking. I'll upload the pictures a little later. I have a huge 52" HDTV, but they don't have great HD Video Quality. They a minibar, but I requested it to be locked..SORRY!! They have complimentary coffee and and an IPOD dock station in the room. 

The room is great the but service is average quality. Why come here?! Well, I am usually at Sahara because I love low key hotels. Harrah's is the first big chain that I am familiar with and would like to keep in my portfolio. I have stayed at MGM, Mandalay, Venetian, Sahara, Harrah's Rincon, and now Paris Las Vegas. I am not sure how much the room costs, but it was FREE and on the elite site of the hotel. 

Have Fun here and Keep Yelping!!

I stayed at Paris Las Vegas with my mom since she had an offer for 4  free nights.  Sadly, Paris didn't really do it for me.  Must've been the layout of the casino floor and hotel in general.

The Positives:

-I could frequently visit Mon Ami Gabi (one of my favorite restaurants).
-Connected to Bally's and their Monorail Station for easy access to the south end of the Strip.
-Location is Center Strip

The Negatives:

-Besides Mon Ami Gabi and Effiel Tower Restaurant, the food choices here are pretty below average.
-The hotel rooms were quite a walk to get to.
-Our room was well, just a simple room.
-Towel service was slow.

Believe it or not, the Deluxe rooms at Bally's are far more luxurious and at the same price point as the standard rooms at Paris.  So overall, I had an OK stay here.  Not as exciting as I thought it would be though.  I guess I can't complain too much since I stayed here for free, but I probably won't be coming back here to stay.

I would actually give it 4 stars but the cleaning lady didn't clean our rooms at all, all 3 nights, even though we weren't in the room. We actually booked 2 rooms, one at Cosmo, and one at Paris. We stayed in Paris the first night, and left it as a "smush" room. LOL. But didn't really use it, but it never got cleaned. It was nice having an extra room. 

I actually really like Paris' rooms. The decor was very nice, the bathroom was new and clean. The color of the rooms and beds were very nice, made me feel like I was actually in Paris. The rooms were smaller, but it's because they actually had nice furniture. The hotel itself was cool. I never stayed in Paris, and it was good. Great view of the mountains, gave me a peace of mind when I stared at it.

Probably one of the better "cheaper" end hotels on the strip. I'll probably stay here next time! But request for maid service.

Its just a casino hotel that needs updating. The only reason it gets three stars is because its in a good location on the strip. You can walk to alot of the other hotels from the Paris hotel. We were greeted in our room by the clogged bathroom sink which they fixed without us asking. I think they realized it when they cleaned our room. The bed, pillows and towels are not that comfortable. The pool area needs an upgrade. So many of the pool area chairs are broken and people are always looking around for a chair that works. The gym was nice and the staff were nice as well. Gordon Ramsey Steak is located in the casino which is a great addition. I also love Mon ami Gabi for breakfast. Paris needs a little work buts its still ok. If you want a spectacular room this is not the place for you.
i have any. bad to said. i love everything from this hotel . so nice and quiet , i live the pool so relaxing

I didn't dislike this hotel but it simply seemed like it would be better suited for an older crowd and there were other hotels I think I'd like to try out next time. I did however really like that this hotel was almost in the center of the most of the action and I thought it was a pretty hotel.

We had some trouble checking into our correct room (due to a technical error when booking), and the lady at the front desk was not the most helpful person. She seemed to give zero shits about all the documentation I provided to show what our correct room should be. Instead she wanted us to pay a $30 "change fee" so we could have our correct room. (2-star experience)

However, the day was saved when a Manager named Francisco came over to assist us. Once we explained the situation to Francisco, and showed him screen shots on my phone from the original reservation, he said he would see what he could do. Well after a few minutes of some very serious typing, he was able to shift around some rooms to we'd be able to get into our correct room and no additional charge!

Thank you Francisco, you saved the day and our trip!

Not going to sugar coat it - the Paris needs some work.  This was one of the huge hotels built in the 90s during the boom (along with MGM, New York New York, etc.). Unfortunately, it hasn't been updated since then.

We booked online for a very good price. We requested two rooms, adjoining if possible, with a king size bed.  We were assigned two rooms.  We had a very check-in staff person (Ryan) who was able to upgrade us to strip-view, with two rooms next to each other (not adjoining), but two double beds per room.

In the end, I almost wish we had stuck with non-strip view.  While the view was great (including the Bellaggio fountains), the noise at night was disturbing.  There's a club in the Eiffel Tower restaurant, and we heard house music and hip-hop on Friday night until 4am.  We were jetlagged, so hoping to get some sleep on our first night.

The rooms themselves are okay.  There's decent space and climate control.  The beds are comfortable. However, the carpets need to be replaced, and the bathrooms need a little updating. Still, for the limited time we spent in our rooms, it was average.

We had difficulty with some of the services.  On our first day, the pool was not heated to prepare for a charity polar-bear swim.  Then, the next day the pool was unexpectedly closed for emergency maintenance. While we could use the patio for an afternoon, within 2 hours we were kicked off so they could start maintenance.  Disappointing!  The internet in the rooms was also very spotty. Although it was included in the "resort fee", it was slow and there was no internet on the casino floor.  They offered 1-day credit on our resort fee for the spotty internet.

The "free breakfast" was also a bit of a rip off.  Turns out, we were given $9 credit per person for breakfast, but we had to use it at Java Joe or Nosh, two fastfood type places at Bally's.  Java Joe had only coffee and minimal pastries.  Nosh had meals, but most of their choices (and most of the decent food) cost  more than $9. Not free, and we couldn't get meals at the nicer places within the Paris hotel.

Overall, we had a good time in Vegas and the stay at the Paris was probably worth the low price. It's a shame they haven't kept it up, or provided more high-quality services. It used to be far nicer.

Worst stay ever!!!! Had no hot water in our room for our first two days. After a huge fiasco with management they changed our room to what was supposed to be an upgrade. Had cockroaches climbing up our wall at bedtime. Never again will we be staying here!!hey just caught my second roach

If you're spending a weekend in Vegas don't bother staying at Paris! Customer service is HORRIBLE, rooms are dirty, bathrooms are moldy, restaurants are all mediocre and the buffet is basically like going back to college and eating in your dorm's dining hall but for $22! You either have a terrible view of a parking garage or if you have a view of the pool you are subject to extremely loud music all night from the "club" in the Eiffel Tower.

Loved our stay at the Paris Hotel!! First time we stayed at the Paris and was very pleased! Hotel is clean and has lots to do whether you are 21+ or under 21. Restaurants at the Paris was good as well! Very pretty inside and outside. Also loved the location of the Paris as it's a nice central location to walk to other hotels. Saved lots of money at the Paris (on room and with uber coupons courtesy of the paris) and had a great time! We'll be back for sure!!

Bottom Line: I think this is a decent casino hotel! Don't brush it off, especially if it's your first time in Vegas. It's central- which is a major plus. I also like the restaurants inside- can you say crepes!? You also can probably get a good deal here on the right day. PET FRIENDLY

Location:  Great place on the strip in my opinion. You're close to everything, and your room is right there! It's a little off from a Fat Tuesday (if anyone is obsessed like me lol) so that was kind of annoying butttt overall- yes. I personally get a little lost inside the hotel, but I think it's like that with most? I also have a Poot sense of direction so I might not be trusted in this capacity LOL

Rooms: They're straight! A little dated, but it works. I had a bad smelling room and they switched me very easily THANK GOD.

Food: Great food options both in the hotel and nearby. 

Buffet: I didn't get to try it!!! :( By the line though, I definitely have to if I come back!

Pets: They are pet friendly- I brought my dog along- but their pet fee is kind of pricey, $75? I believe.

Not a fan of: How far parking was from my room. IT WAS A WORKOUT.

Call me a purist, but I'm not much of a fan the way Las Vegas has turned into a Disneyland for adults. Granted Paris is pretty spectacular but somehow doesn't harken back to any of Vegas' grand style of yore. I can't see Sinatra playing craps in a place like this, which I guess is ok, but somehow the Vegas magic is just missing from this place.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. The view of everything is great.
The drinks were so watered down and outrageous. 
The good drinks we got were from giving the bartender $10-$15 tip EACH time we ordered a drink. 

Room service dinner was good.

The room is truly nothing out of the ordinary, it is as others say, out of date! The beds werent all that great either. 

This was our 3rd time in Vegas, when we come again, I'm 99% sure this will not be where we will stay at.

I love this casino! Why? Because it's newer and classier than Bally's casino. Because it's conveniently attached to Bally's. Because the dealers are so awesome (Michelle and Rex at the roulette tables are the best!). And mainly because I won enough money at Paris to pay for my entire trip! Plus, Paris is gorgeous inside and out!

One of the worst experiences we had in Las Vegas, first they booked the wrong rooms, after we complained, they insisted that's what we booked but they could pull the call.... 30min later, I received a phone call, sorry but we are unable to pull the reservation there was a technical problem (yeah right, I'm sure if it would-off been our mistake- no technical problem)
So they comped us 100$ for staying in a room smaller than a bedroom closed.
Anyhow the rooms are super small and haven't been upgraded for probably the last 10years.
Room service-  in case you need utensils make sure you have your 3$ ready, since that's what Paris is charging for fork and knife.......
Do yourself a favor, stay somewhere else like the Cosmopolitan or Wynn, Aria... -- we never had a bad experience there.

Pros: location on strip, ability to house a conference with large number of attendees, great pool with entertaining DJ.

Cons: very dark, check-in was long, extremely smoky, limited dining options in comparison to other venues, outdated public areas, outdated rooms (vary by floor - 25th was old, 21 was updated, for example). 

Wouldn't stay here again - Venetian seemed much nicer and comparable in price.

3.5 stars

Not a bad place to stay in Vegas.  High ceilings (painted like you're outdoor and looking up at the sky) gives it a friendly and fun environment.  The rooms are okay, no complaints but nothing special about them either.

What I like about this hotel
+ Connected to Ballys so you can just walk right over in AC controlled environment and avoid the rain\/heat\/and or noisy strip
+ They have mini paigow table :D
+ Le Notre is located here: the best bakery in Vegas :)

The casino was wonderful! The painted the ceiling like the sky! the decorations in the casino was great as well.  The buffet was awesome, the food was delicious, again the service was GREAT! add a $11.99 for all you can drink booze ;)

Not sure about the hotel but the pool was just what we were looking for. We stayed off the strip and used a Groupon to use Paris' pool while in the area. Yummy cocktails and nice scenery. Staff was very friendly! Pool was clean and fun but still quiet enough for relaxing. Very happy with our decision to spend the day here!

I've stayed here twice now. Both times my rooms were comped by the casino, so I can't speak to normal room rates, but I have to pay a resort fee for each day. Rooms have always been decent, and cleaning staff does a good job. The hotel is dated, and hallways are pretty banged up from carts and normal wear and tear. The casino is relatively small, and doesn't have many options for table games. The walkways are poorly designed, and it is difficult to walk around outside the casino due to lines for the buffet or other restaurants blocking the walkways.

The rooms are nice and comfortable.  The location is great.  The pool is nice but there is not enough shade by early afternoon.  Free coffee in the room is nice.  We have stayed here numerous times and is always a nice experience.

Gustavs bar smelled so bad we had to leave-disgusting--Very bad moldy\/sweaty\/stale beer smell: the 'dancers' at the tables were so lame and acted like they didn't want to be there:  I expected a higher class in this casino-but it was as low as you can go. May as well go to Fremont street

Still my favorite hotel on the strip. 

Rooms are booty from what I remember (thin walls and small room) with average character. 

I always feel like I am in small town when I come here, and even though the fake sky has been done at a few other places, I still love it. 
Plus, they have a great Diamond Lounge for the ballers (coconut shrimp was delish!) and their Pina Coladas and Strawberry Daquiris have always been the tastiest I have had anywhere else (get it blended!). Even though I don't drink the ETOH anymore, I get it virgin and it still hits the spot. Holla! 

Try to the check out the pizza and JJ Boulangerie (5 star pizza in my book) and the creperie. I want to make love to their food....

Worst Las Vegas experience of my life!  Rude staff, inconvenient, things don't work, can't get a hold of room service ... etc.  We got there we were told we couldn't use valet because the vehicle was to big to fit, but when we went to leave we had to use valet while checking out and it did fit.  We parked at Bally's all weekend like they told us to and walked when it wasn't even necessary.  Checking in the staff was so rude, they treat you like you are inconveniencing them.  We asked if the room looked out at the strip, the girl sneered and said it's a tower room.  That was it.  We figured it out when we got up to the room.  The bathroom has no fan, no lock and the toilet barely flushed.  I'm talking 3 tries to get a piece of toilet paper down.  I called to try to get a wine glass, it took so long I gave up.  We called for extra towels the next day and got ahold of them but the towels never came.  Checking out they have express check out but it didn't work so we waited in a crazy line where only 3 people were working checking people in and out.  The worst part I think was that they never asked the most basic question ... how was your stay? ... just handed us the bill clicked things into the computer and said ok bye next.

This review is for Housekeeping and Lost and Found.  Thank you all for being so honest and helpful.  We stayed at the hotel in November and I left my favorite jacket in the hotel room closet upon check out, and didn't realize it until over 2 weeks later when I went into my own closet looking for it.  My heart sank.  I quickly called the hotel hoping they'd have it.  They connected me to Lost and Found where I had to leave a message describing the jacket.  Minutes later they called back saying they have it and would FedEx it to me!  It got here 2 days later!  Thank you everyone, I so appreciate it! Not everyone is as helpful or honest, but you people are and deserve to be recognized for it!  Thank you again!!

The hotel is in the middle of the strip, which is in a nice location. The hotel is beautiful, but the price vs service do not seem to go hand in hand.

We checked in around 4:30PM and waited about 20 minutes in line...only 3 people working the front desk. While not necessary to have all hands on deck all day, it would be nice during peak times. 

I had requested 1 king bed and they gave us a room with 2 queens. When we entered the room the carpets were wet, there appeared to be vomit stains on the floor, and there was a large commercial fan blowing in attempts to dry the floor. I have pretty severe asthma and allergies, so we had to go back down and request another room. Carrie at the front desk was very apologetic and helpful, and even noticed we had requested a room with a king sized bed and changed that as well. When we got to the room, the toilet paper holder was broken off and sitting on the sink, and it was clear housekeeping was aware of it as they had folded the bottom of the roll neatly. The room was clean and we had plenty of room and a little view of the Bellagio fountains. 

The Le Village buffet was subpar with the only decent items being the 2 kinds of Mac n cheese. The meats were fatty and rubbery, so we basically paid $35 for Mac n cheese. We paid $11.99 extra for the unlimited beer and wine, but the Blue Moon tastes skunked so we opted for a refund and had water instead. La Creperie was delicious - I got the Nutella crepe - but the line was long and the gentleman working did not seem happy to be there. The pool was nice and not too crowded on a Saturday, plenty of room in the water and lounge chairs available. 

Overall, the hotel wasn't necessarily bad, but at a price more expensive than other hotels nearby, I would expect them to step it up a little bit. It was just...ok.

Check-in was a bit of a mess. I had our paperwork confirming that we had 3 night stay there but they had us for only 1 night paid. Luckily the people who set up our stay were with us & after 30 minutes the mess was straightened out and we got early check in without paying the fee. 

The room was a nice corner penthouse room. I will say walking to the rooms down the hall-there is a lot of maintenance that needs to be done! Wallpaper peeling, crown molding falling apart, carpet in need of replacing-I'm sure when this hotel was new it looked far better than it does today. The hotel just looks beat-up. The bed was HARD! I don't think we slept much because of the bed. Even being our room was non-smoking you could still smell the smoke.

The little Crepe place was fantastic. We also enjoyed Jersey Boys, it was a fantastic show.

The layout of the building is very nice with lots of shops, with a boutique hotel feel but not large resort layout even though it's connected to Ballys. Very disappointed to find out the pool was closed for renovations, no alert is posted on the hotel website and wasn't notified of this until check in. They offered an "outdoor space" for "Sunbaithing" that's wonderful if you want to look at a giant concrete hole and workers being put to hard labor that machines could be doing much more effectively. The rooms also don't have any coffee machines and there was scraping going on jn the hallways early in the morning for repair work being done to the wall paper. Overall, a decent hotel but nothing special. Then again I've been to the real Paris and nothing can compare to that!

What a dump!  We checked in Sunday, March 19 at 4pm.  FIRST problem, we didn't get the room I paid for in my reservation, so we settled for a smaller room,for slightly less money.  SECOND, they don't have robes, unless you pay for a suite.   We requested robes for going to and from the pool, and they asked, "Do you want the $150.00 robe, or the $100.00 robe.  WHAT?  "Oh, they said, we don't loan robes to the rooms sir."   Wow, we even get robes on request at Hampton Inn's.  THIRD:  The TV stations come in and out, fussy and scratchy, like someone is adjusting the antennae on the roof.   FOUR:  We called for room service twice.  The first time, they didn't get our order correct.  The second time I called room service for breakfast, they told me "We are quoting a two-hour delivery time sir."    "WHAT, I said?"  "Two hours for breakfast"  "I told them to forget it.  and...we are here for two more days yet.  Wow, this place has become a serious dump.  NEVER again will we ever stay at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas.

Paris is excellent for stay and rooms are kind of okay okay with good customer service. 

Casinos have kind of less options and you will lose all the time. Atleast that's what I found. It's possible that they don't let anyone win. Lol

Room locker did not work for me as doors are kept open by someone before. Room service should have reset everything before they prepare room for me. But that's not big issue as I can stay without lockers. 

Food options inside casino are good and it's worth to try.
Great location!! Some hotels and casino give a shit & are happy to have you. This is not one. Beautiful property.

I am only giving it 3 stars because I think it is pretty! The rooms are pretty too but the beds and pillows SUCK!!!! We got the Red room which is an upgraded room but nothing super special. We had a little view of the strip. The staff were great too but I just could not sleep well on that bed and lumpy pillows! I most likely not stay here again unless it was super cheap and it I brought my pillows from home!

The rooms are so outdated its awful. It feels like we're spending the night at "grandma's house". There was a $60 discrepancy with our bill and they sent two big goons up to our room to make sure we paid the difference. When we went to the front desk, I asked to speak with the manager. He was indignant and unapologetic. DO NOT STAY HERE. It's awful! Bad service and bad rooms. The only reason we stayed at Paris was the fact that we were attending a company function at this hotel. Never again. We will be staying where we normally stay: Venetian\/Palazzo or Mirage where they treat you like royalty and the rooms are all suites. Much better hotels.

Good hotel. Good space. Good beds. Good pool. Not so good gambling for me here (bad luck, I suppose).

Still, I would recommend it. To those looking for a hotel, here's what is important. 

Inexpensive (well, relatively). Clean. Friendly housing staff. Quick service (we called for extra blankets and they rushed it up here for us). Excellent taxi service. (with 6 of us, they recommended that we take a limo instead of a taxi - we were going off-strip and this saved us a bunch of money!)

The ambience is cute, in an attempt to share what Paris feels like. The Eiffel Tower and the Arc are beautiful.

If you really wanted the best view of this entire casino, just walk across the street to the Bellagio and look at it. It is without a doubt, one of the nicer looking casinos on the strip.

This hotel has gone down hill. We used to stay here every year but not anymore. The room was outdated with a not so pleasant smell. The shower water smelled like rotten eggs and what is with the TV on the far side of the wall. The only positive to our stay there was Francisco the consierge. He was so very helpful and nice. Just because we are a rewards customer we deserved better.

Brakes my heart to write this but I have to.  Let me start by saying that it literally took 47 minutes to check in.  I don't mean the line waiting, I meant checking in with the receptionist lady.  They did not want to honor my paid reservation for three rooms.  The pool service was horrible, we had a day bed and the lady only came to check in us once and we couldn't find her at time to paid the bill.  And then room service lost or took with the towels one shoe and one bathing suit, come on!  Complete disaster.

I usually stay in condo resort-type hotels, but if I were to stay in an actual Strip hotel, the Paris would be a strong contender.  This is probably in my top 5 favorite hotel\/casinos in Las Vegas.  The thematic decor, with its fake blue skies, comes across as completely charming, but it's pretty easy to navigate around.  The Eiffel Tower is a bit silly, but worth doing once or twice, especially if you have a 2-for-1 coupon, which are common.  Timing your visit to see the Bellagio fountains and the Strip light up at dusk, is a great idea.

The bakery has delicious and decadent desserts, and when I tried the buffet a few years ago, it wasn't bad (although I've decided I am not a buffet person).  The location is smack dab in the middle of the Strip, so very convenient.

My only two complaints is that the cocktail waitresses' uniforms aren't very attractive and that I've never had much luck at the casino.  Although, I did win $10 at VP last time, so maybe my luck is changing!

Located in the center of the strip, Paris is a great hotel to stay at when you're visiting Vegas. It's a 10 minute walk to Omnia and a 6 minute walk to Drai's. It doesn't get more convenient than that!

The rooms were fantastic - modern, clean, and spacious. The decor of the room was simple and elegant, which was nice. The bathroom had a bath, shower, and a pretty big counter. You could comfortably fit three girls in front of the mirror. The beds were comfy and the sheets felt nice. This was important for getting good rest to party it up! ;)

Great hotel!
Clean and tidy, good service, amazing casino, close to everything right in the middle of the strip..
Great breakfest buffet!!

This is not a very nice hotel.  They are undergoing construction and because of this we didn't have water in our hotel room one afternoon.  They also said we wouldn't hear construction noise before 10am.  One day construction started at 5am and the other day it started at 7am.  When we asked about about the noise they offered to move us to a down graded room on a lower floor with no view.  How nice of them. 

 They also said there would be no more construction on the weekend.  Naturally they still did construction at 7am.  I guess because of the renovations they stopped taking care of the hotel.  Lots of holes in the wall,missing wallpaper, and real gross doors.  To make everything even more fun we found someone else's underwear in our room

Right on the strip and had the best view ever!! We watched the Bellagio Fountains every night. Lobby is beautiful. Restaurants are delicious. Staff is very friendly. Room is nice (stayed at the Red Room Luxury). There's a fridge in the room but no microwave, which was a bummer. But the view made up for it. VERY PLEASED!

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #43:
there's 2 things that you've gotta like about Paris: (1) the freaking Eiffel Tower coming up through the casino and towering above, and (2) the cute walkways, shops, and "al fresco" dining meant to mimic Parisian old city neighborhoods; the casino floor is surprisingly loud & vibrant, including occasional go-go dancers; I think it's a shame that the Eiffel Tower itself isn't a free tourist attraction, but you have to buy tickets or eat at the tower restaurant to go up the elevators; Mon Ami Gabi is famous for good reasonably-priced food and outdoor views of the Bellagio fountains, but a lesser-known option for the same is Sugar Factory; nice brightly lit hotel check-in area with many chandeliers; modest & uninspiring conference room hall; I'd give it 3 and 1\/2 stars overall; best craft beer bet = throughout Paris, it's a similar, modest selection; not bad, but nowhere is particularly good, with perhaps Sugar Factory being best

Unbelievably poor customer service. Was given the wrong information during booking our stay. Was told that our rooms would be connected when in fact they were not. 

Couldn't get confirmation via email. Spent two hours trying to fix their mistake. Very little was offered in the way of restitution.

One of the guest managers, BLANCA SEM, is very rude and incompetent. Very unprofessional staff. Caesar's Entertainment has employed high school graduates in their 20's to serve in guest relations for their hotels. There are no adult, upper management professionals available. Unbelievable.

Is it a hotel or a Night Club?
We checked in at 11 am, we were given a room facing a roof top. We returned to the front desk and nicely asked if a upgrade facing the strip was possible. The clerk was super nice. She said there were upgrades available. I also asked for a room away from the night club, knowing from previous reviews that it can get very loud. She said no problem, I can do that. She gave me the price I said OK, then she kept typing and said she wait here I'll give you the upgrade for $20 instead of $40. Wonderful! We agreed to wait the 2 hours to receive the keys before our upgraded room would be ready. The room was nice, the view amazing.......Until about 10:00 P.M.then BOOM, BOOM, BOOM until 3:00 A.M. The noise from the night club booming into our room. I guess the hotel isn't concerned about their guests getting any sleep. Does the $$$ from the night club trump the sleeping comfort of their guests??!! And while your laying there awake at 1:00 am you also get to smell cigarette smoke coming from somewhere. The ventilation system sucks! The location is great, but we will NOT be staying at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel again. At some point we needed to get some rest, you cannot do it at this hotel\/night club. Then it became time to checkout. We checked our balance on the TV in our room. We were charged $40 extra a night for the upgrade, not the $20 the nice clerk said she'd give us. We went down to the check out desk. Explained to the clerk that we were told $20 not $40. And I also explained that I had asked for a room away from the night club noise. The clerk said "oh that's not possible, all rooms facing the strip have some night club noise". Great another lie! (which at that point we had already figured out) We really didn't mind paying the $40 for a upgrade, but why tell us $20? The clerk brought out the manager, I could tell I wasn't going to get anywhere with him. I told him that I felt like we were lied to. He said he'd talk to the clerk that checked us in. What for, she won't remember us!! So make sure you get your room rate in writing, we made the mistake of trusting the clerk, about the noise and the discounted rate. If you want to party all night long, then this is the hotel for you!!! If you would also like to get some rest and do not want unwanted smoke in your room, pick another place.

One of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. Everything about this hotel is cheap and dirty. The service is the absolute worst in Vegas. We had to wait over 30 minutes for check in and out because they only have 2-3 people working at the reception at any given time. The food is disgusting and over priced. I won't stay at this hotel again for FREE

Absolutely loved the bar and band area of this hotel!! We had a blast listening to the live music and dancing.  I wish we had gone here every night!  The band was awesome and the drinks were strong. It was also a fun night "people watching"    The decor inside is cool and the Eiffel Tower and baloon outside are classics.

From the outside, Paris Las Vegas looks so beautiful and luxurious! The location is dead center on the strip and is located next to many of the other wonderful casinos on The Strip. 

I've been to the top of the Eiffel Tower and the views are absolutely beautiful! Overlooking the street at that height takes your Vegas experience to a whole different level. I highly suggest paying for the ride to the top and also make sure you go at night to see all of the beautiful lights. 

Now to the rooms:

Basic double bed room: It's just your typical room with the normal amentities. The only thing that stands out to me was the view that we had. We were able to see the Bellagio fountain show throughout our stay. Other than the gorgeous view, the room was pretty dated...

Suite: Not exactly sure what the suite was called, but I went inside after making some new friends at one of the clubs. The room was your basic suite with two bedrooms, kitchen, dining table, but the thing that really stood out was they had 8 bathrooms! Why must a suite need 8 bathrooms? I honestly don't have the answer to that, but I guess it can be fun going to a different bathroom throughout your stay..? Overall, thought the suite wasn't as nice as some of the other suites that I've stayed at on The Strip. It's the perfect room for a group of girls though since we all know how much girls need their space to do make-up and all that! 

Overall, Paris is a nice hotel, but it's not the best.

From the information given in bringfido.com, one would think this was going to be an incredible experience for my dogs and myself. I couldn't be more let down. The dog friendly rooms are depressing. The staff has not been helping with directing me to the potty area. I wish I could stay elsewhere.

I stayed at Paris for a holiday weekend and apparently over paid. My wife and I have stayed at several different hotels in Vegas from Excalibur to Caesars so I have come to understand that you get what your pay for (e.g., the more expensive the room, the better the service and quality). 

Paris broke that rule. From the reception to the buffets, I have to say the service in this place is ridiculously sub par. Unless, as a coworker pointed out, they were going for the authentic French treatment of Americans, in which case they were spot on. 

The room was plain with a horrible view. Something I would expect from Bally's or another generic resort, but for Paris (and the price) I was very disappointed. We were on a nonsmoking floor, but could still get occasional wafts of smoke in the room. Not sure if from a floor below, but seemed strange. 

Overall a lack luster experience. I won't be going back. Even free would be hard to get me back.

This was my first time staying here and unfortunately it was disappointing. We arrived late on a Friday and our room preferences were not available anymore. The room we got (smoking and queen beds, total opposite of what we asked for) was so old and gross, I couldn't believe how crappy it was. The carpet was badly worn and there were rust stains like they moved a rusty piece of furniture and of course it reeked of smoke. We were told that we would be getting an upgrade the next day so we dealt with it. The next day the lady gave me a hard time about honoring the upgrade but with a little persistence and remembering the guy who promised us the night before's name, we were moved from the 4th floor to the 30th, that room was a million times nicer so that's why I gave them 3 stars instead of 2. The weekend rates were very high, weekday rates were very good except you have to add on the rip-off resort fee every day which is to use the gym? and have wifi for one device, dumb.

The casino is pretty and the smoke isn't too bad there compared to others but I could not afford the table games there. I had no luck on the slots there and did not like their machines much. I gambled at other casinos instead.

The layout was confusing for us, we got lost several times trying to find the player's club and looking for quick serve places to eat, we ended up at Bally's somehow.

The pool was ok. It was pretty but not enough shade, one side was too much shade and the rest was extremely sunny. I heard it was $15 for a drink, so I did not even try to order anything there. You can't bring your own food or drinks as far as I understood, even water supposedly.

Le Cafe was a great place for the prix fixe chicken lunch. Best meal during our trip was here. It's in the middle of the casino under the fake clouds. 

We went up to the Eiffel Tower at night, it was amazing. I mentioned we were hotel guests and our tickets went way down in price, it was awesome. 

Mon Ami Gabi was just ok. The steak was tough and disappointing. I'd like to go sometime for breakfast and eat outside. Would not go back for lunch.

The quick breakfast place we tried was only fair. Our breakfast sandwiches were cold and the eggs tasted fake. Orange juice was like $5 and so was water.

Le Village Buffet used to be our favorite breakfast buffet but this time it was underwhelming.

I doubt I would ever stay here again. So I guess we won't always have Paris.

Wow! My room was mind blowing for the price that I paid for! I wasn't expecting this at all. My view from the room, looking towards the Eiffel Tower\/The Strip was AMAZING!!!! This view is so amazing that you can see the Bellagio water show in the background! Next time I want to come back to Vegas I want to stay in this casino with the same view!

My husband and I stayed here over Chinese New Years weekend for a more husband oriented baby moon trip.  Overall, we thought the hotel had an unbeatable location, good value for the room size and quality and some of the better in hotel conveniences on the strip.  The only things we didn't like were the noise level and the high minimum bets at the casino tables but we find that to be the case at almost all the on-strip casinos.  

Room: We were upgraded free of charge to a Red room corner suite.  Red rooms are the ones featured in the photos in the lobby area with the plush red leather headboards.  Our room happened to be a corner suite with windows in two directions, including one that allowed us to see the Bellagio fountain show from the comfort of our in-room seating area.  The large marble bathroom also had a nice jacuzzi tub which we took full advantage of.  I did notice that somehow the air in the room was extremely dry and my skin was always itchy from cracking.  Not sure whether to blame the air or the bathroom products for that one but if you stay here, be sure to bring your thickest lotions and chapsticks.  I sure wish I had.  

Food:  Paris is one of the hotels that offers the buffet of buffets.  We optioned for a package that included this buffet pass for only 12 dollars extra, a huge steal if you think about it.   I found that the buffet pass helped me to eat healthier because I had access to unlimited fresh fruits and veggies at every meal.  Whenever I'm in Vegas, I find myself more drawn to fresh produce than to the meat and seafood they have so much in abundance.  Maybe its the dessert climate.  

Casino: Does it scare anyone else to put down 15 dollar minimum bets?  I'm more used to like 5 or 10.  However, the rules and odds for blackjack at least seem more favorable than at lower limit tables and seemed to make up for the high minimum.  My husband did ok here.

Noise: That Napoleon's Dueling Piano Bar and the live music stage in the middle of the casino has got to go.  It is tacky and loud and extremely annoying to come back to after a long walk on the strip.

Non, non et re-non.
En tant que bonne parisienne qui se respecte, je peux dÃ©cemment pas dire que cet hÃ´tel est reprÃ©sentatif de la capitale. Pourtant c'est dommage Ã§a partait bien...

L'extÃ©rieur est trÃ¨s bien fait je trouve. On a une jolie Tour Eiffel, et surtout un Arc de Triomphe superbement reproduit. L'opÃ©ra Garnier, lui, est moyennement similaire a notre magnifique Ã©difice mais bon, je trouvais que de l'extÃ©rieur, c'Ã©tait assez beau. Ãa laisse prÃ©sager le meilleur. Surtout quand on voit ce qui a Ã©tÃ© fait pour le Venetian, on se dit : ouah! Ãa doit Ãªtre trop beau.

Et en fait, non pas du tout. On est trop dans le clichÃ© et la caricature, et si j'ai bien retrouve l'esprit de Venise au Venetian, je n'ai absolument pas retrouve le charme parisien au Paris. J'ai trouvÃ© Ã§a tout much, trop colorÃ©, trop tout en fait. 

Un de mes amis y a pris une chambre et m'a dit que ce n'Ã©tait vraiment pas terrible. Du coup prochain passage a Vegas, je me contenterai de regarder l'extÃ©rieur et prÃ©server mon temps pour partir vers d'autres dÃ©couvertes.

yes. yes. yes. or oui. oui. oui.  had a lot of fun here. it was very french indeed, and i ate it all up (in some ways literally). i would definitely go back and would recommend it to others. great location on the strip, nice casino, really nice rooms, great amenities. just overall a really great hotel experience.

My new favorite hotel on the strip. From the Diamond registration to the beautiful room, I cant wait to come back.  The staff I encountered were all polite and attending.  The slots paid out great.  The monorail station is located behind the hotel, perfect location for all the action.  Great food and Anthony Cools is a great show to see.  On my 3rd day of stay, I didnt even leave the hotel because theres so much to do just at Paris.

very nice hotel though i guess i was expecting a larger and nicer room. really nice shops and food options. the pizza was really good. wife enjoyed the buffet much more than i did. she also won a lot more gambling than i did. the eiffel tower ride is a must! really neat watching the fountains at the bellagio from that high up.

I could not be MORE LIVID!!!! I came to stay here to get married. We pulled up right to the front door with my huge ball gown dress and my fiancee with his garment bag also plus 2 weeks worth of luggage falling off of us. NOBODY HELPED WITH OUR BAGS!!! Not a soul offered. Now my nails for MY WEDDING are damaged from lugging around all this stuff. Just because it might be somewhat of a nice hotel doesn't mean customer service can be CRAP which is EXACTLY what I got!!! LIVID! FUMING! NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Wholly what a great place  !!! Dinner excellent-atmosphere amazing ! Brandon 
 our waiter was off the charts - the manager Michael and  Rodger the  wait staff 
Ok pretty DAMN amazing   - thank you for making our night !!!

The hotel and casino is okay compared with all the other hotels on the strip.  The hotel and resort in Vegas are so amazing that the standards is raise to such high expectation.  I love the Paris theme but other then that this place does not stand out in any other way.  The cigarette smell is overwhelming in here.  I give this place a sold 3.5 stars compared to other hotels on the strip.

My fifth visit to Paris and for the first time I was a little disappointed.  Although the staff was as friendly and as courteous as ever, I did not appreciate being charged an early arrival fee (especially since I had paid a premium fee for my second night -- apparently there was a convention booked.) I had two meals at Ile St Louis, the sidewalk cafe-style restaurant, and was disappointed with both.  Though the duck was advertized on the menu as being accompanied by "rosemary polenta", rather a treat, at least to me, it arrived with mashed potatoes and a half-assed apology from the waiter.  Undaunted, the next morning I ordered the Eggs Benedict, but they were unbelievably salty, almost inedible.  (On my third morning I walked up to the Venetian for breakfast.)  I am also irritated that the "smoking rooms" are all on the fourth floor, with no possible chance of a view of anything.  Smokers are NOT second class citizens and should NOT be treated as such!  If things have not improved, after my next visit I will find a different hotel in which to stay. 
    But I will miss the ambience of "Paris".  I do like the Casino which is large enough to make one feel like one is "on the Strip", but small enough so you don't need a cell phone to find your traveling companion.  The entrances are convenient,  the location is superb, and the staff is congenial if, in some cases, not particularly helpful.  I will HATE having to find a new favorite place to stay in Las Vegas, but find one I most definitely will.

We stayed here for one night.  We wanted two queen beds but none was available.  They upgraded us to a suite with two full baths.  We had a bottle of champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate waiting for us.  How cool is that?

I've been staying for 6 days so far, and am seriously not impressed. I have never felt more ripped off at every turn. $20 early check-in fee, additional charges for room-service, charges based on how many people are eating the room service; as if 12 for an iceberg salad isn't high enough. Casino restaurants are really really not very good, and about ~$30\/person\/meal. $15\/day for 2 devices to use the internet, PER DAY. Most of the TV channels are hotel closed circuit or in foreign languages. The maid service is not very thorough. If you really want to do the whole Vegas Strip experience thing, go to Cesar's Palace, or Winn, or Luxor, at least those places are nice inside.

the wife and I stayed here for an extended weekend.  I didn't find the staff to be rude and I had no issues with a long check in.  and that was arriving on a Friday at 3pm with a big ufc fight in town and tons of A-list acts going on.  I will say that the hotel definitely shows its age.  our room was basic (as ordered and agreed upon) but the furniture was beat up harder than a 2 dollar hookers vagina.  the carpet was also starting get to show its age.  the bed was pretty comfortable though and that's all I really cared about.

Also, the public bathrooms could stand to be cleaned more frequently.  The drunken men get the more they piss all over everything, discerning gentlemen like myself don't want to sit in another man's piss.

for the price that we paid, i am quite disappointed. 

positive: the room we have is comfy and clean and has the view of the eiffel tower.

negative: with its pricey rate, guests are not exempted in paying the daily parking fee. also, the check in and check out process is lenghty and unorganized. even though the check in\/out kiosk are available, guests are still confused with the way it works. the lady in charge of assisting guests with the kiosk is rude. 

all in all, i will look at other hotels in the strip to stay at next time i am in las vegas.

I've been here 3 hours and I have had a rude girl at check in, a bartender who overcharged us by 35.00 AND they gave us 2 out of 3 key cards that didn't work and when security came to let me in the room he wouldn't because the room was registered to my friend. I had to sit in the hallway for 20 minutes until my sister got here. Again, I've been here 3 hours. NOT IMPRESSED!!!!

I had a good time staying there. My room had a big Jacuzzi so I spent sometime with in. The hotel locates on the strip with makes it easy to go anywhere.

I also love the buffet here. The electronic roulette was so cool but I prefer the classic one. I love to see the tiny steel ball running around. 

The room was clean and comfortable, i just slept there so I knew only that I got a good rest. 

The price may be expensive, but went with my cousin family. They paid for me, isn't that cool!!

It is a shame that I have to give them a one star. Stayed here last weekend and had a great time. Celebrated my girlfriends husbands 50th. They had a suite at MGM so we barely saw our room and after going home got a three hundred dollar bill charge for room damages. I think we were in the room a total of six hours over two days and that was all sleeping.   When I called them they couldn't tell me what we damaged and said they would call back. Still no phone call. How lame is that?  They can't give an explanation because we didn't do anything or call back. Will never stay there again!

Absolutely wonderful I'm actually here right now at Gordon Ramsay this is where I always have my mom and family stay this way they have access to valleys and all the shows on the strip since my house is out by Lake Las Vegas
I live by coastal and she teach Ikelea this hotel is right in the center and it's a lot more convenient than staying at city center especially if you do not have a rental car if you are a tourist my favorite part of the Paris hotel is actually the crÃªperie
They have three cheese crÃªpe that is to die for it's about $11 and it's absolutely amazing and every time I'm away from home I'm always craving one of those crapes and I got one yesterday but unfortunately when I sent my husband to get one he came back with a ham and cheese instead of the three cheese
