Extremely friendly lady, and she was well-prepared for our questions. 
The space would be awesome if you're looking for an ideal location to help your visitors stay on the Las Vegas Strip, and if you're looking for a classical\/elegant themed wedding. 
I honestly still don't know if we're going to land on this location for the reception 'cause we're visiting other properties, but it's a contender 'cause of the location and amenities. Plus, Krishana delivered the courtesy, which I would like to reward with business.

This hotel is very expensive even for Las Vegas standards. Hidden fees everywhere. If you get offered a room with a "view" don't take it if you enjoy your sleep. We were offered a room with a view and paid $40 for it to be out overlooking the pool which has a night club by it that blares music all night long. Call the front desk and all they do is offer ear plugs. No notice up front of a noose ordinance. Just bad business. Will not be staying here again and would not recommend.

No complaints here! We checked in for my wife's birthday weekend and I had booked the trip through Virgin American Airlines. The price of the hotel was really, really good. When we checked in to the hotel they would let us check in until after 2 PM. After checking in we got to our room and we noticed they gave us a room with two beds. We went downstairs and told them about the room and within a couple of seconds they gave us another room. We went to our room which was a strip view and it was just what we expected. The room was clean, and the bed was comfy. We had no problems the entire stay and WILL stay there again. The location is great and the inside the hotel is really awesome place to view.
Came here on a Wed and took us nearly an hour to check in. Only 4 workers working the front desk. Talk about customer service. The most I waited for a hotel in my life! Ruined my plans for tonight.

Only because of location, the friendly staff and the fact that I won in the casino, am I giving two stars. This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. See my photos for mold on shower ceiling, corrosion on shower stall and generally worn furniture cabinets! Here for a show so rates were around $250-robbery for the condition of this hotel.
We didn't stay for the rooms, but did enjoy the shops and dining experience. Beautiful decor and stunning architectural design. Will visit again.

POOL DRINKERS BE WARE!!!!  Okay, so I'm a glutton for punishment. Went back to the Paris Pool and my unattractive, over-weight, rude and seldom  seen waitress (I had to go find her several times; once she had her mouth full of food and couldn't speak) was appalled when I asked where my change was from paying for cash. She told me it was customary for the waitress to keep the change....WTH...with her service skills she should be paying them to let her work there.  Also, not too smart, I overheard her telling her co-worker when I went to find her AGAIN that she spit in my drink after I asked for my change back.  Now I know its not just their appearance that makes me ill but their DNA as well....

Very disappointed. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the last 16 years. It was always nice. 

Now it is VERY tired. I went for a conference. I felt very nickel and dimed. They charged $189 for an un-renovated room plus a resort free of $26. Then they tired to upsell me to a renovated room for an extra $50 and a $22 early check in fee. This was a week day, they obviously had extra rooms available - wouldn't they rather have a satisfied customer than an unhappy one. 

Additionally, I spoke to others who booked their room on their own not using the conference code and their room was $95 with no resort fee. I would pick another hotel next time. There are so many beautiful hotels on the strip and I have stayed at many of them, as I go to Vegas at least 4x's a year. Paris is now off my list.

What a horrible experience this place was... Dirty loud the first room smelled of cigarettes so bad you would of had to crawled into one to smell this bad. The staff was un helpful. The food was expensive and so so.At breakfast I had an omelet it had half an egg shell in it all for 17 dollars . The facility was beat and not maintained we had no coffee pot in the 400.00 per night room this is by far the worst hotel in vegas Ihave stayed in never again ........  -11 rating
Update, they refunded our "resort fee of $107" which was a fair resolution, but I still would have rather stayed in the room with a view that we booked 4 months in advance...

Overall my stay was not horrible, the room was small but quaint and we had a nice view of the pool\/tower. 
The casino area was cramped and there are only two bars and hardly any cocktail waitresses. 

My biggest complaint is with  check in\/out they have only two people working and the line is so long we waited almost an hour just to check in and out. They really need to add more employees. 

To sum up it was a nice stay but there are better hotels for sure.

Really? Two. Maybe.... persons to check patrons in? One line is elite dedicated. Another has random people walking up, cutting the line and asking whatever random question.  Terrible,  twenty minute wait. Dreadful service to greet you.

Unimpressed!  We stayed at Paris for a wedding and they put our family in a room facing the Cosmopolitan where every Friday and Saturday night they have a band on their pool deck with a loud, throbbing beat until at least midnight.  Come on!  They knew we had kids and when I called to get the room switched, they did it, but they said they can't control what the hotel across the way does.  Of course not, but you CAN let your customers know in case they want to get sleep in their room.  The next night we got to listen to raucous sex for about 45 minutes.  That made for a great conversation with our preteens. The walls are way too thin.  Yes, I know, we took our kids to Vegas...but one would think we'd at least be able to relax in our room.  And I agree with everyone who said check in took WAY too long....and, frankly, the rooms were not very nice for the price.  

There are a lot of options in Vegas.  I'd recommend anywhere but Paris.

A few weeks ago, my boyfriend and I checked into Paris Las Vegas. I had stayed there for the first time in November and had a great time so I thought it would be fun to stay again; however the service we received the entire weekend was so unacceptable that we will not only never return to Paris Las Vegas, but any Caesar's property.

When we had originally booked, there were no Classic King rooms available so we upgraded to the Burgundy Room wanting to pay a little bit more to have a king bed. A week before our trip, a friend said she noticed Classic King rooms available online and I called the hotel to see if I could change our reservation. They were able to accommodate us and we changed our reservation to a Classic Room with a King bed. 

When we arrived, we tried checking in at a kiosk so we could get to our room faster but we kept receiving an error message saying our room wasn't ready. It being 11pm at night that seemed unlikely. We waited in line and when we finally got to the counter, we received our keys and went to our room. Imagine our surprise when we opened the door and found two queens. I called the front desk expecting that they had just given us a wrong room and it would be fixed in a few minutes. They told me they were sold out of King Rooms and that they would move us first thing tomorrow. I explained that we had paid for a king room not two queens and that we weren't getting what we paid for and I asked for some sort of compensation. They said the best they could do was a $25.00 food and drink voucher -which we later found out wasn't even good at half the food and beverage locations within the hotel. When you pay a couple hundred dollars for a room, a $25.00 food voucher doesn't make a difference. 

My boyfriend went downstairs to speak to a manager, but all he was told was that it states on the reservations the room are subject to availability. Why list a room as available if it clearly is not? I called the hotel specifically to ask if a Classic King room was available; had I been told they weren't I would have gladly paid more for the Burgundy room and this issue would have never come up. I understand things happen and am generally a very easy to please customer, however I trust when I pay money for a specific item, that that is what is going to be provided to me. We were told we would be contacted the next day as soon as a room was available for us.

As I walked down the hall the next morning to visit a friend's room, a maid stopped me in the hallway and asked if she could clean our room. I said no we don't need service yet as my boyfriend was still asleep. She then told me that our other room was ready and asked if we could move so she could clean the room. I said I wasn't comfortable moving rooms without having the key and an hour later my boyfriend went down to get out new room key. He waited at the mail and keys counter as the check in line was obviously long. No one was there. I contacted the front desk from our room and said he was waiting down there and that someone needed to give him our new key. The agent on the phone said she couldn't help because she wasn't physically on site and that he would have to wait. Over half an hour later, he comes back up as they refused to give him the key since my name was on the reservation. I understand this is for safety purposes however he is the one who had spoken to a manager regarding the situation the night before. It's frustrating the necessary measures to get us our key hassle free weren't taken. Since we had lunch reservations we left and figured we would get the key when we returned. As we were leaving the same maid asked if we could move our stuff again so she could clean our room. We said we would move it as soon as we had free time.

We eventually received our key and were placed in our new room, where candy was taped to the ceiling. We only stayed two nights and our trip was completely upheaved by spending valuable time waiting, arguing and moving. The following weekend my friends had the same problem at a different hotel on the strip. However they were upgraded to a suite that fit their reservations. I know where I will be staying from now on.

This place was cool. We definately enjoyed our stay here. We had a great room and could watch the fountain show at the Bellagio from our room. Their music was loud enough that if your standing right next to the window, you can hear that too.  The room was comfy for us and the bathroom was well kept as well. Nothing I hate more than a bathroom you can tell has seen better days.  We got in kinda late, so after checking in, we headed to Le Cafe for a meal. You can't go wrong with burger and fries and we were not disappointed. It was pretty yummy. 

Le Village Buffet was super yummy! I could have eaten those made to order crepes all night long! Nutella and Raspberry..YUMMO!!!

Can't remember the name of the little Crepe place where you can order crepes from the window or go inside, but they were Yummy too!!

Everyone else who mentioned this is right....BE CAREFUL ON THOSE COBBLESTONE WALKWAYS IF YOU ARE WEARING HEELS!!!

** Walk Through Review **

I think of all the hotels and casinos on the Vegas Strip, I have to say that Paris is the most eye catching. It has a giant 1\/2 scale Eiffel Tower sitting out in front of it after all. Also, the giant, neon hot-air balloon really grabs a person's attention. 

Walking into the casino is really cool because the ceiling is painted as the sky and the legs of the Eiffel Tower are built straight up through the casino area. We had brunch one morning in Mon Ami Gabi, and it was delicious! We purchased passes to go atop to the Eiffel Tower Observation Deck. It was a great experience all it's own. 

Overall, I really like the theme and decorations! It did seem to be one of the other casinos on the older side and could use a facelift, but it is still worth checking out!

We just arrived after a long, exhausting day. We checked in online around 2pm and the hotel's published check in time is 4pm. Yet, when we got to the front desk we were told we have to come back in another hour to see if our room is ready. Alternatively, we could pay another $80\/night to upgrade to another room that's ready now. How convenient. Our options are to wait around for an hour (and likely spend money in the hotel) or pay for an upgrade. We had been so excited to stay at this hotel and are so disappointed with this poor service and bait and switch tactic. So we'll be missing our dinner reservation this evening and waiting around for a room that should have been available an hour ago. We won't be staying here again and will be sure to tell our friends the same.

Others have said what I am repeating. The concierge was beyond rude. I never seen so many stanchions in front of a concierge desk like they want to keep you back. I was behind two elderly ladies and when they were done I only asked a simple question "how do I get to the monorail?" The woman behind the desk snaps at me, "Well I am standing over here but I'll answer your question". So she gives basic directions and sneers at me.  Did she want me to shove the ladies so I could stand in front of her?
 Her directions lead me out to a drop off parking lot. I guess they are trying for the stuck up attitude that most Americans think of the real Paris. At least you could help people help themselves by putting a 'you are here' on your map kiosks.

This place made me and my family feel like we weren't in Las Vegas but in some rude city where customer service does not exist. The valet begged us for a tip as if we weren't going to tip them and then at the check in line was the best part... Rena some worker with absolutely rude service and horrible worker at the front was giving us a major attitude and didn't even look at us in the face while speaking. She wasn't even clear and forward as to what we were to expect for our visit, she literally threw pictures of the rooms we were going to stay in in front of us to see what option we wanted and as soon as we picked our room she said ok well swipe your card  then" she needs to go work at IHOP not a luxury hotel where visitors all over come to enjoy their time. Paris needs to step up and do something about this specific worker will never visit that hotel because of her. Also there is a cafe near the cigar shop and elevators not sure what it's called but they defiantly do not know what medium well means while cooking a steak they bought us a steak that was make cooked for five seconds so gross. My expectations were far worse then I would have imagined for vegas

Short and sweet:  The casino is very well laid out, very well light.  
The casino was always clean.  The staff was friendly.  

I would recommend this casino and looking forward to my return.

I went to Paris on my tour of the Strip and while I didn't stay here, I lived the ambience of the place! When you walk in, it truly looks like Paris as the casino ceiling is painted blue like the sky and there are several Parisian landmarks highlighted, namely the Eiffel Tower. I've heard the restaurant there is really good, and I'd like to return and try it. The casino is fun: the bartenders are very nice and the dealers are friendly. Next time I come back to Vegas, I'd like to spend some more time in Paris. From my experience, it will be nothing short of wonderful.
We were here for the Marine Corps Ball and we loved our suite. It was a big room with a fantastic bathroom and a jacuzzi! We definitely got our money worth.

This review is from the perspective of a visitor, who did not stay at this hotel, but from a wide-eyed walk-in guy in for a look. I have been to Paris France, arguably the most famous and interesting City in the world. This hotel is a poor travesty of that great City.

The good news: I enjoyed a glass of wine from the wine-to-go window. The barista recommended an Aussie wine, which was fine, but a surprise, in that he and I were both in a themed hotel, Paris. Wouldn't he at least feature French Burgoyne or Bordeaux wines?

Why the low review, which is uncharacteristic of me? I give every establishment I visit at least three chances to provide me with a bad opinion of it. This was the least friendly of the Las Vegas Strip hotels I visited on a two day walkabout. 

I found that many of the features of the hotel had loyalty club entrances, but if you wanted to be a normal customer, you had to hunt for that back door entrance.

Many of the employees I engaged need to work on their people skills. The vibe was negative with several of them. It seemed to me that employee moral was low and no one was really in to it. Sad, as I find hoteliers have to be enthusiastic for their business to thrive.

A place of business gets but one chance to make a good first impression. Not a big deal for me, but mentionable in that the poor attitude of this place is tangible.

I love staying at Paris. Located in the middle of the strip next to Planet Hollywood and just a walk away from Caesar's Palace. The buffet is pretty good too even though the line can be long some time but worth the wait. I love the interior especially the blue sky painted on the ceiling. I would definitely stay here again.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Paris hotel this past weekend for three nights. With resort fees and tax it came out to around $121 a night, which is pretty good in my opinion for a room on the strip. (The resort fees and tax are about $25 per day but include free wifi for two devices and access to the fitness center.) The check in process on Thursday night was a little slow (they only had three people at the concierge desk). The staff member who checked us in wasn't exactly friendly, apathetic I guess is the right word. He checked us in quickly and wasn't pushy about a room upgrade, which I appreciate. Our room was on the 5th floor but to our surprise it was a large corner room with two windows. We even had a view of the Bellagio fountains from our room. The room was clean and came with a mini-fridge which is awesome for keeping snacks and drinks cold. The bed was comfy and the tv had a nice selection of channels. The hotel is right in the middle of the strip and we liked the convenient location. We ate at the buffet for breakfast before our flight back to San Antonio and it was delicious. If given the same price I would definitely stay here again.

Nothing is classier than sipping cheap booze out of a giant plastic balloon with the word "Paris" blaring in hot pink...

I really like the ambience here. It's nowhere as awesome as Venetian, but it's still better than most hotels. It has a real nice rustic feel, as if someone, in their unholiness, injected Provence into the sleaziest city in the world.

I had a $7 crepe with almond paste in it and it was as delicious as a duck in a vat of fat (in Paris, we say "confit..."). It really was the best crepe I've ever had, and I've had the best that inauthentic crepe places can make. The staff had French accents, and that ain't bad.

As big as the Paris hotel is, it feels really small inside.  And I speak of the casino, because it has a large front on the strip.  Maybe it's the fact that you have a large section of the Eiffel Tower inside the casino.  Or maybe they are doing work.  I'm not sure, really, but it just felt cramped.

I can't speak to the rooms, because we didn't try them.  The place was well-lit, unlike some places on the strip that make you feel like you're off in a dungeon somewhere, so that's nice.  But I'm just wondering where the heck all that space went.

Even though we were in Las Vegas, I couldn't work up the guts to go up to the Tower Restaurant.  I just couldn't.

LOUD MUSIC PLAYING ALL NIGHT LONG until 3-4AM on Friday and Saturday nights.  Got no sleep. Horrible experience at this hotel.  Front desk staff is not friendly, no greeting, don't ask how your stay is, probably a good thing, they don't want to know.  I am a Platinum Total Rewards member and if they don't treat me well imagine what other customers experience.
They now charge for parking if you are not at least Platinum.  Maybe if your Diamond you might get a smile.
Towel and beds are nice, but that does not make up for the all night long loud music playing in front of the hotel.  I'm sure that the entire hotel can hear it. 
Room wreaked of bleach and there was the cleaning was not very thorough nor detailed.  Leaving a tip did not improve service. 
Run away from the salespeople peddling merchandise in front of the perfume shop.  Very tacky and pushy. 

This is our first and last stay at this place.

Been staying in vegas for 5 years in a row now and tried out the Paris for the first time. This hotel for the price you pay is not worth it. The rooms definitely needs to be updated and renovated. The carpet looks very old and the baseboards are nasty also there is black mold spots on the ceiling in the shower. Also they should have more people at the front desk to help all the guest, takes forever to speak with someone.
Pet friendly!!! Room was clean great place. Food was not bad either. Pool was nice right under the Eiffel Tower. Will go back for sure!

Great casino, decent rooms.  Try and get a room with a view of the fountain.  

I swear one night they had strippers dancing during a black jack deal...up on a stage.  One of them was very pretty and the other looked like my ex-girlfriend.  I was with my fiance at the time so this was super uncomfortable.  I wanted to look to see if it was my ex...which it wasn't....but at the same time I didn't want to be pervy in front of my fiance.  I failed on both counts.

But anyway.  The casino play is decent.  Nothing really special going on as far as limits etc.  It is a Total Rewards establishment so bring your card.  They have two amazing restaurants (Mon Ami Gabi and Eiffel Tower).

Do not...do not....buy drinks at the casino bar.  They were trying to charge me $12 per crown and coke.  That must have been crown and actual coke...as in cocaine...to charge that price.

I can remember when this place first opened. I was about 8 or 9 and my mom took me here. My naive little mind thought it was awesome as it was a little piece of France in the middle of my own city!

Wow, how things change as you get older.

The outside is nice, in a strangely tacky way with the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and several other important Parisian landmarks I can't remember the names of all on top of each other. The inside is a claustrophobic mess. It was built in 1999 and yet if I didn't know any better I would probably think it's much older.

Anyways.
Things I've heard: Ray J likes to hang out here. Of all places on The Strip he chooses Paris.....don't ask me.
Interior and Decor: Very little space inside as already stated. Even on a non-busy traveling day and\/or weekend it's still crowded. The fake sky on the ceiling sort of implies that the Eiffel Tower is higher than the stratosphere (the actual stratosphere, not the tower).....yeah. The fake trees and plants inside are quite hilarious. 
Food: The Le Village Buffet is one of the best in town. Everything else is very French save a burger place in the back.
Miscellaneous (or in other words I don't know what category to throw everything else in): The restrooms are awkward. If I have to drain the weasel when I'm in here (and I strangely seem to be in this place a lot) I actually will walk all the way to the bridge in the back and use it in Bally's. No barriers between the urinals, and the appearance of the stalls make me feel uncomfortable. They're just weird. Also, the shopping area is also very French, and not in the Chanel sense. Le Enfants probably is a store for babies and\/or children, whatever the names of the other stores mean....your guess is as good as mine, unless you know French.

Amsterdam always seemed more appealing than Paris. Maybe I would like it better if it were an Amsterdam themed place? Oh well, at least you can get a crepe pretty much anywhere inside here.

Nothing about this stay was good!!!! Hard Beds, Beat up rooms, Hotel smelled so bad of Smoke (I know it is Vegas but this was terrible). It looked dirty and we thought about switching hotels mid stay. We had 5 rooms in total... AND NOT ONE PERSON WAS HAPPY!!!! Would reccomend any place else besides here!!!
I asked for a non smoking room. It's 2 am and I'm on the phone with Tavi who has put me on  hold three times when there is a party going on next door with mariachi music

The only thing I have ever been to at this hotel before and liked and still do is Mon Ami Gabi, the restaurant close to Las Vegas Blvd in the casino\/hotel lobby. The rest sucks. You can hear neighbors in their rooms, the doors are dirty, the staff is slow and half of them are not very friendly. Finally, I stay in a lot of hotels on business travel. This hotel is SLOW at checking people in and during their peak check in time they only had 4 employees staffed at the front desk.  On top of that it is $25 a day for the gym which is lacking and you have to pay $5 to print a boarding pass while at other hotels it is free. While gambling at Paris and Planet Hollywood the wait staff doesn't come by for an hour or more to serve a drink. Valet also took an eternity, it was faster to self park and walk the distance. I hope I don't have to stay here again.

Smokey!  This was easily one of the most smokiest of casinos. The eiffel tower experience was nice. Definitely get the express pass. Waiting in line for 45 min in that smokey environment will drive you nuts. The view from the top is fantastic especially to see the Bellagio Fountains.  Its funny they openly use the Bellagio Fountains as marketing for the Restaurant in the tower as well as the view from the top.
The fake sky ceiling looks horrible here. Its just not high enough and there are shadows of pillars all over the place. At no point does it look like as nice as the Venetian or Ceasers palace.

I don't think I would stay here.

I had zero expectations coming into this trip and, especially considering that our trip was funded by winning a charity silent auction, had no idea what the actual value of our stay was supposed to be. Overall I was satisfied, but I think that had a lot to do with the fact that we paid a marginal amount for a room upgrade that came with the best view and a room that is bigger than my apartment itself.

The decor definitely fits the "Paris" theme, and you won't forget that's where you're staying. When we first arrived I was impressed with their ability to carry the theme throughout all parts of the hotel and casino. Also upon arrival, however, I was very surprised to see how antiquated their systems were. Our check-in person used a manual calculator to show us what our total would be...it didn't look like there was any way for their system to calculate the total for her. The man friend had to sign a physical piece of paper that got filed away with his credit card info on it. Just kind of strange.

The room size was great and luckily the Parisian theme kept my attention and distracted me from the fact that the furnishings were kinda old. I loved that there were two bathrooms and that the bedroom could be completely blacked out with curtains from the living room - definitely useful for some of the late Vegas nights :)

In general I would stay here again, although I likely wouldn't be willing to pay the full cost that our room would have been. I may be more inclined to try a hotel that's associated with a rewards program next time, though, because there wasn't anything overly special about this property above others.

Beyond fun! We went just to gamble on a Thursday night and were told the craps table that was open had dealers and a pit boss that would be more than willing to help us learn. They were all SO funny and nice! We got pretty good at learning and knowing the game... AND WON!! Won at slots there too... they are NOT skimpy with their free drinks while playing either.. they continually were bringing my husband good double shots of Patron on the rocks [and we are no where near high rollers.]

Tried the $17 Pina Colada  drinks in the giant Eiffel Tower "cup" ... bleghhhh!!! Whatta waste. We dumped it all out.. not one of the 3 of us were desperate enough for booze to drink it!! The rest of the time was fun in the casino though.. and fairly pretty inside.

Coming from the hospitality I am very particular about hotels and it's service. I have stayed in everything from motels to five star resorts. So I expect a lot from every kind of hotel I stay in. 

I have a lot to write so let me break it up into sections. I will do them in order of when they occurred, sorta. 

Parking\/Arriving at the hotel:
Ultimately if you know the back way into the hotel then take that way! If not you will be stuck dealing with the craziness on Las Vegas Blvd. One thing I loved was waiting at the light to turn into Paris. When I looked to my left and saw the Bellagio Fountain exploding. Once you enter the front you will be greeted by a three lane roundabout. The first two left lanes all go to the valet and front of the hotel. The far right lane goes to the back of the hotel for self parking. The walking distance for the self parking is not hard! However if you miss the turn off point for it, just continue around the circle and try again. 

Check in Process:
So now I am waking into the lobby and at the front desk. They have two options, check in with a person or on a computer. If you do the computer then they will print your keys and you will have to stop by the desk to receive them. When I arrived they were moving the line very quick! It was wonderful! The only thing I didn't understand was 3 of the 4 front desk clerks were wearing suits. The 4th one thought it was casual Friday and wore a San Francisco 49ers Jersey. I understand supporting your favorite team but at a front desk it should all match. Meaning all of them need to either wear jerseys or suits. It looks sloppy if you have a different uniform in the middle. 

The room itself:
So the elevators here are wonderful and very quick! The longest I ever waited for one was about 2 minutes. My room was all the way at the end of a hallway. Honestly even the walk to the room was not bad! It was a beautiful and short hallway. With the elevators being located in a unique way, it allows for all the rooms to be near the elevators. I was pleasantly surprised by the sheer size of the room. We had a king bed that was extremely comfortable with a beautiful view overlooking the front driveway and the aria. Overall the room was huge! My classic room had a large shower and tub. It also included so many incredible amenities. Now the decor is a little old fashioned but I enjoyed it! 

The biggest thing I gotta give this hotel is how incredible their staff is with handling all kinds of guest concerns. Leaving the hotel was a little rough because my key wasn't working to leave. So we had to call the operator to assist me with it. 

This hotel has an incredible location! It's centrally located across from the Bellagio and Caesars. Then connected to Bally's. If you head south a bit you will hit the Aria and the Cosmo which are both a 5 Minute walk away.
I hated the buffet... It was terrible and I made my husband go there BC I had a AMAZING experience w my gfs 3 years ago... Wha happend!!

I'm not much for the atmosphere here, fake titties & real a holes. everyone walking around here thinks they are on reality TV & their crap smels like Kors & Coach. Didn't really interact with the employees or get a chance to stay here so my review is just on the atmosphere. I never really waned to pretend I was more than I really was but if I did this would be a good place to start. Go team snooki!

This review pertains to two things: the gambling and the bar. 731% winning streak. Yeeeeeah baby, and those Eiffel tower drinks, gotta try those at least once. When you're done with it, you can throw in a few Red Bulls and half a fifth of Chopin -- add ice and you're set!

Overall, the rest of the bar was decent. Nothing special. One thing I love, however, is the bathrooms. While draining yourself, you get to learn some sexy French phrases over the speakers.

We had a lovely room, a decent rate, and the cleanliness factor was excellent (my main concern!).  The buffet was sooo good, and there are a lot of great food options here.  
The pool is great!  Service is prompt.  There are steps all around the pool, so if you're a baby like me, you can sit on the steps (even if it's busy) and get used to the water before making the plunge.  
The location was great as well.  Walk through Bally's, and the monorail is right there!  Planet Hollywood is next door (free wifi at Starbucks and Coffee Bean), and Caesar's is right across the street.

I've had mixed feelings about Paris LV. 

Pros

- decent room rates (although never paid due comped :D )
- central location on the strip...the 4 corners (Ballys\/Paris, Ceasers,  
   Bellagio, Flamingo)
- gorgeous interior decor
- friendly staff 
- nice choice of restaurants
- easy access to Bally's within same property

Cons

- rooms starting to ware & tear
- old TV's--old-school tubes
- rooms could be bigger in size
- casino layout sucks!  So cramped and feels stuffy from the smoke
- slots are gawd-awful! DON'T PAYOUT EVER! (to me that is :p)
- the exterior looks high end--don't expect too much 

Overall

Grade: C+ \/ B-
One of the worst hotel ever! It's not eorth it at all. Dirty,old,outdated room.I'll never ever come back here.

First time staying at Paris, we wanted to finally try it. We had high expectations that were not met :( Very outdated rooms, old fashion TVs, no iPod docks or even an adapter on the old clock radios. Charged for gym service! The only highlight was our lunch at the Effiel Tower restaurant , which we would go to again & recommend! Good thing we ended our four day stay in Vegas at Mandalay Bay! One of our favorite places in town!

My boyfriend has comps for Paris. We made reservations at a great rate of $39 a night. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite on the top level for no additional charge. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Hotel and watershow.

I had a great time playing the black jack tables and won =)

Would def. stay at this hotel again.

WARNING: Leave your privacy sign on if you like to sleep in; our last day we took it off and House Keeping woke us up at 8:30 am

Be honest, I love the hot air balloon and the tower, but the entrance doesn't look as amazing from far away view.  I even had hard time to find the entrance.  Inside, it looks old.  
If you give me the choice of living here, I would say NO!  is this clear enough?
It's a rather confusing layout in there. We went for a show, but I dislike the way the flow is supposed to work and where areas are located.

I thought id give this hotel a second chance just for the sake of it and in a very expensive way I convinced myself that this hotel is not good!!! 
And honestly i kinda regret it because it wasn't a conditioned choice and i still picked this hotel. I believe in second chances still!!! 
 Given the number of the hotels in the strip and the $$$ amount yes this hotel should either lower the prices or should be renovated in order to justify itself!  
$280 a night for a forth floor right next the the ac units or generators or whatever it is, which by the way that was the view from my room, i think is beyond overpriced! On that note encore was $290!! 
Two queen beds sharing one nightstand! 
I dont want to repeat what other people wrote on their reviews but definitely confirming them! 
As far as parking btw for people who think only at paris is free this is not true! Parking is free on all hotels un the strip so dont be misled! 
To be added is the checkin area which is huge but they couldnt place a chair two for elderly people to seat while the younger stay in long lines!!!

05.10.08: I was really suprised at some of the reviews of this place. The casino is alright that is true. But the place is beautiful. The sky image, the little shops and designs makes the place very cute. 

The rooms are comfortable. So much so that I was about to ask the front desk people what brand is the mattress. I have lower back pains and well this is the first time in a long while I woke up two days in a row without any pain. Heaven mattress.

I like the fact that my room had a separate shower from the bathtub. The swimming pool was alright but getting service while ur lounging is wonderful. Getting first class service. 

There is some downer tho, but its little stuff such as their food. Its alrigth there I rather go to the buffet other places but thats the best part about vegas people do go other places. duh. You don't want to spend all day at the same hotel. 

Oh yeah and the greatest thing about this place in the room is their white tea lotion. OMG i love their lotion it smells so freaking good. Just bathe me in it please. ha ha...

Well thats about it about this place come and try it out if you want.. Actually you should just come because I said so.

I stayed Aug 21-23, 12 for a business trip.  On Aug 23 at 6AM, I was woken up by jack hammer noises.  I called the front desk and they transfered me over to a Dan(?).  Dan asked his staff over the radio whats going on and they said that their boss ok'd the jackhammering at any cost in the buffet area.  Then I overheard that other rooms were complaining.  Then Dan said he could not do anything and hung up the phone on me.  I called again and I assume I talked to Dan again and he transferred me over to the Hotel Manager's vm.  I left a vm stating the issue that the jackhammering is going on with my cell number.  I decided to call the front desk at 8AM to talk to another manager and they told me that all managers are at the 8AM meeting.  So I asked them to write my contact to have someone explain why they had to jack hammer at 6AM.  After 24hrs, I still have no contact from them.

They have no customer service.  All they care is about taking my money.  If any management from Paris Hotel reads this, please contact me asap.

One of my fave hotels in Vegas even though the inside looks pretty outdated.

But the buffet and restaurants inside are really good.  Also, you can get through to Bally's through the "Paris Walk".

The rooms (king bed) were spacious, as were the bathrooms.  It was also very clean and well maintained.  I did have a few blown out bulbs in the bathroom, but the front desk was quick to send maintenance to remedy the problem.  The mattress felt a little too firm for my taste.  Even though the hotel is themed, I felt the decor was a bit dated and a bit tacky.

As for the casino areas and restaurants, it felt smaller and lacking in variety compared to the other resort casinos.  The food quality was average at the Ile St. Louis restaurant, and the crepe place offered only a few options -- come on, who doesn't have strawberry nutella crepes???  Oh, and the line into the club, Risque, looked like a sausage fest.

The taxi stand was chaotic on a Saturday night.  It was a 30 minute wait -- and we were yelled at by the valet for taking the next available cab as he was assisting the group before us into another cab.  Whatever.  

All in all, a good place to stay, but won't be returning.

It's fun enough. 
I think since the last time I was here they painted the rooftop to lok like the sky which 4 years ago seemd like only the Venetian looked like that.

Looking for that parisian experience I asked for a crepe and imagined walking with it until I saw they served it on a plate and covered it in sauce.  So much for the french fast food! 

My Latina looking clerk greeted me in french and when I ordered in french she just looked down, they when I apologized in spanish she looked up with a smile and conducted the rest of our conversation in english.  It was my most human moment in the casinos to date.

This was my first stay in Vegas and I am glad I picked this particular hotel. It was cozy and quiet and a great location near the Miracle Mile shopping center and not to far from a Walgreen's and ABC shop to buy sundries cheaper than the stores in the lobby.   Only real complaint would be pushy kiosk type vendors at the cosmetic stores, which I realize are trained to be so persistent. But lady please, wrong time to be talking to people about cream for their eyes and such. No kidding everyone is going to have bloodshot eyes or look jet lagged or hungover.   But the gaming floor, pool and layout were inviting. I would stay again if I had the chance. I would have given it a 3.5 seeing I am a LV rookie, and have no comparison but I can't say anything bad about this place.

Great Location!!!!

Free rooms?!?!?!?

Bathroom is large and roomy with the tub separated from the shower. Yes!

One of the cafe's sell a really good lox sandwich. They don't give out tapwater though :(
Not impressed . We visit Vegas 2-3 times per year and every time  staying at different hotel . Paris it was our worst stay , unfortunately. Rooms size incredible small , bathroom very small .

Good:
- convenient location
- nice, big, comfortable bed
- got an awesome deal on rooms

Not-so-good:
- faucet handle (cold, right side) leaked all over the sink (oddly enough, same as last visit)
- dried blood on one of the pillows

WTF:
- toilet wouldn't flush. Had to call twice and wait over 45 minutes. Would have been nice for them to give us an ETA so we weren't just wasting time waiting around

- pet relief area was a joke. We've been to at least four other pet friendly hotels in Vegas and none were this bad. The relief area was literally just a converted parking space with fake grass slapped on it. It was not fenced off and was right next to the parking garage exit ramp (you know, where drivers come blazing down in a rush to get somewhere). To top it off, right next to area was debris and broken glass every day we were there.

Only stayed here for one night but wish I had stayed for more. Beautiful hotel inside and out. Tons of restaurants inside and right outside the hotel. Loved that it was located right in the heart of the strip. Room had an amazing view of the city. Cleanliness gets five stars from the room to every part of the hotel. Front desk staff was extremely friendly for both check in and check out (shout out Kaitlyn for the awesome recommendations).

So I was really excited to be staying at this hotel because I haven't stayed here in sooooo long. 
When arriving the bell guys were really nice and took our stuff with no problem.
Check in: We got up to the counter and the guy that was checking us in was a true PAIN IN THE ASS! Sorry this was horrible he snapped at us the entire time. He didn't explain anything to us and was trying to charge us extra for everything. We finally had to ask for the manager and by the time she arrived he was already finished and the manager didn't do anything other then let us check in 30 min before 3PM. LOL 
Room: RUNNNNNN DOWN they were not good at all it was extremely out dated and not very clean. When you go to Vegas you expect  these nice rooms but what a huge let down. 
Pool: LOL compared to the other pools on the strip this was nothing to see or even be at. It is this round pool that everyone just hangs at. BORING 
Checking bags on the way out: So my sister was waiting in the line and gave the guy one bag and I walked up with my second bag and the guy said he didn't have room for my luggage. So I had to wait in line AGAIN to check in the bags. BEYOND RUDE AND EMBARRASSING.
Checking out: OMG THE rudeness continues we apparently were being charged extra things like early check in and etc. because the guy checking us in was just an ASSHOLE. So we had to ask for a manager AGAIN. 
Overall this was a disaster! I would never stay there again. Employees RUDE, Rooms extremely run down and pool is laughable. Sorry Paris change your employees and update rooms. VERY DISAPPOINTING

I absolutely love coming to the Paris hotel when I. Vegas. It is just a beautiful hotel with the ceiling painted like the sky...so beautiful! 

If you have the time and want to see a fun view of the strip, I suggest paying to go to the top of the Eiffel Tower. We were lucky enough to meet Liz who works at the tower and she was super helpful and nice! 

If you are looking for a small snack or a glass of wine, you could also go to the restaurant at the Eiffel Tower. 

This is a great place...check it out!!!

I think this is a great mid tier hotel in a GREAT location.  It was relatively cheap for the quality.  I asked for a complimentary upgrade and got a great view of the Eiffel tower and Belagio fountains.  Our room was pretty basic.  Bed, tv, bathroom with shower and tub.  We didn't stay in our room much so we didn't need anything fancy.  Cleaning service did our room everyday in the morning.  We enjoyed going to the pool also.  It was big and there were plenty of recliners available.  It was a very family oriented pool.  The casino was small and we didn't gamble there at all.  Overall I think this hotel is a great value and we would go there again!

There are many themed-hotels in Las Vegas. You have the MGM, New York New York, etc. Paris Hotel and Casino is one of the coolest because of the decoration. It is elegant but not too pretentious. The cobbled-stone walkway through the restaurants and shops is quaint. The buffet is one of the best in Vegas though expensive. 

As far as the rooms, they are typical of Vegas hotel rooms. Once new, the rooms were beautiful. Now they are getting a little old and stale. Nevertheless, the hotel is still great for its reasonable prices.

Had a wonderful time here.  I didn't stay in the hotel rather I walked the mall and had dinner here.  We also went to the Jersey Boys show.

The service staff was very good and the drinks made stiff.  I really enjoyed the coffee bar and real espresso.  I will come again and next time maybe even stay at the hotel.

Oh' Food was perfect!

My friend put $10 into a slot machine and within a few minutes had over $300! I don't want to encourage people to play slot machines bc they are so clearly rigged, but hey, thanks Paris! We thought the atmosphere on the floor was nice, slightly better than some casinos. I like that this casino isn't just a walk through for hundreds of people, and we all got a kick out of the "french" details.

Stayed here on business earlier this year. Was just OK. It took FOREVER to check-in and seemed like their check-in procedure was pretty low tech (hence the slowness). They f-ed up a delivery I needed (which was late and they had issues finding where it went in house). I didn't try and of the restaurants on site but hit up one of the cafes (forget the name but it's the one that has all the yummy pastries). It was fine but got tired of the Frenchness after a couple days:)

Room itself was fine, maybe a bit better than your usual room. Overall though, the hotel left me feeling a bit blah and I wouldn't plan on staying here for a personal vacation.

This review is based on valet, hotel room, bellboys and cleanliness. 

Spent the weekend there to celebrate my birthday (which was amazing, minus the hotel). When I pulled into valet I told them the room we were already checked into (since my friends arrived before me) and we we were taking our bags with us but the other bags needed to be taken to our room. 
An hour later we still hadn't heard and called the valet and they said my stuff was still in my car and all they could do was bring my car back up front and I could get it my own or a bellboy would bring it up but I still had to go back down to valet and check in my car. Prior to hanging up I told the guy to make sure my car would be there by the time I get down there and he was so annoyed (that I was even complaining) that he said that would be fine. When I arrived down to valet my car wasn't there and no one knew who I talked to (surprise surprise) and had to scan my ticket in order to bring my car up. 
Once I got my stuff out I needed a bellboy roller to help me with my stuff. The guy was rude as I told him to just  follow me up rather than delivering it to my room. He just kept telling me to call valet from the room and "press the VALET" button (talking to me like I was an idiot). Still outside, I called my friend to "press the valet button" and gave he my ticket info so by the time I got up there it would be on its way.  Once I got to my room, my cousin had said whoever answered the phone was rude and said "oh are you the girls who left their stuff in the car?" (Basically blaming me for the incident) and was arguing with us about how it was our fault. Stuff finally arrived an additional 45 minutes later. Horrible customer service with that hotel. 
The cleanliness of this hotel is ridiculous. The wall paper was peeling off the wall, the carpet looked like it needed a good stain removal. My cousin wore some socks in the room for the purpose of the carpet. In 1 full day the bottom of her socks were extremely dirty! Compared to waking outside without heels dirty. The comfortable was just a blanket. Everything that I was excited for to stay in Paris for the first time and celebrating my birthday, went to crap with this hotel. Of course we still made the best of it and enjoyed our stay but NEVER will I stay or recommend this hotel again!!!!!!!!!

Paris is pretty exciting place to gamble. I like how the ceilings are painted like the sky and you got the main casino floor filled with many exciting French decors and not to mention sexy chicks dancing on top of the bar tables. They also have a mini lounge that offers live performances by local groups singing songs like "Let's Get Loud", "Poke Face" etc and many bistro type restaurants as well. Overall, not a bad place to gamble and have some fun not to mention quite exotic because of the "French" theme. They also have the Eiffel towe restaurant which is very popular with tourists.

Downside might be one of the senior citizen lounge waitresses that seemed like she wanted some sort of a tip from me for bringing me a diet coke while I was on the slot machines. She brought me the drink and I said "Thank you" and she stood there for a while and says "Thank you~~" like if she reminded me that I must tip her or what not. Hmm, funny gramma, sorry I wasn't winning that night and every dollar of mine is hard earned lol

My girlfriends and I were only here for the buffet Le Village but as soon as we walked in, I instantly loved the place!  The theme is awesome.  So beautiful to see inside and outside. 

The buffet was awesome!  Definitely the best of all the 24hr buffets.  Besides the buffet, they have different restaurants and chocolate and crepe shops...Everything looked so amazingly good.  

I would definitely consider staying here next time and trying different restaurants in here.

Pretty nice for a moderately-priced Vegas hotel.  Location was excellent and the casino in the lobby was a lot of fun.

The towels could have been a bit nicer quality for Vegas but overall, the room was nice and clean.  The hallways and common areas could use a little maintenance -- some chips on the wall and peeling wallpaper -- but inside the room, it was fine.

We booked this hotel because it's one of the few that doesn't charge a ridiculous "resort fee" on top of the room rate.  Internet was $12\/day though so I recommend skipping that.

Can't write a terribly thorough or accurate review since I've never stayed here.  I have, however, perused the casinos and shops, which are always a delight. Based on the previous reviews, it seems like the rooms leave a lot to be desired. Definitely a cheesy simulacra of Paris, but fun nonetheless. Lots of great photo ops. And fancy bakeries.

My friend and I stood here for a couple of nights and it was a great experience no doubt about it. The restrooms were kept clean, the room was cleaned up, and we had a great view of the strip. We could see the Bellagio's water show, as well as the Effiel Tower that they had there. In essence, I am not saying this because we had a great view, but overall the hotel's ambiance and service was great. It was peaceful and just plain great.

We checked in at 1:10pm and the desk clerk said there is a $20 early check in fee if we check in before 4pm. To be clear, Expedia (where we booked) mentioned this fee but I did not see it until after. I told the clerk I would not pay this fee and in 40 years of travel have never had a hotel charge an early fee at 1pm in the afternoon. The clerk said he would waive the fee if we upgraded our room. Now the clerk has turned into a used car salesman! I said I wasn't interested in an upgrade. I also told him I would pay the $20 early check in fee and I'd rather wait until 4pm as a matter of principle. He gave us our room key anyway and I'd assumed he waived the fee. When I checked the room balance upon checkout I found that the clerk had charged me the fee anyway. I went down to the front desk, explained what had happened, and they waived the fee. Fellow travelers: Enough is enough with new fees. Just say no.

On the good side, the room was nice, the pool was itself was nice, and the food was good.

The pool deck was filthy. They seriously need to take a pressure washer to it. Just horrible. If we are paying a $35 resort fee, couldn't they spend some of that money cleaning the pool deck?

This place is pretty cool to go to, they have an eiffel tower that you can take an elevator up to look at the view, dont be fooled though because it isnt free. its nice to check out at least once in your life

Excellent rooms and buffet

Have never been disappointed in their selection and food quality

The Paris saw it's heyday but that time has passed.  I booked this hotel for a conference remembering staying here and enjoying it 10 years ago.  It really was quite nice back then, but now that I'm staying here in 2012 it seems like this place is nearing the end of it's life cycle.  At some point with a hotel on the strip a business decision is made to let it go until it makes sense to fully overhaul it or tear it down.  I think that's where this place is nearing.

The room was serviceable, but it seems like nobody cares.  The light fixtures don't work and the minifridge is empty.  Why not just remove it then rater than disappoint me when I open it?  Also, there is a bit of an odor in the room and a whole different one in the bathroom - neither pleasant.  I should note that I got a very basic king room, but it does have a view of the mountains on one side and the strip\/Bellaggio on the other which is nice.

Wi-fi is free for guests in rooms... You have to accept the charge and then they remove it from the bill.

The restaurants are good, but pricey.

Maintenance Issues. This Hotel is in need of updating with fresh paint and caulking in the bathrooms.  It's starting to show its age at 17 years old it's looking tired.  The staff is nice and it was clean, not sparkling clean but acceptable.  Our bathroom sink water was extremely slow to drain, probably the stopper is clogged with hair from the past 17 years, just a guess.

The Paris hotel is a nice yet average hotel form what is expected in Vegas. The room was clean and spacious. The hair and lotion products are below average. The TV was definitely a nice big flat LCD so i can't complain when watching ESPN on it. Luckily they charge charge a resort fee anymore here but I am annoyed that they charge you $25 to use their fitness center. They say it's because it doesn't belong to them and it's inside the day spa. All in all I'd stay here again if the price was right. Also helps that it's easy to get french pastries here.

Our experience was overall positive, here's a simple breakdown;

Pros:

Hotel
- Friendly hotel staff at every contact from bellman, valet, concierge, front desk, and housekeeping. 
-Clean room with amazing view from #2180

Casino
- Welcoming and friendly dealers 
-Good spread of table games and slot machines 
-Majority of restaurants inside hotel and the wing that connects to Bally's accept TR credits as payment. 

Cons:

Hotel
- Thin walls in room, could hear everything. 
- Drapes don't reach the floor which allowed unwanted light in.
- Weak, but functioning AC

Casino:

- Sticky chips
- Slow drink service, almost non existent at certain times\/areas.

 (Message me to find out how to become Diamond without the $$$$)

The pizza from the little window pizzeria is yummy
Everything from Mon Ami Gabby is yummy
Decent rooms and casino floor
The eiffel tower is fun to go up if you've never done it before
Yummy room service as well

I just spent the weekend at Paris and I really enjoyed it. The atmosphere is really cool. I love the streets and buildings and sky in the casino area. I also love the fact that this is not a huge hotel. It does not take 20 minutes from the front door to your room. The rooms are nice, nothing too special, but comfortable. The Burger Brasserie  down near Bally's has excellent burgers and onion rings!
I would definitely stay here again
Only one car hop took forever to park when we got there. Took even longer to get the car afterwards. I guess this is what you get when you have to pay for parking right? Less service

This is a very nice, spacious  and clean hotel. We had 2 queen size beds for 4 adults and 1 6 years old  and fits all of us perfectly.   The buffet here is very good too with a good selection (forgot to take photos due to hunger hahaha) 
All the amenities like the pool and gym close at 8pm.

Paris is a decent hotel.

Location: Paris is in the middle\/upper north part of the strip which is great. It's known for its very obvious Eiffel Tower. Right across the street from Bellagio and Cosmopolitan, Paris is definitely centered well enough so that you are in "the middle of it all." It's within walking distance from most of the big hotels, which is great since traffic on the strip gets really bad after a certain point in the night.

Rooms: They're not the best (compared to Aria), but they're not the worst (compared to Stratosphere). The rooms aren't tastefully done and beds are a bit uncomfortable, or hard. The bathroom is nice and pretty large; however, the shower has no certain - everything is see through. They do provide you with a bit of closet space; we had two closets, three drawers, and a night stand with three drawers as well. The TV has a lot of Spanish speaking channels, and surprisingly, Chinese channels, which played both movies and popular television shows (American Dad). The English speaking shows were limited to movies, not so popular television shows. Also, you get wifi but you can only apply it to ONE device. The rest you'll have to pay for - a bit dumb.

Casino\/Restaurants: The casino was alright. It's a bit small compared to other hotels, but it is pretty clean. I didn't try any restaurants because when I took a look inside the buffets\/restaurants\/cafe and at their menus, nothing was quite impressive. Gordon Ramsey's restaurant looked nice, but I'm not sure I'm willing to pay $70 for a restaurant decorated with electric red lights and one steak. The crepe place give out large portions, but you are paying $11. The buffet...well, Ive definitely seen better prepared food. 

Customer Service: I had a unique experience with customer service, specifically security\/lost and found. So my friend lost her wallet and luckily for her, front desk told her that security had it. So we went down and they kindly escorted us to lost and found and gave us her wallet. They were very courteous, and were definitely careful with people's lost items, making sure they have identification and that they sign a check out form. Props. Our rooms were also cleaned by noon. 

Location: 5\/5. Rooms: 3\/5. Casino\/Restaurant: 2\/5. Customer Service: 4\/5. 
Overall: 2.5\/5. Bump up to three on the rating bar because of the smooth experience with security in finding my friend's wallet.

One of our favorite casinos on the strip. Really the only one of them to carry the theme throughout the property. We loved the painted ceilings and how it felt like we were walking down a cobbled street in France throughout. The cocktail waitresses even wear costumes. Take the elevator to the tower, the view cannot be beat.

Pleasurable stay with decent facilities.  Serene casino vibe with the clouds on the ceiling.  
And I know everyone knows "the best" buffet, but Paris' dinner buffet is the best dinner I've had in Vegas...EVER!

Paris Vegas was charming and fun! We stayed on the 25th floor in a non smoking red room with an Eiffel Tower room view! Room was clean, bed was nice amd comfy.  In addition  it was a beautiful  view of the strip and Bellagio waterfalls!!! We ate at Mon Ami Gabi,  JJ Boulangerie and Hexx!! All delicious and refreshing!!  The pool area was large, clean and with great views of the Eiffel Tower. The only negative review is that the slots do not pay! I didnt see not one player win in the 3 days I stayed there. My parents came with me and they also lost and did not win once! However, I would definitely stay at Paris again but will not touch the slot machines.

Good location... I know Vegas is small..., comfy bed and good price.
I like their buffet and Casino.
it's old hotel but still they keep nice and clean.

We decided to give it one more go since we often dine at 2 of the restaurants in this hotel.  This time the front desk person was extremely pleasant and asked if we wanted to take the suite upgrade I felt a bit uneasy as the last time they tried to charge us more for the exact room we booked telling us it was an upgrade.  She explained the upgrade features and costs and we went ahead and did it. When we arrived in our room it was perfect and exactly as she described.  The woman at the front has made us believers in the hotel again and has gotten our business back.

We ate dinner at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant here and did a little gambling in the casino. The casino seemed kind of small to me?? But it was so much less smoky than I was expecting, which was a plus. I doubled my $20 into $40 playing slots because I'm such a high roller, which was fun. A waitress came over right away and offered us drinks. Plus we had a great dinner at STEAK. I think I'd visit again!

Yes, I would stay here again possibly because they offer a decent rate, only for that reason but there were a few hiccups in this stay. First, they promised an upgrade to a suite which they never did. We had to beg for a room with a king bed and received a handicapped room. The room was nicely furnished,, great amenities and absolutely beautiful.

The hotel was just OK, it was mainly casinos and extremely impersonal service. The staff acted snotty and not there to please the customer in any way at all. I have traveled a lot and will say that the staff is among the worst in the hotel industry! This hotel is hanging on their 4 star rating by a thread but I think it is mostly because of their nice guestrooms. It is also in a great location on the strip, directly across from the Bellagio. I would recommend a different hotel but if you are on a tight budget, this is the place to stay (only stay here if you can get it for about $100\/night plus tax).

I stayed at the Paris over the long Labor Day weekend and loved it! The rooms are clean and well thought out (loved the separate armoires), the service is superior, and the location is unbeatable. We arrived early (around 1pm) and were seamlessly checked in. The staff provided us extra hangers, by request, and our room was clean even when we took our time and got a late start in the day. 

Chateau night club was also fun to have at our door step as there were always happening events like P-Diddy hosting a party, etc. We ate at the Sugar Factory which was also in our hotel. (Great cupcakes) In a nutshell, the Paris has the iconic balloon and Eiffel Tower that I couldn't stop photographing as well as the ideal location on the strip. The Eiffel Tower restaurant is also top notch and a very romantic experience. I highly recommend this hotel. It's a perfect blend of value and luxury.

The furniture was worn badly and the buffet has nothing to do with French cuisine! The waitress at the buffet restaurant are so rude treat u like a trash! I told them not to smash the empty plates when they clean the tablet because my 4 month olds baby were sleeping and at one point we couldn't hear each other because smashing plates and cutleries! If u want to eat 20 different kinds of potato its a nice buffet! The only thing that I liked was crep with Nutella and hazelnuts which was really not French more like Belgian! It has a nice location though u can go back to your room take a rest and keep hanging around in the strip! Ask for good view without paying for it during check in tine

My co-workers and I stayed here the past few nights for a conference at Bally's. When we checked in there was an extremely long line, we flew in late after work so I really wanted to just get to my room. Sebastian (I am pretty sure that was his name) was absolutely amazing!! He was extremely pleasant and upgraded our rooms to the penthouse suite for the inconvenience of the wait. I also came back to him because of wifi issues and he was very helpful and got it all fixed.

That evening I couldn't sleep (first time in vegas) so I went down to the white bar that is right by the front entrance. Michael served me and once again I was stoked with the amazing customer service and interactions. As I watched him work I could see the quality he provided and could tell he thoroughly enjoyed what he did. 

Once again, killer customer service from a cocktail waitress named Deaira. She was so attentive, funny and had an amazing attitude even before we tipped her :) we joked that she was our good luck charm because every time she was around we won some more cash

The room was pretty nice! Definitely too much space for just me but the tub was so awesome. I had a view of the garage which was not that great but for the free upgrade I can't complain! They also had those cool tvs that pop up out of a dresser, it's the little things. 

Overall I am very pleased with my experience at Paris and I will be back!

We were very disappointed with our room. The hotel is beautiful but the room we had was discustingly dirty. We were just there for a night and we already unpack. Line to the front desk was long and we were in the room just to sleep so we did not request for room move. The shower door got mold, really gross. Carpet was not vacummed and have not been shampooed for God knows how long. Trashcan did not have a trash bag. I would still recommend the hotel because everythings else was good except for our room.

I went here a few years back for a convention. As part of the package we got to stay in the hotel. It was no deal, but the convenience couldn't be beat.

There is nothing that really would draw you to this hotel if you weren't here for a convention. The floor with the slots and tables is quite small by Vegas standards. Barely anybody working there either. Barely anybody gambling...guessed they voted with their feet. 

The rooms were okay, nothing too fancy but certainly homely. 

My biggest problem is with the employees. Rude as all hell. I had to study some papers for the next day and decided to sit at a table outside the convention room and I didn't get into 5 minutes of my work before some POS security guard kicked me out. I told him I was just there to read and make notes. He told me he was there to make threats. So offended was I by this retarded attempt at securing the hotel, I went to the front desk to let the first person who tried to help me have all my rage. She apologized and then sent me to another area that was quiet where I could work. I got kicked out of that area by another dumb security figure. Went back to the front desk and then complained a little louder and then she had to radio all the security personal to lay off the idiocy. I then went to another section and then could finally do work. Not without being harassed again by another security guard, by this time I was over it and decided to go back to the room and blow off the work. It did not work out well the next morning because I didn't do it. 

I mean, seriously, how much of a security threat is it to have someone in a small corner writing notes and reading lecture slides? I had the vision that perhaps someone with a top hat and cowboy boots was going to come up to me and say, "Son, if you ain't gonna drink or gamble or bring hoodrats back to your room you best git outta this hoawtel!

Don't stay here.  Don't eat here.
Go to stroll around and pretend you're in Paris for 10 minutes 
THEN LEAVE.
We stayed there last weekend, the room was totally blah.  The water pressure in the shower was terrible.  The phone operators don't answer.  The restaurants are overpriced and awful.  The carpets are filthy.
And they charged a fortune.  
Trust me, do NOT stay here.

If there was less than one star rating, I would give it to this crappy horrible place. checking in was extremely a horrible experience, the lady who checked me in lacked customer service, she was rude and impolite, her name is Yaguami ( I hope I spelled her name right). My room was not available, so I paid $25\/night to get a room that was available at 3:30! The bathroom; the tub is rusty with orange spots (Gross!). The towels are so old and in a very bad shape; the bathroom counter is broken :( :( 
Now I'm trying to get back to my room; however my key is not working. I've been on the phone for 25 minutes trying to get hold of someone who can help me, I've been transferred five times already. I'm considering canceling my reservation here and spending my few days here at a better hotel which has employees with some customer service. Very bad, super horrible, please AVOID!

This review is only for the bars and ambiance of the Paris Las Vegas.  We were walking down Las Vegas Blvd and tucked into the Paris for a drink.  The bartenders were awesome and very liberal with the amounts of alcohol they put in the drinks.  The bartenders were very friendly and hospitable.  It almost made me want to change my accommodation locations.....almost. 

Nearby the bar, there were go-go dancers performing above several blackjack tables.  In addition, there was a very good house band playing classic dance tunes.  The machines were give and take, and the quick food spots were reasonably priced.

This hotel is way too trendy...with it's over the top French theme pervading the hotel. Honestly, it takes away from the overall quality of the hotel...

Having said that, I find myself staying here almost every other visit simply because it is clean (at least the newly remodeled rooms are) and it is convenient to access the rest of the strip. It even provides a shuttle to the Rio Hotel, it's sister property. 

The restaurants are nothing worth writing about...again, the French theme sort of kills anything of quality. The Brunch Buffet is worth checking out if you find yourself with a comp or two. 

The best thing about this hotel, though, is it's ease of access to Bally's. In the tunnel connecting the two hotels, you can find Le Burger Brasserie (also reviewed), which features the famed 777 burger. For $777 you can enjoy a burger topped with lobster, fois gras, and Kobe beef alongside a bottle of Dom Perignon Rose (you can also have the burger by itself for much less).

I had been planning for years a stay in the red room at Paris Hotel. When i did  my booking, it told me to upgrade to the red room upon arrival. I tried calling before in case they were all taken, to ensure I would get a red room, all their staff did was put in a request. Upon arrival, of course they were all taken, which was the first dissappointment. We had pool chair reservations for saturday. They told us to call the same day to make sure we would be there. We did, and all their incompetent staff could do was say "we cant guarantee your chair will be here". We headed to the pool at 11am and of course they were all taken. They suggested we get a refund as if they were doing ME a favor. Their pool is very boring. With DJ but no DJ interaction, as other pools do. Never again. Please, just visit Paris Hotel to admire its structure, but take your money somewhere else. Their staff is incompetent and the price you pay is def. not worth it.

2 1\/2 STARS review.

This past weekend, a bunch of friends and I stayed here and man was the service sucked at the front desk!  How in the hell can there ONLY be 2 people working on a a Friday Night as the line was so f-ing long?!  It took me about 45-60 min to finally get my room key!! One of the worst service I've got at the casino and the manager at the time was being an ass as well!

Another thing that got me pissed about Paris was that they shut down the elevator on Saturday\/Sunday morning and forced everyone to take a detour and our powers were off on our floor and room! WTF was that all about!?!  To top off that night, my friend sprained his ankle and we called the front desk for an EMT to come by and we didn't get an EMT to come by but a security person that showed up like 6 hours later saying that they can't help us but the clinic down the street can help us and they told us to go around the corner to go get ice without offering any help.  Can't believe it took them 6 hours to tell us that crap!

Besides the crappy service, the poolside is nice but kind of small compared to other casinos on the strip but it was nice though. 

I thought it was stupid that you still need to pay 8 bucks to go up the effiel tower even though I am staying there!

The rooms were not small and the bathroom was big with a separate shower and tub which was a change.  Overall, the room was a good size.     

Not sure if I would stay here again after the crappy service my friends and I experienced.

Gross! Gross! Gross!

Hair in the shower and bathtub, red stains in the carpet, and bad bad water pressure. I felt like I was camping. If it weren't for the hotels great casino vibe, restaurants, and gaming I would've given it one star.
Good casino clean and a little more on the nicer side vs some of the other casinos on the strip great crape place!!

Just stayed at Paris with my family and dog.  I like the fact that Paris is pet friendly.  The room itself was a little small and a littled warn.  My wife and I have stayed here before and had nicer rooms.  It might have been becasue these were pet friendly rooms.  The room was relatively clean and no animal ordors.

Dealers here were very nice, especially Enrique, who was dealing 21+3.  Very friendly and the kind of dealer who really enhances the fun of the game.  Overall, I'd recommend Paris, especially if you have a dog.  One of the few places on the strip that accommodates for this.  We would have enjoyed a slightly larger "bathroom" area for the dog but what they had worked just fine.

Excellent atmosphere and fun French feel. One of my favorite casinos on the strip. Next door to planet Hollywood and across from the belliago. Parking was tricky and we had to walk forever. We should have taken the monorail.

My friend and I took our first trip to Vegas and stayed at the Paris hotel and it was pretty great.  The room we were given was nice, clean, and pretty, i was comfortable as soon as I arrived. The check in process was rather long, I assume because of everyone getting into the hotel around the same time, but it did make for a long wait. My friend did try using the express check in, but for whatever reason the machine wouldn't work, so we waited. The only other thing with check in was that even with the express check in you still had to wait in line to get your keys, I felt like it really wasn't making it that much faster or smoother, but that was the only thing that really stuck out as being difficult.
Overall, the hotel was great, staff was super friendly and helpful and it was in a really great location for what our plans were for our trip. We plan on going back to Vegas next year and are planning on staying in Paris again since our experience was so positive.

I went to Las Vegas for vacation...I chose Paris Las Vegas for 9 people in my family( 8 adults+ 1 child) ... my first impression the hotel is clean, beautiful place, friendly...but when I checked-in at reception desk, Ms Rene she is not nice ...when she spell my sister name , she's wrong and she said we used the nick name when we booked room...my husband gave her my sister ID ...and she knew she's wrong but did not apologize...we had reservation 4rooms...she even made her mistake again...and I waited for changing to my room two times... I feel disappointed

My favorite affordable hotel on the strip. I love the ambiance and cleanliness of this hotel. I booked a standard room and believe we were upgraded for free since it looked nothing like the blue room on the online picture. (Maybe they are upgrading all rooms, idk?) it was much nicer :) Paris Hotel is at a prime location on the strip so you don't have to walk so far to get to restaurant and bars. Plus the Budweiser beer garden is right outside!

Paris used to be my favorite hotel in Vegas and was always my first choice for both lodging and gambling.  The first time I stayed at Paris was in 2005 and I got their romance package.  The package was great, the room was clean and well-appointed, the service was excellent, the casino employees were fun and outgoing and the restaurants were very good.  I was really excited - I'd found a new "home."

I've stayed there several times since then and, unfortunately, each visit saw the place deteriorate a little bit more.  The last time I went - early 2008, the rooms were old and tired-looking, the hallways and common areas looked run-down, the casino had lost some of its luster and the food had definitely stepped down a notch.  The staff was still very friendly and some of the same dealers from my first visit were still there and remembered me.

It's so sad when someplace that was as obviously quality as Paris was starts to get run-down.  I'm not sure what they can do to prevent it; however, they need to do something to turn it around before they're pushed down the list to the same status as Flamingo.

There's a lot of potential here, but not much delivery anymore.

Love their rooms! Big window overlooking the strip; marbled, wide bathroom with a big tub and shower; awesome, clean service. I like their bed chocolates, too hehe.

Good pool and plenty of full-sun and shaded seating for a lazy, warm Saturday afternoon full of people. There weren't enough servers, but when you got their attention, drinks came pretty fast. 

Cute shops inside, too. The casino itself was standard; nothing to complain about. I like the fact they're connected to Bally's which is connected to the Strip and walkway to Bellagio, which is connected to Caesar's and the Forum shops. =]

Oh Paris, what happened? We used to love staying here, but this time may have been our last. The restaurants are still good, but the drink service is nearly non-existent in the casino, and the rooms are very outdated. Also, the casino had a stronger smoke smell than other casinos we visited (MGM, Mirage, etc)

I was happy to see an empty fridge in the armoire replacing the old tube tv, but later that happiness was replaced by shock. Who decided to place the new flatscreens way to the side of the bed?
