My husband and I were enjoying our kid-free holiday and watched several of your $15 in-room movies during our stay. However, we were forced to either get cricks in our necks or move to the very uncomfortable french style couch in order to view them. At one point, we almost moved the entire bed. 

We heard there are some renovated rooms in the upper stories, so be sure to ask for them.

Had my Birthday Dinner here, and I must say, I was very pleased with everything about this casino. We went to Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse. It was amazing to say the least. And, I won 100$ on the wheel of fortune slot machine. So far a very good birthday.

The Eiffel Tower is iconic and it lures you to come to the casino.  In fact the going up the tower is cool and should be tried.  But meanwhile, it alone this doesn't keep your interest up in sticking around.  There is a hallway that connects it to Bally's, but who cares; why would you want to go to a pathetically small boring casino and the shops in the hallway are equally unimpressive.  Then the casino.  Looks nice and big, but it's uneventful and boring.  It just seems too sterile.  Table dealers are not as friendly as the other casinos too.  Slots seem old and tend to bore the seasoned players.  I really don't find myself coming to this casino too often for these reasons.

We had a really nice stay here! Our red room was BEAUTIFUL and the staff was very helpful. I highly suggest checking in online and skipping the lines in the lobby, all you have to do is pick up your keys and show your ID. We were surprised only three people were running the check ins on a Saturday. 

Every time we called Paris with questions we were able to speak to someone very quickly and they were informative and friendly. 

Pool was nice - lots of seating available and towels are given to you when you walk in. Drink prices were atrocious but that was not a surprise. 

We only had one meal here, breakfast at the Creperie. Very good! The line was long but the price actually wasn't bad compared to local crepe places I have been to.   

I'm interested to see my bill - I had a mini heart attack when I checked my credit card statement online, there were a few charges on my card I wasn't expecting. When I called the Paris billing team they told me one was a temporary charge and would clear away once my payment for the room went through. I get that, but usually when people put temporary charges on a card its a few cents, not half the price of your room! The other charge was for checking in early and checking out early. This I'm going to have to hash out with someone because we checked in early but left at our correct check out time. $50 seems a bit high for an early check in...

Didn't stay at this hotel we were at the SLS.. ( which I don't recommend) we came back everyday multiple times just to hang out at the bar . The central bar....All of our bartenders were super friendly and make great drinks . The place it self is absolutely beautiful. Don't know about the rooms but I would stay here.

Located pretty much smack dab in the middle of the strip - this is the perfect hotel to stay at if sightseeing is your Vegas gameplan! Think about it - one day you go left from paris, the next day you go right. There. Done. You've seen the whole strip very time efficiently. 

The rooms are decent sized and reminded me very much of treasure island. the staff is very friendly as well! there is an amazing crepe place in the streets on paris (it really makes the perfect breakfast, lunch, or dinner).. in addition - there is the most unique wine shop right by the elevators (this is where I bought my dad a bottle of wine with the label "Fat Bastard").

One would think that a "luxury" hotel \/ casino \/ resort would live up to a certain standard of excellence.  One would think this, but in the case of the Paris Resort, you'd be wrong.

The casino area and shops look great and seem to run well....  If you're not looking to closely that is.  The facilities seem modern and nice..... Until you stop and take a closer look.

Our bathroom counter and shelves were aged and the veneer was warped, damaged and peeling away.   

In the quad of our floor and down our hallway, someone couldn't hold their liquor and left a trail of vomit up.  Hey, it's Vegas, so this happens, right?  Okay...  I first noticed it at 2am when getting home from the club.  At 7am, when I went for coffee, it was still there and the odor was now very strong.  I called the front desk from the hallway curtesy phone the told them about it.  At 11am it was still there, but housekeeping was just down the hall, so they'll get it, right?  I mean, you can't miss that smell....  8pm and it was STILL THERE.  I stopped a hotel employee who walked through the dried vomit without noticing and pointed it out.  On hour later, IT IS STILL THERE!  The smell is still strong!!!  I call back down to the front desk and complain.  They merely apologized and promised to get it taken care of.  6am the next day, it was finally gone.  At checkout, there was only two open counters and one counter kept letting people bypass the line which really was upsetting everyone.  When I finally was served by the other person, I pointed this conduct out and was given another empty apology.  I told the clerk about the vomit and smell in our hallway and was given another apology.  When I told her that apologies don't fix the situation, she subtracted a day's resort fee off our bill.  One day... Resort fee...  That's $35.  She then explained that next time (like there will be a next time) that I should asked to speak to the housekeeping manager directly.  I'm a guest.  Why should I have to negotiate their system to get their people to do their job????

Bottom line - Not customer focused.  Over priced!  Outdated.  Not maintained.  NOT CLEAN!  Avoid it.

Stayed here in June for 4 nights to celebrate family birthdays. It was a nice hotel and I would probably stay again. My mom turned 80 and my daughter turned 21. Lots of kids here - little kids and a few dogs. 

ROOM: Our room was on the 24th floor overlooking the pool. We were warned that there would be a party on Wednesday evening and we might find the music to be too loud. We did hear the music and it wasn't that bad but we appreciated the warning. We had to have housekeeping change our sheets the afternoon we arrived as when I pulled the sheets back to take a quick nap I noticed food (not ours) and hair on the sheets. We had been up since 2:00 am so I didn't appreciate having to deal with this. The carpet is light gray and easily shows dirt. It seemed dirty in spots but not crazy dirty. The carpet can be touched up, though. The decor of the room and the view were both fantastic! There is a coffee maker in the room but we didn't use it. We brought our own electric kettle to boil water for tea, coffee and oatmeal. We also had a refrigerator but it was my understanding that not all rooms have refrigerators so ask for one if you need it. There were plenty of mirrors throughout the room for 4 women which was great. The bathroom was a really nice size. The bed was comfy. 

LOCATION: The hotel is conveniently located a short walk from CVS where you can buy bottled water and snacks. The souvenirs are cheap at CVS, too!! Don't pass these up. A lot of the stores have the same items but it seems CVS has the best prices. 

FOOD: The buffet is awful. Get an Uber or Lyft and go to The Wynn for breakfast. It is cheaper and OUTSTANDING compared to Paris' buffet which is boring, cold and just a waste of money. The crepes that were made right in front of us were still cold in the middle. Hexx was really good and so was their ice cream. 

CASINO\/SHOPS: The slot machines were not generous unless you played some of the older machines. Unfortunately, I didn't figure this out until the last day. My mom plays video poker and she didn't have any luck. I know the odds are not in your favor blah blah blah but at least humor me and make the money last a little bit. Throw me a bone! I also heard this from numerous people sitting next to me at machines that they did better in the past. Not enough waitresses on the floor. You could wait up to 10 minutes to get a drink on a weekday afternoon. Most of the shops are cute but management really needs to tell the skincare shop across from Le Central bar to calm down and quit harassing people as they walk past. They were so irritating and aggressive!!! 

The lady that checked us in was really sweet. Overall a good stay but there is room for improvement.

This is one of my favorite casinos.  I love the ambiance here. I have a thing for Francophile. The music, the lovely ceiling and even the public bathrooms are sooo nice. This is a nice spacious casino.

To be at Paris on the Strip is a bit like being in Paris at the Disneyworld, with fewer children and sea of adults ready to get down. While the cheesiness is never ending, , this Caesars Entertainment property is as decent as they come for mid-tier properties and just so happens to be situated mid strip.

The most impressive thing about Paris is their lifelike replica of the Eiffel Tower. It is haven for countless photo ops, a Strip landmark, and home to its very own restaurant (and very good) in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/eiffel-tower-restaurant-las-vegas). I've read that Paris attracts the most honeymooners in Vegas. If you can't go to the real Pareee, I suppose the Vegas version will have to do.

There are a decent array of cafes and shops throughout Paris, none of which are outstanding enough to mention on their own.The restaurant variety is a bit on the drab side, from the 24 hour Le Cafe (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/le-cafe-ile-saint-louis-las-vegas) to the uninspiring Le Village Buffet (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/le-village-buffet-las-vegas). Asian food at Ah Sin doesn't feel very Parisian, same goes for the bland Italian at Le Provencal.

If there is a weak point, let it be the casino and their nightlife venues. With the casino, it's a labyrinth of machines, table games, and a drab high limit area. Not that it should be pleasing to the eye, but the casino Bar Central isn't a place where one can truly get drunk enough to spend those TotalReward points and no other bar really does the trick. Chateau as a night club hasn't been all its cracked up to be and isn't a heavy favorite in the weekend rotation of most frequented clubs at all. From a mild to medium standpoint on the casino hotness meter, Paris is somewhere inbetween.

My personal favorite aspect is their rooms. Most of the standard stuff is going to look antiquated with an obvious Euro feel, but the jr suites, like the Le Mans and such have a good value to them, and the comp rewards are more applicable to higher end rooms here. If Caesars Palace is the high end, Imperial is the lower end of the Caesars Entertainment totem pole, then Paris, through all it has to offer, is definitely somewhere in the middle. 

Ah, c'est la vie.

Paris, Las Vegas! I absolutely love this hotel!!!! For me, Paris is the right amount of classy yet a little low key so I don't feel completely out of my element.

First off, the atmosphere is great! It's got a true authentic Parisian flair, with a touch of the Las Vegas fun! Every time I step into the Paris Hotel and Casino I just am filled with glee. The staff is excellent and wears the cutest outfits, and the mock cobblestone flooring downstairs with the beautiful blue sky just makes for an inviting atmosphere.

I personally love the buffet at this hotel. I usually go for breakfast and it is VERY reasonably priced for what you get. Check it out!

There is also a restaurant that has a great French onion soup, I forget what it's called but it'd let indoor out door.

Finally, the gambling is decent. I was able to play for a few hours without losing my home so that's a bonus right?

We stayed at this hotel last July 19 for 3 days. We called the front desk if we get billed if we  use the wifi and  the lady said "NO". To my surprise, when we checked out they billed me for the use of wifi for 2 days. The signal sucks that u could not even get good connection. I complained but my complains fell on deaf ears. I'm not going to check in to this hotel AGAIN!

GegenÃ¼ber vom Bellagio befindet sich das Themenhotel Paris Las Vegas, das 1999 erÃ¶ffnet wurde und von der Caesars Entertainment betrieben wird. Es ist nur unschwer am 164,6 Meter hohen Nachbau des Eiffelturms zu erkennen. Es ist neben Monte Carlo und Venedig die dritte europÃ¤ische Stadt in Miniaturform am Las Vegas Boulevard.

Der Eiffelturm wurde nach alten BauplÃ¤nen mit 8.000 Tonnen Stahl dem Original nachempfunden, mit der gleichen Farbe im MaÃstab 2:1. Aufgrund der NÃ¤he zum Flughafen durfte der Eiffelturm nicht in OriginalgrÃ¶Ãe gebaut werden. Ein Bein des Turmes ist witziger weise durch die Decke des Casinos gebaut worden. DarÃ¼ber hinaus hat man auf dem GelÃ¤nde den Triumphbogen, die Pariser Oper und den Louvres nachgebaut. 

Das Hotel verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber 2.916 Zimmer und bietet jeglich erdenklichen Luxus. Auf dem Dach des Casinos befindet sich ein groÃer Poolbereich. Im Hotel befinden sich 10 franzÃ¶sisch gestaltete Restaurants und Cafes, wie z.B. das Eiffel Tower Restaurant, Les Artistes Steakhouse, Le Provencal, La Chine, Le Cafe ile St. Louis und Jean Jacques' Boulangerie. Auch ein Touristenbuffet, das Le Village Buffet darf nicht fehlen.

Das Casino ist mit 7.900 mÂ² Ã¼berschaubar und bietet den SpielwÃ¼tigen Touristen 100 Spieltische mit Blackjack, Craps und Roulette, Sportwetten, 2.200 Slots, Videopoker und Videokeno. DarÃ¼ber hinaus gibt es noch einen extra Players Club. Durch einen Durchgang ist das Paris Las Vegas mit dem Ballys verbunden.

Am besten hat mir der Shoppingbereich mit den malerischen Gassen gefallen. Hier hat man auf den Wegen Kopfsteinpflaster verarbeitet und von der Decke strahlt ein blauer Himmel. Hier befinden sich franzÃ¶sische Boutiquen, Wein- und KÃ¤segeschÃ¤fte, Kunstgalerien und man kann frische Croissants und Baguettes kaufen.

Mir hat das Hotel sehr gut gefallen und sollte auf keinem Las Vegas Strip Bummel fehlen.

My very first time here and on a Monday check in the lines are ridiculous, a super long walk from parking to end up in a very slow check in, have already been standing in line for 20 plus minutes, this is ridiculous. I will never recommend this place unless it improves by leaps and bounds from here. This is just unacceptable. Poor, poor service.

This will be my 3rd Caesars affiliated resort I've visited, out of the 3; Linq, flamingo, Pairs, this by fare trumps them all. From the valet to guest service to housekeeping, everyone was just so friendly and attentive.

We got a nice room, fixed with 2 queen beds which fit 4 big (muscly) guys comfortably overlooking the high roller ferris wheel! The room was VERY clean, just wish they had a keurig coffee machines vs the crappy pos coffee maker they had. 

My only complaint about the resort was the floor table manager. He wasn't in a good mood and seems like he was hating life. He made a few sarcastic comments about how loud I was being several of time. Come on man, this is Vegas, the city that NEVER sleeps. But Johnny, the bartender from the main bar made up for the lack of customer service the manger didn't have. He was very friendly and helpful, we even shared a few comments about girls walking by! ^_^

 All and all I love this resort and would stay here again, gambling? I'll just stick to the Linqs hotel. Over there I won't be judged or criticize for trying to have a good time.     

KCYE
Don

I don't think I've ever stayed here, but I've gambled here a couple of times.  It took me a while to find a Pai Gow table since they aren't all in one area.  But I had a lot of fun.  The dealers were really nice and the people we were playing with were a blast.  I'd come here again to gamble.  :)

Pros

Location: Paris is located at the "center" of the strip, next to Cosmo, Planet Hollywood, Bellagios and Caesars. Convenient if you want to check the different hotels and a short walk back to your hotel if you're tired. 

Rooms: The rooms are spacious and clean for the most part. The regular rooms are "simple" with a French decor. Not the worse and not the best. 

Cons 

Service: Compared to Bellagio, the service at the front desk was not friendly and I never once felt welcomed.
Don't stay in this hotel we requested a non smoking room they gave us a smoking room that stink .. so bad rooms are dirty .

So I booked a weekday getaway for me and the gf and we just got back. Stayed from Tuesday till Thursday. 

Service: 
- Check-in was packed on a Tuesday afternoon but it moved fairly quickly which was great. The woman who checked us in was polite as per requirement of the job, but not super friendly or cheery as I would have liked :-\/ 
- Room service was fairly prompt. We got 2 desserts ($8 each) and it took right around 30 minutes. They automatically charge you a $5 service fee so I did not feel compelled to tip. It is the guy's job to bring up the food and well...you already charged me $5 for no reason....my justification for not feeling like a cheap a$$ 
- Our TV was not working when we got to the room so they sent a repair man up in the next 5 minutes and he figured out the problem and changed the tuner quickly so kudos to him and his promptness. 

Hotel:
- The hotel's shops aren't all that impressive compared to others like PH or Caesars. It is just a small lane of shops that are quite forgettable. 
- The best part of the Paris is their restaurant\/food options. Mon Ami Gabi is an awesome restaurant and Sugar Factory, while I didn't like it for breakfast, would be great for a late night dessert. I didn't go to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant (due to the lack of Benjamins) but I hear great things about it and more than just because of the view. The pizza place was good for a quick bite to eat and the pizza was solid. I wanted to try to the buffet but the line was always SO long and out the door so I guess it had to be pretty good. It is part of the Buffet of Buffets so try and get the deal of 6 buffets for $45 for 24 hrs. 
- Casino area is WAY too small for my taste. After walking around, I didn't feel the urge to gamble here. 
- The decor was neat but slightly....cheap feeling. The sky ceiling wasn't all that great, especially compared to Caesars. 
- The first thing that I noticed coming through the doors, unfortunately, was the smell of cigarette smoke. That is a problem for me that I don't think should happen. When I walk into Bellagio or PH or other hotels, I don't get that whiff of smoke.
- Valet was busy. I was told 10-15 minutes but it ended up being more like 25. Grrrr. 
- No Resort Fee, but then you have to pay for WiFi. Not that I needed it but for those that do that's a bummer. 

Room:
- Red Room Premium. No fountain view but we got a partial view of it so all was not lost. Plus its across the street so we just walked over and watched from the Bellagio side of the street. 
- Furniture is cool and the queen bed is fairly comfy. Large flat screen tv but lack of many channels when we used it for our downtime, if there is such a thing in Vegas.
- Bathroom was nice in that it had a separate shower and tub. The tub felt very shallow though. There is also only 1 sink. Red Room Premium and we only get 1 sink? C'mon now son. 

 I have definitely experienced better. The red room premium cost me $60-80 on a weekday which is great for the type of room. That being said, seeing pictures from the "lower" type rooms here, I wouldn't stay here unless it was at least the RRP. Personally, I'd rather pay more for a nicer room at like Aria or if you are on a budget, I'd rather stay at Luxor or Excalibur. This hotel is great to stop by for a bite to eat and a look around rather than a stay.

Prime location. Cheap rates. Prime location. 

No frills, no nonsense room. But again, you can't beat the location.

Stayed here for my 50th birthday this past summer, loved it! We had no issues with an early check in, but we stayed Sunday through Wednesday, so not sure how it is on a Friday or Saturday. The interior is pretty cool, imo. The staff was friendly, the rooms were nice, the pool was fun, the restaurants were all great, especially the breakfast buffet. The first night we ate at the burger joint and we each had a shake that has alcohol in it, fabulous, although I will say Vegas is not exactly as cheap as it once was, the bill for 2 burgers, 2 fries and the 2 shakes was just over a Grant$$. Hotels is in a good location and convenient to lot of things to do on the Strip. I enjoyed this hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

stayed here a few times, latest being this weekend. Free rooms thanks to father in laws degenerate slot play over the years I'm stuck at Harrah's properties if I don't wanna pony up for the rooms.
Rooms are ok, not the Bellagio, but better than Bally's. The sink was clogged, the shower has some cracks, but overall space and comfort wise did the job.
Ridiculously lousy soft bed and pillows.
Casino is nice, I like the street look vibe with the cobblestones. And if your not brain dead you know its inner-connected to Ballys.
They dick you with standard useless resort fee $23\/day-ish.
What I HATE about this hotel is the food. No chinese, italian, american cafe, just fake french food and crappiest buffet imaginable. Crepes shop dont do it for me. Mon Abi Gabi a complete waste of time and money (see review), and a sugar-laced sugar factory store (yeah in case you dont get enough from the sodas and iced tea\/foods\/chocolate we eat). Easily worst food quality and quantity wise. Only one cant comment on is gordon ramsays new restaurant, didnt get a chance to go there.
Not very practical food, decent rooms, decent casino (have very bad luck here on table games maybe just me)
Their pool is on the 3rd floor, and isnt all that. Its ok size but not big whatsoever. Before 12pm you will freeze your ass off in spring because sun is limited since its blocked partially coming up from being on a patio floor etc.
Service is slow, they have 2 waitresses covering whole pool, and no food menu, thats a first in an upscale vegas resort. 
AT least close to cosmopolitan, and bellagio, 2 of my fave places.
Sportsbook is average size, players club took almost 20 minutes to give my $125 comp play, they said system fucked up reservation. But they sure did take them down quick when I blew it on the tables---LMAO
I think Ballys and Paris are allergic to having blackjack tables....what happened to all the double deck, and 6 deck games? They had a couple of each in the ENTIRE casino.
Theyre getting replaced with these stupid bullshit 4 card stud, 3 card stud, and your mommas a dud typa games. sad.

First of all their customer service is the worst that I've ever experienced. I travel for a living but I was here on vacation with my family. They have one, at most two desks open for check-in and it takes forever. Same thing for check out. And the people behind the desk and the managers(who I complained to) couldn't care less. On top of that when we checked in they upsold us to a better room for another $25 a night. If the room they gave us was a premium room, that I'd hate to see what the regular one looked like. It was a total joke and a waste of money. 

The location of the hotel is great and the casino was very nice. But the customer service experience pushed the rating way down in my eyes. I would never go back.

Less than thrilled. I've stayed here twice and will never do it again. Both times my ex just "needed" to stay here (should have taken that as a sign...). I think it's a bit overpriced for the room. The first time staying here, I have to admit, I don't remember it. That actually says a lot though. I remember all my stays at the Venetian, my stay at Mandalay Bay, and even my less than great stay at MGM, but this one? Couldn't tell ya. That's how "bleh" this place is. Oh wait, I do remember the margaritas in the Eiffel Tower souvenir glasses. THAT was awesome. The second time we went we checked in, went to our room and housekeeping hadn't even been there yet (this was at check in time too by the way). Went clear back down to the desk, complained, they upgraded us to a corner room. That was nice. It was huge. But for a room so large, don't make it so sparse! Give me a couch or something. Bathroom was average. Pool was nice though, but I have to ask, are ALL pools in Vegas only about 4-5 feet deep?? This was my first Vegas pool experience, so I wouldn't know, but kinda lame. I'm a swimmer. Let me swim. The buffet is supposed to be one of the best in town. Okay, it's average I think, and what they don't tell you is you have to wake up at 3am and get in line unless you want to wait AT LEAST one hour at a NORMAL time of around 8 or 9am which, for Vegas, is still too early to be awake. Too kid friendly for my taste. I suppose if you are one of those on-the-go Vegas tourists and literally only use the room for sleeping, this is okay, but personally I wouldn't do it again.

Welp. This place was terrible. Checked in to one hotel room and the room was still dirty from the last tennants. Called down and asked to change rooms and they obliged. Went back down and got the room changed they lady lets us know that she's going to upgrade our room but it will be s bit noisier because of the fountains and overlooking the pool. Sure. We get to the room and the tub faucet leaks, the mini fridge smelled like something died in it. And we can hear some kind of noise from above us. Oh well I guess we'll make it work. Well it's night one down and if I didn't have to move everything I would have moved hotels this morning. You can hear everything in the halls clear as day. Woke up 4 times throughout the night by people talking. I recommend staying in an upgraded room or a completely different hotel. This place stunk!

We have stayed at Paris a few times and really enjoyed the place.  
*Staff--always been very attentive and helpful
*Restaurants & bars--good variety and value (although I think the dueling pianos guys are the most money grubbing musicians I've ever seen). Don't know about the buffet, never tried that one 
*Layout--being able to stroll over to Bally's for a change of pace is pretty cool  *Location--center strip is obviously excellent. 
*Rooms-- the standard rooms are ok, depending on where your room is the views can be thrilling  
*Casino-- could use a little bit of a freshening.  Last trip we spent more time away  (at other venues) than ever before.

This hotel takes no responsibility for anything that occurs on their property. We spent well over $10k at this hotel to have our wedding, reception, and party all in one place and everything was going great until we arrived at Chateau. We had a party of 11 so had to buy a vip table and extra general admission tickets. To make a long story short, they made us split up and two of my friends from Pennsylvania and one from Texas were never allowed in. Complete disaster, horrible experience, incompetent staff. And all that the Paris had to say was that their nightclub is separate and they can't do anything about it. Thanks for ruining my wedding. I looked forward to spending anniversaries at this hotel to remember our special day but now all I'm trying to do is forget it.

The biggest problem with this hotel is trying to check in. They have an automated check in\/out kiosk but it did not get our room ready info correct. Then waited in line for around thirty minutes to check in with a desk clerk. What was really sad is this was the shortest line we saw the entire time. Easily 20 or more people lined up at any given time and only one person working regular check in. When I asked the clerk, she said that this was the way management wants it. Surely they are making enough money to have enough employees at the hotel desk!!!  Also the baseboards are quite nasty up and down the halls. They may have never been cleaned. The rooms were nice and clean. After you can get a key of course!

This casino was old the day it opened. This casino offers none of the aesthetics of paris and the only resemblance it really carries inside is the cheesey cafes and french stores. No one does anything here except walk through or park.

Nice room. Enjoyed the view of the Eiffel Tower the most! Mini fridge did not work. The parking was very easy to follow which was nice! I am a platinum member, so I did not have to pay parking which was really neat. Overall, a very enjoyable and relaxing time.

I'm writing this for a friend. She stayed for two nights here, very cute rooms. Only down fall was the fridge  it was broke so we put in a few beers (had no idea it was broke)  and it was warm and had a spoiled food smell. The bathroom was so big and comfortable! The pool was relaxing, I got sick after cause of all the kids in there that day but oh well lol. Drinks were expensive but it's vegas and this pool has a waitress.
*As casinos go* pretty cool.  I really enjoyed the fake tower, the fake sky, and the fake streetwalk.  This is about as good as fake gets, people.

My sister and I came to Las Vegas for my 21st birthday and stayed at the Paris hotel for the first time.  The hotel was beautiful both inside and out.  Our room was clean and had an ok view of the strip.  We had a standard double non smoking.  It was a little noisy at times in the hallway and you could hear the room next door when you were in the bathroom- which was gross at times.  Also in the room there is no coffee pot, only a coffee service where you can pay for a cup of coffee to your room. There is no fridge in the room, which is annoying at times when you want a cold drink. We had trouble with our hot water in the shower - it required maintenance 2 days in a row. The maintenance came pretty quick and both men were really nice about it.

The staff was not very friendly but thankfully we did not have to deal with them too often.  I took a shuttle from the airport and they dropped me off on the side of the building. Finding the check in area was really difficult just because of where they dropped me off. 

The best thing about this hotel is the location - perfectly centered on the strip and very close to the monorail stop at Bally's. I wish the pool was open later..it is only open until 8pm. The entire pool area is great though.  We went to Mon Ami Gabi at the hotel, and it was wonderful. Also there is a pastry shop by the elevators and the cinnamon buns are amazing. The casino isn't huge, but its nice and not very crowded. 

I would stay at this hotel again.

We were here for EDC and decided to stay at Paris since it's near the Shuttle to the event. We were here for 4nights 5 days. Anyway, they told us we needed to move rooms due to plumbing maintenance. Which I feel is a inconvenience to us since we come back really late from the event. We tried calling the front desk to speak with the manager, they put us on hold and got disconnected. We called back and they said they are really busy and they said to call back. We called again and we're on hold for 10 min which wasted more time and they said they'll call us back, which never happened which is not good customer service.We will move but we will not be staying here again

DONT STAY HERE. RUDE RUDE RUDE.    5 of us were here for a girls\/21 birthday weekend. Worst customer service ever. We booked our rooms 8 months in advance, with a request of having adjoining rooms. We were told that it was just a request and no, you can't have that. We were constantly offered rooms away from each other, on different floors, with no view (costing less than the amount already paid). Once they found us a room, we were told the room had a customer in it that had a late check out, but they had no idea when they were expected to leave. We would have to wait until after 6 to get our keys, possibly later.  Asked to see a manager twice,  Debbie our customer service rep. would just walk away. After throwing a huge fit, in front of approximately 75 people also waiting, they "upgraded" us to adjoining burgundy rooms. Will never stay here again.

I usually stick to the Mirage, but my buddy and I decided to try somewhere new. I went in expecting to dislike the rooms (having already decided, on previous visits, that the common areas were only ok), but was pleasantly surprised. Lets break it down:

Check In: Friday at 5:30pm and it was surprisingly quick and very efficient, with some friendly thrown in too.

Rooms: We ended up in a Premium Guest Room (second up from the cheapest), and it was well appointed and of good size. Our room had a mini fridge which was great, though I am not sure if all rooms have them. Beds were comfy. TV was large and of good quality. Plenty of storage space. The bathroom was very large with a nice vanity and separate tub\/shower. The shower was great - large, nice and with good water pressure. Housekeeping was very good. Wifi was approximately $14\/day should you need it.

Elevators: One thing I've noticed is how bad some elevators can be. There was never a wait for Paris. They are set up perfectly and whisk you away quickly, to or from your room. 

Location: Perfect. Across from Bellagio in the middle of the Strip, you've got Wynn as a 20 minute walk north, and NY NY the same south (with crowds). 

Casino: Average. It has all your basics, and employees are friendly enough, but nothing here is really all that special. 

Sports Book: A bit small, but still decent. Could use some more TVs though. Staff are the friendliest on the Strip in my book. 

Food: Paris really, really lacks here. You basically have French, Italian or buffet...that's it. Selection wise, this is probably the worst on the Strip. At least other places have variety.


So, I stick to the opinion that Paris has mediocre common areas. However, rooms and service here were both very good, on top of the ideal location, so I wouldn't hesitate to return.

What big hotel corporation not give toothpaste and tell you to go buy some. I'm paying a resort fee to be treated fairly and given respect. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. Last time I stay here.

The Absolute most worst hotel in Las Vegas, please save your money, and go somewhere else!!! My family and I regularly visit vegas two  to four times a year, we usually stay in a beautiful suite in planet hollywood, this time we decided to stay here at Paris, AND WHAT A BIG MISTAKE THIS WAS. The suit first of all I'd the size of a regular room in planet hollywood, the decor looks like it's been here since the 70s, I was looking past all that until we delt witth customer service, the absolute worst service that I have ever come across. House keeping, we requested house keeping to.come and clean the room, nothing was done, no new towels, no beds made, nothing what so ever. I will gladly say that I will never stay here again. They treat you so bad with such disrespect, all because my bank put a hold on my  card, my bank thought that there was fraud on my card. After I called my bank and resolved the issue and was able to properly have my card up and running, they still continued to give me issues and treat us like criminals. forget this place and go else where!!!!!!!!

Wedged between the Bally's and Planet Hollywood Hotels.

This hotel has a decent shopping mall, but none of your big name brands.

The casino floor is not as large as the other hotels. I wasn't lucky on my visit, so I have to keep moving on to the next casino to find my luck.

I love staying at Paris, primarily because of its ambience. A pretty hotel\/resort with comfortable, attractive rooms and a cute little cobble-stoned "street" lined with shops, bakeries, and restaurants. They also have one of the best buffets on the strip. What I DON'T like, though, are their low odds of winning at either slots or tables. Of the dozens and dozens and dozens of times I've gambled at Paris (I know, why do I bother?), I can probably count on one hand the number of times I've ended the night (or even a session) up. So, if you're wiser than me: spend the night, stroll along the cobble-stones, enjoy a buffet, but RESIST the urge to gamble.

I've always been a bigger fan of the outside of the Paris than the inside; but, then again, they just recreated some of the most beautiful structures in the world.  The tower is of course gorgeous, and Arc de Triomphe with the fountains in front is breathtaking.  My love affair with the casino ends there.  

Inside, it's poorly laid out and feels crowded.  The giant legs of the tower are huge cubed impediments throughout.  You're always asking for directions, and the beauty of the outside doesn't transfer into the inside at all.  I really, really hate the cocktail waitresses' uniforms.  They're awful.

Stick to the outside and take pictures of the pretty things there.  That's as good as it gets.

The moment I got in this place  I had a very bad impression, the lady that checked us in was so bad and rude, she did not greet us nor welcomed us, not even thanked us for checking in or choosing this place and I don't blame her because this place is so bad that no one  would be proud to welcome you in.

We had to pay more for the room to check in at 3:30 pm or let us wait until 6pm to check in !!!!! 

Bathroom tub is rusty. The window is dirty. 

I highly recommend that you go to anther hotel ! 

I stayed in 5 stars hotels, and motels ! I never had such a horrible experience such as this! 


I really regret booking at this hostel.

Upon seeing the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door that I was exiting, a weird housekeeper inquired three different times (in a row) if she could come in, even asking, "Can I use the phone?"  

Every time I would respond with "No, thank you," "No, we don't need anything," and "No, it's okay," she would ask again as if I didn't say anything.

This made me REALLY UNCOMFORTABLE to the point that I even came back a few minutes later to make sure she wasn't in my room.

The whole building has extremely poor air quality; my eyes were so red and irritated that I could barely open them.

The bathtub was so small that even a diminutive adult would find most of their legs to their knees sticking up out of the water.

There was no microwave or coffee maker in the room.  The television has only a handful of channels.

One star to the rest of the professional staff (NOT HOUSEKEEPING).

Just based on a few visits to the Casino-- 

The customer service was pretty poor. The line at the cashier cage was huge -- they had one cashier servicing the low rollers, and three cashiers who weren't busy were there for the "Diamond" customers.  They were really slow to correct this, and the other people in line with me didn't seem too pleased either.

Couple of blackjack dealers were pretty arrogant and didn't even know basic strategy for the game they dealt. One pretty openly treated me like a fool, which I didn't really enjoy. :) 

Bad rules for the games and personally could do without the fake Paris decor. I know some people like it, but I like a casino that's not pretending to be Disneyland.

stayed here the last couple nights and woke up at 10am freaking out from construction noises. now just a heads up, it's not drilling from outside or a couple rooms down.. it literally sounds like it's on your ceiling. we started to freak out because we thought the ceiling was collapsing. when we called the front desk they said oh yeah we are doing rennovations. we asked if this is just something we are supposed to sleep through. I'm telling you I'm not a complainer but even when the TV was on the highest volume I couldn't hear the TV. they said there should be a note in our room saying that they are doing renovations to upgrade their hotel. a note in the room? really? how about a note when you book your room. why would anyone book a room here if they would be waking up like this every morning. definitely not fair to customers. and this will be going on for a while so my suggestion is for late 2016 or early 2017, book a room somewhere else. it is not worth the pricey rooms and expensive resort fees. I wasn't rude to the staff when I called the front desk to ask why we weren't notified of this construction. When I complained they said they would take off one nights resort fee. well just like every other review on this hotel, THEY LIED. they charged me for everything and when calling to complain, they don't care.

now for the actual rooms- I understand why they're upgrading it because so many details of the room make it feel like a cheap motel. it is clean and decent but decently older. (another reason to try somewhere else. you can stay somewhere newer for the same price). I had a king suite and there is a giant armoire directly across from you. it's just weird because the TV cabinet of the armoire is a refrigerator and your TV is way off to the side.
carpet and bathroom tile were sticky and uncomfortable so don't walk around barefoot.
the only plus for me was the location of the Paris and the food options. but I definitely will not return or recommend to any of my friends.

It was my first time in Vegas and I wanted a hotel that wasn't near the end of the strip. Paris was a good location with great restaurants. There was Mon Ami Gabi and Gordon Ramsay steakhouse.

My initial impression of the hotel when I walked in was that it looked pretty cool. I loved the ceiling of the casino area. It's quite nice how many details are created to resemble Paris. The check in counter was beautiful with all the chandeliers. 

So why 4 stars and not 5? I felt that the hotel was disorganized in their booking system and this affected the check in process. On the night my party arrived, we went to the express machines at check-in but they weren't working. So we lined up and there weren't many counter representatives so the line was quite long. Can't really complain since I know it's Vegas and other hotels could be just as busy.

My issue with the checkin is because my room was not available ... and I arrived at 11pm which is wayyyy later than the allowed check in time so my room should already be prepared. My room was booked ahead of time online. They did not prepare a room. Why was it not ready? How can a hotel like this be so disorganized? The staff who was checking my party in had to check the system which rooms were available at the price we paid. So we waited ...  then she tells us there is a room available with one king bed. But we booked a room with TWO beds, two queen beds. She said both rooms are about the same price. But it's not about the price. This is about customer needs. We (customers) paid for a room with 2 queen beds. If they overbooked a standard room then they should offer an upgraded room with 2 queen beds, not another room with 1 bed. I'm confused why she thinks we would take that offer when we paid for a room with 2 beds. 

Anyways. She made a call to see if there were any rooms left with two queen beds (which we booked and paid for in advance) and there was. So we got our room finally.

I was disappointed how can Paris hotel not have an available room which was booked and paid for. You would expect their system is accurate and they would not have such issues. 

Other than the horrible check in process, I think the hotel is nice. The housekeeping staff are friendly and they did a great job. I hope they improve on their check in process.

Wow in a bad way.  I don't know how this place can get good ratings on TripAdvisor.  For starters, it is dark and dingy inside the hotel by design.  The lobby is just about the last place in Vegas that I would want to be... well, except for the floor that our room was on.  I definitely wouldn't want to be there because, on account of the fact that housekeeping is headquartered on that 10th floor, the hallways smell like stale spooge.  I will never set foot in this hotel again.

Not sure what happened to the rooms here at this hotel?  The lamp cord had so much dust on it, it looked like snow. The bed skirt had dried up brown stuff on it, and it was dingy and dusty. The bed had food under it from WHO KNOWS WHEN. The headboard, hand not been dusted in months. The rugs had black scuff marks on them and on the walls. ALL the baseboards are dirty dusty and CRACKED!  The bathrooms (appeared clean), but the shower around the bottom door was corroded along with the bottom of the toilet.  I was so grossed out, I LEFT!  It is really sad, because their location, and restaurant's are wonderful!

Great food, great tables.
Light, airy interior.  
Captures the spirit.

I was here for super bowl 50, super easy check in and check out, rooms are okay but definitely can use a renovation.  I tried to get an upgrade but no luck.  Didn't matter, had a great time, clean hotel with a good vibe.  Will be back soon with the Mrs.

This hotel is terrible.  The front desk people are rude.   The concierge is useless.   We had to beg housekeeping for more shampoo, etc.  They nickeled and dimed us to death.  IN ADDITION TO THE RESORT FEE, we were charged for using a locker and taking a shower in the fitness room.   REALLY??  There was no automatic connection to the internet in my room and I had to call EVERY DAY for them to connect it manually.  I could go on and on.  Never again Paris.  You suck.

First my review of the hotel rooms.
Very clean. I like that the shower (very spacious) and tub were separate and the bathroom was much bigger than I expected.  Our friends across the hall had a great view of the pool below and the eiffel tower.  This part of my review gets 4 stars.

Now my review of the villa pool rental:
For $325 we got a private villa with A\/C room w\/ flat screen tv, table w\/ 4-5 chairs, loveseat chair and coffee table, cd player, fruit basket, and a mini fridge full of water, soda, and juice.  Outside there were 5 lounge chairs and  pool floaties that the "regular" pool guess do not get.  Also there were misters that we could control from the inside of the room.  My main complaint about the villa was that it wasn't clean when we arrived.  There was a cup with a rotten lime on the ground, mysterious sticky black stuff on the floor inside, and a phlegm looking thing on the side table outside.  Also the waitresses weren't around much and was slow to come back with our drinks.  This part of the review gets 2.5 stars.  I still had a great time at the pool with my friends though because of the privacy.

Now my review of the shops and cafes:
I liked that everything was in in one area and easily accessible on the way to the elevators.  The food wasn't amazing in every cafe, but was good enough to hit the spot.  This gets 4 stars.

Lastly my review of the casino itself:
I think the gaming is very small and limited.  Not many open tables and slots.  This is one casino I don't really get lost in since the gaming area is so small.  I went to the poker room to play 3-6 limit, but there was only ONE table playing no limit.  LAME. This gets 2 stars.

Ugh.

40" to check in (and check out).

$20 charge if you want to check in before 3 PM.

You'll be asked to pay even if your room is vacant and available.

You'll be asked to pay even if you attempt to check in at 2:45 (PM not AM)

Clueless, indifferent staff.

Worn carpets, dirty public bathrooms and claustrophobic elevators.

Loud, poorly maintained rooms.

Activities fee added to each bill, regardless if you use their gym or crowded pool.

$5 charge to print your boarding pass. 

Really??

Save yourself from endless aggravation, stay in a hotel where management and staff take pride in customer service.

Love the location, room and pool, BUT the customer service is seriously THE WORST!!!!! Adrian at the front desk was great checking us in. They originally did not have our 2 queen, non smoking, when we arrived. It miraculously came up at the last minute. We put down a $50 deposit for in room movies. Upon trying to rent a movie for my kids, we were unable. After 1 hour, 7 calls to the front desk, engineering supposedly coming and a no show, and house keeping coming with a new remote, we called AGAIN and spoke to Mike who was beyond rude!!!!!! Told us there was no $50 deposit charge (even though we have a receipt) and to bring proof to the front desk. This, after nearly an hour??? To drag my 2 kids down to the front desk and show them their screw up????? For the topper.......they mistakenly called us this morning for a 5:30am wake-up call. Wrong room people! Thanks a bunch!!!!!! We have come to Las Vegas many times and stayed at Bellagio, Caesars, NYNY, Mandalay Bay, The Hotel, Treasure Island, Tropicana, MGM, Luxor, Excalibur, The Palms, Mirage, Riviera, Hard Rock, The Rio, Venetian, Palazzo,etc. Stay away from this Clown College!!!!

I stayed at this hotel like over 5 years ago and it was just ok but now it is really nice! They have tons of little cute shops to shop at now and I loved the cobblestone roads everywhere!  It felt a lot more French than it did in the past.  The rooms we had were not bad for doubles and had modern dÃ©cor inside.  They have apparently remodeled some of the rooms so ask if you can get one if you stay there.  Our room was not remodeled but was nice.  They allowed late checkout after 11:00 and the staff was very courteous to us at all times.  I would recommend staying there to anyone going to Las Vegas and want a smaller hotel with less crowds. I would avoid their gym since it was $25.00 a day and a way too pricey to go use!
I really enjoyed the buffet and service at this hotel. I was a specially pleased with assistant manager Bob Brown! He was very professional, and provided me with excellent customer service.

I give them a 2 for the friendly cleaning people and the delicious pizza sold by the slice. Everything and everyone else was just bad. Upon check in we had an unfriendly robot get us into our room. We wanted a possible upgrade and she was dismissive when quoting the possible cost to upgrade as if she didn't want to be bothered thinking we could not or wouldn't pay for it. Not the case. The room which was in the newly renovated tower was small and depressing. When I went to the promotions area to obtain a players card I waited in the "new\/gold level" line. When it was my turn I walked up and the lady said " not just yet" walked away and grabbed two women waiting in their diamond players line. I was pushed aside while at the counter and told I needed to move back in line. That was very rude to be dismissed yet again as if I didn't deserve good service. The man next to her closed his line by putting up a sign. The people waiting behind me said that was terrible and rude. I went to play as I spend a good amount of time gambling and my roulette dealer Dan gets 10 stars for being sweet and fun. The hostess' at your brunch places also need to smile and not seem like they hate their jobs. I'm a super friendly service oriented human being that only promotes kindness and has been raised with manners. These people need either get a lesson on how to work in the hospitality industry or just work behind a computer with no interaction with people.  The food at the cafe was bland and the noodle place should stop ripping people off ($80) for cafeteria style noodles. I've had better for at the local mall for $8 bucks. The pool has no cocktail server or vibe. This place is a dud. I've been to Vegas 100s of times and I've stayed just about everywhere and this was the worst experience ever. Save your time and money and go anywhere else.

From the outside, Paris Las Vegas looks fantastic. It's truly one of my favorite views on the Strip. However, once you go inside, it's a slightly different dynamic. It is very outdated and needs an epic upgrade. Ok, not so much a total remodel, but just enough to reflect some fascination! Additionally, the employees are not my favorite lot of the bunch. I have yet to run into a dealer or waitress who convinced me they were genuinely smiling and\/or happy to see me. Even with all that, the place does hold a majestic aura to it. Is it french love I smell? No, it's a lot of smoke. But still, Paris has its perks and until the walls are falling a part, I will still consider this place decent. Overall, I would not recommend making Paris Las Vegas your destination but somewhere to travel through and pass some time.

Location: Center strip, easy access to the main attractions on the strip.
Casino: On the smaller side but has some unique elements such as 60s like band stage and dancers.
Pool: Awesome with great views of the Eiffel Tower replica.
Eating: Good options like Gordon Ramsay, dimsums place, crepary, pizza, etc...
Room: Average. oldish furniture, wallpaper dirty at places, empty fridge in the room, no dental kit and no hot kettle for coffee\/tea.
The ambiance is descent for the French vibe and it has a GR restaurant... so 4 stars.
Very nice resort, I just don't care for french food. Nice rooms and a nice well ventilated casino
Nice place .. had a good view of the Eiffel tower and of the Bellagio and the water show.. downfall was the toilet paper

get a room above 25th floor - they re newly remodeled and wellworth the upgrade premium.

hotel is located w\/in walking distance of almost everything.
This isn't a five star hotel, but the value was good for what we paid. The hotel room was quiet and well air-conditioned. They upgraded us to a suite when only a smoking room was available.

No too over the top French country theme in the rooms and hallways.  The lobby, casino and shops ARE over the top -- two of the eiffel tower's feet extend into the lobby\/casino! it's Vegas and that's ok.

The buffet is pricey at times (brunch), cheaper at others (breakfast) but overall pretty good, there are also a couple fast food type places, including a quite good creperie. The shops are not standout, though the (very price) store full of Art Noveau glass and lamps is fun to browse.

Staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge helpfully checked me into my flight and printed my itinerary for free when my iphone couldn't check me in. Very nice. (She could have easily directed me to the pay-as-you-go internet terminals nearby.)

It's a great central location and a nice place to base your stay in Vegas.

PLUS
- nice big rooms
- nice bathroom with shower, tub and plenty of counter space in bath
- handy convenience store in elevator lobby

MINUS
- no coffee\/tea maker in room
- no free wifi
- no storage in the minifridge

This would've gotten a 3 star ("A-OK") review, had it not been for the over-entitled cabhop(or whatever they're called) who made an already bad day even worse. After losing $900 @ the casino, the last thing i need is to be guilt tripped and hustled for a tip. All he does is blow a whistle, which is redundant and useless because the cabbies can see people line up and would drive up anyways if he wasnt there. Anyways, I was nursing my big losses and wasnt really paying attention, so i just got into the cab and let the driver put my bag into the back. Then the cabhop opens the door, sarcastically snarls "WELL I HOPE EVERYONE TREATED YOU WELL HERE", and slams the door on me...

Well, everyone did treat me well there, except for that asshole. The rooms are old (perhaps intentionally), and the internet is like $15 bucks, or $25 in one of the convention rooms, which IMO is lame and sucks a lot of ass. The tv is also from like 1983 and the remote doesnt work. Additionally, I waited in a huge ass line at the cafe outside of the elevators for a quick hot breakfast (quiche on the menu), only to find out after 20 mins of waiting that they only had pastries. In addition to that, they left my coffee out of my order, so i had to wait another 10 mins to get that..for some reason.

This casino would've started with a 3 for average accomodations, and gotten a 4 for $10 craps tables and a smokin hot raven haired cocktail waitress named Roe, but because of the previous 2 paragraphs, -2. I get free stays at harrahs because i lose a lot of money, so i may stay here again in he future....if it is the only choice...and if the other choice is imperial palace...lol

My name is Boris Yelpsin, and I approve this message.

Finding the place was pretty hard. But I give it 3 stars for the reason that they have 20 check out windows open and only 3 for picking up your key. 

One lady checked in another gentleman who was not in line then walked away from us saying "I'm unavailable " when we tried to get help as well. 

This place sucks so far

The casino area was the worst of all I encountered.  It actually smelled so bad I had to wait outside for an hour for my friends to finishing wandering around.  I dodged back in twice to check the score of the Cubs game, but basically held my breath at the gaming area the entire time.  It was pretty gross.

Perusing reviews, it appears that some of the toiletries smelled nice, so I imagine if you walked around the casino with some of those shoved up to your nose, you wouldn't even notice.

Outside though, I got to watch the water show at the Bellagio twice, so I was glad I could enjoy it.

I just received the worst form of customer service that I have EVER received in Vegas.  I am currently staying at the Paris Hotel...   I simply wanted to get my key that stopped working, fixed.  Concierge asked me to wait for a certain key pick-up attendant, and not to wait in line.  When I talked to her, she told me I had to get in line, that everybody is picking up keys.  She did not care that I was just getting my key fixed.   The customer next in line told her it was ok for me to go ahead of her, but then she yelled out to everyone in line and asked if it was ok for me to go ahead of them.  I was very embarrassed !!!   She was VERY rude.  I walked away and was helped by another attendant who fixed my key in less than a minute.   It's unfortunate that Paris Hotel has such a rude employee working for them.  In my line of work this is unheard of, nobody should be treated like this.
They don't allow uber and Lyft to pick you up. Boo for corrupt system. Have to take rip off taxis and what poor customer service.

Review is for the casino property.

Paris has certainly gone through some major changes over the years, and I like the direction its going on the culinary front.  Mon Ami Gabi offers a decent French menu with views of the Strip at ground level.  Or you can go high to the Eiffel Tower restaurant with a better view.

The promenade between between Bally's and Paris now has an upscale burger joint, dim sum, sushi\/sashimi, a bakery, and an excellent crepe stand.  They also have Italian (Martorano's), which looks like an intriguing place, with the chef\/owner looking a little like a cross between Vin Diesel and Dwayne Johnson.

The gaming area itself was okay.  I had a very hard time spotting a $10 blackjack game with 3:2 payout on blackjacks, but finally found one.  

Conclusion: Paris is probably one of the better casinos for a casual place to eat.  There seems to be more lower table limits in Bally's and Treasure Island, at least for Blackjack.

The Parisian vibe with stone paths along Le Boulevard, the massive Eiffel Tower replica (which hosts a restaurant in the middle), and mural sky are great for pictures and a stroll, but as someone mentioned before, everything feels a bit compressed and congested. If you're looking for a romantic hotel, Paris Las Vegas is an obvious choice.

Le Boulevard has an array of boutiques, cafes, and dine-in restaurants with "outdoor seating." Dimmed lights grace the stoned path, great for a nice stroll during the day or at night. It's a very popular area, especially from those stopping by from neighboring hotels, which is why I said it can be a bit congested. Paris Las Vegas' casino is situated in the middle of an X-layout--right under the Eiffel Tower--with restaurants and bars surrounding it on all sides; it's accessible from The Strip-side entrance, as well. Compared to other casinos, it's small and a bit limited in terms of the type of games you can play.

The buffet located along the same path follows the same design and layout. However, Mon Ami Gabi is regarded as one of the more popular places to dine in the area and on the Strip overall. This French bistro is the one with the misting machines attached to the patio area that sprays outwards towards the sidewalk. All of the restaurants follow a French-theme, with the exception of the Hong Kong Chinese restaurant near the jewelry boutique.

We got a comped room so my review might be different if we paid full price. The "free" room did not include resort fee, parking or tax so we still paid like $55 for a free room! How does the resort fee not cover parking?

We got a remodeled room with an Eiffel tower view. I have to say the view was fantastic! You can see the tower & the bellagio fountains in the background from bed!

The room itself was spacious, nice, with a mini fridge & separate shower & tub. 

We tried to check in at the kiosk (great idea to avoid the long lines), however it wouldn't read my husbands ID so after 5 attempts we uad to wait in line.

The Paris is in a great location on the strip too- right next door to the Miracle Mile shops!

Beautiful hotel and gorgeous architechture. Good food, and amazing pastries. The casino is very attractive, not too loud or too smoky. However, there are a lot less shopping choices compared to Caesar's or Planet Hollywood.
A lot of great stuff to look at in here but a little to pricey for me to play or buy anything.

Bellman placed two bags and tagged them then wanted my signature. I asked if my friends had change for a tip. They had two dollars so I tried to tip him but he knew I had $20 and was saying, noooo, how much change do you want. I said $20, he said nooo, and said $15? He didn't even deliver so it cost me $9 just to receive my luggage in the room after tipping twice within 30 min. The shower water had very little pressure, it was Hardy warm enough to make steam. The sink water was very hot. The tub looked gross as it had rust stains around the drain. The keys to our door stopped working 2 out of 3 keys twice. So I had to have them taken to the front desk and wait in the long lines just to be able to get back in the doors x4 times. It was very frustrating and little concern shown by staff. I'd post things I enjoyed, but there really wasn't that much. Vending machines for 16 oz water and cokes $3.

Keeping in mind this is the first hotel I've stayed in on the strip, this hotel was great: 

Room: large and smoke free, so-so water pressure

Casino: Nice options, easy to navigate

Restaurants: Good options, Mon Amie Gabi is amazing.

Hotel got us on the guest list for the Bank @ Bellagio, which means that the $30 cover was free!!!!

Great experience, good location to walk to the Bellagio, Venetian and Caesars.

When you cannot go to Paris, France, then travelling to Las Vegas to visit the Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino is the next best thing to seeing the Eiffel Tower.

I've stayed here on two different occasions to attend conventions.  Each time, the stay was top notch.  The rooms were modern, beautifully decorated, comfortable, and clean.  

The staff was terrific.  We've gotten lucky each time because we've received terrific views of the strip at no extra charge!  

Self parking at the Paris Las Vegas is easy, and it's conveniently close to the convention area.  The food places are pretty good.  Probably the best choice is Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse.  It's expensive, but the food is oh so good.

Another plus is the ventilation system.  I find it much easier to breathe here compared to other places on the Strip.  The smoke doesn't bother me here nearly as much as elsewhere.

If the price is right, then Paris Las Vegas is a wonderful place to stay.  It's centrally located to all the good places on the Las Vegas Strip.

We check out early approximately 0700 to go eat and walk around. Baggage check picked up our bags from our room. When we got home my girlfriend noticed her jewelry and perfume were missing from her suitcase. Yup. Stolen. We called the Hotel several times leaving messages for the manager and lost prevention and have yet to receive a return call. I'd think twice about staying here. We know we ever will again.

I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights in November. The hotel is pretty nice and the staff is really helpful and friendly.

The casino has a great "natural light effect" illumination so you always feel it's noon! The downside is that it's really small and I felt there wasn't enough waitress to bring you drinks... so you had to be paying attention to see if a waitress passed by instead of focusing in your sloth machine...

The breakfast buffet was really good... get there 10mins before 9am and you'll save like 2hrs of queue!

The shoppes are meh... definitely go to other hotels and you'll find better ones...

The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is really clean. The thing that surprised me the most (and that's why I took 2 stars off) was that the last day of our stay, I was looking for an earring that had fallen on the carpet and I saw AN OLD SHOE under the bed! A disgusting dusty old shoe!!. That made me feel that they don't do the cleaning that well... o_O Thank God it was the last day!

I think next time we are in Vegas we will definitely stay in another hotel...

Pretty on the outside (lit up Eiffel Tower),
Forgettable on the inside (aka the rooms).

THE GOOD:
+ Beds are comfortable
+ Located in the center of the strip- across from Bellagio, next to Bally's, close to pH & City Center hotels

THE BAD:
- Music from Chateau was blasting throughout the night... you seriously need earplugs if you want to sleep
- Retrieving your luggage from storage is extremely slow at midnight. I understand its late but when does Vegas ever sleep?! 

I think there are much better hotels to stay at than here.. but then again I've been pretty spoiled by the nicer & newer hotels!

I really have mixed feelings about Paris Las Vegas.  I really want to LOVE it, but for several reasons I don't.  The Hubs and I stayed here over Valentine's Day in order to celebrate 10 years together.  Since it was a special occasion I had really high hopes we would receive great service, but alas this wasn't the case.

During the booking process, the service was excellent.  We were given a good rate and told that there would be a note on our reservation indicating our anniversary, so we should expect good service.  Upon our arrival I had high hopes for getting a good room and we were told that the room we were assigned was really nice with a view, but it wasn't ready.  We were fine with that because we wanted a nice room for our celebration - we were told to come back in two hours and our room would be cleaned by then (he said he put a rush request).  Well after 3 hours walking the strip and coming back at 4 for our room, it wasn't ready.  I was getting upset and clearly just wanted to plop down in a room for awhile, so the guy gave us another room with a view that was available.  He said it was in a good location not near an elevator.  Lies- it was the first door after a suite right near the elevators!  The room was ok - not the red room we booked, but it had a great view of the fountains and Eiffel tower.  Unfortunately, we were next to a suite, which was really noisy.  We were really upset and asked to move rooms the next day.  The person we spoke to was rude and offered us a new room, but no apology for the nose of sewage smell in the bathroom.

The second room we got was a red room.  It was similar and also had a good view but a smaller window.  All in all, I like the location of Paris and the style inside.  We really liked Mon Ami Gabi and going to the top of the Eiffel Tower.  All in all, not a bad stay, but surely not the amazing stay I hoped for.

Was rudely denied valet because I did not have a check in conformation number. Car in front of me and behind me were given valet. Check in was speedy, however, the room was hot and not clean. The furniture was busted up. This place needs renovation. 

Still here. Made me stay a night in this room. Not happy. Will update as things go.

Received new room but not compd night in filth.

Nice casino and bars.  Had dinner at Mona Mi Gabi and enjoyed very much.  There is usually a long wait to sit on the outside patio but with stunning views of the Bellagio Fountains I can understand why.  Paris is perfectly located center strip and connected to Bally's.  The self parking is convenient.  The guest rooms are large and comfortable decorated with European, Parisian decor.  You can score a room Sun-Thurs for under $100.
Nice place,specially they a have a good choise of restaurants

My wife and I stayed for two nights (July 4-6) for our 25th anniversary booked a 
king size bed and paid for the room on May 8th, this was our 3rd time staying at 
the Paris, got to check-in and told only have doubles disappointed but can deal 
with it, she asked if we wanted a strip view with the Le Rendezvous Lounge and a 
bigger room. So we paid the extra. The room 2307 was not bigger and the ac would 
not get cold, disappointed but can deal with it, went to the Le Rendezvous 
Lounge not room to sit, table with a couple we'd met in the casino who said 
their family lived in Las Vegas as was meeting for dinner was there was their 
family a table of 7 Thought this was for paid guest not with their guest. They 
said there was no one at the door when they came in. I asked the waiter in there 
is alcoholic drinks were included, he can "no, this is an honor bar" fill out 
form with room number. Did not get beer or wine, the pasta was gone never 
refilled while we were there. Only ate cheese in evening and a piece of toast in 
the morning. Disappointed but deal with it. Was told we get free faxing, went to 
the business services asked the man about the free  faxing he said "WE DO 
NOTHING FOR FREE" in a very rude tone. This was the last straw we paid over $125 
for the Le Rendezvour Lounge services not rendered. There are a lot of casinos 
in Las Vegas we can stay in, but we thought we'd celebrate our 25th here. Spent 
a lot of money on show, food and gambling worth every penny but the money spent 
on the lounge not worth a cent and not coming back to this casino or any other 
the other ones owned by this company.

I love Themed hotels. Paris Hotel and Casino opened in September 1999. ItÂ is a French-themed casino and hotel withÂ a real Eiffel Tower in it. Even though I saw the Eiffel Tower in Paris, I had to experience this one.  It is half the size of the real Eiffel Tower. 

This place has a French feel that makes you feel like you have left town. 

Some of the pros of this hotel are that it is
centrally located on the strip and has many good food options.

One of the must do is dine 110 feet above the Las Vegas Strip in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant or go all the way to the top and enjoy a stunning view of Las Vegas on the Eiffel Tower Experience.Â 

The casino side is a lot smaller than most but it has all the normal games and slots as any other property just on a smaller scale.

Got a great price in advance for a Red Premier room on the top floors with a fabulous strip view, pool, Eiffel Tower, Paris Balloon, and all.  My boyfriend and I spent a couple days in Planet Hollywood and a couple days in Paris just to get a couple different vibes and hotel experiences - and we ADORE Paris.  We're in our mid and late 20s, and many have said this is more of a place for elderly folks to stay, but we sure enjoyed it much more than Planet Hollywood.

The room was a little on the small side, but I loved the decor.  The different patterns and materials never clashed.  Just watching the Bellagio fountain shows over and over and over from our windows on the adorable, cozy sofa was enjoyable enough to make the choice worth it.  

The restaurants were great and I enjoyed everyone we encountered that did us even the smallest service.  Vallet, front desk, bellman -  everyone was funny and kind, which is a great, relaxing contrast compared to how overly and unnecessarily rude and brute a lot of workers for taxi lines and clubs in Las Vegas are.  That shit gets old REALLY fast and it's great to go to a peaceful, welcoming, romantic and cheesy spot that's also a big part of Vegas' allure.

Funny, I've been staying in Paris since it opened and have had few problems. Just read all the yelp reviews and agree with many of them. Bleachy smell from room cleanser. Not the best mattresses. Old tube style tv's. Lack of channel choices on tv. I have never left Paris being up. Have always lost there. But then again I have only left Vegas once or twice in at least a hundred trips being up. Sometimes I hear people say shit like "yeah, paid for the trip" and I think yeah, with your credit card  shithead!  I don't even bother gambling anymore. The books say you shouldnt play with scared money, well I've got "shell shocked" money in my pocket. I've never had to pay for a room at Paris so to me it's the best. Some people on yelp mention they found hairs on the beds.  Do what I do...lay down and make pubic hair angels!

Pros
-Nice views of the strip and Bellagio fountain from the rooms we stayed in. 
-Pool area is serene.
-The Eiffel tower restaurant and wedding reception dinner held there was amazing. Food 5\/5. Service equally great.
-Wedding chapel was gorgeous inside. 

Cons
-The self parking garage is a joke. You walk forever to get to the actual elevators for the rooms. Not to mention the "directory" signs are sparse and hard to find at all. It takes a least a day to figure out how to get around.
-Elevators are grouped for different sections. If you have family staying on different floors you have to go down, switch sides and go back up.
-NO LOCKS ON BATHROOM DOORS. This is just a horrible idea.
-The fake cobblestone walkway is slippery and uneven, if you're a woman wearing heels be careful! 
-The casino in the Paris was small. Walk over to Bally's for some variety. 
-Some of the room floors allowed smoking, when you walk through them it's hard to breathe. 
-Was worried about bed bugs the whole time after reading reviews prior to leaving. We checked everything and found no sign of them and thankfully came home rash free.
-One elevator had a puddle of urine on the floor. It smelled awful.
-Drinks by the pool have alcohol added from a gun dispenser, I watched him pour and it seemed like half an ounce IF that. This is just an easy way for them to use less and charge more. 
-Finally, the pool closes at 7 p.m. every night. Is this a joke? Not that it matters, we went in the afternoon our last day there and the water was COLD. I'm not sure how they pull that off in the middle of July.

I can't say anything about the buffets, we drove to the Gold Coast every morning. We took a handful of people and paid what it would have cost for one person at the Paris.
Worst hotel I've ever stayed at room service never came people are rude avoid this place

Just awful..I will NEVER stay there again! Check-in folks are exceptionally rude, rooms are outdated, pool area is overgrown and littered with broken chairs, and spa\/fitness areas are old with several broken showers. Not good! Terrible experience!
Hotel is decent. But- I called the front desk to see if there was a microwave anywhere in the building to heat up some leftovers. They said no. What type of hotel has no microwave anywhere?!

We had to add an extra night to our vegas vacation due to weather in dallas. We decided to move to the paris from mandaly bay  to try something mid strip. My wife is a big fan of paris so she was very excited. We visited the restaurant the previous day so we thought since that went well the move would work out. The check in process was terrible. The clerk was the absolute rudest person I've dealt with. I could finish a question or sentence without her rudely interrupting. She was short and terrible to my wife and I. She spoke to us like we were half wits and didn't deserve to stay at the paris. I walked away appalled at how we were spoken to at a vacation resort. I let management know I needed to speak to someone asap. The assistant manager called me within the next hour and apoligized graciously. She was very nice and apologetic. She comped a few things and let us check out late for free. Every other encounter with employees at the paris was above average or even amazing. The check in clerk was an abysmal at customer service hence I couldn't give 4 stars. We will come back cause the other 90% of our stay was great. Decent rooms and fun atmosphere.

Stayed in a $1000 per night suite. Toilet didn't work. Told housekeeping at 4pm. Came back to room and flushed the toilet. FLOOD! Waited 1 hour for someone to mop up water. Have to wait until next day to fix toilet.

Stayed here a few times and it's pretty nice. Comfortable rooms, but small. You're in the middle of all the action on the strip, which is great because you don't have to walk five miles to get to Casear's or wherever. 
They have little Parisian style bakeries that are really yummy, and I really enjoy the buffet at Paris. Made to order crepes and omlettes for breakfast, pate and french bread, individual creme brulees.

Ahhhhhhhh idk. 

I've stayed here like a bajillion times. My mom loves this hotel. Its a love\/hate thing for me. It's the opportunity cost of having a great location for the cheapest price but how much cleanliness and quality are you willing to sacrifice??? Personally, this last visit did me in. Hairs all over the shower...really? Also there were tootsie roll wrappers under the bed... which is funny bc last time I stayed here I also found tootsie roll wrappers under the bed... I think Paris has tootsie roll parties in their rooms or something bc tootsie roll wrappers are all over the place lolol.. 
I'm not happy about the quality of cleanliness or standard of presentation. With that being said, I've never ran into an employee that was anything less than curtious, kind, and hospitable. But the overall "tone" of the hotel has some overhauling. 
They're in the process of revamping all their rooms- which is great bc this place was getting dated. 
I love that the pool is huge and CHILL. A get away to nurse your hangover. Also, they allow dogs which is clutch and why they get 2-stars.

Either way, there's a 60% chance I'll be back.
Stayed here for the first time! Loved this place and the workers were super friendly!   10 stars to the spa!  Everytime I come back it is a must for the spa!

Finally decide to stay at Paris during my last trip to vegas.

-Location:
It is very conveniently located in the heart of the strip.It is in walking distance to all the other good casinos. It's has a number of good restaurants inside.

-Room:
My room was nice but nothing fancy.I believe the rooms look a lot older now. Even though we booked a non smoking room, they gave us a smoking room. We ultimately moved to the non smoking room on the second day. If one wants a view facing the strip and bellagio, they ask for extra charge($55), so make sure to see what view you are getting when you booking the room. The room had a small fridge,ironing board, iron and flat screen.Bed was very big and comfortable.It had a couch and small table.Closet with security safe.
The bathroom had all the basic amenities and was very clean.The Wi Fi is not free.

-Staff:
Staff is very helpful right from the doorman, receptionist and manager.
They go all the way to help you out whether it's getting tickets for a show or dierctions to grand canyon.

-Hotel:
