I was a little surprised - not in a good way - to see pseudo-strippers in thongs and bra-like tops gyrating to music atop an elongated table in the center of the lobby (I know this is Vegas, but STILL!). I swear, I'm no prude, but the atmosphere just seemed....seedier here than in the other major hotel casinos we visited. 

I must make note of the bathrooms, too. The women's facilities were dingy, and some of the enameled ceramic pedestal sinks were cracked. Some of the bathroom stalls were dirty, and some doors had  graffiti carvings on them (at least, mine did). They didn't appear to be maintained well. 

The replicas of the Eiffel Tower and l'Arc du Triomphe were awesome landmarks, and we took a few photos by them. And the few folks we talked to who worked here were friendly. All in all, this is a cutesy place to check out, take some photos in, and then leave.

Le Central bar is a cool spot to hang with friends.  I haven't really spent much time in the Paris, so my experience is limited, but a recent visit with a group of 10 friends was great.

Le Central was a perfect spot to hang out for a few hours, enjoy some drinks and relax.

I'd definitely return.

4 stars.

The hotel is on the strip...is as big as any other but the rooms were average, the shower just ok but my views of the Bellagio, the Eiffel Tower and pool with neon lights pulsing in the background made things better. The acres of gaming floors with noise and visual pollution accompanied by smokers everywhere make it hard for a clean living lad like myself. Maybe I should've signed up for Mitt Romney's Mormon tabernacle. $109\/night during the week and $169 on the weekend was acceptable. These places are so big they lose their ability to connect with patrons in a personal way. I'm not going back in a hurry.

The set up truly makes me feel like I'm in a town in Paris and I just love those Paris cups full of margarita!  There's also a bakery shop inside the casino that has amazing tasty crepes and nice stores to go shopping if you feel like splurging or win big and and wanna go on a shopping spree. Staying here can be a bit pricey but you definitely get what you pay for.  One of my favorite hotels for sure.  

One day I wanna get a room here but until then I'll enjoy the amazing atmosphere this hotel brings!

Good: on strip and in the middle, close to everything

Bad: I booked online.  They sent me 3 emails for 3 rooms to check in.  When I got there, they can't find two of the check in\/emails.  what's the point of the email check in if you get there and still have to stand in line to check in?

Room: two lights in room not working, when they give the plastic cards, a couple of them do not work

Water in room: hot water for the first person is good but the second person has to wait for 5mins before the hot water returns

Wifi: costs money for more than 2 devices.  this shouldn't happen now adays
Refrigerator: takes two days for bottle water to get cold. Not good in Vegas
No complimentary coffee.

They spend money to improve the lobby and everything else but not the rooms.  Most lower end hotels have all of the missing stuff this hotel has

Concierge's english is poor:  Not a good position to put a person with poor english 

When I Left, I was being nice and called back to tell them that one of the rooms had two broken lights...they keep hounding me about my reservation number which I don't have handy.  Just send someone to go to fixt it.

NExt time: staying at bellagio

beautiful casino. amazing dealer julio, and chinese lady, kim, and the asian lady over-seer. I think she said she was 43 or so years old. they made my night. they were so much fun!!! 

i like the toilet closet in the bathroom. nice and private. maybe a little dirty. i can't remember that part. nice coffee bar and barista.

can't wait to go back!

Not the best hotel experience. Our refrigerator didn't work well and the access for the wifi was shit. I gave up on the wifi and tried to use my cell phone's 4g data and didn't get great reception either. We could only find 1 swimming pool (do they have more?? idk) It was clean and usable but when you're trying to keep your water cold and day time temperatures hit 113 degrees.. a working fridge would be nice. It's nice that it's in the middle of the strip and walkable to Fat Tuesday in Planet Hollywood next door and that the Bellagio is right across the street!

This hotel is really MX there were times where the service was it's excellent and the hotel was worth every penny and other times where customer service was completely lacking and the attitude of the employees was horrible. The hotel is starting to age things are not as clean as they used to be rooms are a little beat up and honestly some of the staff seems a little worn out.   I asked for a view and was told there weren't any while my coworker who checked in at the same time next to me was even easily given a great view exact one I asked for. I think next time we will stay somewhere else on the strip.

We wanted to stay somewhere pretty central to the action on the strip but didn't want to drop a ton of cash, simply because we aren't rolling in dough.

We found a good deal on hotels.com for Paris. It's a little cheesy to some because of the cobblestone floors and decor, but I liked it. I think it's cute that when inside, it looks like you are outside in Paris. From the lamp posts, to the windows with hanging plants, to the "messieurs" instead of "men" for the bathroom, it's all very sweet. The staff at Paris  was also friendly and helpful.

We had a "Luxury" room which is their standard room. To me, it was one of the nicest hotel rooms I've stayed in!

It was very spacious, comfortable, and pretty. We had two large windows, two chairs, the bed, and a cute little lounge padded bench. There is a ton of storage space: two closets that are a part of the TV stand\/case\/whatever you'd call it, and one large closet on the way to the bathroom. The bathroom was especially wonderful. They was a huge mirror above the sink, and a full length large mirror on the back of the door (we ladies appreciate that especially). There was a tub AND stand up shower (all glass, so it's fun to watch your partner shower, haha). I made sure to utilize both for bathing, just cause.

The few things I'd like to see improved on are:
- the pool temperature. It's a nice pool but the water was a bit chilly.
- the shower water temperature. It DOES warm up, but for some reason it takes a good three minutes before it finally does. Oddly, the tub did not have the same issue.

Those are relatively small complaints though. 

I really liked staying at Paris and I'd stay there again!

While this is a pretty hotel, it suffers from a lack of customer service. In fact, the lack of customer care has infected every inch of the hotel.  

The housekeeping department services requests for extra bedding items within a brisk 45 minutes to one hour? Although they promise within 20 minutes.

The casino mentality is to cater to only the top 1 percent player. Mediocre players, those not at the 7 star level, need not apply. 
 
Why when your only regular cashier window is occupied by a credit transaction, what do you do, yes open more 7 star only cashiers and let us stand  for an extra 20 minutes just to cash in chips.  
 
Valet parking follows the same principal, 7 stars get cars and regular folk sit for at least 30 minutes, in the heat, waiting for their cars.

Here is a great idea, patronize those places that provide great service to everyone and leave Paris with only the 7 Star clients and let them see how long they will be around .  I would give them a 0 star but no such rating exists

When the hotel was new, this is the place that you want to stay in (Last visit to this hotel was in 2001). Now that it is 17 yrs old, the hotel is falling apart. 

Walls are very thins (Can hear people talking in the middle of the night in the hallway), shower was leaking water into the whole bathroom area  and had to use a few towels to clean up the spilled water or could possibly slip and fall due to flooring materials, housekeeping staff did not even put away the iron that I used (left it our on purpose to see if he\/she will actually put away). Until the management do something about simple stuff like fixing the splash guard at the bottom of the shower so that water will not be running into the whole bathroom area which is unsafe for guests or staff that is cleaning the rooms, I will not be returning here.

Even though there was only one person ahead of me at the check in desk, it took me almost 20 min to check in. Also, I misplaced my room key and had to get another one the next day. Took another 30 min again with two people ahead of me. (They do have self check in but the machine is so complicated that I gave up 1\/2 way through trying). 

Pool hours sucks! 10-7 pm? Seriously? and the Hot Tubs are hidden well beyond the view of the pool. Took me a while to find it. 

Personally, for few dollars more, I would stay at newer and upgraded hotels such as Palazzo, Venetian, or Mandalay Bay (stayed at Mandalay Bay in Aug 2015).

I stayed here recently and only because we got a decent deal from an acquaintance. The rooms looked pretty decent but like someone said no comforter. These rooms are like 200 bucks without a deal. Methinks you would get some kind of blanket. No coffeemaker; No free internet or internet station and no free gym!! Man, I was surprised that I had some shampoo since they stiffed me on some essentials. The gym is like 25 bucks a day! I would rather walk down the strip and lose 25 through gambling. 

It's a nice place to walk through and I enjoyed that it connected to Ballys and it's smack dab in the middle of the strip. However, I was thinking they would give us some coupons for some places within the hotel. All the coupons went to other hotels they are affiliated with like Rio. We did get a coupon for Carnival Buffet in Rio so that's cool. 

I still had fun because of the strip location but I won't stay here without some sort of deal... that's ridiculous for what we get....
We didn't stay at this hotel but we checked out the slots and looked around. It's a really pretty hotel, lots of slots, nice bar and seating. And you can take Eiffel Tower photographs.

Our friends were getting married in the chapel at Planet Hollywood this past weekend, but apparently there was a big UFC fight in town the weekend we went, so all the hotels were charging way more than usual. We found a promo code for this hotel and figured it wouldn't be too much of a hassle to just stay next door at Paris and walk over for the ceremony.

We booked the cheapest room, a standard with two queens, although I appreciated that they let me call later and upgrade to a room with one King bed for free. Our cheap-o room was better than expected! Clean and spacious with a desk and love seat, big bathroom with a separate tub, mini fridge for all our booze, comfy bed and actually a pretty nice view out to the strip. One complaint was that it's a little weird there's not a fan in the bathroom, so when you shower it gets really steamy. 

The pool is fine - mostly families and set right next to the Eiffel Tower which makes for a cool atmosphere. It was easy for us to find lounge chairs and there were a lot of servers running around to bring drinks. The DJ is kinda cheesy. 

Skip the Village buffet. I hate buffets anyway because I feel like yes, it's a lot of food, but nothing is made particularly well. My boyfriend is a sucker for them and made me go anyway, but even he was disappointed - no flavor and weird options. And definitely skip their $5 Bloody Mary and opt for the real deal, it's only $5 for a reason.

All in all, we're happy we stayed at Paris and it was so easy to walk over to Planet Hollywood for the wedding and even make a quick run back afterwards to change our clothes. Would stay here again.

Valet is not exactly the smoothest process in the world here, but it could be worse.  Overall though, we've always enjoyed our stays here since we've lucked out each time we've checked in early and received a larger corner room in return (definitely ask for it when checking in).  Room service has fairly good burgers, but the fries are what seal the deal.  :)  Of course, the crepes are delish!  It's a good place to stay, but if you have a larger budget...go to the Wynn.  ;)
Just had the buffet.  Not my favorite.  Poorly laid out and crowded.  Lines at every station.  Table service was poor.  I think the buffet at the Mirage is way better.

avoid this hotel! We encountered MANY problems. First was check in being so late at 4 the line was huge...so we checked our luggage with the hotel and walked around for an hour. After the drive the last thing we want to do is stand in line. I had over 1000 worth of product from Sephora and snacks and water in my luggage. When they arrived at the room they were hot. Why the HELL would a hotel in Vegas leave the luggage in a room that has no AC or outside!?!?!? my snacks melted and my water was piping hot...luckily none of my make up was destroyed. After that, it was nothing too crazy to be so upset at but the stay got worse.Secondly, my bf was mistaken about the dining credit being for two days and a manager overheard and said no well  honor $50 credit. So we went to Monami Gabi and got pizza. Well they only honored $25 and not the $50. Real nice. The worst was the last morning i woke up with a HUGE spider bite on my foot- fang marks broke my skin and other bites all over my arms. i'm assuming BED BUGS. Calling to complain was the worst experience. The first lady we talked to at Paris who was a manager (what a joke) was a total B. She was so rude and talked over me put me on hold abruptly. Then the manager CHRIS said he would sort out the dining credit issue and give a refund...yeah that never happened either. epic fail Paris, epic fail. Never again.

Hotel was very nice! Very clean, spacious, and had nice decor! They upgraded our room when we got there knowing we were celebrating that weekend. The bed was the most comfortable bed ever! (that and given we were tired from a LONG weekend). . . overall, we had a pleasant stay; would definitely recommend!

With this being my first experience staying at the Paris hotel I'm extremely disappointed.   The look and feel of the room is nothing that I would have imagined of a 4+ star rated hotel according to most travel sites.  The room is very dated, smells of mildew, and to top it off the bathroom is old-dirty and has mildew growing in the corners of the shower.  I will be requesting a bottle of bleach from housekeeping because this is pretty disgusting.
 
I contacted the front desk to inform them of these issues along with my level of dissatisfaction and was told that the hotel is booked solid and no room changes can be made at this time.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, please look elsewhere when you are looking to book a hotel room in Vegas.

Outside is awsome, but there are much things to do in this hotel. 

This hotel has no good show like Ka, O, or Love. 

Casino is kind of small compare to other hotels. No fun slot machines. Slots never pay back.

no modern style rooms which I prefer.

has some retailers but no impressive products.

no kind casino employees.

My wife and I decided to stay here this time, because we got engaged at the top of the Eiffel Tower here back in April of 2006, but have never stayed here. My father who lives in Vegas booked a basic room for us and then I called and had them upgrade not only the room, but they added a package where you can have breakfast (7a-11am) and a manager's reception (5pm-8pm) everyday in the lounge which is located on the 31st floor. The breakfast was the basic continental stuff, but for some reason the OJ tasted soooo good here. The evening reception was nice. They had all you can eat shrimp, and a few good hot apps. Each time you can have 2-free drinks per person. If you have over 2 then they are $4.00 per drink. They had liquor there as well in the evening, so you could make your own drinks. However strong you wanted. 
The hotel - I called right when we landed which was at 9am to see if they just happened to have anything ready. Luz at the front desk said they did have something on the 10th floor ready, but to call back around 11am to see if anything better opened up. I called back and they had a room on the 21st floor which we opted for. We ended up in room 2198P. The room was nice, but nothing SUPER. The bed was comfy, from what I remember. We had a few chairs and a couch. No flat screen, but a vanity area for the wife. The bathroom had shower and bathtub. Out of one window we could see the pool and the Eiffel Tower and from the other window we could see and hear the Bellagio Fountains which was cool. 
We did eat at the buffet which i will review separately. Overall everyone we talked to at the hotel was nice and helped us out with anything we needed. Oh and just so you know, if you want a late check out and they are sold out the night you check out they will charge you $400.00 to check out late. Since we had family taking us to the airport we just checked out on time and brought out bags to the Bell Desk for them to hold for a few hours. As we were walking to the Bell Desk we noticed that there was a hell-a line to check out. With my wife and I traveling a lot, we opted to check out through the TV in the room. We checked our bill and check out in a matter of 5 minutes. If your bill is correct, I would just check out through the TV rather than standing in line forever. 
We would stay here again, but only if we get the same upgrade with the food. It was well worth it.

Considering this is Vegas...I think it's hard to really rate every aspect of the hotel\/casino. 
I enjoy staying at Paris as it is in the center of the strip. 
I also really enjoy how close the main entrance doors are to the elevators to the hotel. It's so much more convenient than some other hotels where you have to walk through half the casino and get lost figuring out where the elevators are. 
The room we had was clean and everything seemed to be in working order. The bedside lamp had extra plugs and usb ports to charge all the electronic devices. 
My main issue was with the shower water pressure. I felt like I couldn't get clean with the amount of water trickling out of the spout...it also didn't help that the shower head is the one stuck to the wall so you cant adjust it.

I will say that the housekeeping staff is amazing. We didn't need our room cleaned during our stay there but if we saw them when we walked out they would always ask if we needed anything or if they could help us....every single one of them!! And they always say hello when you walk by.

å¤©è±æ¿å°±æ¯å¤é¢çå¤©ç©ºï¼æä»¤äººæåä¸åºæ¯å¨å®¤å§åï½å¦æè·éååèµ°å¨éï¼å¾æçèèçæè¦ºåï¼

Lucky for me I have a Harrahs Players' Card, Platinum Edition. I gambling my mother's retirement away so I can move up into Diamond Status. Well now, Paris Hotel Casino in Las Vegas is in one great location. Next to Bally's and Planet Hollywood (formerly Aladdin) and across the street from both Bellagio and Caesars Palace.

Now the rooms are decent and pretty well sized. The whole place is well taken care of. You don't have to wait forever for an elevator. There's a great toiletries store right next to the elevators just in case you need something that bad. Plenty of places to eat (buffets, creperies, boulangeries, bistros)...like the real Paris you won't miss out on good food. For me, the best place to eat is Mon Ami Gabi. I solely eat the Filet Mignon medium rare and I pair it with the house Merlot. Also try the crab cakes appetizers. Last, you must try the dessert menu. Looks like I'm going to do a review for that place too.

As for the casino...it's Vegas. So plenty of games. The sportsbook is huge and hardly ever busy except for special events. A great aspect of Paris is that it is adjacent to Bally's...so if you're want to eat a Sbarro or want to try playing at Bally's...it's just a quick walk away. 

Paris is a lot less expensive than the bigger hotels like Caesars, Bellagio, etc....but it is just as well taken care of, just as pretty and just as comfortable. Definitely worth the price. But I'm comped...so I don't pay anything...well except at the tables and slots.

I have kind of a funny story about this place.

My mom, step dad and I were going out here for my uncles birthday. I was only staying for 2 day while my parents, 7 days, so my mom didnt want to have to pay for me. So she requested a dble bed room when she made her reservations. When we got there they checked in and we went to the room. I walked in and was like, uh?? There is only one bed. So we marched back downstairs and my mom told the woman that there was only one bed. The woman said, 'Oh I thought that was your husband" (referring to my step dad), my mom just gave her a look. The lady was like, oh well, we dont have any dble bed room available but I can send up a roll a way bed and change your room tomorrow. She said that was fine. So I got to sleep on a roll away bed. So the woman must have thought my parents were fighting and wouldnt share a bed or that my mom likes to vacation with her brother? I dont know, it was kinda amusing. 

So anyways, I got a lovely pull away bed... The room was kinda small so with that set up there wasnt much room, but it didnt matter cause the view was great! We faced the Bellagio and the Eiffel Tower. The room was awesomely decorated, very classy. My cousin and her fam got a dlbe bed room and we went to see it and it was on the opposite side of the hotel with a view of the parking garage so we were quite happy with our room after that. 

I do not recommend the Paris's buffet. It was by far the least impressive buffet I had in Vegas. I think I left hungry because it was just gross. WE went over to Plant hollywood and spent less money on the breakfast buffet.

Update: bed finally came at 3am. 

This hotel has changed a lot. They have horrible service. I requested a roller bed and was told that it will be sent up shortly. For over 3 hours, it did not come. We called multiple times and were put on hold. Then we were told that there is a hold on our room and we cannot get the bed because we had 2 queen beds; even though we were offered the option of a roller bed at check in (thus we did not get the suite). I was so tired and ended up falling asleep on the chair. The reason I needed the bed in the first place was because I spilled water all over my bed and it was too wet to sleep on. I'm so angry with the hotel for being petty and unprofessional. It is CHRISTMAS EVE by the way.

Also, the room is freezing. There is no heat. The closet space is awkward with no lights and since I wear all black it's hard to find what I'm looking for.

Hotel  is conveniently located.  Rooms were good size. Elevators were convenient.. they now charge for valet . Food was marginal  in the hotel. They were confused in registration .hotel needs remodeling.  It is very confusing. Rooms were moderately  priced.music was good

Harrah's gave me three free nights at Paris, so my entire experience was through the scope of "this is free." Our first night was great, we were upgraded to a really great strip view on the 21st floor for free. Although we were on the 21st floor, you could still hear the loud music from the club. Didn't really bother me. 

The room was small, but generally clean and neat. The beds suck. The tv was not a flat screen, but who cares "this is free!". The second day, we had some problems with dirty cups, but after almost an hour on the phone with management, we got clean cups and free Paris bathrobes. And a $50 comp for the buffet and $20 taken off our bill from the previous nights dinner at Serendipity 3. 

The buffet, like everything else, was okay. Great "for free!"  The crepes were actually pretty awesome. Some of our line-mates (the line was so long we bonded) were treated really terrible by hotel management, who had told them their complaints were "trivial." 

The location can't be beat, it was great to be able to walk right out the door and be at Planet Hollywood or the Bellagio.  It was great "for free" but I would have been pretty upset if I had to pay.

This is my absolute favorite "themed" hotel in Vegas. The builders\/designers did an excellent job with the architecture of the Eiffel Tower, L'Arc de Triomphe, the facade of L'Opera Garnier, Galerie des Glaces (hall of mirrors), Parisian metro entrances and street lamps, oh the details go on and on and are delightfully exquisite, which is hardly the adjective to use for Vegas.

I may be a little biased being that I am a Francophile through and through, and I was proposed to right out front by Mon Ami Gabi, so I'll always think fondly of Paris Las Vegas.

I could not do express checkout..was charged extra $11 tip by the cafe near the pool. I specifically signed bill+tip and had put total on the bill.
This is bad and hotel should something about the cafe near the pool.

Stayed back in January 2011 for 3 nights. This was also my first Las Vegas trip so I didn't know what to expect with the hotels. By far I am glad we decided to stay here for my first trip since the hotels is located in the middle of the Strip. The location alone of the hotel makes it 3 stars, easy to see the sights and sounds of Las Vegas from just within a short walk of this hotel. The staff seemed pretty unhelpful when we needed their assistance. During our checkin process the front desk agent was not very friendly or helpful. We both work in hospitality and we can easily tell when someone doesn't show the skill set required for the job and unfortunately the agent either needed retraining or to find another job. Our keys also stopped working during our stay and loss prevention let us into the room but we had to come downstairs and get our keys remade. We were just coming in from a day spent on the Strip at various casinos, it was our time to relax and get reenergized for the night. They should have sent some new keys up since we had to wait 15 minutes for the loss prevention to come up and let us in. The rooms were quite big but quite old in decor. We stayed in a standard king room which Paris Las Vegas advertises as a Deluxe room. We had a very nice view of The Cosmopolitan and Planet Hollywood. Even though we didn't come to Las Vegas to watch tv, the tv was a very old tube tv that had the old curved glass screen. I think they may need to do a remodel of all their deluxe rooms soon. The bathroom was our favorite part of the room with dual sinks, huge vanity space, separate shower and soaker tub, and all marble flooring. The casino area although small was pretty active and fun when we gambled. We were a big fan of the sportsbook to catch some of the NFL playoff games and the UFC event that took place. The outside of the hotel is absolutely spectacular to look at. We took several photos of the outside area both during the day and at night. Overall the Paris Las Vegas was a good hotel to stay at for my first trip to Las Vegas. Excellent location with a pretty nice casino area and average rooms. Staff service could be improved.

First off on the positives; Loved the location of this hotel. Close to everything and quick walking distance to some great shops and restaurants on the strip. The staff was friendly and happy to help! 2 for the rooms. Our room was gross. It was dusty, dingy and old. Also, we are on a non smoking floor but it smelled like smoke the entire time. The wifi worked maybe 1\/4th of the time which is frustrating since you have to pay for the wifi in your resort fee. They closed the pool early for a private event. No big deal but a little bit of a bummer when you shut it down 2 hours early. If location is your biggest priority and you don't care about your room then this is your place. If you're looking for an upgrade then probably book elsewhere.

I think whether or not you like the Paris depends totally on what you are looking for. The Paris is an upscale hotel\/casino with some beautiful architecture, a scale version of the Eifel Tower and a casino floor that is designed to look like, well..... Paris. I love walking through this casino and just checking out all the sights. 

My only complaint is everything is insanely expensive. We paid $18 for a glass of wine and a domestic beer. I went for a cigar and ended up paying $17 for an average cigar. So if you come here, be prepared to drop some serious cash. 

That said, it's no more expensive than any other south Strip casinos, so as long as you're prepared for the sticker shock, you'll have a great time enjoying the ambiance.

I got a free room here, and didnt want to stay here so i packed my shit and went elsewhere.  Seriously, Paris sucks.  The cafe sucks, the buffet sucks, and the rooms suck.  What sucks even more?  The people who gamble here.  Lets just say the bottom of the barrel are seen at the Paris.  Like, when IP is booked, they come to Paris.  Bad luck, bad scene
One of the beat buffets on the strip. Le creperie is on point! A mid-night snack hit the spot!

Very pretty!  Looks just like the original Paris, except the Eiffel Tower is a little smaller.  Like another review said, it was due to airport proximity.  I went there for a convention.  This is definitely a hotel to consider or weddings-that's for sure!  Very breathtaking! You will get beautiful photos & it's not all hokey fake looking.  It does look like the real deal!

I'm not a gambler, so I can't really comment on the slots & other gambling.  Their floor was always busy, though, & attended to. 

Within 30 seconds of being there, a woman was trying to sell me an eye cream for $700.  Welcome to Vegas!  It's the same one I can get at home for $100, and with a sale $50.  So, let that set the benchmark for you on what to expect as far as the economy goes.  I can't exactly say I blame them.  The cost of living in Vegas for the locals is quite high!

 We had a beautiful view of the mountains.  I was there on business and wanted quiet, so we were put on the back side of the hotel per our request for quiet.  The Bellagio fountains view is a bit more costly, but the lights will keep you awake.  

The restaurant buffet was pretty good, with foods & stations from all over France.  A tip on the buffet, though, the counter girl, Martha, tried to get me to pay the tip up front, and this grandma has been around long enough to know that means terrible service.  I did have a problem with Martha shouting out in front of a line full (~20) of people, "WHAT, NO TIP?"  I quietly responded, "I had planned to leave it on the table in cash."  My problem is that Martha VERY quietly muttered under her breath, "Oh."  So, she tried to bully me into leaving a tip for service which I had not even received yet.  On the other hand, the waitress was plenty attentive.  She might like to know that I tipped her 20% instead of 25% due to Martha's behavior and figuring Martha wouldn't have been so territorial and pushy if she didn't receive a portion of the tip.  All in all, the buffet that is toted as the best in Vegas was really nice despite Martha's inappropriate behavior.   While I realize they get plenty of free loaders and cheapskates in Vegas, this does not excuse her behavior.

The rooms were quite nice, clean, and tidy.  Very impressive!  Bring a good amount of $5 and $10 bills on your stay.  Leave them each day for the maids.  It's just good manners!  I cleaned houses in college, and the  maids, too, depend on their tips.  $5 for a single person & $10 for 2 or more.  Don't leave them all at the last day b\/c people and schedules & shifts change.  Leaving a large tip at the end may ensure that your maids never  receive a dime, and someone else that turns over the room gets it all.  When you leave something every day, you get better service, and the right person who preformed the job gets the money.  

The little breakfast\/ muffin shop is a great place to grab breakfast if you have to go to meetings.  

The check in was pretty smooth, easy, and people friendly.  I received  a small discount from going to their on line  website, although I did call and book in person.  The website offers much better deals than the random travel sites.  I would suggest trying to book airfare and then try to go through their website if you are planning on staying there.

It's a nice hotel & the beds are comfortable. I was surprised the work out room was a la carte, but you get so much walking in Vegas, what's the point of that? 

The concierge held our luggage for us as we walked the strip the last day.  I made the mistake of leaving $40 in my backpack, and it was not there when we returned.  I thought I should have taken it, and that is my bad.  As much as I have traveled, and that is extensively, you would think I would know better, but I will have to take responsibility for my forgetting.  Just know that if it is not attached to your body there, that it is gone.  No funny business, or trying to trick us, just plain old taken.

The elevators are pretty secure with cameras everywhere!  That's a big +.  All in all I will stay here again, because the people whom I did come in contact with were (mostly) sincere and willing to help. It is a big, BIG hotel and there are going to be some great employees, and some not so great ones.  Don't bring anything expensive, and if you do consider what it will be like to lose it. 

It's still a pretty great place to stay, and I will bring minimal to nothing that I want to lose.  Their beds are ultra comfortable!!!

Wife and I came here for our anniversary from Sunday - Wednesday (November 5-8) and had a meh experience, hence the 3 star review.  For you Cliffs Notes folks (pros - great location and nice casino, cons - poor customer service, had to call every day to get maid service).

Here are more details on the pros and cons:

PROS
1.  As others have mentioned, great location
2.  Burgundy rooms are nice (ours was well appointed and clean)
3.  Casino is nice and clean and not too smoky compared to others
4.  Express check out process with the machines was quick and painless (checked out in under 3 minutes).  Just enter your room number, select whether you want your receipt e-mailed to you or printed out, drop off your keys, and you are done.

CONS
1.  Staff do not seem to care very much about customer service.  

1a.  Check-in desk staff.   Went to the check-in desk and mentioned that it was our anniversary and that we were hoping for a room overlooking the strip.  No response.  No "congratulations" or "thank you for spending your anniversary with us."  Figured we were there during an off period and in the middle of the week staying from a Sunday to Wednesday so our chances would be good, but we were told none of those rooms were available.

1b.  Wait staff at the buffet.  Went to the Paris buffet only one time.  We were seated in one of the side rooms with only one waitress for 6 tables of about 30 people.  We got one drink and then the waitress never came back to our table.  I asked the two tables next to us and none of them received any drinks or service after drink #1 either.  I went to ask the hostess for help.  To her credit, the hostess did get us drinks, but there was no report to management about the other tables with the same issues and no apology.  No one came over to check on the tables next to us.

1c.  JJ Boulangerie cafe.  Rude staff again.  Wife and I each wanted the $10 special of 2 pizza slices and one drink.  We told the woman that we wanted 2 of those specials for 4 pieces total.  My wife started her order, but never got to finish.  The woman looked down and grabbed various slices, started walking over to the carrryout counter and told us to order at the register.  We waited in line to reach the register to order and then the first woman came back with 4 pieces of pizza and insisted that we had ordered those slices.  We told her that we had not ordered because she had told us to go to the register to order, but she insisted we were wrong.  The first woman eventually walked away and everyone in line asked us what was happening so it definitely seemed odd.  Again, the woman at the register did not apologize or act like this outburst was weird.  We did not get into a big argument or anything, but it was definitely bizarre and seemed to keep in line with our poor customer service experience with every other part of the Paris hotel.

2.  Maid service was very slow.  We were there for 3 nights and had to call every single day to have maid service come to our room.  We were gone from about 10:00 - 10:30 a.m. to 4:00 - 4:30 p.m. every day so they definitely had enough time.

3.  No option for a late checkout.  Normal checkout time is 11:00 a.m.  We asked for one extra hour to check out at noon on a Wednesday and were told that option was not available.  Really?  On a Wednesday in November?

Location is excellent for seeing the Strip. Restaurants are very good but get reservations wherever possible. Shops are fun and interesting. The Casino is fairly minimal but to a casual gambler it's fine, or just go to any of the nearby casinos. On arrival check to see if upgrades are available, ended up in a suite Le Mans for $159.00 per night. 

The rooms were very clean and very aesthetic. My girlfriend and I actually ended up just hanging out in the room at times because it was that nice. Very spacious and the bathroom was big enough to have an echo (exaggeration but you get the idea). 

The personnel we encountered were all friendly and helpful. 

Self Parking is waaaaay at the back of their property but its free so if you are budget-minded you can do that but it's a long walk with your luggage. In retrospect, it's probably worth it to most people to get valet parking unless you are on a very tight budget.

Have a seat this may take a while... I do my very best to write positive reviews but this time that is not going to happen.
Checked into the hotel- The front desk was beyond rude. Took a look at the room- Horrible  (see pictures). Don't forget this is not a cheep place to stay. Stains on the floor, wallpaper falling off, just nasty. We had 3 rooms and all are just as bad. 
Then the fire alarm goes off and from what we were told this happens often. Let's stop for a moment and think about this. What if there was a true emergency? It goes off so often people just kept on doing their thing. Electricity goes off only on some floors and parts of the hotel.  Time to get out before we can't.   Here we are at 2:30 am and still no power in our room. My husband has a CPAP machine he must use. I call down and ask the front desk if we can be moved to a room with power so we can get some sleep. They tell us no rooms are available.  I call reservations , I can book a room with them. Hmmm. 
The next day construction starts. We get a note under our door that says "if construction bothers you, please ask for another room". We are told there are no more rooms.. 
Check out time and ask for a manager.  He could care less about our bad experience. 
The only positive thing about our stay, our amazing time with friends.. 
I will be writing corporate,  not that it will do any good but going to try. We spent almost $1,000 for this room.. There are many choices in Vegas, we will not return!
Horrifying customer service.  They would have to pay me to stay here again.  Luz at the front desk needs to find another profession.  Customer service is not her thing.

Beautiful hotel... but gambling here is comparable to staring at yourself in a cracked mirror screaming for bloody mary.... super bad luck!

The interior ceilings will totally confuse you. Is it night time? NO? It's day time? NO? WHAT? You will walk around in circles until you ask someone to point you to your destination.

Other than that... eh, it's aiite.

I can see why there is an average on 3 stars- well I give them 1 and that's based on my room looks at a fake Eiffel Tower ... we come to Vegas probably once every 2nd  month- have never stayed here before- prefer Vdara, Aria, and the Hotel at Mandalay... where the customer service is excellent and I  HIGHLY RECOMMEND those hotels - Here the service STINKS-  the front desk female can only be described as a witch with a capital B- the casino is the worst for smoke - and that's just walking through- god help you if you want to work from your room because their premium Wifi is horrendous. After explaining to the witch at the front desk that the  premium wifi service I paid for is not working and I need it because I'm not here in Vegas and outside having fun, but  stuck in my room working - she  had the nerve to respond "well I have to work too" - well maybe miss smart mouth can then pay my hotel room bill. Oh, then our room wifi mysteriously got turned off.

It has a lovely sky-coloured ceiling that sometimes seems to move, and the floors are decked out like cobblestone roads.  It's a pretty casino but I didn't exactly have a religious experience - there are more compelling ones.

A fun place to stay in Las Vegas.

After careful consideration of all the options, we chose Paris as our destination for a day and night in Vegas. The price was moderate (not too high, but still reasonable)

Right off the bat, parking is free and the hotel is close to the middle of the strip. A very solid location. The Paris experience is fairly authentic. Not perfect, but a nice touch. From French-speaking clerks, to the food options, magazines in the rooms and, of course, the Eiffel Tower.

We stayed in a Red Room suite and it was beautiful. Not the highest end option, but based off of the reviews, much better than the basic rooms. I recommend paying a few extra bucks to get a room with a view of the tower. The back view isn't bad, but is a bit on the boring side. 

The pool area was huge and very clean. It took a while to find the hot tubs, as they were nestled in the back. It was nice, they were very quiet and situated directly under the Eiffel Tower. 

Overall, it was a great experience here. The only real downside was the walk from the parking garage to the hotel itself. It was a rather long and somewhat confusing maze to actually get back into the hotel. 

I would come back here and recommend this place for sure.

No major complaints on this place.  We ended up booking an impromptu Vegas getaway through HotelTonight.  Compared to the Arias and Cosmopolitans, it's a bit outdated, but the location was ripe for venturing along the strip.  

Lodging - classier than staying in the Hooter hotel, but the room we were lodged in clearly missed the rounds of the recent renovations (not sure if that was because we booked on HotelTonight, because the photos they had of rooms on that app made the rooms look much more updated).

Atmosphere - I liked the Parisian theme.  Beware to the casual visitor, the place was teeming with wedding parties.  May have been a convention or something, but it was like the bride parade come Saturday.

Overall -- a good economical choice.  Don't plan on spending all of your time in the hotel.  But hey, it's Vegas.  There's so much to do, who spends their time in the room anyways?
Paris is very smoke and old it smells like an ashtray here. My room had three different lamps only one was working. This hotel should on the old Vegas Strip.

Stayed here for a convention. It was ok. Nothing special to write about. The rooms were decently clean. Good location in the middle of pretty well everything. The pool was alright, no real themed area here.  It is Vegas, so the room is only for sleeping anyways. Not sure it is too good if you spend a lot of time at your hotel.

So I stayed out at Paris during St.Patrick's weekend to catch the flogging molly concert. I've stayed there multiple time without ever having an issue which is why I always come back...that is until this trip. I've never had an issue with rooms but when I checked in this time I noticed that the sheets were dirty. The room smelled like smoke even though I requested a non smoking room. And the most painful, and I mean that in the literal sense, was taking a shower. For some reason there was no cold water running in the room so my back got burned pretty bad. I'm never one to complain about things, especially when I've had great experiences in the past, but honestly this has really put a damper on my decision to stay there again in September.

Watching Bellagio fountains from my window.  I can't believe the hotel would hold a rave while a conference was happening.  The music was shaking my windows.  They should have faced the sound towards the Strip, not the hotel.  Service and food were good.  Enjoyed being a Diamonds Reward Member and getting things free like in the Diamond Lounge and a free trip to the top of the Eiffel Tower.

I stayed here with my family because my mother was charmed by the concept.  I think the buffet is expensive and the cobblestone floor is tacky.  The bed was good but with a view of a parking lot, the room was forgettable.  The boutiques are sometimes like being on a cruise ship... but you're in the desert.  The Eiffel Tower photographer thought my brother was my boyfriend, eww.

Coming Soon Paris Hotel & Casino, if you want to see Paris until then take the Concorde." In the summer of 1998 this was the sign that stood in a barren desert lot between the Old Aladdin and Bally's. Since this sign went up before Paris Hotel opened on September 1, 1999; I have been a fan. The thread that ties together the great attractions, restaurants, hotel, and public areas is the commendable job with the Paris theme. When I want to escape Bright Light City, I just step into our City of Lights. The Concorde does not bring me to this Paris; imagination does. As a tourist prior to September 2004 and local up to now, I have pages worth of memories in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower. This includes two week long vacations here including in June when we stayed in room 1757.

   Without stepping foot inside the hotel, I feel like I am in the shadow of Paris. The hotel facade is an architectural marvel that conveys the feel of being in Paris. Towering over the hotel is a half scale Eiffel Tower. My favorite spot to view it is from the Bellagio dancing water fountains. Near the Eiffel Tower, Paris towers above Las Vegas soil with Montgolfier balloon Paris sign, Fontaine des Mers, Arc de Triophe, and a facade that resembles a Paris opera house and the Louvre. Inside, there is a world that will exceed the character limit I am permitted to write. With a limit in characters, this review focuses on why I am a fan of Paris.

   Just like the facade, every inch of the property from the chandeliers above hotel registration to the cobble stone casino walkways pays tribute to Paris creating an environment unlike any other. Unlike the typical dingy smoky casino, there is a painted sky above the floor. This creates an upbeat atmosphere. In this upbeat atmosphere I have drank, dined out, slept, and had the best of times.

  Paris offers nice eateries. Le Cafe has served me nice dinners in a faux Paris street cafe at competitive prices, Nearby JJ's Boulangerie serves the best raspberry napoleons I ever ate. Plus their coffee is good. Le Pizza has served me quick to eat pizza when pressed for time. The Buffet offers dishes that are hard to find outside of France.

  The nightlife is Vegas nightlife. Since 2009 I have been a regular at Napoleons to see Billy Krauss duel it out in Dueling Pianos. Prior to the live DJ, I used to enjoy the covers band that played in La Cabaret.

  I've seen top notch shows in Le Theatre. They include We Will Rock You, Jersey Boys, & Olivia Newton John.

   The hotel is a nice place to stay. Rates fluctuate. The rooms are comfortable and include a bathroom including shower & tub. The best part of staying here is Soliel pool. This is the resort rooftop pool under the Eiffel Tower. The pool around a Parisian garden is spacious with views of the Strip. 

  As a local, the FREE parking garage is nicely laid out. It is a straight drive up a ramp leading to different levels. As a local I appreciate that it is unnecessary to reach it from the Strip.

  Paris is proof that well done themed properties don't get old. They just age gracefully.

Would love to give this a better review.  Love the Paris.  But from the worst check in experience to the now dated and worn out rooms, Paris is just another cheap old casino on the strip.  Time to redo the entire place.

This was a disappointment.  I thought the Paris would be fancy and professional but that was not the case.  We checked in at 5 p.m. and were told that our room wasn't clean and we'd have to wait another two hours - with the rush put on it - to get in.  We called after 1.5 and 2 hours and it was not clean.  Finally, 3 hours later we could go into our room.  We were told to go to a special area and not wait in the line, but no one were there to help us.  The check in line was backed up and people were pissed.  

Finally I asked someone to help us and they did, but they didn't give us any coupons or anything that my friends got.  After I asked why we had to wait we were told that a king bed is a special request like a strip view and if we had just taken the two queens we could have gotten in faster.  Last I checked, beds were sleeping options and not upgrades.  On top of that nonsense they tried to upsell everyone like crazy.  The rooms are nice and Ah Sin restaurant was good too.  Just watch out for the $15 Redbull vodkas.

Paris is a good hotel but not a great hotel.  As one of the hotels on the more expensive side go I am not sure if it is worth the extra cost.  Yes, the location is great, its right in the middle of the strip but so are other hotels that are less expensive.  So I don't know..... anyhow the hotel is nice but I guess I wanted it to be a little nicer considering the price.  The rooms are completely average and so is the service throughout both the hotel and the casino. Make sure you arrive early enough to get valet because the walk from the parking garage with your bags to the check in area totally sucks!  I do love the inside of the casino area, the decor and walkways, bar areas, restaurants, and ceiling are beautiful. The room was comfortable and clean, the bathroom a good size and checkout went smoothly.

Great place, hotel has great amenities plus we had rooms for free and it was worth every penny.  Only thing I don't like is that they didnt have cheap tables for people who wants to play and learn black jack without having to commit $15+ per hand.

Hotel packed..lots of convention attendees.
Great location on the strip.
Nice restaurants on property..French theme..good food
Rude staff..don't care..seen too many people..at check in\/out
At key pick up the clerk was downright rude to us
Room ok..nice theme..dirty under the beds..someone else's coin and pen plus dirt..
Sink in bathroom very slow to drain..plugged

My second stay at Paris in the last 5 years and I was a bit disappointed this time.I took my sister to Las Vegas as a birthday gift and made reservations for two rooms each with king beds. When we arrived to check in I asked if we might have adjoining rooms as I usually like to order coffee and continental breakfast that we can share before heading out for the day. No adjoining rooms were available but we were given two rooms near each other.  Thankfully, the check in person,Amber, suggested we NOT take the rooms with the Strip view as they tend to be "noisier". I noted in other reviews here that other Paris visitors were not so informed. When we arrived at our respective rooms, they each had 2 queen beds rather than the 1 king bed which I had requested. No big deal but it did make the room seem smaller. The furnishings are looking a bit worn from my last stay here 5 years ago and could use some "freshening". The overall appearance of the rooms was OK but the carpets did not appear to be vacuumed and I found small plastic tags and other "evidence" of previous occupants(thankfully,nothing gross). Although I did order "Express Breakfast"(coffee and croissants) and Express coffee the next morning(both guaranteed delivery in 20 minutes), what were supposed to be $18 and $12 charges were actually $28.50 and $21.00 respectively, after taxes and additional fees. I guess it pays to read the fine print on EVERYTHING. My biggest gripe with ALL of Las Vegas is that I'm a non-smoker and there are very few casinos\/hotels that have sufficient air circulation to avoid the smoke. Some have awful "fragrances" which are added to the air systems which only masks the smoke and in many cases was actually worse than the smoke. Thankfully, Paris was NOT one of these. I would stay in Paris again although I found the $28.50 "resort fee" on top of the room charge to be a bit high considering it only allowed me to use Wi-fi on 2 devices, my phone and iPad. Any additional devices results in additional charges. The $85.50 resort fee I paid for my sister's room went entirely unused.

We sat outside overlooking the Fountains at the Bellagio. I ordered the Ham and Cheese Crepe with an over easy egg on top. It was so rich and tasty!  I would definitely order that again. My husband ordered the Smoked Salmon Platter. The salmon was very fresh tasting. The coffee was perfect as were the mimosas. They also have a Bloody Mary bar that we'll try next time. The atmosphere and service were impeccable.

This place is in a fantastic location. The parking garage always has a decent spot available too.
The pool was nice and we never had trouble finding a spot to lay out.
There are lots of machines and plenty of restaurants and bars.

The bathroom is gorgeous and large.

I give this place three stars because the beds were awful. Also, my pillow smelled like mildew. There were also stains on the sheets. 
Even though the beds weren't comfortable I would come here again.

PARIS HOTEL AND CASINO WILL NOT STEP UP TO THE PLATE!!

My vehicle was found in a  parking lot  totally stripped about  a mile off   
Las  Vegas Blvd.  Insurance deemed the vehicle
 a  total loss. Now we are dealing with insurance headaches. We called the Paris Hotel To give them a second opportunity to make things right, show some compassion...after all we missed dinner reservations, show tickets, and spent our entire stay talking w insurance,  security, police detectives. and car rental personnel...NO SUCH LUCK...  Just a repeat of what we we're told at the Hotel reception  "we are NOT responsible, we are within our legal limit". THEY WON'T STEP UP TO THE PLATE...THEY DON'T HAVE TO, OR CARE TO!  I WILL ASSURE NEVER TO RETURN TO PARIS HOTEL AND CASINO.

It's been a while since I have stayed in Paris.  I've always thought the accommodations were overpriced here.  The newer refurbished RED rooms are ok, but still the rooms are comparatively small and outdated for the others.  Location is good, close to center strip.  Great views of the Bellagio fountains.

What is nice is the layout of the casino and the feeling of being outdoors and staring at the clouds while you hopelessly give away your $$$.  There's not a lot to do in here other than the tower.  No shopping.  No clubs.

I saw one of the rarest occurrences in Pai Gow here last weekend.  A 7 card straight flush w\/ a joker.  But of course, it was the dealer that hit it.  So no bonus, no envy payout for anyone.  I sobbed.  Another reason to hate this place.  But I'm just bitter.

They charge to parkkkkkk!!!!! Stinks the days of locals parking free are dead as disco. Ow well, I do like the the decor in this place and my new favorite French resturant is located in this casino. The parking garage is nestled in the back of the casino and can be a little bit of a choir to find. All in all still not a bad casino.

Okay, I will start by saying I was comped for five nights so I didn't have a stake in wasting my money. The Paris is a Disney version of Paris, after all it is Vegas. The Paris Masquerades as a fancier hotel than what it really is. I was given a room with a great view of Bellagio, the fountains and the Eiffel tower; which isn't bad for a comped room, I am hardly a "High Roller".  View aside the room is what you would find in a nicer but worn Holiday inn, or older Hilton. I have not seen the upgraded Red rooms so I cant speak to what they are like.  We had eaten at the buffet the first night out of convenience and after waiting in line for about 45 minutes we were seated. Later that evening I saw my food again, if you know what I mean!  That same night, after my stomach had recovered we went to the casino. We played slots for about an hour and no one came for cocktail service, which is unusual for a Caesar's property. I informed the food and beverage manager who was really nice and polite and she bought us a round in the bar to make up for the incident, they had been short servers. The Paris is connected to Bally's next door. The two have two totally different atmospheres; at Paris we saw a lot of Gray haired polo shirt wearing yuppy types whereas Bally's was a little more low-market with dancers in short shorts on some of the gaming tables.  I guess they are both so different to appeal to a greater number of customers, the Tequila bar at Bally's we found to be exceptional in service and had great drinks and a third of the price of the bar at Paris. 
       Some finer points of the two casinos are
           - its on the Monorail with a station at Bally's
           -they are Mid-strip and convenient
           - staff is very friendly
           -there is a small shopping mall at Bally's  with an Ichiban, 
             a Nathans and a 24 hour Sbarro in case you get hungry late

       Some not so nice points for us;
         - A lot of older business types
        - More strollers than you normally see in Vegas, infant clothing 
           shop in the Paris!
        -No nightclub or live music, there is a dueling piano bar which
           is nice but not really the same.
So basically if you want a subdued Vegas experience in a quasi upmarket casino than book here. If you want a more exciting "what happens in Vegas" experience you may want to book at the Planet Hollywood next door or elsewhere.

We flew in Thursday evening and checked out Sunday. The rooms are very nice and the hotel atmosphere is fun but the customer service is by far the worst! Front desk staff is so unbelievably rude and not helpful at all. My mom accidentally forgot her room key in the hotel room so she went to the front desk to ask for a replacement. She was told that the person who made the reservation has to call to add her on as an occupant which is understandable. We call and tell the person the situation and they say they can't help and we have to be transferred...we were transferred four times in total because apparently no one at the front desk knew what to do. The person that originally answered the phone was the one that ended up "helping". They refused to add my mom to reservation although they verified that we purchased the rooms via phone number, address and made us walk back to the hotel to let her in to the room (we were at the Venetian at the time celebrating my birthday which was cut short due to this whole debacle). Also, we wanted to purchase tickets to a show so we went to the ticket desk and asked the man for tickets for thunder down under, he gave us a weird look, stopped us and made his coworker stop helping the people she was with to "help" us! It was so unbelievably rude. Anyway, so this lady comes and we ask if they sell tickets for thunder down under and she says yes and shows us a video for another show....so I repeated to her no we want thunder down under that's what we asked you initially and you said yes. She got all flustered and said oh go next door to the ticket box...so we go to where she said and they said no we have to go the front of the hotel to purchase tickets. The whole thing was a mess....don't stay here if you want good customer service. It's a shame that the staff is rude because I would have considered staying again and recommending the hotel to family and friends but there is no way I will now!

Great strip value!  And the Eiffel Tower is fun, although touristy.  Definitely worth the trip up.

The little village shop area is romantic and cute.

Rooms clean\/ modern.

Pool is very small.

Casino is very good.  Good crowd.  Good layout.

I did a lot of research before booking a hotel room in Las Vegas, because there are so many to choose from.  

The Paris fit just about all of my family's needs, which included a pool that is open year-round, decent restaurants, cool theme, comfortable room, and good location on The Strip.  I got a newly renovated "Red Room," which was perfect.  I requested one with a view of the Bellagio Fountains, and that was provided by the check-in clerk, no problem.  

My husband and I typically despise and avoid buffets, but The Village is a must when in Vegas.  We even took advantage of the "All you can drink" beer\/wine package that you can purchase with it.  I did my best, but my hubby said it was time to call it a night after 3 pints.

I took my son on The Eiffel Tower Experience, which was pretty fun.  The view of Las Vegas at night from up there is amazing!  I signed up for daily texted coupons, so we got a 2-for-1 ride.  

This would be a 5 star review, but the bell hops would not let us use any of their luggage carts to wheel in our full cooler from the car.  We had to carry that 50lb beast to the room by ourselves.  Also, the movie we ordered froze halfway through, but the hotel removed the charge from our bill.

Booked a nice room for the four of my friends and myself with two queen beds. The room itself was very beautiful and organized. This room had all of the necessities to ensure its customers that they will have an amazing stay at Paris Hotel. It had a security deposit box to put your valuables in, a big plasma screen TV for when you need to rest, hangers to hang your clothes, etc. I thought the bathroom was super cute because the shower and bathtub had beautiful calligraphy on it, which definitely added a "French" touch to the Paris Hotel altogether. Appearance and atmosphere, 5\/5.

Also, Paris is located in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip, which is a GREAT location for tourists. Basically, you're right smack dab in the middle of the city and can choose to go either left or right from when you wake up to explore Las Vegas. No need to walk too far to get anywhere since we're in one of the best spots. 

But what's not so great about Paris? Their service. I don't know what reason, but every time we left the hotel, we'd come back to our un-made bedsheets, used towels, and empty shampoo\/conditioner bottles. It's like housekeeping didn't even do their job! We actually had to do their job for them and CALL the front desk every single day to request extra towels and shampoo\/conditioners. Then they'd take about 20-30 minutes to bring up our supplies, which really puts a damper on our vacation as we have to take vacation time out of our day to do the work they were supposed to do in the first place.

But it's okay, we left them a present. A giant heap of 15-20 used shower towels on the floor of the bathroom because somebody didn't clean them up when they were supposed to.

Otherwise, I'd still recommend this place to stay. Great location, great appearance, great atmosphere. Maybe we just weren't so lucky, but hopefully others will be.

I like the 'paris' experience. The cute streets with signs and tower seeming to be everywhere. The casino floor was a bit small for me and didn't have too many varying tables. Only a few of each. There's some celebrity restaurants worth checking out but I wouldn't stay here.

I really liked my stay at the Paris. Although we were supposed to check in at 3, we arrived at noon and received our rooms right away. They were spacious and clean!
Since we didn't get the room cleaned the second day, we called room service and asked for a couple of towels and shampoos; 5 minutes later someone knocked on the door with 4 towels and a HUGE bag of soap, shampoos and conditioners. Definitely what I like experiencing in hotels. 

Things to check out:

1)The Eiffel Towel replica is the best thing to look at at night.
2) Check out the crepes place in the hotel; their crepes are one of the best!
3) Buy on of those tour eiffel drinks or the big paris ball as a souvenir!


and lastly: HAVE A BLAST!!

Having stayed here and having frequently visited many of the establishments within Paris I can say that I simply love it! What's not to love?  The ambiance is adorable, Mon Ami Gabi is wonderful.  The bakery is to die for.  The staff and personnel  are friendly. The rooms are spacious. I could go on and on and on.  Paris has earned and solidly kept its place on the strip.

THIS PLACE IS UNACCEPTABLE!!! The way they deal with basic guest service is to pretend not to know n rather not deal with it. I checked in the pet friendly floor with my 4 months old toy poodle puppy. He just completed all his shots n has never been in public places before. I carried him throughout the whole way to the room. TWO hours later he started scratching like crazy and we called the front desk due to fleas, even I got bitten by fleas!! what they can say is "here's the phone number to the vet, give them a call".  In busy traffic and high price, we had to take our baby to emergency! 
We contacted the so called manager and what we got back was "we need our ego lab to get back the result from examining the room". 
I spoke to a representative later on after I got back home n they dare to send a letter back to say they found nothing so what the fuck do u want to do?!
They have fuckin fleas in the room!!!
So very disappointed and furious if they even care about their guests!! 
**WE HAVE VIDEOS TO SHOW** what happened to my puppy (poodle rarely shed hair!!). He is scratching himself like crazy and HOW MUCH hair being shed in one night from A POODLE!!! I am consulting my lawyers right now on suing them!!

.., great rooms, awesome set up, good times. 

I've never stayed here on my own, my friends & I would always split the nightly charge. But from what I remember it wasn't too bad. This past visit, we came here strictly to eat, drink, & wander around aimlessly.

Paris' Le Village Buffet was a tasty choice to eat at. The line was ok, but we were happy we grabbed the 24hr. backstage buffet pass from here. Definately a nice place to stay at, check em out!

For price and location, this hotel is one of the best values on the Strip, especially during the off-season. And NO resort fee. I paid $72\/nt (and have seen rooms as low as $60\/nt) and had a very modern, nicely furnished room on an upper floor. The location is central to everything you'll want to see on the Strip, making walking easier. Driving to the hotel (exit Flamingo off of I-15) and parking is pretty easy too. Thankfully you don't have to walk too far from the parking garage to get to your room and you can skirt the casino pretty easily if you're traveling with kids. Restaurants, including Mon Ami Gabi and the Sugar Factory, are good too and several, cheaper options are available in the shopping\/dining area between the casino and garage and in the Planet Hollywood complex right next door. Ask for a "Red Room" (or upgrade to a suite) for one of their more recently renovated rooms.
The rooms are nice but the food situation is awful and the store workers are so rude. Not worth the price.
This hotel is far better looking from the outside. The casino floor isn't very inviting, nor was I impressed with the buffet. That's all I have to say about that.

Paris Las Vegas Hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the Strip. It is next to the hotel "Belliz" and "Aladdin" and across from the "Bellagio". This 34-story building, repeating the historic hotel "De Ville" in Paris in France. On the hotel Paris Las Vegas features original designs Parisian attractions, including a 50-story half-scale copy of the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, the Louvre and the Paris Opera House.
    Rooms at the Paris Las Vegas are elegantly furnished and decorated in a European style. Rooms are furnished in a European style with rich fabrics and marble bathrooms, with a separate shower and bathtub. The rooms comfortable spacious wardrobe and all that should be in the room 4-star hotel. 
    This hotel Paris Las Vegas - bars, restaurants, banquet and meeting rooms, an outdoor pool, fitness center, spa, 33 elevators, room service. The hotel Paris Las Vegas you can get acquainted with the atmosphere of Paris. The complex vast territory for the games. You can visit the Eiffel Tower and watch the city from above. The hotel arranged theater performances and shows. It also has three halls, clubs and bars. Shoppers will be able to give vent to in shops in a typical Parisian boulevard. The hotel has a business center. The two churches are wedding ceremony.
Must visit thing is their Eiffel Tower restaurants, but it's sweet shop isn't that good

Love the ambiance at this casino for some reason. Maybe it's the HUGE Eiffel Tower that's planted in the middle of the casino? Or the quaint boutiquey shops? Or better yet, the food. I'm a regular at P's buffet. Not like a 24\/7 during a given visit-Regular. But, it's a must-do when in town. Much like their croissants, breads, sandwiches, crepes, and salads in their other restos in the P. You get transplanted to a different place and time, much like the Venetian does I think.

Right across from the Bellagio and Caeser's Palace and with the Sugar Factory steps away, it's a good central location to hit while in Vegas for sure.

I stayed at the Paris now several times. At first they prided themselves for having no resort fees, then they added resort fees, and now they even have the audacity to charge for printing out a boarding pass for their guests.  The excuse of an utterly uncaring manager was "the concierge service was taken over by a private firm and they can change whatever they want."  Nice going!  - After getting a room with a non working safe, now that.  No way we will ever stay at this place again where the basics of customer service have completely gone lost.  Well, I guess that the true Paris, France experience. ;-)

One year later. Same convention, same hotel. The renovation is complete but I don't see a difference. We had a nice corner room over looking the Bellagio Fountains and the Eiffel Tower. Pretty cool until the party started.

There is a rooftop nightclub under the Eiffel Tower, where it is built out of the roof. The music was so loud that things in our room were vibrating. We were on the 11th floor but the noise was incredible. No way to sleep.

I called the desk at 2:30am. The woman who answered was very nice until I complained about the noise. Then she stated.."Well, it's a nightclub!!" Okay, and I am not trying to sleep in the nightclub, I am trying to sleep in my room.
She said it would be going until 4:00am. They must have received many complaints because they toned down the music about 30 minutes later.

Two nights at this place and two nights without sleep. The room was hot, the bed is so so, just like last time and the pillows are horrible and the noise.

Las Vegas is a noisy town, however, every other hotel I have ever stayed in knows how to make the room dark and quiet.

As was last year, the convention host paid for the room. Next year I think I will pay for my own room in an MGM property. MGM Resorts knows how to do it.

What a disappointment.  The hotel and rooms is dated but pretty clean.   I'm sure it was great in its day, but there was worn carpet, mystery stains, the bathroom mirror frame was delaminating, the mattress creaked, wall paper was torn, and the wardrobe had veneer peeling off of it.   Right outside our room there was a hole kicked in the wall.  On the main floor where its designed to be Paris streets, everything is dingy and depressing, the novelty wears off as you walk for probably a half mile to the parking garage or monorail.  The front desk is surrounded by casino, so you have to walk through the smokey slot area to check in and then get to your room.

The cable tv has about 5 basic cable channels we would all expect, and the rest are weird international channels in other languages.  Wifi is $15 per day and dropped the connection consistently.

Stayed at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino for a belated birthday trip in November. 

I'm giving 2 stars instead of 3 stars, because the restaurants, slots, and availability of late night food at the Paris was great. Mona Ami Gabi is one of my favorite Vegas restaurants, the section of the hotel that connects the Paris to Bally's has late night pizza, and that was amazing. 

Chateau the club at the Paris, is worth stopping in since you can dance listen to music, and view the fountains at the Bellagio directly across the street.

The weather was mild, the days sunny, but we had to nix sitting out by the pool. I wouldn't recommend Paris if your looking for pool action. By no fault of there own, the Pool becomes completely shaded and chilly before the middle of the day because of newer buildings recently built around it. 

I stayed in a Luxury 2 Bed Queen room with a group for a couple days, and then a Premium Red Luxury room on the 29th floor directly facing the 'Eiffel Tower' the last couple of days. Views from both rooms were good. However the rooms simply were not as nice as they looked online. The Luxury Red was only a smidgen nicer then the regular Luxury room. Both rooms were lacking detail in cleanliness. Stains and hairs on the bed toppers to name a couple. I find visibly lacking in details in regards to cleanliness scary at hotels, so I would not stay here again.

Great location and clean rooms.  I went on a family trip (rooms were comped) and enjoyed my stay. Casino is a nice size too. Bell service is fast and courteous. The pool is nice; although it could be open later, especially during summer hours and it could have a deep end. DJ comes out during the afternoon and plays great music. 

Food: Make sure you check in to Paris via foursquare because you'll get a $5 off coupon at Le Village Buffet. Overall the food was okay. The crepes were really good, as well as the desserts. Went to St. Louis Cafe and the food was decent. 

Overall great hotel to stay and is in the middle of The Strip close to everything!

We stayed here over the 4th of July, 2012.  I really like this place.  Our standard room was nondescript, but clean and that's all I really care about as I wasn't planning on being in there much.  The only things I didn't like was the fact that there was no place to hang towels near the shower in the bathroom and the lack of free wifi.  

Big fan of the casino and shop area.  There are lots of places to eat and drink for every price range.  Our bartenders were friendly and generous.

  The best part for me though, is the location... Smack dab in the middle of everything.  Oh, and the pool is the other best thing.  It was clean, beautiful and there was plenty of space.  Loved it!  

I also liked the price range.  Not quite as cheap and yet not nearly as expensive as it can get.

First time stayed in Paris Hotel and i really liked because the crowd was really young so it was good to hand out with people my age. Probably will stay again. Rooms are clean we had view of the strip the Bellagio fountains. Love their restaurants and bars.

So I wish I had a good response for this hotel but unfortunately I don't. Our room was spectacular but the service is absolutely just horrible with any type of hospitality what so ever. I would prefer not to go into Great detail but all in all they had several opportunities to make our stay redeemable but there was no chance of that ever happening. I would definitely pay extra money to stay in the Wynn because I hear they actually provide service there...  Even though I did pay a good amount of money to stay at Paris. So if you're looking for good service please stay away from this hotel.... So I really didn't even want to give them a star but in order for me to share my opinion I have to do something...

Haven't stayed at the hotel, but went to the casino and their breakfast buffet.  I was told by a savvy Vegas traveler not to miss the Paris Breakfast buffet, because it was the best in town.  The line was over an hour wait, but I would do it again.  I am a breakfast person, and on vacation, I better have a mimosa option.  Paris was excellent.

I also liked their casino, dessert shop, and the general decor.   It is a beautiful hotel, inside and out.

We go to Las Vegas about twice a year, and have tried many hotels.  We find the value and location of Paris to be our best bet.  The rooms are a cut above neighboring Bally's and worth the few dollars more they cost.  We always eat at Mon Ami Gabi in the hotel, and usually grab a fresh roll or baguette at the bakery for breakfast.

I was at this place for a conference.  And let me just say, I really enjoyed my experience.  The hotel provided us with a continental breakfast from one of the French bakeries located there.  Excellent!  The whole atmosphere of the place was a lot of fun. Everything is pretty ornate, from the chandeliers, to the crown molding, and the walls in the meeting rooms.

I enjoyed the fake sky, a little cheesy, but a lot of fun non-the-less.  To be honest, I was most impressed with the restroom.... I think it's bigger than my house!  And clean - which you don't find everywhere.  I wasn't afraid to touch anything. 

There were a lot of interesting shops and places to eat.

You have to try the bakery!  They have excellent tomato soup.

Overall, a great experience.

Unbeatable location but that's about it. The hotel is still hanging on its old fame. Unwelcoming front desk staff makes you wonder if all of them are on minimum wage; rooms are just ok for the hotel's star rating; a lot of hidden charges tells you that the hotel is desperate in need of money (for one example, the horrendous "resort fee" supposed to include free local calls but on the in-room info card it also says in fine prints that they charge money for local calls). Our entire experience was just mediocre. I would expect more from a hotel that's at its level.

HORRENDOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE !!!!!
Could not get a diet coke while playing slots.
The server looked directly at me, and walked the other way.
Bartender ignored me also, then he told me to use the "House Phone" to contact the manager of food & beverages if I had any complaints.
Spent nearly an hour on that phone GETTING A RUN AROUND from an operator who made an obvious attempt to make it impossible for me to contact ANY managers (she continually sent me to voicemails, non-working phone numbers, and even the hotel front desk!!!).  I finally found the Casino Manager and explained the situation.  Then, EVEN SHE WAS UNABLE TO FIND THE MANAGER OF FOOD AND BEVERAGES !!!   She apologized, but was clearly unable\/unwilling to do ANYTHING about the horrible treatment I had received or even suggest a remedy with regards to her company's disgraceful customer service issues.

I WILL NEVER SET FOOT ON THIS PROPERTY AGAIN !!!

We got a room with a great view of the tower and the pool!! however, i wouldve like another fridge so we could chil our drinks and what not...
the beds were comfy and the bathroom was pretty spacious. maybe next time ill get a chance to go to their spa :)
