The lady who told me this charged my card while I was checking to see if this had been added as part of the reservation, before I could say yes, she handed me my receipt. When I told her that she didn't even wait, she went right into "Have a great rest of your day" This attitude and condescending attitude in itself will result in our staying elsewhere on our next visit and my overall 3 star review.  
My first visit to LV in many years, it's expensive, do your homework, read the reviews, then you won't be disappointed.

The only reason why they're getting 3 stars is because of their buffet.  I've been to a good number of buffets in Vegas, and I have to say Le Village Buffet is in the top tier of my list.

The halls in the hotel were just scary.  I felt like I was in the movie The Shining.

I got a free suite, the suite le mans, with views of the strip and the eiffel tower.  The room is huge, but the decor left a bad taste in my mouth.  The couches, curtains, and bed sheets were all colorful and flowery, the wallpaper was striped, it made me dizzy.  Not to mention the dirty stains you'd see here and there.  I was almost scared to find something super nasty crawling in my bed.

It had a sitting area where you could work on business-related things and a closet directly behind.  The bathroom was huge.  Obviously made for two people, with side-by-side sinks.  It had a huge tub which I unfortunately never used, and a shower.  The sinks were looking alittle dated.  Whenever I turned on the hot and\/or cold water, the faucets would start leaking water. The drain in the sink needed to be unclogged because the water in the sink would just start filling up.  ICK!!

I've never bothered walking around this place to actually peruse and shop. I'll just go straight to their bar to buy the gynormous plastic eiffel tower and fill it with strawberry daiquiri and scoot my butt on out to go to the better hotels down the ways.

It's a good thing I didn't have to pay to stay here.  I don't think I'd ever shell out money to stay at this hotel.  Totally not worth it no matter how cheap their prices are!

It was almost like the real thing!  I drove up to the Gare du Nord.  My room looked like the one in which I stayed at the Hotel St. Germaine on the Rue de Rhenne.  And there's even a Tour Eiffel.  Why go to France?  The Europeans are here anyway, it's like a piece of home away from home.

Cute little reception area with friendly staff.  Decent rooms with the remains of the days when there used to mini bars and other amenities that would eventually become the fodder of what "stays in Vegas".

I like the centralized location of Paris.  The rates aren't offensive and my room didn't smell entirely like an ashtray.

My only con, the main walking area is not stiletto friendly, a sin among many in Sin City.

Been a great experience. The only thing people should know is around 11pm a nightclub opens and you can hear the DJ and crowd through the walls. Otherwise the experience has been great. Plenty of food choices especially the desserts. Staff is friendly and helpful.

I've always loved the Paris. I went up the "Eiffel Tower" during the day. It took awhile to go all the way to the top. The 360 degree view was pretty nice and I'm sure it would look even more amazing at night. This has always been one of my favorite hotels because of the ceiling artwork and building architecture inside. Also, because I love eating at the Le Village buffet and having the all you can eat macroons and crepes! nom nom nom I just love walking through the casino area and admiring the detail designed to look like Paris itself.
The building and Eiffel tower was amazing. I loved how the casino was under the tower and with french influence surrounding everybody. The gift ships were too pricy compared to the other hotels.

What is not to love about the Paris?  It's about as pretty as Vegas gets (meaning it's still totally cheeseball but in the best possible way!)

Our room was lovely - comfy bed, huge TV and smoke free.  Access to shops, restaurants, "Wheel of Fortune" machines and enormous Eiffel Tower daiquiris made the Paris a winner.  

I would happily yak again in a Paris Hotel bathroom on my next trip to Vegas.

I have nothing but praise for this gem of a hotel. The rooms, the decor, the service, the restaurants, the pool, the price - all completely outstanding!

I have stayed at a LOT of hotels in Vegas...and so far, I think I like it better than all of them - The Luxor, New York, New York, The Mirage, TI...the list goes on. 

First off, the hotel is beautiful! I was truly surprised because I thought that the quality wasn't going to be that great since we got such a good deal on the room at only $150 a night. The hotel reminds me of the Venetian - but with a French theme. We got a room with 2 queen beds on the 10th floor and the room was perfect for our needs. It wasn't overwhelmingly big but had a wonderful bathroom with a shower and a separate tub, a great view, cute decor, and very clean. 

The restaurant strip mimicked the streets of Paris with lots of cafes and restaurants scattered all over. My favorite is Mon Ami Gabi...but they've got some other great places like the Crepe stand and Le Provencal. 

My favorite thing about this hotel was the pool. Because it was 110+ degrees outside, we ended up renting a villa by the pool. They are these fabulous air conditioned houses with an outdoor patio, a flat screen TV, a stereo system, a table and couch, and they are packed with snacks, water, juice, soda, water rafts, etc. My friends and I alternated between tanning on the patio and hopping in the pool which was the perfect temperature. Incredibly attentive service by the pool and decent food - the salads are great and refreshing.

I had such a wonderful experience here - my only criticism is how crowded the place was which made it difficult to eat here but eat early or late, make reservations and you will be fine.

I would highly recommend this hotel as a good place to stay if you want a great, central location and a clean, fun hotel.

I stayed at Hotel Paris with my family and when I got home from my stay, I noticed that I had a few items missing from my makeup bag. It took me weeks to go through claims with them and in the end after 2 months, they decided to DENY my claim! I have never experienced this with any other hotel I've stayed at! So WATCH OUT people! Make sure you dont have anything out when you are not in the room. Not only will it be missing, but they do not care either! I WILL NEVER STAY AT HOTEL PARIS!

My beloved wanted to stay here, so I opened up the wallet. No deals here. The room was fine, but could have been a Marriott in any city in the US. Once you leave the room, the Frenchness is all around. That said, the view from the top of the Eifel tower was nice, great place to take pictures. The restaurants were very good which is why I give this place 3 stars. I took away one star because internet access was 15 bucks, what?  even the cheapest Ramada Inn gives it for free. Another start taken away for charging me a 11 buck "processing fee" when I checked out. That said, she liked it a lot, so what the heck, I would probably come back.

Nice, clean rooms and love the pool. It's right under the tower which is pretty cool. Rooms have a small tub and small shower though. Otherwise the hotel is nice and in a great location. It's quick and easy to walk to either side of the strip. The gym isn't the best and the room doors are unnecessarily heavy to pull open. Very affordable though and lovely casino area.

I enjoy the atmosphere of Paris and the gambling areas are so much fun.  "Dino" is the best bar tender at Paris! He stays at Gustav's most of the time.  Must go eat dinner on the Eiffel Tower.  The location is great on the strip.

Sucks. Blows. One of the worst hotels on the strip - and I mean that because I have stayed at many (from the Tropicana to the Venetian baby). Every time I come to Vegas, which is fairly often, I like to try some place new. I've been wanting to stay at Paris for awhile, but every other time I have come, the rooms have been too bloody expensive. Surely for the price they were charging I was going to have an extra-ordinary experience? WRONG! This time I'm on the company bill, so now the room fits into the per diem. And its not even the room that's the problem, although I'm sure as hell glad that I didn't stay here when it was $200+ a night. I would have felt TOTALLY ripped off. Its everything else about the hotel that blows. NOOOO breakfast options. As another Yelper said, when you're looking for that hangover cure, you sure as hell better look somewhere else other than Paris because there is nothing here other than a Boulangerie with a bunch of crappy pastries. I paid $18.75 for a fruit salad, croissant and coffee. That says something right there. The casino is minuscule and very uninspiring.The slot selection is ridiculous. And lastly, I ordered room service and the pizza I was served had to have been one of the worst I'd ever eaten in my life. The only reason why I continued to eat it is because it cost $17 and who could let that go to waste? I give Paris 2 stars because 1, the rooms aren't terrible and 2, its connected to the monorail which makes it convenient to the Convention Center. Other than that, I'm sure you'd have a better time at Circus Circus rather than here

Is there trouble is Paris?  We've stayed here at least four times and this last visit has me a little concerned.  After checking in we made our way to the room.  I took note that there was a tray of room service on the hall floor several rooms down from us.  Guess what?  Still there at 11:00am the following day.  Gross.

We intended to spend a lot of time at the pool to, hopefully, stay away from the urge to gamble.  Not impressed with the pool.  Half of the lounge chairs were broken.  Lukcily we got there early and were able to search around for those that weren't.  Even the chairs that were operational we filthy...literarally moving them around left us with blackened hands and clothing.  

Their saving grace?  Mon Ami Gabi.  We always eat there at least once.  This trip?  Four visits.  More on that in their reveiw.

Viva Lost Wages!

Disclaimer: This review is only for the suite experience at Paris.

I was fortunately enough to stay in one of their lovely suites here at the Paris recently.  In terms of the overall experience, it was fantastic from beginning to end.  The room was very large for a suite - with a large living room\/dining area, small bar area with a sink, two bathrooms (one for the shower and sink, another for the hot tub and dual sinks and bidet), and a huge bedroom with a kind sized bed.  The view was also lovely - it was directly facing the faux-Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains.  We were able to get a terrific view of the water show which was a real treat at night.

In terms of the room comfort - the bed was absolutely the best part of the experience.  The sheets were soft, the mattress was perfectly comfy (yet firm), and the pillows were just right.  I slept so incredibly well on this trip, which really helped me get some much needed rest before all the nighttime drinking festivities.  

The shower was good and the hot tub worked fine.  The living area was well appointed with faux-period furniture.  The room was nice and cool and we were very glad the air conditioning worked well (with minimal noise) in the middle of the Vegas summer.  I can't stress how important it is to keep the room cool when it was 110 degrees outside.

Speaking of heat - it was a perfect time to take a dip in the pool.  The area was quiet, which was excellent compared to some of the noisier pools in other hotels.  It was also huge, but not too deep - which is good for families.  Given the angle of the hotel, it was difficult to find any shade after 12pm noon in the summer, so it got extremely hot by midday, but if you go early in the morning (like we did) you can easily score a good spot by the pool with minimal risk of overexposure to the sun.

The casino itself is fine - though the minimums here are higher than many of the other Harrah's\/Caesars themed hotels in the area.  If you're looking to gamble, expect to spend the same as what you would with Caesars versus other related properties like Harrah's, Flamingo and the Quad (soon to be renamed the LINQ).

As for food - MonAmiGabi is a nice choice if you're looking to score a decent meal with great outdoor seating facing the Bellagio fountains.  The food there was good, and I enjoyed dining there for breakfast.  The other restaurants and cafes were generally very crowded, aside from the new Gordon Ramsay steakhouse.  In terms of the buffet - Le Village Buffet is a decent choice and one of the better ones among mid-tier buffets in the area.  Obviously you won't get something as good as the Bucchanal buffet at Caesars, The Buffet at Wynn or Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan - but for what you pay for it's an ok choice for any meal of the day.

I've stayed at the suites at the Wynn and Caesars as well - and I didn't find the experience at Paris to be inferior to the hotels listed above.  Our room was always tended to quickly and the complimentary truffles and wine (of decent quality, I might add) was a nice bonus.  

If you're looking to go all out - this isn't a bad choice to consider.

HORRIBLE SERVICE! I went there with my mom, dad and sister. My grandpa got us 2 rooms, 1 for my mom and dad and another one for my sister and I. So my sister and I went to our room but our key wasn't working for some reason. So we called the security. After sitting on the floor and waiting for 45mins (after 4 hours of travel we were exhausted), the security finally came. He asked me to show my ID and I did but he said the room is not under my name so whoever booked the room has to show his ID. I called my dad but he wasn't feeling well and was taking a nap. I told the security that but he didn't seem to care. So I asked my mom to come and bring my dad's ID. But the security refused to open the door unless my dad himself came. So we had to wake up my poor dad to get in the elevator and come to our floor EXHAUSTED AND SICK! He showed his ID but the security STILL refused to let us in because the room was booked under my grandpa's name who didn't come to Vegas with us, he just got us the rooms as a gift. So my poor sick dad had to go downstairs and change the room under our names. After 3 hours we were finally able to get into our rooms. We were punished for THE HOTEL's own problem of having nonfunctional keys. But even our new keys would act up, we had to slide it in the door about 10 times for it to work. Overall horrible and cheap hotel, horrible service, they dont care about you whatsoever. We go to Vegas every year and we will definitely NEVER stay in Paris again. And if you wish to be treated like a normal human being, I recommend you don't either.

Stayed here for 4 nights while we were in Vegas. Got a really good advance deal on Expedia. When we arrived got given a remodeled room on the 30th floor facing the strip. Small wait for check-in but nothing like what I was expecting - maybe 10min tops. Room was great. Service from staff was good - can't expect much from a place that holds multiple thousands of people at a time. 

The location is amazing though. I'd stay here again just for this. Right in the centre of the strip - just where you want to be.

I really enjoyed my stay in Paris. Its clientele was young and fun and not a lot of kids. 

Right when you drive up, you're greeted by the Arc de Triumphe and the Eiffel Tower. After you enter, you see the casino floor and check in is to the right. The check in lobby is amazing! Large oil paintings, big chandeliers, brightly lit and marble floors. It certainly gives off the style of French royal opulence. The casino floor is pretty small but enough to satisfy all your gambling needs. BlackJack tables go from $10-$25 minimums. I love the interior decor. The painted blue ceiling tricks you to thinking it's outdoors during the day. The decor and style are all based on the French culture. They have a Cafe right beside the elevators that has the most amazing smoked salmon sandwich and great coffee! Their other restaurants aren't bad. But the buffet line is always super long. I think it's pretty cheap, $15\/meal.

Their pool is huge. Poolside happy hour includes half price drinks! Like $5 frozen mojitos and other delicious cocktails. Look up and see the vast span of the hotel building and look behind you to see the Eiffel Tower towering over you. 

The only complaint I have are the rooms. Their TV is obsolete with a lot of boring political Chinese channels and the bedding and mattress isn't up to par. Other than that, everything is great. For $89\/night, I'd totally visit Paris again!

Nice Hotel but Bad Casino...

-the gambling floor is really small.
-they did not have food service at the pool but said they will soon, this was in March.
-tried to upsell me a better view of the fountain for 35 more a night, I didnt bite. i got the back side of the airport...Pist.
-for 20 bux more i could of stayed at Caesars Palace that weekend
I like the Paris - the energy is good, decor is nice, and casino fun. The rooms are small, but decorated nicely. I would call it the top tier of the middle-class hotels in Vegas.

I like to stay at Paris - it really is convenient to everything on The Strip.  Since you are in the Harrah's family, there are lots of places to use your club card to rack up comps.  I like the layout of the casino and the setup for the video roulette - how lazy can I be???  We cab it to Mandalay Bay for concerts - it is quick and easy.  Our new favorite bistro?  Mon Ami Gabi - i think the Parisian theme is fun since I am unlikely to ever visit the real thing.

This place is beginning to show it's age a bit. The best thing we got out of our quick visit here is the souvenir Paris Balloon drink cup. It is very nice and makes a great decoration. It isn't made out of cheap plastic like other drink cups, but appears to be porcelain and it's pretty solid. Definitely pick one up for yourself if you're there. I collect gaming chips and put them in this cup.

I was disappointed by this hotel. You get the idea it's going to be really classy and sexy but it was just a room... It seemed a little dingy and old all things considered. We've stayed in at least 50% of the middle to upper-rung hotels on the strip so we had high expectations for this one. We wont stay again even with another good deal like the one we got on Expedia ($78 end of March mid-week).

My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon - only part because after three nights we couldn't stand it any more.  We left and went directly to the Cosmopolitan and had a fantastic experience.
Room was old-fashioned, smelled bad and was damaged upon arrival.  Had only the most basic amenities and when I asked the front desk to deliver a couple of forgotten toiletries they said I would have to check the gift shop myself.
Concierge was unhelpful when we tried to book tickets for a show and get reservations for Gordon Ramsay Steak.
Tried to speak to a manager about our experience and were left standing in the front lobby for about 15 minutes waiting before we had to leave for a show we booked ourselves through the Cosmo's concierge.

To top it all off, we received an outrageous $1700 room damage charge on our bill after we left.  We assume it was for some of the damages that we noticed during our stay, so we went to speak to a manager the same day.  Eric was unable to give us any details about the charge because he wasn't the acting manager that morning.  Since then I have spoken to multiple hotel managers and not one of them has been helpful or is able to show us the damage we were charged for.
We now have to go through an extensive dispute process with our credit card company in order to get this resolved.

Waste of time and money.

This was the worst hotel experience I've ever had !! My husband and I visit Vegas a couple times a year and usually stay at the Venetian or MGM (both great hotels). This time I thought we would try something different. My cousins were visiting from Italy, so I thought Paris would be a nice change for them too. The day we arrived, after planning this trip for months , we get to the lobby of the hotel, the line to check in was very long and only 3 receptionists were working.  After about 35 min waiting in line we reached the front desk . We check in and we ask for an upgrade (we had 3 rooms).  We were told it would be an additional 40$per room for the upgrade, and we agreed. I really wanted my cousins to have a great experience in Vegas . Some of them were visiting for the first time . We get to our rooms and they were very nice ,clean, and they had a pretty good view . We were so excited to start our vacation , so we thought?? After a while I noticed a letter in the bathroom informing us that they shut off the water from 10 :00  am to 3pm due to construction,but really until 5:30 because that's when you get the hot water back !! Well, needless to say we felt deceived !! Why didn't the receptionist tell us this upon arrival??that was just the beginning of their deceitfulness and rudeness... We complained and asked to be moved to a room with water or give us a discount. The receptionist was rude , We were moved , but the rooms they moved us to were old and gross and on top of that we could hear loud jackhammer construction going on just above us . Our rooms were so noisy and felt like we were in a construction zone .. At this point we were beyond mad ,so I asked to speak to a supervisor, Finally someone a bit more pleasant (his name was Eric) switched our rooms for the third time . Now this next part is really unbelievable. The third room had no water and construction noise !!! We were shocked how poorly and unorganized the hotel staff was ! This hotel needs to be upfront with their guests and let them know what's going on !! Every time we went to the lobby to complain we were not the only ones doing so . Quite a few guest were angry .. You can't charge people full prices for no water and no hot water until 5:30 pm and construction noise and flat out lie about it !! Very deceitful hotel !!! In the end we were promised our rate would be reduced and our resort fees waived, that never happened!! We were only given the run around and we just got tired of complaining and nobody cared to accommodate us or give us what we paid for !! Too many  people trying to run the ship , but without a captain, the ship will soon sink down to the bottom!!! We will never stay here again !!! The worst receptionist was a French women her name was collette  she was the worst of the bunch !! The Paris hotel is rated a 4star , but really more equivalent to a 1 star!!

What a terrible first experience. Received email to complete for "express check in" at kiosk. Once there, the kiosk said to see an agent. Stood in line, but when I got to the counter, all the lady cared about was whether I was a Diamond or Platinum member. When I said no, she told me to go wait in the longer line, as this was only for Platinum or Diamond members. Told her I understood that, but I had already checked in and was just supposed to pick up a room key. Didn't care - you have to stand in that other line. What was the point of express check in?  And it would have taken what, one minute to check my ID and get me a room key??  She didn't even have an attitude of caring about it at all. So I'm typing this while still in line for 10 more minutes, waiting for one of the 2 people checking in all 19 of us in line.  Great customer service.

Nearly 3 hours to check in.  1 hour waiting in the self check in kiosk line, 1 more hour waiting in the regular line after being told by the kiosk worker Rena? that we'll never be notified when our room is ready, another what seemed to be an hour speaking with management who I fear still do not recognize the underlining issue.   

They were sending every other person to the regular line after nearly an hour wait in the self check in line.  If you know your kiosks are buggy, have a plan put together to assist the victimized guests other than directing those guest to the back of another hour long line.

Never again....
I love staying at Paris.  It is right on the strip.  They also have parking.  If you like to walk, you are right in the middle of the strip. I like their buffet, too.

We were deceived into buying an upgrade that was supposed to include access to the fitness center. I called to complain and they were trying to offer me ANOTHER upgrade. I refused and they refused to transfer me to a manager the first 3 times I asked for one. The manager was no better help. 

I also found a dirty towel that stunk the room for the first whole day. I also found a bottle of cleaning product in the trash. Then I got allergies and was informed it is common at this hotel. They offered a humidifier. 

I will never be back. Even if offered a free stay.

Omg i LOVE this place! And that's saying allot from me because i try to avoid the strip as much as possible but when i DO i absolutely love Paris! Great staff great restaurants EXTREMELY clean bathrooms it is utterly amazing! Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel!  Location is perfect also!
Nice hotel....  Casino is great....  Room amenities good.  2 things broken but were fixed by repair man quickly.  Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Oh yes lets not forget free valet parking

Nice bathrooms. Havent tried much of anything else, but typical slots and table games. The bathrooms though, are very very nice! The deduction in stars is because it took us 30 min to get our valet car, when other people were coming up after us and getting their cars first.

I would have given them 5 Stars if it was easier to check in. Been coming here for 10 years the rooms are always clean and comfortable. Love the fact that they have refrigerators in every room. I do wish they would switch back to the French music in the elevators though. LOL

My husband and I stayed during the 4th of July weekend and it was a nice stay. We had out dogs with us and they had a blast. The only thing I didn't like was the hassle of taking them to the bathroom. There was no patch or outside area for dogs to go to the bathroom on our floor. They have a designated area for dogs but it's small and hidden by construction. It was really hot so sometimes my dogs didn't want do their business because their paws would burn on the artificial grass. The area was on the bottom floor so we had to walk through the casino a bunch of times and it's hard to carry them across the entire casino sometimes. I'm allergic to the smell of cigar and cigarette smokes, so that was not fun to walk through every time. I have never been to Vegas and was afraid to go because of all the smoking. But my friends reassured me it has gotten better. But when I went it was still pretty bad. It was worse when we went because it was so hot and humid that the smell rises and makes it 100 times more unbearable. I had to cover my mouth and nose a bunch of times...note to self, stay away from the strip. Other than the complications, it was a great stay, great service.

*** Review is for casino and amenities only***

I can't believe I haven't reviewed Paris Las Vegas.  From the time it opened, I have been impressed with its faux Parisian dÃ©cor.  Being a Francophile, this was a place that made me smile and think of the real thing!

As for a casino, it's OK.  What I like more is walking the cobblestone walkway from the parking garage entrance.  Looking at the restaurants, Napoleon's Lounge, and the long lines at the buffet are people watching at its best.

The main bar on the casino floor has been redone.  The Eiffel Tower ride is something to do once or twice--night and day-- and there is a special price for Nevada residents.

Eat at some of their restaurants gets you a small discount per item i you have a Caesars Total Rewards card.

i come here for an eiffel tower every time i get here. and Richard is the outside bartender everytime i get there. so it kinda feels like clockwork with me and those daiquiris. and the nights always get crazy. thanks richard. i always love my drinks stiff. haha. he only works for an hour at 7pm. find him and you will forget about being gypped with your drinks.
Pretty good rooms and location on the strip (especially for free).  Restaurants arent that exciting, but again, you can walk to everywhere else.

Worst Front Desk Customer Service I have experienced in 34 years of visiting hotels across the world. Shout out to Casey for being exceptionally unpleasant, rude, and aggressively argumentative. Our group will never be staying at the  Paris again.

The casino floor is nice. The layout is easy to get around with the street post signs pointing you in the right direction. The night club seem to be hopping. Beautiful ladies and guys lining up to get in the place all night long. The view from the Eiffle tower has a must see view.

Such a beautiful hotel! My first trip to Vegas. My husband and I stayed in the Red Room (Room 2623 on the 26th floor). The room was beautiful with a very romantic feel, king size bed, tub and walk-in shower, with a spectacular view overlooking the Eiffel Tower, pool, Las Vegas strip, and Bellagio fountains. We stayed 5 days\/4 nights. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but having a fridge and coffee maker helped! Also, we walked to the CVS and bought drinks, snacks, etc. The hotel and casino floor has an awesome Paris feel with unique french dÃ©cor, shops, and restaurants! The casino isn't huge, but it has a nice vibe! We really enjoyed playing slots! And of course they have all the other casino tables if you enjoy poker, roulette, etc. There's a walkway connecting Paris to Bally's with shops, restaurants, etc. We ate at Burger Brasserie (sports bar) ... delicious burgers and salads! And I loved that they offered gluten-free buns! Also, if you're looking for new sunglasses or glass cleaner, go see Chris at Optica! (Actually, all 3 associates we spoke to were very friendly and helpful! Just can't remember all their names.)

Thank you Paris Hotel & Casino for an exceptional experience!!! 

Additional info: *We arrived at the airport late (11p.m.) and took the Bell Trans Shuttle ($8 per person) to Paris. No wait for shuttle, however, the shuttle made many stops for drop-offs, so if you're in a rush you'll need to take a cab. 

*We checked-in online so all we had to do was show id's and pick-up room keys upon arriving at the hotel! Self check-out was great upon leaving too! No wait, no hassle!

*BEWARE!!! If your first visit to Vegas be prepared to walk a lot! Make sure you have very comfortable shoes! We walked 32.18 miles in the 5 days we were there! This was even after using many Ubers for longer distance trips, Double Decker Hop-on Hop-off Tour Bus, and Grand Canyon Tour Bus. (After 1 day I had blisters on both feet and on our last day, both of my feet swelled up like a balloon and it took about a full day for them to go down after we arrived home.) 

So much to see and do... We need to book another trip just to fit it all in! Fun Fun!

I always loved this hotel my family used to stay here when it first opened too I remember, now I work and live in Vegas and mom visited me so we decided to stay here for one night to gamble and hang out on the strip, I checked in earlier, we walked into our room, it was messy, beds weren't done, there were to go boxes from Denny's with food still in them, God knows what bottle in the bathroom with red liquid in it... I was shocked and called the front desk, the lady said I can come back to the registration and get the key for a different room, I said I have to leave right now for work.. And I don't want a stranger to walk in while my moms here by herself? They didn't do anything and I ran into a house keeper so I asked him if he could send someone to make up our room while we are gone because it's messy, he said he would and I came back after work and it's still dirty. Very disappointed and such an unpleasant experience it feels really bad to walk in and stay in a room that hasn't been cleaned ... Always loved this place like I said I don't know if I would ever recommend this place to anyone

What did I get myself into...Paris, France...more like Paris Texas. This hotel needs major renovations! The rooms are tiny. The ceilings in the bathroom and room were stained and cracked.  The plumbing needs to be fixed. Every time I turned on the faucet a stench would come out reeking of sewer. The tv in the room was from 1964. What hotel holds big box tvs anymore. Even the holiday inn have flat screens. There was loud music at night coming from the casino that we could hear from the 20th floor. When I called the front desk the receptionist advised the noise was coming from across the street and there was nothing they could do about it. Even though I would stand by the Window and could tell the sounds were coming from below. The receptionist even advised that she was getting calls from the 32nd floor in regards to the music noise. The receptionist did not seem to care that the music was being a disturbance. There was no security to check our room keys in the lobby area so basically anyone could access the elevators to the rooms in the hotel at night which is very dangerous. I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and usually there is security to check your room keys. This hotel was a huge disappointment. Major renovations are needed. This is not a 4 star hotel, far from it. I stayed at this hotel with my cousins for our annual family trip and will not be staying here ever again. I would not even recommend this hotel to an enemy. Your better off at circus circus. At least there would be no shock in what you get over there.
Walk thru the doors strip side and the Casino smells like a sewer. I can't even stand the smell to gamble or even imagine ordering a drink. Good luck, you need announce a public explanation. OMG.

The room was okay.  It was reasonably convenient to the strip.

The room rate was okay, until they piled on outrageous "resort fees" and other misc. charges, including a $20 + charge for checking in before their 4:00 pm check-in time.

Obscene.  There are better options.  Hard to enjoy an experience when you feel you're being cheated.

We stayed here because it was the only Caesar's property that I haven't stayed at. We arrived late because we left late since I had to work so the diamond check in was closed. We went to the desk and a little Asian lady and a tall black guy checked us in. They weren't very friendly and were not accommodating at all. I reserved our reservation through the VIP line and they said that they had requested that we be upgraded but the people at the desk said that they would have to ask the hosts and they might based on play.
It has been my experience that the Caesars properties casino hosts are all useless...except I think her name was Veronica or Victoria at the Rio. They don't work with anyone that doesn't spend 10s of thousands of dollars.
The employees at this hotel and casino act all hoity toity when the place isn't even that great.
The rooms are mediocre at best. After the service we received I didn't even want to play at any of the properties and ended up spending more at the MLife properties. Will never stay here again

Disappointed. On the outside, the Eiffel Tower is gorgeous and definitely adds to the strip. Before we even got  to check in, we were stopped by people inside  the hotel at a booth offering  us a "free show\/meal"... With a catch of course, so no thanks. The inside seems more for an older clientele, like for senior citizens maybe? ... Compared to the elegance of the other hotels\/casinos, this place looked outdated, surprising since it's not that old!.. I definitely didn't feel like i needed to dress to impress! So the room... Somehow we ended up with a handicapped room with a shower, no tub. The decor was definitely drab and outdated, unless they were trying to go for a Parisian country theme? It was a basic room with one king size bed.. Maybe the upgraded rooms are better? I wish I did my research beforehand... Next time we will check out Venetian and\/or Caesars!

We had a great stay here and loved the decor. We only dealt with the front desk but they were friendly. The price was great too because we stayed on a Tuesday & Wednesday. It would be nice if they included admission to the Eiffel Tower for guests of the hotel, but that is a minor complaint. We would definitely stay here again!

I give the Paris good marks purely for its location on the strip.   Rooms are nice and kept clean with good quality bath aids and rooms come with mini coffee makers to help hangovers.  Food options are a let down but the advantage of its location makes this a non issue.  Can't win in the casino and sound system is bad with dancers on tables at night...Planet next door has dancers with a better sound system and better odds of having good luck plus its a three minute walk to get there from Paris.  Caesars and City Center are across the street and only takes a few to walk there for convenience.  The gym is very basic with just enough to keep you focused on trying to be good on vacation with two bikes and about eight treadmills.    Spa at Paris is very small with towels being even smaller(hand towel) but offers steam,sauna, and the hot tub.   The theory is to be relaxed and naked and it works if you have the place to yourself which is typical.  Taxi service is quick and never have to wait but valet does take a few minutes if they too busy.  I never have to pay to stay at Paris but they do charge me a resort fee of around $22 a day so I use the gym and spa to justify the expense.

I stayed here for a few days recently for a work trip. Check in was quick and painless, and I did get an offer to get moved to an upgraded room the next day. I was told I didn't have a coffeemaker in my room so they offered to move me, but when I got to my room there was a coffeemaker there. Hmm. The room was fine, though laid out super weird. Two beds and the TV was mounted on the wall off to the left. Definitely the product of a room redesign as they left the old console in the room and just put a fridge where the tube TV used to go. What can I say, a free fridge and coffeemaker and I'm happy.

I was here this past Thanksgiving weekend and it's in a really great location on the strip. The rooms are spacious and has a classic feel. This casino brings my dad very good luck. My fiancÃ© said that the sauna area was overseen by some not so friendly people. It's convenient that there are restaurants and a buffet located at this hotel. I will return!

I wish I could give this 3 1\/2 stars because 3 seems too low, but 4 seems too high. But, since my rule for rating things is if you have to think about it, it's probably the lower of the two.

-I got the $75-ish room, and the thing I had to keep in mind is it's just that: $75 room. I think it's helpful to keep that in mind because it's easy to get caught up and expect\/want more. It's a really good French themed room (especially for that price), just not the out of this world AMAZING you might want to hope for. So keeping that in mind helped me appreciate it a lot more since I don't think you can get a better room for that much money, least of all on the strip at one of the themed\/big name hotels like Paris. The only complaint I could find about my room is the drain in the bath tub had some rust around it, but that's it.

-Overall it seemed like Chucky Cheese's for adults, which was pretty fun I thought and it was fun to walk around and play along with that imagining you're in Paris, and even thinking about France and their culture, funny as that sounds.

-Food-wise, watch out. I don't drink or gamble or have any other vices to blow my money on, so I thought it would be somewhat safe to indulge in being a "glutton" and just trying that aspect of things and seeing what all they had to offer since it's based on France and France is known for having great cuisine so I wanted to see how good it was and if that would be the case with this hotel\/casino. Anyway, I still ended up blowing a ton of money by just doing that and I didn't even try that much and really it was only at the little cafÃ© shops they had where the food was kinda mediocre (but still pretty spendy, especially if you have every meal\/snack there). 

-Going to the top of the Eiffel Tower was pretty neat. I'd recommend that. 

-The view from my room on the 5th floor was pretty nice. It was of the Eiffel tower and the pool below and it was nice to look at and see.

-The pool looked pretty nice and not too crowded from looking out the window in my room, but I didn't really get a chance to try it since I only stayed over night and it just didn't work out that way unfortunately.

-The shops, meh, nothing to write home about. I still got suckered into buying a Madeleine book for my niece though.

-I liked that I could park my own car and could access it whenever I wanted since I needed to do that and come and go whenever I pleased. 

Other than blowing a ton of money on the food (I had to work to pull that off though), I had a pretty fun time just being there and hanging out and I'd recommend it, especially if you want an inexpensive, yet nice room on the strip at one of the fun hotels.

Very disappointment!! We were there for 4 night for a conference. How can a hotel have a business Conference when the internet and phone won't work most of the time. They tried to tell me it was my phone. Funny thing everyone I spoke to had the same problem. 
We had to call 2 times to get our bathroom cleaned right. Coffee and 2 muffins in out room cost $28, could of bought a few cases of muffins for that. I would really think when you have a hotel full of people you want to sell your product things would be better.

This place brings back so many memories!  Very beautiful hotel.  You do get the feel of being in Paris...and this last time my friend and I had a drink at the "Central Park" place.  Drinks were delicious and I had extra garnish!  All the workers there were nice especially security.  We were having trouble trying to find the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and this security guy literally walked us to the elevator to get to the restaurant!!! I was just amazed!!!  Bathrooms are always clean.  Oh and don't miss the buffet here...it's to die for!

We came here for a conference and when we got to our room there was trash all over and urine on the toilet not vacuumed. When I called down they said to come back down and they would give us  another room. No apology no comps nothing got up to her room and it's smaller the furniture is old and the air conditioning doesn't work. I do not recommend staying here.

The Paris Hotel has lost its luster since its opening in 1999.   I've visited the hotel and casino and finally got to stay at the Paris Hotel 17 years later for my birthday this year.  The hotel is undergoing a $400MM renovation project to compete with the other newer and upgraded casinos and hotels.  Personally, I would wait until the renovation is completed before you stay at the hotel.   

During the weekdays (certainly not to lose money on their weekend travellers), construction is ongoing as early as 7AM with the drilling and the pounding.   I hope you are not light sleepers!!   Water can be turned off from 10:30A-3:30P as part of the construction project.  Hope you are early risers!   You see an increase in the number of employees all use the casino bathrooms during these hours which I never ever saw under normal circumstances.  They do have a lot of water issues as I see water damage in the hallway near the baseboard where the bathrooms are located.  The carpeting in my room was also loose and no longer tight.  

The employees do the best they can to accommodate and\/or overlook the issues.  You really don't know about them until you've checked-in and you read all the notices in your room.  Most of the construction, as I understand, take place above the 22nd floor.  So a non-upgraded room and lower floor with no views would probably be the best right now to stay away from the hotel issues.   Or you can simply stay somewhere else until their multi-million dollar renovations are completed.

Bought a Groupon for an Eiffel Tower view room. Arrived early to get the best room when we checked in,  everything was fine. When we got to the room, we were given a parking structure view room. I called the front desk but I was informed that the Eiffel Tower view rooms are all unavailable. I reserved that room but I got downgraded without them even informing me. I had to find out by myself after we hauled all of our luggage to the room. Now we're stuck in a parking structure view room with an Eiffel Tower view room bill.  No compensation whatsoever even though the room we got was way cheaper that what we should have gotten. Had I known this was going to happen, I should've booked the cheapest room to begin with. Awful stay.
Beautiful rooms but will not go back. It was lacking a lot of customer service.

This was my second stay in Vegas, and I was very excited to book the Paris hotel. The first time we went, we stayed at the Stratusphere- very disappointing, expensive, bad view, and far from everything. The Paris has an excellent location right in the middle of the strip, so easy to get to anything by just walking. The room was big and beautiful- nicely decorated, huge bed and huge bathroom. We had a fabulous view of the Bellagio and it's fountains across the street. Parking was free, but internet was not. Staff all seemed nice and helpful.
They have quite a few restaurants and shops downstairs, and loved the continued theme. Something about it was very Disneyesque- a little cartoonish, very clean, but that was fine by me, it was cute. We ate at their bistro restaurant and had a delicious seafood dinner. We even ventured into the casino, where I won a few bucks at black jack, not bad!

I arrived at at 7:50am, and had scheduled an 8am checkin. I went to the front desk and instead of looking up the reservation they told me to wait for a text. I sat in the coffee shop for an hour in the smoke. I know it's a casino in Vegas, but it still isn't comfortable. 

I waited there until 9am, and still didn't receive a text. I walked up to the front desk and they were able to check me in. If a room was ready, why didn't I get a text like I was told I would receive??

So now I smell like smoke and am late to my conference. 

On a positive note, the room is nice and I have a great view of the Bellagio and can't wait for the water show tonight.

Stayed here three nights in late January.  Got a great rate on a travel booking site. Bed was super comfortable, casino was connected to Ballys and thats where Keno is, so it was, a bit of a trek every day just to play. I enjoyed my stay very much, ate breakfast every morning at Cafe Belle. Best coffee, quiche,  cheese plate and cheesecake. Close to The Flamingo where we walked to for one of the shows. Also the buffet was excellent. Crab legs and creme brulle were my favorites. Staff very helpful and friendly!

Finally! Review #600, holy smokes...

When you've never gone to vegas... somehow, you have this gut feeling it's not gonna go all according to plan as it originally should. I'm finally free of my Vegas virginity (no I did not have a shotgun eloping wedding hungover with a Asian Stripper chick from Sapphire). But I did end up staying here with some good friends of mine for a birthday celebration and some other "Vegas" oriented type of activities.

We rented out two rooms (at least to my knowledge) in terms of the pricing the break down was Six to a room (with $60 for 2 nights making it a grand total for $720.00 for both rooms not including tip). The rooms were clean and well kept. See through shower, clean mirrors, and a gangload of Asian TV channels to keep all the guests happy (but no Korean ones surprisingly as Jayne L. mentioned).

Amenities were close to what I expected as standard for most hotels. The pool is spacious but limited in depth (only 3 and half ft. deep). I guess its to prevent the drunks from drowning more effectively, considering you can bring drinks to the pool area or drink them as you wade in the pool. Purchasing a drink w\/ the Paris Water Bottle as a souvenir $22.00 with tax (ordered the Jack Daniel's Lemonade).

Since I did a few rounds of Gambling getting a taste of nearly everything (Poker, Wheel of Fortune, Roulette, Blackjack) at least to my recollection. Didn't win anything and loss a few bucks but nothing great to lose a mortgage payment for a house over.

Overall, it's nice to finally to have visited and tasted sin city. Even though I didn't commit enough sins to consider myself qualified for a confessional. I even have a photo souvenir (my current profile picture) Cheers!
Guy who checked me in Brian was a dick, and no I'm stuck with a non smoking room instead of a non smoking room. Solution was I pay more.

I have to say right when we got there it started off bad. So when we were asked if we like help with our bags we said YES well needless to say we got no help with them at all. Then we got all checked in. Well We had no hot water at all... i mean none... So the first night i was thinking ok maybe it will be fixed well the  night 2 still no hot water at all again when we called the front desk some one was sent up.  he could not do anything about it. well he told them we needed a room change. So later on around 945 we got a call saying if we really wanted to be moved to call but they really didnt have anything tell the next day. So come the next day we got the run around. telling us we needed to get out bag and bring them down to changes room but we would not have a room tell 1 and if we are not back by 6 we mite not have a room.... WTF dose that mean? Then the bell boy asked what happened and was like i don think they told u that!!! WTF i could not make that up if i want to. Needless to say ho one was nice no one was helpful the one nice people where the 3 young men working the bar closer to the lobby and the guy who came to try to fix our water issue. but other then that every one was rude! I don't think i will go back here again

The maintenance and housekeeping staff need to pay better attention.  I know I'm being a bit nitpicky on some of the stuff, but for the price we paid during a recent stay, I  feel its justified.

We had reserved a room with a King bed.  We have a queen at home, so always like getting a bigger bed when we are away.  No line to check in, which was good.  Now the bad

we get to the room, the mattress has clearly seen better days, sagging in the middle, I sit on it and you can hear the springs, and they are shot.  that mattress should have been replaced quite awhile ago.  Go into the bathroom, the hot water is barely lukewarm.

Downstairs we schlepp and explain the situation.  Front desk staff was very nice, but unfortunately no more king beds available will be take 2 queens and an upgraded view?  What are we supposed to say, we weren't given any other options.

We get to the room, mattress is better and I check the hot water, bingo, much better. 

Throughout the weekend I just kept noticing small things.  Torn wallpaper in the bathroom, lots of chipped paint on the vanity.  Window was filthy, so was the TV remote.  Bathroom mirror coming away from the wall.  Control panels in the elevator need to be tended to, faded print on the buttons. Also several splatters on the wallpaper up high, that looked like they could have been scrubbed off.

Comes time to go to sleep, wow, you can hear the music from the nightclub!  Wow!  Not an upgrade, I consider this a downgrade.

Trying to get coffee and pastries in the morning was unpleasant, huge line out the door, that needs to be better organized.  Second morning, I notice an Express coffee place by the restaurant Ilse St. Louis.  Turns out after we check out receipts, the croissants are a dollar more and the coffee was more too!  Same coffee, same croissants, I guess u pay extra for their disorganization.

I'd consider staying here again if it were no more than $100 a night.

Nice looking hotel, beautiful lobby and casino area.  As with other hotels on the strip, everything there is expensive.  Went to one of the small bakeries, got a few pastures, some coffee, and juice, and the bill was over $40.

To be honest, I don't have a huge problem with the prices... It's on the Vegas strip, it's a huge touristy hotel, and there is a lot to look at there.

The reason for the 1 star rating is service and safety... Safety being the bigger issue, but will start with service.  We checked in online to "save time".  The process is supposed to help you skip the long check in lines and just pick up your hotel key at the "Key Pickup" desk.  We waited in line at the Hotel Key desk for over 20 minutes while we people go all the way through the long check in line and leave.  Finally we left the key-pickup line and jumped into the regular check-in line.  We waited about 10 more minutes in the check in line and still got out key while the "Key Pickup" desk was still helping the same guest.  At the VERY least, the person at the key-pick up desk could have acknowledged us and apologized for the wait.  Very frustrating.

Our bigger gripe was safety.  At about 12:15am, our elderly parents in the next room got a knock at their door saying it was room service.   Mom said "we didn't not order room service." and peeked through the peep hole to notice it was two plain clothed men.  The men shouted at mom to open up the door demanding that she let them in.  Mom called hotel security who said they would look into it.  The men eventually left, but no phone call or follow up from the hotel.  The next morning, we went to the front desk to ask them if they caught the people trying to break into the room and why they never called back to check on our parents.  The hotel manager said they just chalked it up to someone mistakenly going to the wrong room and weren't concerned about it.  We explained again that the men were posing as room service and demanding to enter the room, and arguing with our mom.  This was very deliberate and no mistaken room number.  The manager was still very nonchalant  about it and said it's not their policy to inspect those things, as long as no one physically entered the room.  I explained that my mom had the presence of mind to not open the door and look trough the peephole, but what if these men robbed another guest or worse?  Weren't they concerned about it!?!?  .... Not at all.  The manager expressed zero concern and basically laughed us off.

This last comment may be just me being nit picky, but the manager who came (eventually after a long wait) to talk to us had large ear gauges in both ears... Not really a professional look for a manager of such a large prestigious hotel.

Have been to the Paris numerous times over the years for the buffet (when it was previously awesome, then not so great and now with a bit of a resurgence) and some light gaming but never as a guest as, with most casinos now, they don't cater much to locals. Decided to take advantage of a great deal and did a stay-cation for my birthday. Stayed in a 'Burgandy Room suite' overlooking the Tower and the Bellagio water show. Fantastic. The room was great, clean and well kept with blackout curtains and minimal Strip noise. If you have the opportunity and a great deal is to be had, I recommend it.

Another "themed" hotel on the Strip, Paris was grander in its heyday but has lot a bit of its luster as more modernly stylized resorts like the Wynn and Cosmopolitan have taken their place as the top places to stay and visit in Las Vegas. 

Nonetheless, Paris's faux cobbled streets, skies, and indoors Parisian architecture are fun (if not a bit tacky) to walk through and the Paris buffet offers a very decent variety of food for its price. 

A gripe is that the walls in the rooms are thin...its Vegas, so people are most certainly going to make noise!

I hate you Paris! I don't believe that this is a four-star hotel on Orbitz. I requested a king size bed in a luxury room and instead got two doubles in a room that technically had a "Strip view," but it was actually a view of the pool. Apparently, they ran out of king beds and were unable to accommodate me, even though they had plenty of unoccupied suites available. So much for customer service. Not only that, but the room and the entire sixth floor smelled like cigar smoke on the second night. Wi-fi was free for only one device per room per 24 hours. I felt extremely itchy after sleeping in their sub-quality linens for two nights. The only saving grace was its central location on the Strip.

Dan Newton a host for this place is a big disappointment for this company ..I now know why they are in a deficit of 15 billion and in bankruptcy .I have a close friend who was supose to have us booked for Super Bowl XLIX and VIP to the party while there .Never received a response via many sent emails or text confirming my reservation ..Had to stay at another property for weekend good thing .I have my My Life Card ! Would stay clear of this place .

To preface this review, i have stayed at all ranges of vegas hotels, including the Motel 6, Excaliber, Luxor, Mirage, Aria, Wynn and the Encore.

We arrived at the Paris and on check-in was told there were no rooms with King beds, which we had requested months in advance. "Paris does not guarantee rooms, but you can pay extra to guarantee a room". No big deal, but when we asked if they could check again to make sure there were no King beds, we were told "Umm, I wouldn't lie to you" with attitude. Ok, again, no big deal (but I thought this was the service industry and Vegas isn't exactly in the best of times right now, so don't they want my future business?). 

When we got to our room, it was clean but not in the best shape - the carpet had stains, dirty\/ratty wallpaper and dated furniture. Outside, there were holes in the hallway walls as well as the elevator. Definitely below what we expected for the price (compared to the other hotels we had stayed at).

Went to take a shower, no hot water (we let the water run for a good 15 minutes). Called the front desk and was told they would send engineering up, but again, very rude front desk. Never had the problem fixed, so switched rooms.

Second room had hot water, but the TV was broken. No way to access the movie\/music menu. No big deal since I only watch ESPN. 

On check out I saw I was charged $10 for movie or music I had ordered. I called to explain that this was impossible since I couldn't even get to the movie\/music menu since the TV was broken. This is the conversation I had:

"Sir, you must have ordered it, the TV doesn't just do this by itself."
"But I just told you the TV was..."
"Sir, don't cut me off."
"OK."
"If the TV was broken you should have called somebody, this is YOUR fault."
"I just told you, I only watch ESPN so it wasn't a really a problem for me so I didn't call."
"So it's YOUR fault. Next time you should call."
"OK. Next time the movie button doesn't work on my TV I will call. Are you going to credit me the $10?"
"No. I just told you it's your fault."
"Can I talk to someone else."
"No you can't. This is what I do, you can't talk to anyone else."
"Can I have your name?"
"No you cannot."

Then she gave me her name as "Barbara" and then put me on hold and never picked up. 

I called back and they put me in touch with an assistant manager who said there was no "Barbara" who worked there - So Paris has front desk employees who aren't helpful, are rude and they lie. (On a side note, the assistant manager and operator were nice and helpful).

So bottom line, I will never be staying here or gambling here again. It's just a poor value, there are much better values to be had elsewhere on the Strip. And if the management can't get their front desk and staff to be polite to people (by the way, politeness and honesty are FREE) they don't deserve to be in the service industry.

My husband and I enjoy staycations on The Strip and Paris was our most recent. For some reason I had low expectations, but the room was clean and spacious. 

Check-in lines were shorter than most of the other hotels we've stayed at in the past. We had to visit the check-in counter twice. The first employee had the personality of a potato sack and was not helpful, but the second was friendly and helpful. Paris also has self-serve kiosks for check-in and check-out. We used the kiosk for check-out and found it to be very simple. 

The room as mentioned, was clean and had plenty of space. It appeared that the room had been renovated recently. The bed was comfortable and we didn't have a lot of noise from rooms around us. The room included a basic coffee maker and an empty refrigerator versus a minibar. I'm always a happy camper when I can make my coffee first thing in the morning without wandering the entire property. 

There are a couple of lesser known shows on property. We saw Anthony Cools during our stay and thought it was a pretty funny show. There are several restaurants on property, Mon Ami Gabi is a great casual restaurant for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. We weren't wowed with Le CafÃ© Ile St. Louis. A huge assortment of desserts can be found at CafÃ© Belle Madeleine. Le Central is a nice spot to grab a drink in the middle of the action. 

The Paris has a pretty central location on The Strip and would be a nice spot to be for exploring in both directions. The self-parking garage is a hike from the check-in desk, but most this is the case for most Strip hotels. My only real gripe about Paris is the resort fee, coming in at around $37. This is more than we paid at places like Bellagio and Venetian (notably more impressive). The Paris needs to know their place with this one and decrease that to a fee that matches their property.

If I could have given this place a worse rating I would have. It's nearly midnight and despite doing an online check in ny room was locked from the inside. There was a tray of food outside the room and a tv on inside the room. 
I'm still standing outside and locked out. With no room. And the staff hung up on me when I called for assistance. Security is on its way....and hung up. So here I am. 12:15am and they are refusing to help me. 
The security guard, Alan, refused to help me an threw my keys on the ground at my feet and walked off. 
I haven't even got into my room yet an I'm beyond appalled..

Talk about disappointed. We came here for a family trip a few years back, when the hotel was fairly new and it was just a bad experience. I came back here with some friends again about two years ago and nothing had improved.

Positives: The location, it's walking distance to all the main hotels on the strip, The lobby is really pretty- you really feel like you might be in a nice area of Paris. Their buffet is great. Large selection of food and everything is delicious.

Negatives: The rooms, both times I went were broken down. The lamp shades were broken, the room felt kind dirty and stuffy. Even though the lobby is very pretty there is VERY little to do at the hotel. Not very many shops or restaurants in the lobby to keep you entertained. Most of the hotels in Vegas has so much to offer that you don't even feel like leaving where you're staying, but Paris hotel isn't quit like that.

I hate this hotel.  It's old and outdated.  The only nice thing about it is that it's on the strip.  The restaraunt upstairs ain't bad either, but more so only because of the view.  So many other choices, like the Bellagio, Venetian, Ceasar's, MGM, Cosmopolitan, or Aria.

The place is in need of maintenance (painting trim, replacing carpet, etc). There isn't a microwave. We also had an issue with the water temperature in the the shower, it would be warm then get ice cold for 2 minutes before returning to temp every time we took a shower. The casino really needs better ventilation for cigarette smoke. We got a deal on the room, so I can't complain, but won't be back.

This review is solely based on our experience at the casino. We did not have the opportunity to stay here. There's lots of things to do in this resort. Lots of good food! This place has a night ambiance and makes you lol feel like you're taking a stroll in a park. My only complaint is that drink service is pretty sparse here and we never got a drink order the entire time we were playing.
Enjoyable atmosphere however very sub par service from most staff which made this Vegas trip very disappointing and left us with a bad taste overall when it came to this hotel\/casino.

A friend and I were talking recently and I mentioned that I missed Paris and want so badly to go back when I return to Europe.  She said I looked like I would love France and that I was probably an elitist.  I'm no elitist, nor am I a francophile, but the fact that I use those words might point to the fact that I a bit of a culture snob.

In spite of that, I have a special place in my heart for the tackiest place on earth, Las Vegas.  And when I go to Las Vegas, I absolutely must go to Paris.  Now I don't gamble.  I hate smoke.  I like drinking in groups, not from the tray of a waitress while I'm trying to roll a seven at the crap table.  And yet I love Paris because of the things that don't involve the casino.

On a sunny day, there's nothing more fun than sitting out at Mon Ami Gabi, the restaurant that is street level on the strip side.  You get the best view of the Bellagio water fountain show that isn't from a Bellagio hotel room.

Le Village Buffet is one of my favorite buffets in town.  It's not the biggest or the best, but the price is mid-range, the food is good, and it's clean.

JJ's Boulangerie is the place where my diet dies.  They have somehing called a caramel choux, which is pastry made of the same bread that they use for cream puffs, filled with vanilla custard, and a hard, clear caramel top.  I once bought that with a banana tart, which is a regular tart shell filled with a thick chocolate filling and topped with caramelized banana chunks.  I got them to go early one morning, returned to my room in the hotel, and my Dad watched me sit down to two desserts for breakfast.  My dad looked worried and said, "I don't want you to get offended, but diabetes runs in my family."  I almost cried because I knew that was my Dad's way of saying I love you.  "I get it Dad.  Thanks, I'll be more careful."  Then I finished off my desserts because hey, it's Las Vegas.  You're supposed to indulge.

Finally, I loved visiting the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  I went during the day, before they were open. The maitre d' saw me and before I could flee (I hate making people go out of their way) he called me in.  He then took me on a tour of the restaurant, told me the best time to come to watch the for sunset, and said he'd save me the table with the best view of the Bellagio fountains.  He was unbelievably nice.  I went later that year and they started giving tours to tourists, showing us the dining room, the kitchen and letting us check out the view.  My family seemed really impressed that they'd go out of their way.

As for the casino, I like the outdoorsy theme, which is rare for a casino.  Definitely one of my faves.

I do enjoy this casino overall. I often play here and I love he fact that when I go to their bar near the tables, I would order shots and the guys gives me Half price! That's without me putting money in he video poker machine. At least so he claims that I got a half price deal. Usually when I get here with my friends, we would order a round of shots! Time after time we come back to this casino bar, this bar tender would always let me know it's buy one get one free. Awesome.

Decent variety of slots and tables. I don't have any issues with this casino. Staff members are friendly. 

The only bad thing is that this is one of the casinos with the toughest entrance if you are driving or taking a cab during weekend evenings. As the people walking on streets don't really like to follow the cross walk lights. Might get a little frustrating if you don't drive a bit aggressive when necessary. 

Same for the entrance across the street... Bellagio

Crappy hotel. The decoration almost gave me eye cancer. You can see that everything is outdated, and walking around the "fake Paris" casino area feels like being in a children's amusement park. At least the only thing they got close to the real Paris is the overpricing of basically everything around the hotel-casino (20 dollars PER day and PER device for hotel room WiFi, 8 dollars for a liter of Cola, overpriced restaurants with crappy staff...)
It feels like they asked someone that never went to France to build a casino based only on stereotypes.
If you want to make the most out of Vegas, go to Caesar's Palace or even the Mirage, I bet they're way better than the Paris casino.

Edit: Those bastards even charged us for the internet even though we didn't use it.

My fiance and I were celebrating our engagement at the Paris.  We have been to Vegas multiple times together and have always loved the Paris' beautiful casino and accompanying shopping areas, which boast cobblestone streets and charming Parisian store front restaurants and cafes.  This is an awesome hotel, but deserves only three stars for a couple of reasons. 

1) The hotel pool is disappointing for a center-strip Las Vegas hotel.  It has all the excess and ornate appeal of a Holiday Inn.  Beyond that, the hotel bar goes light on the liquor in mixed drinks but heavy on the prices ($7 for a 12-oz can of Bud Light; 13.50 for a Miami Vice with a 1 oz. shot of rum)

2) We requested on two separate occasions a strip view room before checking in.  The first request was two months in advance, and the second time was a full month in advance.  Both times we were told that they "would see what they could do."  It was only upon check-in that we were given the opportunity to upgrade - for an extra $55\/night.  I understand.  It's Vegas.  Nothing's free. However, perhaps someone could have told us of the upcharge beforehand?  If only to temper our hopes... 

That said - we will stay here again.  The staff is friendly and there are plenty of nice restaurants.  Most importantly, it's location really can't be beat.
The hotel was beautiful and services were great but the music in the club was so loud we couldn't sleep all nite. It went on til 4 am!!! Very unhappy about noise!!!

Rooms are so old. Everything it's like a witch is going to appear anytime. Dirty and staff so rude!! The manager know about it and don't do anything. First and last time here. Don't worth the money at all.

My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights during the week of March 16th. We stayed in a Pet Stay room. Overall the stay at the Paris was pretty blah.

They service we received from the front desk was not horrible, but the guy was not friendly and we didn't feel that we were treated with spectacular service. Actually this is how we felt about all the staff, with the exception of the security staff. They were the most helpful and friendliest of any staff interaction we encountered. 

The room we stayed in was not very clean and it looked shabby. The entire hotel looked shabby. They are in serious need of an over hall. 

We visited the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The food was spectacular and the service was great. We were surprised because the care and attention was so much better than the hotel experience. I made a comment about this to the restaurant manager who explained to me that the restaurant is owned by another company. This explained the difference in customer service.

When we travel with our dog we know that we sometimes are not gong to have the best options to stay, but most often we don't have a problem and are provided exceptional service at major hotels. We felt that we were given a horrible room to stay in.

We won't be staying there again.

In 2002 At night, the tower was actually very pretty. Everything in Vegas is better and prettier at night. Trust me. 

  The Paris Casino is just like all the others- except the bathrooms are cuter.  The shows here at this hotel are......hehhhhh.  

Speaking of the Bellagio-  Our favorite restaurant this trip was the one at the Paris, Mon Ami Gabi (see my other reviews) 

. Nestled right on the balcony...you can watch the huge beautiful water show at night.  It's breathtaking and quite romantic.  This is the place to be if you want to pop the question on your lady. Right Here.
I was not asked here, I was actually asked in a more romantic way- but you get the picture.  We came to the restaurant here right after he asked me, so...

Think of how many relationships blossom here from the beautiful view.
Our favorite song was "Time To Say Goodbye" by Andrea Bocelli  and to this day- I cant hear it without thinking of the night I was there, with Bear, watching the water sway.  Here, listen to the video I recently found on an old phone. I was so excited to see that I still has this inside the phone.  

https:\/\/vimeo.com\/49415946

It's the most romantic water show there is, and from the point of view from the French restaurant, on the balcony....  Oh--  I get all mushy and get goose bumps when I think back and remember this special memory.  

You would not think of Vegas as a romantic place, but If your with the right person..who has a wonderful imagination.... it definitely can be.

I have stayed in Vegas many times we usually will visit Vegas 2-3 times a year at the very least. I have stayed at the Bellagio a few times, Aria a few times, Wynn, Encore, Planet Hollywood, Venetian and Palazzo among other places. This past weekend we decided to go to Vegas on a whim and because we had friends already staying at the Paris Hotel we decided to also get a room there. 

We got to Vegas at 5AM and went to the front desk to see if there was a room we can check into because we had just driven 4 hours. The lady at the front desk was the rudest person I have ever come into contact with. In a town where customer service is known to be the #1 priority and at other hotels they do everything to accommodate their guests this was not the case here. she didn't even check their records and immediately said we are sold out, come back at 11 AM and MAYBE we will have a room for you. we asked her why she was being rude and all we wanted was for her to check maybe there was a room. She refused and we asked if we can see a supervisor and instead of call her supervisor she called security! We were not rude to her, we did not raise our voices and we were utterly shocked at her initial rudeness and her behavior. We had to wait for the security to get there and the security was the one who called the supervisor over. the supervisor just said oh we don't have a room we can hold your bags come back at 11 and once again MAYBE they will have a room. How does a hotel that size not knowif they will or will not have a room? Did they expect us to wait until 11AM so that they can say oh we don't have a room? 

Only thing is, when we left the hotel and called their 800 number the operator was able to give us a room right away and asked us to come back! 

Safe to say we left Paris and checked into ARIA. 

Would not recommend going to the hotel to anyone. Their Staff is rude and will call security on a whim for no reason. Even our friends who stayed in their room the night before said that the sheets were dirty, the room smelled and that they also were greeted with rude staff members throughout their stay. 

If you're going to Vegas try the Bellagio, ARIA, Caesars Palace ANYWHERE but here!

Gorgeous hotel, just like the Venetian, with a feeling you are actually in Paris and outside.  Fantastic!   Great shopping and eating.  Next time, I would love to dine at the Eiffel Tower!   It is awesome how you enter the restaurant inside the hotel and the tower goes through the roof with dining at the top. I'm sure it's a great view.   My favorite shop inside is SHOOZ..... oh the gorgeous shoes!   And, of course, we dined at Ramsay's Steak restaurant which was an ultimate experience on its own.   The exterior is also fantastic for photography, my favorite hobby, hopefully future career :)  Downside again...... would be the smoky casino in the middle of the place.  Why can't they find private rooms for those activities???   Hmmmm, just not a fan of that habit.

On my top 10 list of strip hotels to stay at.  Everyone is very friendly and felt very comfortable.  The machines paid out for me, so that's an added bonus.   Only thing I would say slightly negative is that there are some employees (not all) that need to be more attentive and put a smile on their face.  Don't just walk past people and ignore them...at least say, "I'll be right with you..OR...I'll send somebody your way."  That's about it.  Oh...and the water pressure in the showers need to go up a bit.

I like the Paris Casino floor. The high ceilings help keep it from being too stuffy from smoke (and the paint doesn't hurt the atmosphere either). 

I attended a conference in the Paris, and it was comfortable and easy to navigate. There's plenty of food options and the streets modeled after the streets of the actual city are really cute.

Absolutely disgusting hotel. I have never seen a hotel so dirty in my life. Not only do you walk out of the elevator smelling dirt, but when I got to the room, there was stains (red stains) on the carpet and bed, the carpets were suppose to be blue but were dark from dirt. The beds itself were the worst. They were cheap spring beds that killed my back. We also tried to order a movie they charge almost $20 bucks for a rental! I asked to confirm if I was going to get the actual movie to take with me for that cost. Of course they said no. The only good thing at this place is the food. Room service was awesome. Even though our fridge was broken so we couldn't save any of the food. don't waste time here even if it's cheap. The stratosphere is cheaper and the rooms were at least decent.

I just stayed here for a week attending a conference.  I like this hotel but it is starting to show it's age and the "regular" rooms need updating and remodeling.  This is a great hotel for a conference and I love the chandeliers in the conference area.

Doesn't even deserve 1 star. Horrible experience all around and I hope no one ever stays here in their lifetime. Ridiculous check in experience with no one understanding their own early check in system and then we find that the power goes out in all the rooms but they allowed everyone ride the elevators, even though they thought it would be a risk. Person at the front desk said he was sorry and we can walk down 20 flights of stairs to come down to the casino. We would have had a better experience at circus circus. Worst hotel ever! Never stay here.

STAY AWAY NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY!  Their rooms are old and dirty, you can hear everything your neighbors are doing.  Even the hotel casino area isn't great you can walk the entire premises less than 10 minutes.  Very limited on shops, and food selection, I'm not a buffet kind of person I guess they assume everyone loves gross greasy food.
