I posted pictures and I hope somebody does take care of it before there is a fire. Toddlers can easily access these and wrap those around their necks and get entangled, electric shock or choke.  Please fix this management? Las Vegas Fire Dept? Whatever the code enforcement agency in Nevada is?

Totally Contradicting to the room description, the carpets in the room were ugly stained worn out and dirty. I have posted a picture to refer to.

Also another very funny thing was that all the soap provided was smelling very feminine like flowers. Hello....? Men have to shower too. 
Most men don't like to walk out of the shower smelling like a bouquet of feminine flowers lol.. 
Stupid people. Choose neutral fragrances that both men and women can use. 

Wifi is only free for 2 devices. the third device is about $15.00 \/ day. Thats crazy. Again that might just be a vegas thing I don't know. 

I had never been to a motel before this. 

Now the thing to see is if this review gets any attention and what they care a damn to do something about atleast the loose electrical chords and Mike's ugly attitude.

As far as I am concerned, I'm not going back to this place again.

I didn't stay here but man this place has a lot of good places to grub, a lot of great venues, and friendly staff...plus...any place that doesn't mind a drunk ass kid walking around high fiving people is a place I like to be at. I like the paris margarita cups so much I went here twice to get some more. Yessir. YESSIR.

I could not find the wedding area to write my review. Tina Arnold was such a helpful wedding coordinator and went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed from beginning to end. She even surprised us by remembering when I told her what our song was and made sure the pianist played it. She answered all of my emails promptly and researched everything we needed. She also took the time out of her day and  walked us to every restaurant at paris so we could select the proper restaurant. She made me feel as if I was a friend of hers. 

We selected a wedding package and stayed in one of the red rooms and had a view of the eifel tower and belagio, it was fantastic. Our reception was at Mon Ami Gabi and the food and service were excellent. 

Le creperie was so good we had them twice. 

The spa was an added bonus and I enjoyed that the morning of my wedding. 

I have never been so impressed  with a vegas hotel, and am pretty sure we will be back for our first anniversary.

The hotel is conveniently located right in the middle of the strip right across from the Bellagio, so everything is within walking distance. We were on the 18th floor and could see the fountain "show" from our room

The hotel itself is nice, rooms seem due for an upgrade but  they are clean and comfortable. Then again it is Vegas, who comes here to sleep? 
On the first day my husband  and I noticed the air conditioning system was very loud. The Le Village Buffet was decent for a buffet. There are also other restaurants on the premises, Gordon Ramsay's Steak, and Bon Ami Gabi. It was a good stay at this hotel. It is a decent hotel for a decent price. If you're looking for luxury there are other more expensive hotels on the strip.

If you are a Diamond member they have decent food at the diamond lounge.  We visited the diamond lounge at Caesars, which has a more moderm feel, not faux French 19th century.  However, it didn't open at early on Friday

I love Paris in the springtime!! I also love Paris any other season. Fall for pleasant weather, winter for fewer people and shorter lines and summer for the hot heat which works best for lazy moments by the pool.

You really can't go wrong booking a stay here - hurry up - summer is ending soon!! Great neighboring properties, good buffet, a small rooftop pool, big good smelling casino, thoughtful tower design with central elevators, and super views of Bellagio fountains.

Great nighboring properties: Planet Holleywood, Flamingo\/Cromwell, Bellagio, and CP kittycorner. All these neighbors have something to offer and if you spend your whole visit just at these few mentioned mega resorts you will not have missed much. Bellagio has some of the best food and great stuff to look at. The fountains are obvious but also their large indoor garden that they change monthly. Flamingo also has a beautiful courtyard garden with koi fish and flamingos and many pools. Cromwell offers a great nightclub Drais, lounge and a rooftop pool with stunning views of the famous four corners. CP has one of the best night clubs around and upscale shopping. 

Paris has lots to offer too: A small rooftop pool that is generally peaceful and not so over filled which is shocking as there are so many rooms and presumably people with access. I think because it is small many people pass up on going there - perhaps the casino is that good and the guests never leave their slot machines.  Paris buffet is also great. Last time I checked they cut some corners but it is still very good. Crepes are outstanding with their berry syrups.

Casino has good HVAC system - not too much smoke. Rooms are nothing special in terms of square footage of a standard room and decor is dated. Views of Bellagio fountains are possible for an upgrade charge. I like the thoughful tower design with elevators neatly tucked in the middle to reduce unnecessarily long walks. As with any vegas hotel ask for something close to the elevators. In the case of Flamingo there are elevators scattered all over the whole casino floor. I usually ask for a room as close to the parking garage elevator as possible to make leaving that much quicker. Makes sense if you utilize your car and you came with one rather than on a plane. 

There are better options in Vegas but this possilbly one of the best choices if the price for a room is right. Its worth more per night than Flamingo and Harrahs but significantly less than Bellagio. See if you can get a good deal here or neighboring resorts and you will enjoy your stay.

Just came back from Vegas and we stayed at Paris hotel and casino.  I was pleasantly surprised, because  there was  a lot of bad  ratings, we expected less.  Customer service was professional and polite, the room we got was the "red room" which i think is one level up from a regular room, very nice room.  Reason for 4 stars is it's not as elegant as Bellagio,  that's where we usually stay, but Paris rates are much cheaper.  I would stay there again.

Horrible service! We checked in on Wednesday. When we were checking in we were told their pool was under construction and wouldn't be available until Saturday. Although we were very upset, because we were staying for five days we figured we'd have two days to enjoy the pool. Now they leave us a notice saying it won't be available until Monday! There was no notice on their website, no email nothing. Had they told us this from the beginning we would have probably stayed elsewhere, but I guess they knew that. We've come here every year for the last three years. Never again! Next year we'll be going elsewhere.

Three trips a year to LV on business and usually stay at The Venetian.  Because of a USMC function, I was asked to stay at Paris.  To the eye, it's an amazing place walking in.  Was checked in quickly and went to my room.  Very average size compared to others, nothing really more than a Courtyard type view.  No view whatsoever even after upgrading online.   

Met my grandkids there and had breakfast in the CafÃ© first morning.  $155.00 for breakfast including three adults and four kids.  No kids menu and they ordered pancakes....AT $16.00 PER PLATE.  Donuts $4.00 a piece.  Coffee is outrageous. The charge was the same as a full breakfast of bacon and eggs.  Then there is the resort fee of $40.00 per night.  Use of the gym, pool and 'free internet'.  So I just had major surgery a while back, can't work out, it was too cool outside for the pool and I connected to the internet through my phone and never used it.  So I was charged for three things that either I could not use, that the weather precluded me from using or I always use when I travel and pay for via my phone bill.  Last, when buying coffee this Am, I was accosted by a beggar outside of the CafÃ© restaurant asking for $$.  He had seen me pay cash and was immediately all over me.  The young lady working the coffee watched this happen and she was appalled.  She felt bad for me but also confided in me that it has happened often of late. I was scared and I was outraged by having someone inside a resort hotel on the strip able to get away with something like this.  There was no security around anywhere and I looked for them.  Very scary, especially at 7:30AM in the morning. 

When I complained at checkout this morning about all of this, the staff could not have been any ruder.  They could care less about any of this.  All they cared about was getting me finished up and out of the line. Especially the security incident.  One would think Vegas hotels would be a little more sympathetic and careful after the October incident.

Just beware of if you decide to stay there: prepare for major sticker shock; prepare for very rude employees; prepare cigarette smoke everywhere; prepare to get ripped off by the 'resort' fee and prepare for awful hotel security.  They are nowhere to be found when you need them.

Paris staff was unresponsive to our needs as a hotel guest for two of our five nights.  For two nights the sound check and grand opening of the Chateau outdoor nightclub at the Paris shook our room until 2 am our first night and then till 4:15 am our last night.    Our room, 598P literally felt as if we had a private room inside the club.  The Bass literally pounded our internal organs.  Couple our inability to sleep with the complaints of a tired and angry girlfriend, and you may imagine the pain I felt until 4:30 am 

Repeated calls to the front desk and night manager did us not good.  We have repeatedly left messages for William East, the Operations Manager, even requesting to meet with him prior to our departure.  Guess what,...No response for three days now and counting.  

The night manager broke down on my third call to the desk to admit that he had received 75- 100 complaints about the music.   If you desire getting to bed prior to 4:30 am, do not stay here or at least ask for a room that is on the backside of the hotel, far away from the swimming pool.   I have been to LV about 20 times in my life, this being my first stay with the Paris.   I do not advise staying here.  Also another note...The layout of the area between the front desk lobby and room elevators was not well thought out.   It is almost always congested and one continually feels like a salmon fighting upstream in both leaving and getting to the elevators.  Many better options available for staying in Vegas. Mon ami Gabi and Sugar Factory were Great, the hotel however.....please stay elsewhere.

I love this hotel 
Very good customer service 
And the room is very clean 
Will definitely come back next year

I stayed here on a Vegas trip back in mid-August. I liked how the interior had a sort of faux-Paris sky thing going on with the ceiling, and the floors were made to look like they were cobblestone streets. The room we stayed in was more than adequate, even though it had an outdated TV set that looked like it was made in the late 90's. I'd heard the buffets here were really good, but I never got the chance to find out firsthand since the lines for them were super long on each occasion my friends and I tried to check them out. And as other reviewers have pointed out, the location of this hotel is great because it's in "le centre" of the strip. All in all, I wasn't blown away by this hotel, but I'd probably consider staying here again on a future Vegas trip. 3.5 stars, mes amis!

I've never been to France. Hell, I've never been to Europe. But, I can say that I've been to Paris...the hotel, not the city.

Great stay here, rooms were nice and clean and everything in working order.  I actually came up from pool to get something from the room while housekeeping was in there and the housekeeper asked to swipe my key card first before she let me walk right in.  She apologized for the inconvenience, but I thanked her and was happy to know they would do that!

We reserved the air conditioned villas at the pool for 2 days and it was well worth it!  Service was efficient and friendly both days.  Any problems we had were quickly tended to.

Down at the hotel lobby lounge we loved our bartender Big Daddy and who could be upset about 2 for 1 martinis????

And free parking garage parking!!

The only gripe is $25 fee for day use of the fitness center, really?  That seems lame.  At least give me one day's access with the room!

Buffet a little lame too, they advertise breakfast buffet until 11AM, but by 10:30 they are not replenishing any items and right at 11 it switched to lunch.  Oh well.

Overall a great stay though and we didn't lose too much in their casino!

The rooms are nice, comfy, and clean. Our room was a standard size. The room was clean and big enough for four of us. Not much of a view, was not an issue.  
Had a Cosmo at the bar downstairs, was good. The whole place is nice and clean. Not overly huge though. We didn't spend a lot of time here, other than to sleep and get ready. The hotel is conveniently located on the strip. I would recommend.

Stayed at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas the end of August through early September 2016. What a LOUSY hotel! And, I've stayed at over 80% of the hotels on and off the strip. I've been going to LV since 1964 and have seen all the changes. The good. The bad, and the ugly. The 1st time I stayed at the Paris Hotel & Casino and it's damn ugly! I was there for 2 nights and paid $161.28 plus the B.S. "Resort Charge" of $71.68. Got a room looking out at the street and the Paris Hotel hot air balloon sign. Wow!

Take a look at the photo's. This was supposed to be a nice room. Wallpaper peeling off the walls in the room, in the bathroom, and even down the hall (which I haven't posted). Baseboards and carpet nasty in the hallway. I saw a maintenance man in the hall one afternoon and asked him why they just let the place get so run down. He said they didn't want to spend the money but he thought they were going to repair it. Oh yeah. 

One evening I went downstairs to get a cup of coffee and purchase some gifts for the wife. Talked to a young gal at the restaurant entrance and somehow we got onto the subject that cameras with mic's were everywhere and watching everybody... inside the hotel and even outside on the sidewalk. She agreed and wasn't happy about it as the NSA, Homeland Security... every other alphabet agency are now watching us, scraping our phone calls and text messages and emails. I gave her a secure email she could use and a secure search engine other than Google she could use. She wrote it down.

The next day when I checked out I went to the wrong parking level to look for my vehicle. Standing right outside of the elevator a plain cloths security guy walked right up to me on my left and holding his finger right below his left eye gave a signal that "this is the guy to be watched." When he noted that I understood his signal, he kept his finger raised.. but raised his arm which made his finger point into his eye next to his nose and pretended he had something in his eye. Who did he think he was fooling? 

So why was he interested in me? Probably because I talked about the camera's and microphones who watched and listened to everything one says and does inside the hotel to the cashier at the restaurant. And, to show how they watch... about that time the parking lot cleaning guy (with an earpiece) yelled at me... "Hey! Isn't that your [vehicle] over there?" I answered, "No, it looks like mine but mine's a little different." That's when I realized I was on the wrong floor and went up to the next level and got the Hell out of there! But why would this guy know what type of vehicle I was driving? Its because the Security people upstairs record every vehicle and every person coming into the hotel and its parking lot. They were telling him to point me to my vehicle... but even they got it wrong as I guess they couldn't read the license plate of that vehicle parked at an angle. Oh well... they'll say its to make us feel secure. Yeah... that but its also so they can control you. They didn't have that kind of so-called security back in the 60's or 70's, etc. They still had crime back then... and with all their hi-tech boogie equipment there is STILL A LOT OF CRIME in Lost Wages. 

I won't be staying at the Paris Hotel & Casino anymore. In fact, next time I'm in Europe I won't even head to Paris! It's now turned into a toilet!

Paris hotel has a hint of a 19th Century theme, so don't expect it to be very "modern". It's more focused on the well known Parisian elegance and opulence. It has some ups and downs, for instance; in one hand the rates are fair, the newly re-modeled rooms are very spacious and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and helpful; at least the few I interacted with. On the other hand; the bad hand, cleanliness and upkeep is only a facade until you get to your room. In one of the stands in the room, there was a dried up fluid stain in the surface. In addition, the love-seat in the room had a 2-3 inch tear in the back rest. How long has that been there? no way to tell. The hotel seems to have a constant costumer tempo and shutting a room down for every minor repair is preposterous. However, a thorough cleaning before\/after a costumer is not too much to ask, is it? and how hard is it to stitch up a  torn fabric? Because of the lack of attention to detail is why Paris deserves a border-line three our of five.

This was our first time staying at Paris. We were pleasantly surprised with how nice it was. It's not a huge casino or anything, but has just enough of everything to keep everyone happy. And whatever else you may need, you're connected to the Ballys casino and hotel, and Planet Hollywood is a short walk next door, with their casino and Miracle Mile shops, plus across the street is the Bellagio, which is nice to watch the fountains. 
Our room was fantastic! We had a smoking room on the 27th floor, and it was so clean and smelled fresh, you would never know it was a smoking room at all. Their room service is 24 hours, and they serve breakfast all night too (my fave). The employees are friendly, efficient, and QUIET!! Those of you who have stayed in many hotels know what I mean....like when housekeeping lets the doors slam over and over as they clean throughout the day. Not here! We thought we were the only ones on the floor most of the time. 
Here's a tip: Pay attention to what elevator you are getting on, because they separate the elevators by floor levels. It was so nice to breeze by all the other floors straight to ours. You don't have to pass any lower levels. But we did laugh at the people that got on and stood there in a daze looking for their floor, LOL. Hysterical. 
There were plenty of restaurants nearby, or in the hotel itself. Do NOT miss out on a visit to Gordon Ramsay Steak, Ballys Sterling Brunch (Sundays only), Hexx bar and restaurant (24 hours), etc.
We stayed 5 nights which is plenty of time for a place to screw something up, but nope, it was perfect! I seriously would come back here on my next visit. They did no wrong in my opinion!

Where to begin? We had to move to FOUR different rooms, finally agreeing to settle in an outdated room. This hotel is in great need of a renovation. Not only is this hotel out of date, it is DIRTY! Our first room had urine in the toilet when we arrived. Another room had cracks and water stains on the ceiling and smelled like mold. There were stains all over the carpet and scuffs on the walls. We had friends coming in the following day (the only reason we didn't move) and their first of three rooms had bedbugs. The staff was extremely UNHELPFUL and RUDE... Their advice? "Stay somewhere else if you are not satisfied." TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. One night there was a man urinating in the corner of the hallway leading from the lobby to elevators. That same night, when we got back to our room and our room key didn't work so we used the hallway phone to call to the front desk... After 3 phone calls, security arrived almost an hour after our arrival to let us in. Another night we ordered room service and they got 2 of our 3 orders wrong.... We called to address the mistake and what did we get? Undercooked food. DISGUSTING!Room service was also a nightmare... Unless you are out of your room by 1PM, don't expect it to be cleaned even if you call and request it. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO MY WORST ENEMY. This is by far the WORST hotel I have ever encountered. Do yourself a favor, and book anywhere but here.

We stayed here for labor day weekend because the rooms were complimentry if you gamble enough with Total Rewards\/Caesers entertainment. 

When we arrived at 1 am on Friday night (or Saturday morning to be technical), there was a long check-in line that lasted about an hour. I was pretty tired and out of it from the 4 hour drive, so standing in line for another hour was not pleasant. I had made two reservations back to back on for the weekend and the lady at the check-in desk helped me check into both rooms so I didn't have to come a second time.

When I entered the room I didn't feel the Vegas glam that I normally get when entering a hotel on the strip. I'm talking about Bellagio, Venetian, Palazzo, and Wynn types of glam. The room was a little worn down from use over time. The wooden furniture was had visible damage and the leather headboard on the beds were deteriorating. We checked the linens to make sure they were clean, and to our surprise there was a fresh stain on the sheets. That grossed us out and we had to ask for a full service by housekeeping. 
The bathtub was stained and a bit disgusting as well. There was a cigar burn and also debris near the drain. I wouldn't recommend you use it to take a bath, maybe as a cooler if you're bringing a lot of drinks. 
The hotel rooms definitely need some renovations and I hope they do that soon.

There's a large casino for gamblers who play slots or tables. They have a nice selection of slots with some of the popular machines as well. The BlackJack table games on the other hand have some of the worst rules in Vegas. If you're a black jack player, the best place on the strip is Treasure Island. The double deck rules are a little better , but they still try very hard to gain an edge on the players.

Over all, the stay was pleasant and I would stay here again. Paris is nestled right in the middle of the strip, making it a very convenient stay for tourists and sightseers.

We stayed at the Paris because they claimed to be dog friendly. The front desk emplyee at registration was about as friendly and welcoming as a DMV employee on a Monday afternoon. No smile no personality and as stiff as a board. We told them up front that we had a dog, we paid extra because we had a dog, we were honest and responsible about every aspect of our reservation as one could, but she treated us as if our dog was going to destroy the room and proceeded to lecture us about what we would be responsible for should we cause any damage, even if they find something at any date even after we leave. Our dog is crate trained and we brought our crate, so as to make sure nothing happened while we were out of the room. 

We also booked a couple of hours for a relaxing visit at Paris Spa by Mandara. We booked a massage and facial package that included their three enzyme deep cleaning exfoliating treatment. My massage was good, but I have had much better. My wife specifically said that she wanted lite pressure and nothing that resembles deep tissue, but her masseuse had to be told several times to use less pressure. My wife said it was not relaxing at all. 
The facials were good, but save yourself the money and skip the three enzyme part, or better yet get a spa package elsewhere.
Really hoped for more. Not worth the extra dollars. Love the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant, but the hotel just didn't live up to my hopes.

I loved my stay at Paris. Before arriving to our hotel I thought it would be very run down since it is an older hotel on the strip, but to my surprise it was VERY well kept and there were no issues at all with out room unlike other hotels and casinos on the Strip. The hotel was Very comfortable and roomy. The bathroom was large, but not overwhelming, and the staff was great. 

The only 'cons' I have with the hotel is that their valet is VERY slow. I completely understand that there may be issues with staff calling out, etc, but when it take 20-30 mins for your car to be pulled out a garage, it seems a bit excessive. I would recommend they at least schedule more people on Sundays when they know most people leave Vegas. Just checking out, getting our baggage picked up by the bell-hop, and getting out valet car it took about an hour. 

Aside from this issue, I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again:)

Booked a king size room, got a room with two queens instead. Not what we asked for but i suppose they do say they cant guarantee your room type....not sure why that is...WiFi is 15 dollars a day...extremely overpriced especially when most modern day hotels offer it for free. .No tea or coffee making facilities, not really any television channels...unless you want to watch Chinese stations they have a bunch of those. Really not what we expected. The casino is nice though and the place downstairs selling $5 slices of pizza is pretty boss too. I suppose after staying in hotels that offer those free perks like wifi and coffee, iwas expecting that same quality, especially given the amount I paid to stay at the Paris hotel...but I guess it is Las Vegas and they want you on the gaming tables, not in  your room checking your emails.

I've never been to Paris, France but I can say I got a fake experience in Paris, Las Vegas. They do a good job of replicating landmarks that I've only seen in movies and on postcards. The arch de triumph and the Eiffel tower. Neon lights only go so far it's enjoyable to view architecture even though duplicated.

As some of my friends know, I'm not a fan of sleeping on a bed, that thousands of bodies have slept on. It's rated a four star hotel. The hotel itself, is remarkable and many different shops to choose from. A replica of Paris. We, my sister and I stayed here around the 3 of October. The occasion -State Farm Insurance nationwide convention. I  had the pleasure of being treated to a private  concert of Bon Jovi and Kool and the Gang. I spent my free time at the spa ,and visited another spa at the Monte Carlo.
Great Hotel when you get a good rate. Showing a little age but still a great place.

Since when do you sit at a $10 blackjack table and they change the stakes to $15?  OK, that happens.  But, don't they "grandfather you in" for the $10 for at least an hour?  

How about one minute?  

Get your bets in!!!  

Get my butt out!!!  

Bad Form.....

Below average in nearly every respect, but at $100 or less is fine.  At $150+ I'd give 1 star.. but $99 or less.. 2 stars. 

Took 10 minutes to valet car.  2 valets busy chatting, while 1 valet was trying to do a good job.  There was a line of 10 of us wondering what is going on.  Once we realized it was poor service, you could see eyes rolling of everyone waiting.  Car drive in is designed so once you are stuck in the lane, you cannot get out.  Self-park would have been better. 

"Only" a 5 minute wait to check in.  Non-Smoking room not given at check-in despite booking a non-smoking room perhaps 45 minutes before we checked in.

Phoned in for a rate and was told $350.  This was despite 4 room types being avalable via internet at $100-235.  WOW.  REALLY?  You want to charge me $350 for a $100 room, and not even offer the better rooms that you normally charge $235 for?  

Dated rooms & hallways.Beds are VERY UNCOMFORTABLE.  Old spring mattresses.  My wife said they were "lumpy".  This is my first experience with a lumpy mattress.. less than ideal.  No LCD TVs here.  

Dirty bedroom windows.  Had a view of the tower, but it was sort of disgusting.  No window washers here. 

Did not eat at steakhouse since it was packed.  Did not eat at Eiffel Tower restaurant either (did not see if it was packed).  Crepe station was fine with nice guys working there.  The bakery had good to-go options in the morning.  Did not eat at the buffet either. 

Older crowd comes here.  Think 50+ for 50% of the folks, 35-50 for 30%, and 22-35 for the other 20%

Casino isn't that crowded and the slower paced French theme is nice respite if you are into that.  

Please don't be the fool to pay $350 for a hotel room here.

We was there when they had a power outage that lasted over 14 hours and as a seven star rewards player I must say it was handled very poorly. No employees to show how to get out of the hotel stairway. Us and 4 other couples wondered down the stairs and into the basement as we couldn't find an exit out of the stairwell. Once we got out they wouldn't let us back in to get event tickets, jackets or anything for the evening. (this all started at 9:30am) We had to buy phone charger, jackets out of pocket and the only thing they offered in return was 50,000 reward credits. The next day a jack hammer from above room remodeling woke us up and the day after that we woke up to a hot room as the ac wasn't working. Won't be going back to another Caesars Vegas property, if this would have been a fire it would have ended very badly.
I agree with everyone else ... it's average; nothing spectacular, good price. . ... BUT if you are looking for an awesome breakfast buffet, PARIS is where it is at!

My stay at the Paris was amazing. We were upgraded to a suite for free without having to ask if an upgrade was available. The food options located inside the casino are great. They have a variety of options and the prices aren't too bad. The Eiffel Tower tour is amazing. It's a must to experience. 

The room was nicely furnished and it was very spacious and comfortable. The A\/C worked perfectly, the bed was comfortable, the shower was amazing. 

The location of the Paris is perfect. It's literally right in the middle of everything that's happening on the strip. This is my go to when staying in Vegas.

I attended a conference held here and stayed 4 nights. The conference facilities were adequate, and the hotel room was ok but quite outdated and a bit dirty. Housekeeping was inconsistent and problematic. 

The casino facilities are super depressing and sad. This place is, by far, worse than any Indiana or even Mississippi casino I have visited. The patrons are old and sad. The cocktail waitresses are old and sad. The decor is extremely artificial (in a bad way) and I couldn't wait to get to a place that didn't bring me down as much. 

The restaurants are no better. They should tear this craphole down to build something worth going to.

The best thing about this property is the location on the strip.  Very central to all the other casinos.  The property tries to go for the romantic,  European ambiance. The rooms can use a revamp, but comfortable. I used to love the buffet here because it has French favorites that other buffets didn't have but with the onset of mega buffets like bacchanal and wicked spoon, the buffet here just doesn't have that kind of quality or quantity. For nightlife, chateau is decent for a mid sized clubbing venue.

Its too bad to see all the low reviews for Paris. While I agree the place needs an update\/upgrade\/facelift (minus a star) the outstanding customer service is enough to keep me coming back. 

From the drive in you are immediately transformed to Paris and the minute you walk into registration you remember why you booked a room here. All the decor is very French even the restroom signs are in French. 

The hotel is smaller than the Venetians of the Strip but it offers better customer service an a more intimate experience. It's also nice to walk around without getting completely lost. 

The tables are $10 min during the day with plenty of open tables to go around. 

There is a great central bar that serves tasty cocktails. Go for happy hour to catch a good deal. 

Valet is free at the hotel. 

$20 resort fee includes access to their fitness center so take advantage if you can. 

The bed was super comfortable which was a nice surprise. 

Checkin and check out was a breeze. 

Every hotel employee we encountered was unbelievably nice and helpful.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! I had my $350 sunglasses stolen by house keeping. I've contacted security about the issue, but regardless - they have shady individuals going into your room with your things. I am unsure how the hotel is going to remedy this for me, and I sure hope they do ASAP. I have no problem contacting an attorney on this.

Aside from that, they need to work on refurbishing the rooms - I was in a suite and the wallpaper was peeling off in both bathrooms and the living area. Music in the elevators was mis-fitting for a "French-feel" hotel.

Stay here at your own risk.

My husband and I went on our wild getaway weekend we had a great time, the hotel was beautiful very breath taking. The casino was very fun great entertainment all around you. We had a wonderful dinner at the eiffel tower, the food was just perfect a bit expensive but it was all worth it. The only thing I didn't like about my stayed at the Paris hotel was the water temperature I had to leave the water running for 15min before it even got warm. I felt so bad wasting water but it was impossible for me to take a shower with freezing cold water. After that it was all good but besides that we had a wonderful time at this hotel!!

great location!---got a reasonable price thru my totalrewards card! ;)
nice, clean, roomy room!

gordon ramsay restaurant downstairs!!!
I don't think I've ever actually gambled here, but I do love coming here to walk through and look at the blue sky and fake effiel tower.  They have good restaraunts too.

I can't believe I have not written a review of this place with all the times we have stayed.  My wife loves this location in the middle of the strip.  I have stayed at Bellagio across the street for $300\/night and never saw the fountains.  Here it's under $100\/night and I have always had a great view of the fountains.  Inside the Resturants are  our morning go to for breakfast to start the day.  Casino is nice and there are always entertainment to watch.  The dueling piano bar at night is the place to relax before turning in.  If you get the chance to go to the pool under the Eiffel Tower it is a unique view to look up at it all.  LOVE IT

Very beautiful and the inside is very well thought out. The restaurant selection is good and nice shopping. This is a must stop and much nicer than what I heard about it. Didn't stay in rooms but heard they are not that top notch but seem like a good value.

I stayed here for a quick getaway with my husband. I was a little hesitant to stay here at first because the hotel is older, but a friend of mine said I would like it and he knows how particular I am with the hotels I stay at. 

We booked the burgendy room or red room? I can't remember, but it was a color! haha. We arrived around 10am and check in wasn't until 3pm but Bree (front desk girl) laced us up! We booked a high floor with a tower view, but Bree put us in a room with a tower view and a direct view of the Bellagio water show and a view of the strip. We loved being able to see all the city lights at night and watch the water show from our window. 

The room. Very modern and newly renovated. The room decor felt kind of sexy. It was clean and spacious. We only stayed a couple days so we didn't need housekeeping services. 

Minus 1 star because room service was bank! I ordered chicken alfredo pasta and water and the bill came out to be almost $50!! $47 and some change if I remember correctly. I was too hungry to care though.

The end.

Paris suffers the same plight of many strip casinos in that they are looking more than slightly dated. I did appreciate the short walk from the entrance to the elevators.  But that hardly makes up for horrible food at every restaurant we ate at and the hour and a half wait for a cold omelette and coffee from room service. I'm also sick of hotels charging $25\/day to use a gym that rivals a holiday inn express at anytown USA.  We asked for a humidifier and were given some contraption that had a bowl of water with a fan on top of it. We would have been just as good if we filled a pot with water. We wanted to stay an extra night and were told that's fine but there is no way we could keep that room. "It is already filled by someone else". We begrudgingly packed and went downstairs only to get our same room back. A little frustrating.  I think I'm just tired of the hotels that seem to "vegasy". The ugly carpet, trashy waitresses and constant ringing of slot machines. Hopefully more places will adapt the Cosmo\/aria style...

We have been in Vegas many times over the years and always stay on the strip.  We have stayed at the Paris hotel more than once but haven't been back for a few years.  We made the mistake of staying at the Paris this week.  We have a room with a great view of the strip on the 21st floor.  However, what we discovered on our first nite is that the Cosmopolitan Hotel across the street has outdoor rock concerts in their pool deck which is right on the Strip.  The volume is so loud that it literally vibrates the windows of our hotel room at the Paris.  The music does not stop until 2:00 AM.  There was another concert last nite and again tonight Thursday nite.  I called the Paris hotel manager and they said there is nothing they can do about it since there is no city ordinance prohibiting noise on the Strip.  I called the Cosmopolitan to complain and was told "Well you know you are in Vegas."  I called the Las Vegas police and was told there was nothing they could do since the hotel has a permit that permits these conferences to go on at that decibel level and to that hour if the morning.  Obviously I have a choice of what hotel to stay at and I will not be staying at the Paris ever again.  Hopefully with this review, people who might be considering the Paris hotel or any other hotel near the Cosmopolitan will think twice assuming they want to actually get some sleep after gambling and going to shows.  Shame on the Cosmopolitan Las Vegas management and shame on the Las Vegas Municipal Government for permitting this noise pollution in the middle if the night.

The entire casino and restaurant\/shopping area was absolutely stunning. I liked the outside as well because of the eifle tower and giant balloon which looked gorgeous lit up at night! The casino area was pretty small. I enjoyed dinner at Le ProvenÃ§ial (not 100% sure on spelling), the chicken penne pesto was outstanding. The buffet had a souvenir drink stand attached to it where I bought an eifle tower filled with piÃ±a colada and strawberry daiquiri, it was delicious and different from other places. I honestly just loved walking around inside because it was so gorgeous, next time I go to Vegas I'd love to stay here at least for one night.

The hotel interior is actually kind of cute. Rooms are decent looking but the mattresses are very outdated with being able to feel the metal springs. Pillows are filled with feathers and were also limp an worn out. My favorite part about this hotel is that they don't charge any resort fees which is pretty awesome. Rooms can have wifi for $13.99 a day if you choose. The housekeeping staff is very friendly and made sure we always had fresh towels. I never like leaving my room without the do not disturb sign and sometimes I have experienced housekeeping come on in anyways, but not at the Paris which again was very nice. Each morning they call us if we are out and leave a message saying they will bring up anything needed. This hotel is also located to my favorite poker room at aria of course. Only problem with the location is that there is nowhere to cross for pedestrians. Luckily a taxi cab is only about $6-$7 each way.
I like the theme. I lose here everytime i play. Same for my sister and my dad. Everytime!

Location: Fantastic. This is right in the middle of the strip, across the street from the Bellagio and next door to the Planet Hollywood shopping area.

Rooms: Good for the price that we paid. We went over Christmas and paid about $50 for the room only (+ $20 for the resort fee, below).

Additional Fees: You have to pay a $20 "Resort Fee" to use WiFi for one device only + get access (two passes per day) to the fitness center\/spa.

Fitness center\/spa: The fitness center was okay. There were several treadmills, a few elliptical machines, and several weights. I'm so glad that they had free weights and a few mats for yoga\/abs\/whatever. They also had tons of water. The "spa" area also had tons of water, some coffee, and some tea. Get a locker key and slippers from the front desk of the "spa" area. They had a dry sauna and a steam sauna, but both weren't very hot. There was also a jacuzzi. The resort fee is worth it if you use the WiFi a lot (which I had to, for work) and if you use both the fitness center and the saunas.

Restaurants: If you can't get a spot at Gordon Ramsey's Steak (or if you can't afford it), go to Mon Ami Gabi and see if you can get a table on the patio. Get the steak frites. Fantastic!

Rundown, cheap and it shows. They up sell harder and faster then a Vegas hooker.  Though the girl banging on the door across the hall at 5am cuz she couldn't get in and "had no pants" was pretty awesome but its Vegas that can happen anywhere. 

Je ne vais pas rester ici encore!
For the price, the rooms were old and run down.  Stayed a night during the weekday and wasn't impressed.

I guess I can be review #200 for Paris Las Vegas!!! 

Do I get complimentary rooms or something? If I do, will the owner please message me asap so I can hurry on back to Sin City! 

One thing I love about Paris is it makes you feel like your outside when your in the casino area! When you look up, you would have thought you were standing outside because the ceilings are sky blue and designed nicely. The replica Eiffel Tower is a thing of beauty at night. 

I still need to take the gf up the Eiffel Tower one of these days when I come back. It is pretty cheap to take the ride up the Eiffel Tower. Look for coupons and save yourself some gambling money! 

The rooms were simply everything one could ask for as they were very comfortable and spacious. Dont touch the fridge of goodies now, you dont want to pay $8 for a Gatorade do you!!?? 

Paris Las Vegas is also conveniently located right next to a shopping mall! The best Urban Outfitters is right next door and it is huge! (only because I found stuff I actually liked at this one)

I really enjoyed my stay at Paris Las Vegas!

I booked Paris lodging because Orbitz had a deal for flight & hotel. Learned my lesson. I'd rather pay full price next time than to stay at Paris again. Service was pretty rude; the lady who checked me in never made eye contact, mumbled something that I just nodded to, and just had this air of "you're inconviencing me with your presence." 

I had booked a King sized bed, but they gave us two Queens. I called to ask if it was a mistake and if I could switch. It turned out all the Kings were booked, and the only way I could get another room was if I moved the next day.  Again, the person who answered my call sounded SO irritated with my request. As if it were my fault that they messed up my room. I figured it wasn't worth it, so I didn't end up switching.

Housekeeping was also lacking.. we found hairs on the pillows!! So gross. 

And lastly, I find the staff's behavior towards tipping super obnoxious. We arrived before check in so had to leave our luggage with the doorman. He wasn't particularly friendly with us either, but kept implying that we should tip him. (We didn't.)

Ugh, never again.

Hotel is nothing to write home about but rooms are comfortable, with a bathroom that has a separate walk in shower and a tub.  There is plenty of counter space for 3 girls to share. The tables here have a higher limit that some of the other casinos but the decor of the Paris is nice and certainly transports you to another place.  It would have been nice to see some of those touches in the hotel rooms.  The hotel is connected on the casino floor with some shops and restaurants  then you run into Bally's.   Bally's also has a free shuttle over to the Rio hotel on the other side of the freeway.  

The restaurant in the Eiffel tower is very nice and the view of the Bellagio water show is fabulous.  Go up there and just get a drink in the lounge and get the view for free.  If you want to go up to the top you will have to pay.  

The hotel is centrally located so its a quick jump over to the Planet Hollywood Casino and the Mile Shops.  They have a deal with the buffets its $44. for a 24 hour pass which includes 6 different buffets in the area.  The one in the Paris is not the best service wise, food is pretty good but Planet Hollywoods and the Rio are great.  

Would certainly stay here again but for the price I think it should have been better.

While it may not be as new and exciting as The Cosmopolitan, The Paris Las Vegas Hotel is a staple on the Strip and always serves up a good deal.

Obviously, the location is PRIME. It's in the dead-middle of the Strip, so whether you're walking to catch Mystere up at Treasure Island or Ka at MGM, you won't be walking forever and ever, nor will you need to hop on a sketchy bus or take the Monorail. Plus, if you get a room that faces the Bellagio, you can watch the famous lights show right from the comfort of your staying room. All bonuses in my book.

I've stayed here two times and both times the staff was equally-friendly and helpful and the rooms were also clean, nice, quiet and spacious. The bathrooms are all recently renovated, which is certainly appreciated.

There's a huge casino and more than a handful of on-site dining options, ranging from grab-and-go to nice, sit-down meals. Additionally, there  are several shops and a gigantic outdoor pool at which you can occupy your time.

Tip: there is free Internet access in the cafe that's off the elevator bank on the main floor.

I am not even sure this rates one star.  This has been the very worst experience.  How can a hotel have NO BLANKETS?  No water, the AC doesn't work, the room is not clean.  My poor child just got to sleep and it is 330 am for him.  I am appalled that this is property is related to Caesars palace.  It is embarrassing.  What did the front desk manager say?  It's late, ma'am and we ran out of blankets...seriously?  But don't worry I am giving you a $100 food and beverage credit - OMG I get a food and beverage credit for not sleeping?  I just cannot even imagine that I am here!

I remember when this hotel opened up in 1999 and the Dorito girl, Ali Landry was one of their special guests.  Although it looks a bit run down now, Paris is still one of my favorites because there is plenty to do in there.  One of their main attractions is obviously the Eiffel Tower and the lines can sometimes be long.  I often get there during not so busy hours so the parking isn't that bad upon arrival.  There are tons of cool things to take photos of in this hotel so make sure you bring your camera.  Enjoy Paris!

I've never actually stayed at the hotel as the prices are usually a bit out of my range but this is, hands-down, my favorite place to visit on the strip.  I love the ambiance, the casino, and the staff.  I even overlook the fact that they have the worst drink service in the casino that I have seen in all of Vegas.

It is a cool hotel to visit and walk around and I make a trip over at least once a visit, if I can.

This theme hotel in the center of the strip has been getting tired over the years, however, they have been slowly updating. Stay in one of the updated suites, not bad. This is not the Venetian, which is my favorite, but certainly was not slumming it. The Hotel is small enough to be able to navigate with ease (unlike MGM and others). The location provides a great central location to take in all that Vegas has to offer.

It's just okay. Paris is a great location on the strip as its in the middle across from the Bellagio. The outside of the hotel is beautiful and the check in\/reception area gorgeous with giant chandeliers everywhere. Casino didn't seem any different or special from any of the other ones, in fact maybe a little smaller. 

The flooring thru out the downstairs is a faux cobblestone and makes it super hard to walk thru wearing heels since it's so uneven. The shops inside are nothing to write home about. The only place we got food from was their little walk up counter pizza place, which was open at 3am. Not sure if it was because we had been drinking and were starving, but it was GOOD. 

The rooms\/hallways need a serious update. Our room was very basic. Nice size bathroom. But everything just seemed dated. The wallpaper was peeling up in multiple spots and carpets seemed old. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and pool however. Some rooms have a Bellagio fountains facing view. Wifi password was never provided to us but I heard you can only have 2 people connect per account so be careful if you're in a large group. 

Over all it was just alright. It got the job done, and like I said location was good. I don't think I would be rushing back to stay here anytime soon, unless there was a great rate that other hotels weren't offering. I would like to stay somewhere a little more updated like Cosmo or Aria.
Ahhh it's ok     Look you're in Vegas so how bad can it be?  Everyone in our party got a suite except us!!!!!! Nothing special.. I prefer the hotel at man bay better.

We really enjoyed our stay at Paris. Check-in was really fast & easy with the express check in and customer service was great at the desk. (I believe his name was Jake- and his assistant's name was "Revenge".) He even remembered me by name two hours later and made me feel very welcome.

Having all of the elevator banks so close together made it really convenient for us to meet up with our friends that stayed on different floors. 

We paid a bit extra for the Red Room- and I wouldn't do that again. It was pretty much the same as the rooms our friends were staying in, only ours was red in color and had a larger television. All of the rooms have refrigerators, and pretty much the same setup.

Of course, the location is central, making it easy to get everywhere on the strip, plus the Deuce picks up right in front of Paris.

The pool area was fun and relaxing, with ambient music playing in the background. 

We will certainly return to Paris on one of our future trips!

I have stayed at Paris before a long time ago. This hotel is part of the Caesars Total Reward program so if you signup you we receive special deals on the hotel room charge. One of the things I love about this hotel is the interior design. When you are walking through the various food court and shops the ceiling is decorated like a sky and the walkway has cobblestone. They have done such a excellent job of recreating the Paris environment it is like be transported to Paris. 
As a guest the rooms are pretty nice with nice bedding and soft pillows and it is kept pretty clean and updated. The check in area is truly beautiful with high ceiling chandeliers and marble flooring. I love the fact that you stay at this hotel you are eligible for a discount to ride up the Eiffel Tower; which the view is truly amazing and it is a great opportunity to take some fantastic pictures. When you see the Eiffel tower it is very iconic and it is amazing that they had done such a marvelous job replicating it. 
The gambling here is very not bad the floor is of midsize and it has a more dimmer scenery and has very laid back vibe to the room. I myself love the fact that Gordon Ramsay's Steak house is located in this hotel. I highly recommend looking at my review for Ramsay's Steak house so you can see the menu and some wonderful pictures of the type of food that is available there in addition to their steak specialty. 
So back to walking around the shops, it is just stunning everytime I go there I can't help peeking into some of the shops and the bakery. I hope on my next visit to actually in eat some of the smaller shops that offer sandwiches in which you would find in Paris with the traditional baguette and cheeses. 
The location of the Paris Hotel is on a prime spot on the Las Vegas Strip. If you are looking to get a feel of Paris but can't afford to go to Paris then this is the next best thing and you can have a chance to go up the Las Vegas Eiffel tower. The details will amaze you and the service you receive from the employee's welcoming and they provide fantastic service.

The Paris hotel is pretty cool.  It's probably middle of the pack as far as niceness goes.  Though it's a nice hotel, you can find nicer at the Wynn, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Venetian, etc.  But it's a nice place and it's pretty affordable for what you're paying for.  I haven't had any food in here but the hotel itself is nice and clean and very comfortable to stay in.  It's also located in the middle of the strip so it's highly convenient.  
I also went on the Eiffel Tower ride at the Paris and though it affords a spectacular view of Las Vegas, for having been up the real Eiffel Tower, it's a little disappointing and not at all the authentic Parisian experience.

Meh place, but it was the cheapest and best located decent hotel to stay.
If you can afford it, try the newer hotels.

I've been coming to Vegas for over 20 years, but somehow never made it to Paris. We booked our stay here as part of a festival we were attending, then after reading some recent reviews, I was a little worried. We arrived a bit early, but our room was ready. Plus: you don't have to walk a mile, zigzagging through the casino with your bags to get from registration to the guest rooms. In fact, although it's right there, you don't have to go in the casino at all. We arrived at our room, our keys worked, everything was clean and welcoming. Unexpected bonuses: in-room refrigerator and free wifi for 2 devices. Late night orders from room service were yummy and served with a friendly smile and conversation. Only two cons I can think of: the marble bathroom floors and shower are VERY slippery. Also, despite a Do Not Disturb sign on the door, housekeeping CALLED to see if they should clean the room. (*yawn* - no, thank you. We're going back to sleep now...) - EDIT: 3rd con for the ladies: showers have horrible water pressure. If you've got long hair, treat yourself to a blowout & avoid the frustration ### -  Because it was mentioned by so many others: Yes, they are doing construction. BUT, there was a note in our room that if we felt it would be a bother, they would relocate us to a quieter area of the hotel. We stayed put, and the little noise we heard was really not that bad. Merci, Paris!

This hotel is in need of an extreme makeover. The room is just okay. The tv is as deep as my arm, there is warm empty mini bar just taking up space, only a few hangers, no luggage rack or any place to put our suitcases since the closet is an armoire and is too shallow. First impression not good... More when we leave.

This was the first time we stayed at the Paris hotel. We loved it here. The room was awesome! They felt clean and lots of room. The bathroom was huge and I loved the decor. The beds were so comfortable, thank goodness no lumpy beds. If I had to complain about anything, it would be that the crepes window doesn't stay open 24hrs! Had a little trouble with our tv signal but nothing major. Will definitely stay here again.

Love love love!
I received a 2 night comp at Paris; I usually stay downtown but I couldn't resist, free (less resort fees), I liked it!
I arrived early but was able to pre-check in from my phone; then received a email when my room was ready, at 11:00 am!
My stay was excellent; rooms are great, comfy mattress and check out was such a breeze, just did everything from my phone then dropped the keys off.

This casino totally ripped me off. I strolled over there with friends for a two glass o' wine lunch.  Afterward, we walked out and there were all these vending machines where you put money in and more money is supposed to come out.  Welp, none came out. I did get a free drink from it. But that free drink cost me $45. WTF?

This is my favorite hotel in Vegas.  Maybe I'm sucker for their theme (which is executed beautifully), but the rooms were amazing, always clean, and the service is wonderful.

The Casino floors don't even feel smoky, and the lobby ceilings are beautiful.  From the "street" performers to the little details, Paris is by far my favorite hotel...anywhere.  Make sure you check out the club and the prime rib.  It's amazing.

Me and my wife stayed at the Paris Hotel on 9\/4\/17, over night.  As we entered the casino and found the check in for our hotel stay, we stood in line for approximately 45 minutes and there were only maybe 10 persons in front of us.  It felt as though we were at the DMV, due to wait and the unfriendly demeanor of the staff behind the check in section.  The staff gave off a vibe that they hated their jobs and people.  Customer service is definitely not a priority at the Paris Hotel Casino!  We have stayed in almost every major Hotel on the Strip and we have lived here over 40 years.  We have had great customer service in all the other Hotels.  We have worked in the customer service field for many years and being friendly and inviting is part of most jods.  If the staff is carrying that type of attitude , I wonder if the heads of the Casino are the same, or just making the staff hate their jods. We will not EVER stay at the Paris Hotel Casino again and will discourage others from doing the same.   What a shame!!

We didn't stay in one of their rooms but while walking around, we came across The Paris Hotel.

It was nice to explore the Paris themed hotel. They had some cute shops and restaurants inside. There is a spa in here as well, along with a Eiffel Tower Experience which gives you a 360 degree view of the city.

this review is on the casino grounds & parking lot, casino, total rewards desk (customer service), Eiffel Tower observation deck, and bathroom near the total rewards desk.

A good-sized casino with carpet and cobblestone floors (neat, if you're wearing flats or athletic shoes, not so much if you're in heels or boots). It's a fair amount of walking from the garage to the heart of the casino. We saw lots of restaurants and little shops along the way. Busy crowd but not jam-packed when we visited sunday afternoon.

I had my husband sign up for the Total Rewards Card since entry to the Eiffel Tower on my birthday was free (sunday), so was our son (no strollers BTW), and after all the taxes & fees, paid $16.00. Not bad, since two of us were free (it does cost more during the evening). The tickets are in the gift shop. Take the escalator. Then, you take pictures which you can view later on. This was our 1st time there as a family. (The last time was on our 1st date, in 2004.) The elevator was a minute and 17 seconds, according the to the attendant. Nice views during the day, with little rectangular cutouts at certain vistas, so you don't get the fence railing. 

While my husband was in line (was a busy line), we went to the bathroom (there was no visible changing station and the only handicapped bathroom was occupied, so yes, I changed him standing up (but I'm starting to get used to that!) The sinks are so pretty, floral porcelain (I don't think I've ever seen that in a casino). 

It was sunday and lots of employees were wearing their football jerseys, including the cocktail waitresses. 

Once you are outside the property, it's walking distance to the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops, which you guessed, was our next stop.   

It'd been a long while since we were at this property.  Overall, it's very nice. Not that smokey, either.

I have to say, I really really enjoyed the room we stayed in.  Great view, comfy bed, really enjoyed the soft comforter and down pillows.  Sleeping in was very nice and I liked the bathroom, although the tub dripped and that was annoying.

However, they gave us guff for wanting a late check out (they didn't know their bookings for the next 12 hours but would be more than happy to charge us $70 to stay past 1:00).  The casino leaves a bit to be desired (not enough half-naked dancing girls for my liking and the slots ate all my damn money).  Also, I ordered room service one night and got FOOD POISONING!  The food was almost rotten and it was all cold.  I know it was 2:30 in the morning but for crying out loud there's a 24 hour cafe in the hotel and there is simply no excuse.

Also, the walls are thin in the hotel.  We could hear the kids next door screaming the entire time.

Probably not staying here again, though it was fairly enjoyable.

Paris is a nice looking hotel, its really cute but when it comes to the room itself, its a different story.

We got upgraded to the Red Room which features a more modern decor but the thing about the room that we got, which was at the end of the hall was that there wasn't any hot water, the room was SMALL, and the internet was EXTREMELY slow. When i say slow i mean lets wait 5 minutes for a page to load type of slow.

The service was mediocre but the manager, Nate to whom we addressed our concerns, gladly refunded the internet access, comped the upgrade and offered to help book our next night in a different hotel.

My suggestion? Stay at PH next door.

Overall:
Room: C
Service: B

Paris is always our go to hotel when we stay in Vegas. Its clean, friendly and doesn't smell of smoke everywhere like other hotels. This last trip started out as a bad experience, we couldn't check in early like we were told and then when we were able to we were down graded to two queen beds instead of the king we ordered. We had reserved two rooms that were supposed to be kings. My parents room was fine however my fiance and mine had a broken shower. Once we noticed it we immediately notified maintenance we were waiting for them for an hour and a half. Finally we had to leave the room in order to make it to our ceremony, we stopped by the front desk and talked to the manager Ezra. He was FANTASTIC,we explained the situation and he immediately upgraded us to one of their remodeled suites. When we returned to the hotel from our  ceremony we picked up our new keys and moved into the new room. The remodel and suite was gorgeous! This turned our experience around. The only reason this is 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the lack of urgency from the maintenance department and on the day of check out we learned the minibar sink did not work in the suite. (This is a non issue since there were two other sinks we could use but should be noted.) Overall I will still make Paris my go to hotel in Vegas as long as their cleanliness and hospitality stays up!

We didn't stay here but we did walk through a couple times, we really like the ambiance and the feel of being in Paris on a spring day. We ate at the cafe inside and enjoyed the atmosphere while walking around, it was warm and cheery while being on the casino floor.  The location on the strip is great, it's right in the middle of everything and walk away from everything in them middle of the strip. It's located next to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shopping center. These properties are part of Caesars, along with many other properties.

I didn't know what to expect when I first booked the room, but it turned out to be better than I expected. I booked a Luxury Room with double queen beds.
I'm glad that they held the room the whole day, because I got there way later. 
It's also great that they have fulfilled all my requests!

The room was not too small. The bathroom was great. It has a bath tub and a shower separately. 
The room was also clean. The front desk service was especially awesome, because they gave me a complimentary late check out. Thank goodness, because it was much needed hahah!

The only thing that I would consider cons are the windows and the position of the TV. I wish the flat screen TV would be placed in the middle of the wall between the two beds. The windows cannot be open all the way, so there is just a small crack at the bottom. 

Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Paris Las Vegas. The staff were also friendly and courteous.

Location is great.

Free upgrade to a room with a view was pretty sweet.

View of Eiffel tower and Bellagio watershow is visually awesome.

If you're a light sleeper, though, bring ear plugs.  The Bellagio watershow sounds like mini-explosions through the glass.  

Who knew you need that much force to push a column of water high into the air??

Pros: good location, affordable, nicer than the other affordable mid strip options, many food options in the hotel, one solid restaurant, clean, surprisingly super comfortable beds, experienced nothing but great\/friendly staff
Cons: rooms are outdated, paris theme is a bit corny, dead at night, pool area is "plain", there were long lines every time we were in the cafe. 
It's not 4 star hotel, but it's 4 stars for what it is... A mid level hotel on the strip.

I'm not a high roller, but I spend a lot of time and MONEY in Vegas.  I stay at a couple of casinos all of the time but my wife said we should give Paris a try. 

We booked our room well in advance for one king size bed. When we checked in just after 4:00 PM on a Tuesday afternoon the "Cranky Lady" at the front desk almost made me turn away and go to my usual hangout. There were no rooms available at that time with a king bed, when I asked when one will be ready she told me 2 - 3 hours. I asked why and she said "I don't work in housekeeping so I have no clue why". At my business that would be an immediate escort to the front door with a loud "YOU ARE FIRED" She needs to learn how to smile and treat customers with respect. We took a room with two queens so we did not have to wait.

The room was "Just OK" 4 out of 10.  The room, however, smelled strongly of cleaning detergent, the toilet would not stop running and there was mold in the bathroom. This place needs a serious upgrade.

Here's what I say, First Impressions are a must and the front desk here FAILED!!!!! I spend a lot of money in Vegas and going forward it won't be at this place.

Paris needs to get their act together.

This review is very late In coming - almost 2 years late. We went to Vegas for labor day weekend a couple of years back. We were 3 of us and had booked a room with 2 queens. We reached there almost around midnight of the day of booking and found that our room was given away. The management then apologized and gave us the PRESIDENTIAL SUITE. I believe that's what it was called.it was luxurious. Had a master bed with king, a beautiful living space, a royal bathroom as big as the entire suite itself, a great view of the strip, statue of liberty and the bellagio fountains beyond it. It was luxury at it's best. We had come to Vegas after completing arches and Zion national parks and the plush beds and jacuzzi were perfect for our sore bodies.

Overall rating is more like a 3.5 stars out of 5.

Now I know with all the reviews I've posted about the different restaurants and places I visited while in Vegas it was only a matter of time before I posted a review about where I laid my head while in Vegas. Well YC Paris Las Vegas was the winner for my first time trip.

Okay first I'm going to discuss the check-in process. Now the check-in process was quite smooth, as long as you have the card used to book the hotel and photo Identification. But the thing I didn't care was their $25 plus tax early check-in fee that is applied to the final room charges if you decide to check-in early, which my wife and I did, because we didn't want to be sitting around waiting since we got in earlier than expected. Sigh.

Just so you know they do allow smoking in the casino area. I personally don't have anything against smoking but I just don't like it when my clothes smell like smoke, I hope that Paris gets whatever MGM Grand has because whatever they have you can barely smell smoke in that casino.

Okay now I'm going to discuss the actual room. I was a bit disappointed when I entered our room because since I payed additional money to get the next upgraded room I assumed that our room would be that much better from there standard rooms. However, I mistaken, although the room was quite spacious it honestly didn't feel like much of an upgrade. Also I felt that I was a bit misguided by their website because this upgraded room was suppose to have an all red lips love seat but when I entered the room this thing was brown. Not what I was expecting at all. The decor of the room did match the theme of the hotel (Which by the way is pretty cool. People were taking pictures of the decor of the main casino area because of the Paris decor) but I felt it still needed some sort of mild makeover.

Some of the things I did like were that the rooms were cleaned everyday. Also the maids were quite patient with us being that we would always leave out of the room later than the maids expect so they would always ask us if we would like our room cleaned, and if so how long my wife and I needed to get ourselves together. No matter if it was 30 minutes or 1 hour they would return after that to clean our room. Also the our room itself was in an excellent location because not only was the view of Las Vegas Nevada breathtaking from our room but it is also right across the street from the Ballagio and if you are lucky enough like we were you could see portions of the Ballagio water show from the room. In addition to that I enjoyed that our hotel was connected to Bally's because, that hotel housed two restaurants that I enjoyed visiting and would absolutely visit again when I go back and they are Le Burger and the Tequila Bar.

I think Paris is a decent hotel and I would go back again but I will make an effort to try other hotels before making this the hotel of choice when visiting Vegas.

I stayed there this weekend with the date and we had a really good time. I did the upgrade, and they gave us this great room with a spa tub, and everything about it was pretty clean (one of the chairs had a slightly noticeable stain on it, but that's all). The room was huge, probably larger than we should have stayed in, but it was fun.

I actually enjoyed coming here with her, especially since I'm kind of tired of coming to Vegas and got to see it with someone who isn't tired of it. Paris is about the right size for one of these theme casinos -- not too large, not too small -- so it's easy to walk around and conveniently located across the street from the Bellagio and their water show for the turistas.

Some of the restaurant choices are kind of weird (outside of the Eiffel Tower restaurant, which really isn't French, there isn't a French restaurant here), but for the most part it's a fun place. 

The coolest part is some of the random music acts they have off the casino -- very classy and elegant for a place that doesn't always have a classy and elegant crowd.

I didn't get the room that I booked online! I paid extra for Eiffel view room but I get the back tower view then I went back to the lobby but they said we don't have anymore Eiffel view. omg I booked the room 1 month earlier and I checked in at 4.30 pm.. there was no way to have no more room. This is ridiculous hotel.

Paris is beautiful and elegant just like the Venetian is. We came to this hotel to eat at Le Burger Brasserie Sports Grille. Check out my review of that place. It was a nice sports bar with great food.

I love everything about Paris except staying there.  The beds are worse than the beds were at Motel 6 in the 1970s.  The bedding is course, scratchy and thin.  The mattress is one of the least comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in.

Stay elsewhere but go enjoy Paris for the food and atmosphere.

This review is for Le Cafe, by the pool.  Fair prices.  My eggs were mediocre but my friend really liked her pancakes with mascarpone cheese.  The setting was nice, outside by the pool.
The pool didn't look to be too happening, so we didn't stay.

Came here during the week on a Monday.

Pros:
Great location in the heart of the Strip.
Great decor that tries to evoke a kitschy France.
Clean room.

Cons: 
Not the largest or most impressive casino floor, pretty small actually. 
Restaurants not up to par, i.e. fake ass French restaurant.
Front desk staff that are pretty clueless when checking your reservation.

The hotel was okay. My room was clean, but did show wear and tear if you looked closely. TV was off-set form the bed, which was weird. My door was hard to open at times. Shower had a strange smell from the drain. Very loud from the hallway. Bed was comfy.

Casino was dark, but the painted ceiling kind of helped make it seem more open. The shops walkway was narrow but interesting. I'm not a fan of people or crowds, and not having any room to navigate through people was very annoying. Wanted to try Le Village Buffet, but it had an hour long wait, even with a reservation.

Check-in was easy if you do it online. I walked right up and got my room keys, meanwhile, everyone else was waiting in the very long line. They looked pissed at me like I cut the line or something. But that's their loss for not researching a bit further to save time.

I stayed here because it was cheap, $175 for two nights with the total rewards. However, next time I will probably go somewhere a little more up to date.

The rooms are poopy. 

There is no cable television, the shampoo was latherless and the conditioner wasn't much better. The rooms are on the tiny\/cramped side and the soda machine only took singles.

These may not seem like big issues but when you're nursing a massive hangover and barely alive you need:

A comfy room- to nurse yourself back to "functional" 

A satisfying shower - because they always make you feel 90% better.

To stay hydrated- When you can barely make it to the bathroom, going down to Casino Level is not an option. The soda machine by the ice machine is your only hope. When you make the exhausting trek down the hall only to have your $5 bill rejected by said soda machine, well that's just a whole new level of pain.

Entertainment- this is where the TV comes in. You may not THINK you'll spend enough time in your room to care, but you will. When every fiber of your body (including your hair) aches and your bound to your sickbed until your "second wind" comes around, entertainment is indispensable. I'm not picky, I don't need premium cable. A TBS movie marathon would suffice but Paris Hotel offers only Vegas tourist info TV and about 20 random channels in Korean:  

My hangovers and I will stay elsewhere from here on out, but I'll probably still come here pre-hangover to drink and gamble since I do really dig the casino...

I stayed here this past week from Tuesday-Thursday. Paris has quite a few of restaurants and little shops inside. It is in the middle of the strip, right next to the Miracle Mile Shops, across the street for the Mirage, the perfect location. 

The rooms were pretty average to me. Nothing too special, nice big counters in the bathroom, decent beds, nice bathrooms. We never heard any noise in the hallways or from any other rooms which was very nice!!!

The casino isn't too big, between 4 of us we gambled maybe about $5 the whole time we were there. Room Service is SLOW! We wanted to order a bowl of Frosted Flakes and a bagel with cream cheese and they said it was going to be 45 minutes to an hour!!!!!!!! So we opted out. The next morning we made time for room service and it was quite tasty and just as expensive as most room service's. 

We booked our room through Expedia.com and got a pretty good price. I would stay here again if I got the chance.

I stayed at Paris for one night. The hallways were filthy and my room was not much better. I am checking out and was shocked to see a $40 resort fee plus $18 for parking!!  This is outrageous!!  This hotel should be no more then 3 stars. I will never stay here again.

Ive come here two years in a row now for Affiliate Summit West conference.  The hotels rooms definitely need a face list.  Some fresh paint and new furniture. Everyone else in Vegas is doing makeovers and this place definitely needs one. The service is okay but it definitely could be better all around from from desk to even the people taking drink orders. We did have one of the larger suites for a couple of days to have meetings, definitely huge suites but again. The rooms are just plain and old.

Well....the rooms are small, staff was o-kay, and the casino sucked. The rooms looked clean, but didn't feel clean. The beds were sooooo hard. I woke up hurting every morning and it wasn't because of the drinking. And charging $15 for Internet? Ridiculous!  I won't be staying here again.

I stayed at Paris for a convention and it was really a terrible experience for one reason... the air. The air quality was so bad that when I got back to the Bay Area, I was having asthma problems for almost a week. The air was so heavy with smoke that I had to wash my clothes a few time to make the smell go away. 

The staff was decent but not very helpful. The rooms were clean, quiet and decently sized but had a funny odor. I would not stay here again. 

Also, on a previous trip, when I was in town and dined at the Paris' Eiffel Tower Restaurant, I was informed that the valet bashed up my Mercedes SL550 Roadster Rental Car while I was eating. They gave me a limo ride back to the Wynn where I was staying and took care of all the repairs but it left my boyfriend and me without a car on my last night in town for that trip.

I have to preface this by first stating two things, one- I am a bit of a hotel snob and two- I hate Las Vegas. There. I said it. 
Now on to my review of the Paris Hotel where we spent two horrid nights this last weekend... 

the down low: 

- dated tube TV with none of the following: Bravo, E, MTV, TLC, and of course no movie channels so no HBO, etc. I settled on CNN most of the weekend... :\/ 

- uncomfortable beds, THIN, scratchy sheets which forced me to wear my jeans to bed as I had only brought some cute little bed short shorts to sleep in.. also, the other reviews which mentioned hairy sheets were correct, I found multiple hairs that were neither mine nor my husbands. :( 

- rubber mat under the bed sheet. no further explanation necessary, this was just plain gross and uncomfortable. 

- thin stretchy bath towels. After I dried off from taking a shower (with super low water pressure I might add!), I had red splotches all over my skin which I still don't know whether was from the heavy duty bleach Paris uses or just because the towels were so rough. Either way, we longed for our own towels at home.. 

- stained carpet, sticky folded complimentary Las Vegas magazine to peruse on the night stand. yuck. and p.s. the Las Vegas mags are free, they can't supply fresh ones for new guests??
