- horrible toiletries. they smelled gross and felt even worse. the only one I tried was the shower gel which smelled of a sickly baby powder scent and felt very gelatinous on my skin. I think the label red "white tea"? not even close. 

Needless to say, our hotel experience left us trying to change our flights home one day early. Instead we hightailed it out of there early Sunday morning and got on the earliest flight home.. our original departure was scheduled for Sunday evening. 
I should also add, that our rooms were paid for by my mother-in-law and I know she got them for quite a deal.. but srsly?? One star is generous...

I've stayed here twice, last year and this past weekend (Thurs-Mon). The rooms were clean and we had great views of the strip, both times. They treated us well each trip and the eats are pretty good here (just a little on the high side at HEXX).  Now the minor issues; the lady that checked me in had zero personality.  Her face would crack if she smiled.  The hotel is a bit worn in and the casino machines are far from loose, but the hotel felt safe.  One can always try their luck next door at Ballys or PH.

hotel itself is relatively new so, it is very clean and non-smokey...even in the casino area of the hotel.  it's centrally located and has very convenient access in\/out.  our elevators to the room were relatively close to the front doors unlike caesars where you could walk for days and get lost before finding the right doors...

as sarah t mentioned, the floors are a little hard to walk on with heels...especially my louboutin stripper heels...designed only to look cute...just walkable out the hotel,  to the car (valet of course) and then to the restaurant =)

there are nicer hotels on the strip, but for the price, location, and convenience...i will be back

I LOVED this hotel. I think some updating would be great, but the decorations and food options in the hotel were great. I really loved walking though Paris and seeing everything it had to offer. The casino was also nice and I didn't notice the smoke like I did in other casinos. The dealer at my table was also very nice when I played Black Jack for the first time. It's located in a great area on the strip. Like other hotels, it has a designated area for Uber.

Uhh.. I didn't stay at the hotel here, so this only pertains to the food.

I went to the buffet here... by the way I got in for free which makes
it like 20x better, I had lamb, prime rib, assortments of different sweets...

but what really did it in for me was the CREPES...
I had to try every single flavor\/ combination\/ whatever~!!!

I never felt so full in my life.

I was excited about staying at Paris because I found a really good deal on our stay and it's right smack in the middle of the strip.  The rooms were ok, nothing special.  The drain for the shower was clogged so that was annoying.  One thing that they didn't have that I thought was an essential was a coffee maker.  One thing I liked about the hotel was their swimming pool.  Although nobody really swam in it, it was a nice area to just hang out.  I'd happily stay here again if I found a great on it, but if I had to pay $200\/night, I'd be extremely disappointed!

Total dump.  The Venetian and The Palazzo ripped this place off which was smart.  Totally run down and needs a face lift.  They have these stupid eiffel tower drinks.  Bad idea.  They use vodka and rum from plastic gallon bottles. Welcome to your hangover.

I've stayed here twice. The first time was years ago when it first opened, when everything was new and fresh. 

The second time was just after New Years, earlier this year. The property is showing its age, and the rooms are in definite need of an update. They still have box TVs as well as pillows that are super hard and pretty gross from years of built-up grime. Seriously, the pillows and beds were my biggest complaint. They were so uncomfortable!!

But the saving grace of this place is its location and price. If all you need is a cheap place that's in the center of it all, then stay here. I paid $75\/night mid-week. Anything over that would not be worth it, in my opinion. This is a 2.5-3 star property in terms of aesthetics, and that's why it's consistently one of the least expensive 4+ star hotels.

If you're looking for a great hotel with a tasteful clientele, this is not it. I think it's worth paying more for a nicer spot, like the Wynn or Bellagio. I will admit that I'm a bit of a hotel snob.

This review is incredibly long and detailed, but it's important to note how horribly I was treated as a guest. I was in Las Vegas for work this week and my place of work had booked us to stay at Paris 4\/26-4\/29. I had never stayed at this hotel before, but had stopped in on prior trips to Vegas. I had had no issues with this place (or any other hotel in Vegas) before. I had been given a non-smoking room, and so I left my hotel room at 2am on 4\/28 to smoke a cigarette. I went outside by valet and was there only for the amount of time it took me to smoke, 10 minutes tops. I ran into a coworker who was on his way out and talked to him for less than a minute before he hit the strip. I did not converse with anyone else. I went back inside a minute later and headed straight back to my room. When I was making a turn for the elevator, I was stopped by three security guards. The first thing that was said to me was, "We noticed you were outside for awhile." I told them I couldn't have been outside for more than 10 minutes. They asked for my ID, which I happily gave to them. Then they asked me my name and if I was staying there. I complied. Then they radioed in, saying, "We have a woman here. She claims to be staying here." I am not paraphrasing. They got a response, I can only assume verifying that I was. They still asked which room I was staying in and for proof of my room key. If you're thinking they assumed I was a hooker, you are correct. Not that this SHOULD matter, but I was wearing a pair of converse with a simple skirt and had a completely zipped up hoodie on. Nothing even remotely suggestive about my clothing. I fully recognize that there are a lot of prostitutes working the casinos, but even if they suspected me of that, this could have been handled a lot better and I was upset. I approached the hotel manager, Eric, the next night when I was done with work. He called the head of security, Brian, into it since it was an issue with security. A coworker stood with me throughout this, outraged at how I had been treated. I gave a detailed account of what happened and Brian said he'd review the tapes based on my account. I got an apology from both of them, but not an offer for anything further without my coworker asking. Eric said he would see to it. They both noted my hotel room # and said that they would be in touch with me. Brian never got in touch with me. Eric did, however. I was not in my room when he did, but he left a message saying he thought that Brian had talked to me, and that he wanted to do something for me and if I could not call him back while he was still on shift, that he would leave a note on my room account. I checked out the following afternoon with a woman at the front desk named Arely. I mentioned that Eric had left a note, she went in the back to take care of it. When she returned, she handed me a new bill. I politely asked if she found out what the note was about. She explained that I had been given a $50 credit, but because I had only charged $35 in room service, I was being credited $35. I never raised my voice. I did tell her I knew this wasn't her fault, but I didn't think that was fair. I asked for Eric's business card so I could get in touch with him personally. She returned to the back, returned a minute later saying no, he didn't have a card. Seriously? The manager doesn't have a business card? BS. The head of security handed me a card the night prior. So I asked, "The only way I can get in touch with him is by calling the front desk and hoping that he's working?" And she said, "Yes." Sweep it under the rug. This place absolutely does not care about how they treat their guests and I will absolutely never be stepping foot into this place again. No disrespect to the rest of the staff I dealt with, they were great. But this was beyond ridiculous. I have never been treated so poorly anywhere as a guest.

I go to Vegas every year for my anniversary and have tried most of the casinos on the strip. I wanted to like it, I love the theme resorts. But service was pretty rude from beginning to end. 

We paid for a red room luxury booking, when we checked in they didn't have any available.  When we asked why it wasn't reserved, the concierge rolled her eyes and lectured us on how she's doing her best to accommodate us. Um, that doesn't explain the lack of reservation at all, but great deflection and attempt to make us out to be the problem. At the very least I would expect an apology for not having it, instead of acting like we're unreasonable for expecting our reservation to be reserved. They offered us a downgraded room. When I objected, she said she did have a red room luxury available, but only a smoking room and we booked a non-smoking. I didn't want to get less than what we booked and paid for so I took the smoking room. Her explanation, after trying to get us to take a lower room, was that the smoking vs. non aspect of the reservation isn't guaranteed, only the room type. She didn't even offer us our room type though until I said no to the downgrade and asked for something else.

She also said the room was ready according to the maid service, but when we went up to our room the cleaning staff were still working on it. We had to hang out awkwardly while they were still mopping the bathroom. There were no snacks or drinks stocked though the fridge was wired up for that, and no robes. I wonder if maybe these things were missing because the maid felt hussled out of there by our presence or if these things just aren't included anymore. These are standard niceties that I've had at all my other casino stays even in the lowest room types, so it just felt shabby booking a more expensive nicer-level room and not having any of these things. I think in the future I would recommend only booking the cheapest room type so that they can't possibly downgrade you if they don't have your reservation available.

Beware of the new $25 "guest fee" they tack on now on top of the $11 booking fee. Told it was a new corporate policy they started last summer for all the Las Vegas hotels in the Harrahs chain. The hotel and rooms are very nice but i can't stand the feeling of being ripped off by yet another corporate scheme to make money.

My first time in Vegas and I really thought it could have gone better hotel-wise.  I don't know why, but I thought Vegas hotels were more guest oriented .  Bottom line: service and staff SUCKED!  The hotel itself was lovely and I really enjoyed the decor.  The fact that it is done up inside with the cobblestone streets, wrought iron and blue skies were nice.
Location: right in the middle of the Strip across from the Bellagio fountains.  Great!  
The room: Nice.  I had a red room, so a little more modern than the older blue rooms.  The beds were comfy and the bathroom was pretty big with a stand up shower and separate tub.  The AC for some reason didn't make the room all that cool and it didn't have a fridge which would have been nice.  
The worst: my room was next to a house keeping closet, so every morning at 7:30 the banging would start.  The housekeepers would roll out their carts and the door would slam behind them every 2 freakin' minutes!!!!  The second morning I just couldn't take it and asked that something be done.  They gave us another room, but gave us a time limit to get out of our current one and didn't even apologize!  I was shocked. 
The food: not that great for the price.  Actually, it's all pretty much crappy hotel food even in the nicer restaurants.  The steakhouse was eh and the service was awful.  The asian place was also forgettable.  
Nightlife: the club, Risque, also not great, kinda lame.  Much better clubs elsewhere.  The cocktail waitress in the Cabaret was awful.  She did not come to our table once.  She preferred to chat with another staff member over by the bar, so don't even bother going there if you're thirsty.  The hypnotist show was pretty funny though, dirty humor.  
No luck with the gambing.  No wonder most of the machines are deserted.
Shopping: no good shops.  You're better off going to the Miracle Mile at PH next door.
Pool: The pool was kind of small for such a big resort and it was freezing even in August!  The first day, the cocktail service was awesome, but the second day it was non existent practically. Hit or miss.
Spa: AWESOME, but very expensive.
Tower: the wait to go up and get down is ridiculous because the elevators are tiny.  The staff running them has no idea what they are doing.  The view was good though.  Go at sunset or night. 
The Best: the spa therapists are wonderful.  Their hands are magic.  Our first pool cocktail waitress, Nicole, was AWESOME and so sweet.  That girl works hard! The best was the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.  Definitely can't be missed.  The view, the food, the service, all was impressive.  
All in all, I think next time I go to Vegas, I would stay somewhere else.

As a hotel, it had much nicer rooms, buffet and so affordable than our usual hotel:) It is beautiful, clean and elegant.  However, I do have to give it only three stars simply because the hospitality staff was just not very interested in servicing us it seemed. It was our 20th wedding anniversary and we splurged a bit (for our price range).  We mentioned it to the check in staff  and they were so busy gossiping and talking about themselves to themselves, it was like we were interrupting THEIR conversation and they were on auto pilot ignoring us completely.  Not a great first impression. 

Then, when we signed up for the Total Rewards program, there was an error (which totally happens, we are all human) and when I went the next morning to redeem my promotional $10 because I had played there, the guy behind the counter could absolutely offer no solutions.  He was more interested in who screwed up then how to fix it and in the end, it left a very bad taste in my mouth.  

I point blank asked him, "So there is no solution you can offer me here?"  Too be honest, I watch Hotel Impossible ALTO and I was mostly just curious on how he would respond because it is nice to give someone the opportunity to keep a customer, but he had no interest at all at finding an option and basically just walked away from us saying no, probably thinking we are not "Big Fish" and not worth the effort.  So after that, we just went to other casino's surrounding the hotel. Which, too be honest, were far superior and happy to see us lose our money there. lol  But at least we felt valued there enough to give it to them. Oh, and very FEW cocktail servers around the game machine.  So again, why bother.

All in all, I loved the rooms, the buffet (get the Buffet of Buffet special if you go) and loved the look of the casino area and I will stay there again, but very likely, will just stay and go next store to gamble again.

It's a fun casino with fun guests with whom you can instantly connect with.  Hosts, security and EVS were all polite and helpful.  I disliked the dealers and bartenders.  I come here often for the lounge at Le Caberet.  Paris chateaux and their high end restaurants are pretty steller.  However when I think hotel & casino.  Rooms and gambling are most important.  I get upset staying here and gambling.  You're better off at Ballys or Harrah's

paris only received two stars for a very simple reason. a very bad experience for me with the valet service....
the casino itself is sub par - given the effiel tower is a nice sight to see - if you're looking for a euro ambience i'd recommend the venetian or ceasars palace over paris. the staff (during the day) was more suiting for the Mandarin Oriental as 75% of them were Asian so i didn't feel as if i were in Paris - the decor and sky painting on the ceilings lacked a wow factor. not as mesmorizing as ceasers palace or the fresh feel of the venetian.
as far as the valet service goes - the drop off was as easy as any other hotel there. but as paris was a quick stop before the airport for my friend and i... when it came time to get our car it took 18 minutes of standing there waiting and watching everyone come and go but us. when i asked the valet attendant what the hold up was he said "it's coming. just wait" unacceptable by my standards. would have been much faster to park my own car.

Stayed there this week . Nice property, good buffet, but watch out for all the added charges . Extra fees ala the airlines for early check in, late check out, the $20 daily resort fee covers only one device for wifi Internet, other devices cost 15 each per day. They nickel and dime you to death here. The housekeeper didn't show up til 4 pm, the pool lounge chairs were in disrepair. Maybe Paris\/Ballys Should take Some of those extra fees they are collecting above the room cost and repair the pool chairs and hire more maids so the room will be cleaned before 5 pm!

This is a nice hotel, could be 4 stars easily, but greedy and ineffective management reduced it to 2 stars so people are forewarned that the additional gouging fees are coming and you dont get shocked. In this Ballys hotel, you're not a guest, your a TARGET! We will go elsewhere next trip. No more Ballys houses for us!

I stayed at Paris with my best friend in June '07 for a girls' weekend. We arrived around 11pm local time and they didn't have a room available that we paid for. They upgraded us to a suite for no extra charge and we would get our regular room the next day. The suite was amazing. It had a wonderful view of the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio. We were totally exhausted, so it was wonderful that they made that part hassle free.

The regular room was a standard hotel room. The view wasn't as nice, but it was a perfectly good room. 

The pool area was really nice. We went every day we were there. It was a bit surreal to be laying out under the Eiffel Tour, but enjoyable nonetheless. The location of the hotel was ideal for first time travelers. They're right in the middle of the strip. It was great to know that we were in the middle of all the action.

The spa was a different story. I called to make half day appointments for both of us and was told that it would cost $550 for each of us. I thought it was a little on the cheap side, but believed the person I spoke to. Big mistake. When we arrived at the spa, we were charged $550 each and expected to tip each of our technicians. The man at the desk wasn't very helpful either as he wouldn't let us cancel the parts of the day we didn't want. It was unclear if the spa was operated by the hotel or if it was a separate entity, but it definitely left a sour taste in our mouths.

I gave them a 3 overall because of the spa incident. In my opinion, something like that shouldn't happen at a hotel that claims to be so high end. If it does, then the staff should try and remedy the situation rather than being stubborn and unhelpful.

The room is pretty decent and the La Creperie restaurant was pretty good. But I have called housekeeping services for my room twice in the past half hour and no one has come to my room to do housekeeping.

Recently stayed at the Paris Hotel for 4 nights and LOVED it! We got a good rate from Kayak.com. The rooms were large, comfortable, and clean. The bathroom was huge too. Some of the decor and the TV were a bit dated but that's not a huge deal. Access to elevators is centrally located in the hotel and the signage is abundant and clear. 

The staff at the Paris are all wonderful - from the front desk to housekeeping. Very professional and helpful.

The location on the Strip is excellent - right in the middle of everything! The restaurants within the Paris are great too - Mon Ami Gabi, the Paris buffet, etc. Paris is also connected directly to Bally's which is very convenient. No need to go outside!

The pool area is pretty big and offers a great view of the strip. Waitresses are abundant, the pool is clean, there are sunny and shay area, and the towel service is very nice.

The gym\/spa at the Paris is pretty nice. The reviews for it on here are bad but when I checked it out for myself, I thought it was fine. See my separate review for that.

Other nice points where that they offer express check out (no need to wait in the long lines twice) and they give you the option of billing most things within the hotel to your room (gym, spa, etc). The only somewhat bad thing is that the WiFi is for a fee which is crappy.

I would absolutely come back to the Paris anytime.
Great place! Perfect spot on the Vegas strip. The restaurants were all great. Room was nice and comfortable.

Should have checked Yelp before booking, but since I've been to Vegas before and had a good time at Paris, I thought my stay here would be nice... 

Extremely crowded, their buffet is running some specials, so that makes the hallway always pack, it's poor design to have to travel through the main path between registration and guest elevator.  Should have taken a picture of their buffet line, it's worst then DMV.  

Room is old, although non-smoking, but i can still smell cigarettes everywhere.  Shower is weak, tub and sink looked very used, and some tiles have cracks.  

$29 bucks resort fee does not include coffee was the first in my experience, spotty wifi, and it's winter so the pool is useless.  I'll just chuck that $32 (with tax) into my room rate.  No wonder it was so cheap during Christmas week, total average about $100 a night.  Good thing I made some money from their tables.  

Only thing going for Paris is the location.  Then again, if it's not because it's across from Bellagio, I'd have stayed at the north end of the strip.

Will not stay here again...

Location, location, location! This hotel is in the epicenter of where you want to be on the Las Vegas Strip. It is directly across the street from the Bellagio and just between Caesar's Palace and the Venetian. We found an excellent deal for this hotel online so we booked it for Wed-Fri. The price was impressive for a hotel off the strip and we were not at all disappointed by the experience. We arrived from the airport around noon and had to pay a little extra for early check-in - not a problem, as I was warned about this in advance. Our room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable and the bathroom was huge. The hotel's pool is an excellent way to stay cool during those dreadful hot days. The Eiffel tower shadows about 3\/4 of the pool so the water stays really cool. The drinks from the pool area bar are crazy overpriced and a little on the weaker side but that is how the pool scene in Vegas goes. I didn't get to try any of the several fine dining options in the hotel but we did order breakfast for dinner room service one evening before heading out to the show and it absolutely hit the spot. We will definitely consider staying here again for future trips.

This place is rude. They have one baby changing station in ONE bathroom not that I need a changing table to change my baby. I was told by the maid to use a different bathroom after being misdirected three times. Get your shit together! They're signs are in French. Wanna be. They're so broke they can't afford to put signs up for their guests or have changing stations for families that travel. Obviously they only want young and drunk people who couldn't afford to stay at their hotels. Restaurant been serving the same food for the past 5 years and it costs $200 a person. You have to pay to use their Eiffel Tower elevator to see the strip. Nothing new and nothing's changed except the people here are rude and without perspective. Take your money elsewhere where you'll be treated like royalty and with respect without judgement. I'm never staying here nor eating here. Played out.

**Review of the Poker Room only**

First time playing here was over the weekend.  Actually it was the first time in Paris resort.  Cool place IMHO.  I like the poker room because the wait wasn't that long and it's inside the race and sports book room.  Sooo, there are a ton of big flat screens that you can watch all the games on - nice.  I did get yelled at for texting. Since it's in the sports book you can't use your cell.

Location is ideal - right in the middle of the strip, across the street from the famous Bellagio fountains (which I could spend hours watching!).  Love the ambiance with the Eiffel Tower, the sky-ceilings, the feel of a Parisian street.  

The price is pretty reasonable.  Lots of food and drink options.  Connected by indoor walkway to Bally's. 

I love, LOVE the way the rooms are decorated - beds are very soft and comfy!  The bathroom was a little bit of a letdown.  The bathroom is advertised as "separate bath and shower" - which is accurate.  Possibly based on other hotels I've stayed at, i was frankly expecting more than a standard bathtub like I have at home, with a shower (non-adjustable head) next to it.

Next time I'm in Vegas and i get to choose where I stay (instead of business trips where I'm told where to stay), this will be one of the first ones I check.

My husband and I usually stay at the Las Vegas Hilton, but he got us three nights for free at the Paris.  
I absolutely love this place.  Out of all the hotels, this one was my favorite.  The atmosphere felt like you were in Paris. Rooms were clean and great decor.   Many great restaurants to choose from which were delicious.  You are in the middle of the strip (if you don't mind the touristy crowd) which is ideal.  
I like the casino gaming areas, which had a great selection.  
The staff was helpful and very friendly.
Overall a great experience staying here.  I would come back again.

Good Spa, good quality food, good rooms ... Not the Ritz, but a great value...

Wish I had won in the casino!! LOL

Enjoy this Hotel!

The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the room service was really good. Let's start from the beginning first we stood in a line for over an hour because they had 2 ladies up front. Finally they send out another lady Corrine and she asked for my name she Told me I only had 1 room I politely corrected her and said no two as she looked at me as if I could afford two of there subpar suites. She keep making slick comments until I finally snapped and was rude back. Then she changed her attitude I guess she didn't want it that day. We finally get to the room ugh....The room was terrible I felt like I was in a roach motel. You lay on the bed and it sunk to the floor. If you want to lay in bed to watch TV normally you just open the armoire but of course not here they were to cheap to move it. You had to literally roll all the way over to the end of the bed and look around the armoire. And to bad for the person laying next to you. They just can't watch. Needless to say I WILL NEVER stay here again.

i stayed here  during a recent trip  and found it  quite nice ! 
first i have to say thanks to the  front desk as they upgraded me to a suite  upon check in  which was very nice - i had a great view of the  Belagio fountains  from the 29th floor  a corner suite ! 
the room was immaculate  and kept  clean  all during my stay  and i got clean sheets  without question  when i requested them .
the only problem i had was that the air conditioning made the  room extreemly  DRY   and i was forever trying to invent ways to get humidity into the air  by wetting towels  and filling the tub with water ... and nothing seemed to work  LOL ! 
also  it was a little bit of a walk  to get to the monirail  on which i was dependent for transportation to and from the convention hotel. i had to navagate both the Paris and  Balleys  to get to the monorail 
kudos to  room service !  i ordered breakfast one morning and they were  PROMPT !  i had food in ten minutes  flat !
I enjoy this hotel for location and overall feel. Unfortunately the beds are quite uncomfortable and the sheets feel like sandpaper.

stayed here for the first time this weekend. it was nice but not great. one of the house keeper was really mean. i asked her for extra bathroom things and shes like WHAT? YOU DONT HAVE ENOUGH? and im like no... she gives me only shampoo and i had to ask her for each thing that i needed. the other ladies were nice... it was just that one... 

casino took all my money... but i guess that wasnt its fault haha. 

went to their steak house... wasnt anything too special. just very fancy.
I come here when it was new.  The shower was awesome with the hot tub.  We had a fancy room, they hook us up.  We had  nice view overlooking the Vegas strip.  It was beautiful.

Location was extremely convenient, located on the Strip. We stayed 3 nights and the staff was very helpful and accomodating. We were on the 18th floor facing the pool, the eiffel tower and the Bellagio Fountain. We found our window to be the best show for the fountains, the view was perfect! I found the entrance to the Paris to be spectacular and mesmerizing. It truly gave a french feel to it. French-inspired bar called Le Central offers the best drinks ever! Food at the buffet was decent. I will certainly return! Merci Paris Las Vegas! :D

Eifle Tower- The hotel was overwhelming when we walked inside to find the place, but we found it and we waited about 15 minutes to go into the elevator and as soon as it was our turn to go into the elevator we didn't realize how much we was going up I started to close my eyes due to the fact I was the person I front of the elevator doors so as we went up it looked like I was at the edge of the tower and my BF's knees got shakes but he shook it off and we ended up on top looking off into the city the view was great wasn't as scary, I thought the ride up was worst. But the price was $18 so it was ok. And it was a nice night out.

Excellent hotel, accept dogs and give you a set of plates for your furry friends, let them stay in the room without you, all the people are nice! Definitely I'll come back and highly recommend the place and the buffet there delicious! Try it once and you will be satisfied!

I really enjoyed my stay here. Lines were long during check in and check out. Tables minimum are $10 and up. I always get lucky in vegas. They put us in a smoking room the first night because they were all sold out but the room did not smell like smoke at all. Than the next night they upgraded us to a strip room view. Pool is awesome right by the tower and a good mix of family and young groups. Overall great hotel to stay in.

We have stayed at this hotel before with a fair experience. After this visit, we will never return again and intend to tell every human being, we know, the same. If you arrive early, there is no way to follow up on check in. So you have to stand in the growing line all day long to inquire as to the readiness of your room.   In this day and age of technology, I ask your CIO, what are you doing about this?

Ugh. The beds at Paris were the only thing worth talking about here. The beds are super comfortable and the room itself is nice. The casino itself is oddly laid out and the restaurants were nothing to speak of. The casino seems old and outdated in an unpleasant way. We spent far more time out of the hotel than in it. The pool area was ok - I liked the lay out for the most part and it was never super crowded. Though they did play music hideously loudly all weekend - that was a turn-off. We wanted to relax at the pool - not get blasted by Pit Bull tunes. I wouldn't stay here again by choice.

Can i give this place zero stars?????  $85.00 for a "Deluxe" Pedicure and it was the worst, quickest, wambam thankyou mam pedicure.  Horrible!!!!!  They won't be getting another dime of my money.  If I could give this place zero stars I would.

I am sitting in my hotel room as I write this. My husband and I have been coming to Vegas every year for over 30 years. We try to stay at a different hotel every time. This hotel is well past it's prime. The dÃ©cor is faded and old. It needs a serious freshening up. They nickel and dime for everything. Extra $$ for early check-in or check-out, and a full day's charge if you are a few minutes late at check-out. It took 55 minutes to check in. The walls are like cardboard. I can hear my neighbors talking and every door that opens and closes in the hallway. The sign at the elevator says "non smoking floor." Boy is that a lie. Our room stinks! the hallway stinks! 
The only good experience I've had is the $750 I won at the poker machines. They won't begetting it back! I will gamble somewhere else.

For a "4 star" resort this place sucks. Rooms sucked. Casino floor sucks. Resort fees suck. Sugar sucks...the food was awful! And those big $35 drinks that have "8 to 10" shots...sucked. The 8 to 
10 includes liqueurs...boo! Shame on Paris for charging hefty prices and failing miserably when it comes to quality and entertainment.

Loved my stay here! My friends and I stayed in a room with a great view of the pool, their Eiffel Tower and some of the strip (which is great for taking pictures in front of).

- Nice View, right on The Strip 

- Ability to walk right to Bally's 

- They have a club called Chateau within the hotel ( which has a rooftop lounge and a dance floor.) As you check in, they usually give you free passes with each guest. 

- There's little eateries in there such as a crepe place and a pizza shop. The pizza place is okay, nothing amazing. 

- There's also a buffet, which is pretty good. Their desserts are off the hook though.

Nice Hotel and Casino.  Always enjoyed my stays there.  I think that most of the strip casinos are the same.  If you are nice to them, they will be nice to you.  That being said, I prefer the laid back attitude of downtown versus the over the top attitude of the strip.  It's a nice change of pace, but if you're into partying and doing the damn thang... till the wheels fall off, hit up the strip lol...

My friend has comped rooms here so I wasn't going to argue with him, who doesn't like a free room in Vegas? We had two rooms, one with two queen beds and one with a king bed, the rooms connected. Since they connected I felt like we had a huge room and found myself constantly walking back and fourth between the two. Rooms were clean and neat. 

I like the location of this hotel a lot. It's fairly in the middle of the strip. I went to Marquee night club the second night, it was a short walk. When I found myself craving earls sandwich I also walked there too! I didn't gamble much in this casino so I can't speak on that. 

Food downstairs was cool. There's pizza and a cafe and the buffet. Sugar factory is connected to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again because it is walking distance to other hotels.

I booked Paris because I received comp room and I couldn't resist, so I booked it right away. The entrance is always full of people crossing but so is Bellagio and Mirage, the valet area was taking forever to park my car but that was no biggie. Checking in took  20 minutes but the front desk woman was very friendly checking me in and told me the pool was open 24 \/ 7 but I should be cautious because of no lifeguards being on duty. That was a plus for the pool being open 24 \/ 7 but the weather was too cold to go night swimming. 

Casino wasn't as stuffy and was pretty clean to me. My room was very clean and updated with the flat screen TV and the mini fridge was a huge plus, so no need to bring coolers to Paris unless you have lots of food and drink to bring. It beats going back and forth for ice. The room was clean and has a French contemporary design and is not to shabby for a basic comp room and your hardly in your room unless you're here for work and no play.  :o

I request a non smoking king bed with a strip view but they they only had 2 queen so I opted for that. I do like looking at the view from my room to relax and enjoy the scenery but it was nice to get what I requested despite checking in late. 

I would come back and stay here again if it was comp and a deep discount. Even though they don't have wifi, the internet on my smart phone still works so yay for me. 

=)

I stayed here with my family this weekend. All in all, the experience was not bad. The location is great and the rooms are decent. I docked a few stars because the housekeeping isn't the best. The room was a little dirty when we arrived. Could have been cleaner. Most of the staff was nice but some of them were rude, which is not acceptable. The pool was nice. Nothing special, but it did the trick! Of course, the drinks at the pool are overpriced. Everything in the shops near the hotel elevators is incredibly overpriced ($15 for a small sunscreen). 

All that being said, I would stay here again but only with the knowledge that it will be just ok.

worst hotel ever! check in was at 4pm, went at 3:55pm and they said the room is not ready and its gonna be between 4-6pm. first hotel ive booked with a check in time between 4-6pm. i would have much rather have stayed at a beat up motel than here. worst experience ever

Pretty nice hotel. Felt safe there and it was well maintained. The rooms were standard and probably similar to most you'll find on the strip. Service was friendly, prompt, and welcoming with the exception of one dining experience out of two at Mon Ami Gabi. It wasn't hard to get drinks in the casino while playing slots which is always a huge plus. The pizza place was so-so but the crepe place, both located in the main lobby before the connecting corridor to Bally's hotel, was soft, sweet, and flavorful.

There are very few things I can say good about the Paris Hotel. So I will say them now. The view from the Eiffel Tower room is awesome. The hotel is centrally located on the strip. The amenities such as the restaurants in the hotel are quite good.  And finally, the room is semi-clean.

Now for the not so good things. When we arrived, the valet placed us in the center of traffic in the middle lane so my elderly mother could not exit from her car without risking her life.

we waited in line to check in for an hour. When we checked in they told us that they couldn't give us our rooms because we were in early by an hour. They said however, the rooms are ready and if we would like to check in early that would be a $25 up charge per room.we chose to have lunch and then return back. When we returned back, at the designated time that they told us, they then indicated only one room is ready (despite having told us that both rooms already previously). The wait to pick up the keys alone was 30 minutes.

We got to our room and the room was not fully clean. In the words of my wife, the room was not maintained well. We had other people's personal belongings and mango juices left in our room, the stains were on the carpet. PS the safe didn't work.

Customer service from the hotel staff was abysmal. It's as if they don't care that you are coming as a guest and they use the word guest as a mandatory requirement. Nothing about my stay with Paris made me feel like I was a guest.

By the way, they charge a large resort fee and that resort fee enables you access to Wi-Fi and the gym in the pool.   

I asked to see if I can have my boarding passes printed, and they indicated that they couldn't do that I could try in the business center and that that would be a cost for doing so.

The breakfast restaurant floor was very sticky and did not get cleaned even after we commented about it. It was as if syrup had been spilled on the floor and nobody decided to clean it up. When my father asked for it to be cleaned up, the staff was very rude about it.

My suspicion as to how they get away with it in Las Vegas is as follows: one it's center strip; 2. beds are clean; and three there's just so much volume that they just don't care.

I was at the Paris for a conference and myself and multiple others all had issues opening the doors. The customer service for this was horrible. I had to wait a half hour while they sent someone up to open the door. Will not return with so many other options in Las Vegas.

We stayed here at the Paris hotel for the first time, over Valentine's Day week. The hotel itself is nice with the obvious French theme throughout. Casino is big with an expansive ceiling so you get the sensation of being "faux outdoors". 
The check-in process was not fun. Long lines, and they appeared to be testing a "self-check in" system, which was causing more confusion than helping.
Our room on the 24th floor had a good view of the strip and other hotels. Not a huge room, but large enough to be comfortable. I liked that our room had a separate tub and large shower. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very quiet (didn't hear the neighbors).
One advantage to being at Paris is the location. It is situated well in the middle of the major action, and also the tram station is right out the back door. When I say the back door, I mean it will still take you 10 minutes to get there. Remember the size of these hotels these days. . . But, the tram will take you all the way to the end of the strip North (Wynn, Encore, etc.).
TIP : For those that use rideshare services (UBER, LYFT, airport shuttles), the pick-up and drop off is at the North side doors. NOT the front door driveway. The rideshare apps will show them to be at the front door...

What happened to this hotel ? It used to be on the higher end scale and now it's almost at Excalibur level. The cocktail waitresses are rude, let me give you an example. The roulette table was full and I was waiting for a chip color to open up, meanwhile the cocktail girl comes up and asks if anyone wants beverages. I said yes, she right away asked- are you playing ? Uh, yea I have been for the last hour and right now I'm waiting for a spot to open up at this $25 min roulette table. She made a huge deal because I wasn't playing at that moment BUT was ok to take a drink order for some guys wife who was not even playing! She didn't get a tip. The hotel itself is very dated, the view was crappy, and they nickel and dime you for EVERYTHING. Parking fee $18 a day. $39 resort fee. ONE PERSON working the check in line. Extra $22 for checking in 2 hours early. $30 rollaway bed fee. $15 Wi-Fi - wait wasn't this part of the resort fee? NOPE. $25 spa fee. Ridiculous. I just stayed at the Flamingo and they had so much better service and a beautiful room facing the High Roller wheel. No wonder your casino floor was empty ! This place needs a major re-vamp.

when you step into paris, it's like you've entered a new world.  the ceiling is painted as clear blue sky and as you walk through, it's designed to make it feel like you're actually walking through the streets of paris the city!  beware of the mime and the people who pretend to be statues.  =)

stayed here over a thanksgiving weekend...the rooms were nicely decorated and clean.  the location on the strip is one of the best...it's right in the center of everything, next to some great hotels\/casinos like the venetian, bellagio or caesar's.  this is expensive...but you do get good quality and service here.

my favorite thing about paris is the food!!  by far, this hotel\/casino has some of the best food anywhere.  the buffet always has a huge line though!!  had the breakfast here...pricey but good!!  i didn't know there were that many different types of sausage to be had in one place.  =)  we also ate at the smaller cafe here too...food here is excellent if you're not in a buffet mood.  the bakery\/sandwich shop is wonderful as well!!  great for a morning pastry or a quick bite...salmon sandwich is yummy!  i did not get to try the steakhouse or other fancy restaurants but i know others who have and they all say they are great.  also, if you get a "yard" of alcohol...you can get it in the shape of the eiffel tower!  =)  i still have mine from our trip.

highly recommend paris...especially if you're like me and want to eat in the hotel you're staying in because you're too lazy to walk somewhere else  =)
Nice facilities, quieter than most casinos on the main gambling floor.

I had a great time here, they didn't have my room so they gave my wife and I a full suite at no charge. The suite was sooo awesome, it wasn't a hardcore suite but good enough I would suggest giving this hotel a shot.

As an hotel, Paris Las Vegas is a great casino. 
The casino area is beautiful, the Parisian village is cute, the buffet at Le Village is even better than the famous buffet at Wynn!  There is a gourmet burger restaurant between Paris and the other casino (can't remember the name) that is really gourmet and still well served, good portions, great taste - and I am not a burger lover!  
Said that, the hotel needs a urgent reformulation.  The furniture look old, the mattress is saggy, the pillows are cheap, the wall papers look dirty and the one in the washroom was falling down. My husband had to call room service for cleaning the bedroom for it smelled dust. No charming at all when you pay full price.  Besides, the pool only works from 10 to 4 PM, and they charge you $40 dollars a day more for the view that was not this fantastic AND you pay extra $20 dollars for internet each equipment!
Really disappointed!

We almost stayed here but a friend suggested the Venetian instead, and boy am I glad I listened to her.

We were still curious about Paris and since we were already in "Venice", we figured why not take a lil jaunt over to Paris to complete our pseudo-Euro vacation?

After walking a mile in 104 degree weather, I'll admit, maybe I wasn't in the most cheery mood.. but god damn this place was drab and dark! It felt old too to be such a new place.

The cocktail waitress came up to me as I was winning on a slot machine and asked if she could help me, I was about to order but she just walked away like a total twat! 

We did a lap and tried to find the beauty in this place, but couldn't so we left.
I definitely would not want to be a guest in their rooms if their casino and overall vibe was this lackluster.

The first time we stayed here, we were upgraded to a corner room on the 8th floor with windows on two sides and a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. We had requested the same online and still got a room with a half of fountain view. It was still lovely, very clean, a great view of the strip and our room was well maintained every day. If you park in the Paris parking garage it is one of the hotels with a shorter distance to walk from your car to your hotel elevator. Although we like the casino slots, we always lose there, never even get to hang on long enough to play for a while. Restaurants are excellent. We ate in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and it was just excellent and so romantic! We will stay at Paris again.

I've been staying at different hotels in the strip for a couple of years and the Paris Las Vegas is the worst I've been to. 

--------------------------------------------
THE FRONT DESK EXPERIENCE
--------------------------------------------
The beginning of the experience upon checking in was horrible to begin with. The front desk agent, Ms. Youngmi has inexistent customer service skills and should not be working in the hospitality industry. She was very condescending and never even bothered to make me feel welcomed in the hotel. 

I booked my room through Expedia, but through her own ineptitude she cannot locate my reservation. She gave me an attitude and insisted that the confirmation numbers that I have from Expedia doesn't mean anything on their computer system. She never made any effort to assist me at all even if I'm showing her the email confirmation from Expedia and the Expedia app on the phone. When I had requested if I can be helped by someone else, she said in a very rude tone -- "If I cannot find your reservation, I'm sure they cannot. Go ahead go back in line and have someone else assist you!" 

I've never been treated this way in a hotel before. I was so upset that I took her picture so that I can later complain about her. Note that I wouldn't take her picture at all if she wasn't rude to me in the first place. When she saw me do this, she insisted that I erase her picture on my phone and that she would call security if I didn't. I was standing back in line at this point and she was making a scene and everyone was looking at us. I don't like the attention especially if I have not done anything wrong. I didn't delete her picture and she went back inside and threatened to call security.

Eventually I was assisted by a more competent front desk agent who was able to pull up my reservation. Ms. Youngmi later came out with the Front Desk Manager On-Duty, Mr. Robert Leach who apologized for her agent's behavior.

However, check out this other Yelp review: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/paris-las-vegas-las-vegas-3#hrid:O_S76rqTGdsZpc20dPVkrQ Apparently it's for the same front desk agent, Ms. Youngmi. And this review was from last year. So maybe there is a pattern of behavior for this agent and it's not being addressed by the hotel.

--------------------------------------------
THE ROOM
--------------------------------------------
For the price, the room doesn't measure up to Aria, The Cosmopolitan, MGM, or Bellagio -- which are probably the same price range or only slightly more expensive. But the amenities those other hotels offer make up for the price difference. The Paris Las Vegas doesn't really offer anything special... except maybe for the view, which you could also get from The Cosmopolitan or Bellagio. 

Everything in the room looks dated and worn. The glasses in the bathroom even had a lipstick mark and a crack. This is considering that the room that I got was supposedly a high floor corner suite after I paid $40 to be upgraded to it (yeah I know after the horrible front desk experience I still had to pay for this). This non-smoking room also smelled of cigarette smoke all night. Good thing they took out the resort fee after I complained about this.

--------------------------------------------
BOTTOM LINE
--------------------------------------------
Avoid this hotel. You can get a better room from another hotel for a similar price (or maybe just slightly higher), but the higher price difference is certainly worth it. I'm just not nitpicking on the room because of my horrible front desk experience. But that experience certainly made me dislike this hotel with a passion.

This hotel has nothing to offer. Move on. Nothing to see here.

The only reason they are getting 2 stars is the great restaurants. My bed was hard as a rock, no cushiness, you could actually feel the springs beneath you. The pillows were terrible as well. I woke up this morning at 2am with the worst pain in my neck and couldn't get back to sleep- this NEVER happens to me. Motel 8 has better beds. The tv is not in the armoire, it's way on the left side of the room so it cannot be viewed by both people laying on the bed. Terrible design! Way overpriced for what you get. I won't be back if I can avoid it.

The pros:
-Great location (right on the strip in the center of the action).
-Good ambiance and theme (it's a little on the cheesy side, but this is what you should expect in Vegas)
-Friendly staff at the bars and restaurant (albeit a little slow)

The cons:
-The check-in process is a mess.  I "checked in" early via email, which somehow made it more difficult to check in in person.
-The layout\/numbering of the rooms is entirely illogical
-The dealers and cashiers on the casino floor are a bit rude

Stayed here 2 nights. Did not expect much from my hotel on this trip as I didn't plan on much sleep time.

Great location: center of the strip and directly across from City Center and the Bellagio fountains.

Breakfast was surprisingly good at their buffet, though be sure to get their before 10am when the 14.99 price jumps to 27.99 for no good reason (they call it 'Brunch').

Room was a very good size for the price, modern & clean. A fairly nice bathroom which is essential with any hotel stay for me. Bed was hard as a rock.

Casino sucked :(  Games were outdated, tables were filled with idiot players. Try MGM for better gaming.

All things considered especially the price and location, I'd stay here again, but not my first choice next go around.

Here on a conference, so I had no choice where to stay.  The hotel is EXTREMELY DATED.  It is dark and melancholy.  The casino floor is depressing, dingy.  The food is poor.  I wanted a King bed instead of two Queens and they said they did not have any unless I wanted to pay an extra $20 per night.  Huh?  Also, I arrived at 2pm and they charged a $15 fee for early check-in.

The room, although non-smoking, smells stale.  There is a rather ugly oversized wardrobe in the middle of the room and the tv is off to the side rendering it virtually un-viewable from the bed on the other side of the room.  I have an unpleasant view of a concrete parking structure outside my window.  I will NEVER stay here again.  Wish I was at the Bellagio across the street.

The event we were in town for started at 7:00pm,left the hotel at 6:15pm was in traffic on the strip for about 25mins.made my left turn in front of the Paris Hotel in the line for self parking 20mins.looking for a parking space 15mins.another 10mins.from the parking lot to the event,I learn a big lesson( monorail or cab )

This is the worst hotel you'll ever stay in. It may seem nice everything the rooms the facilities but the real catch is their guest relations. I stepped out of the room for 5 sec to help my mom and we both got locked out I just woke up and had nothing on me no shoes or my glasses I didn't even have a bra on since it was just outside the room to open the door. I had to call security to let me in but they won't let me back in the room because my name wasn't registered with my family who booked the room. I understand that they have a policy I waited patiently for them to figure it out. The security told me that I have to go down the lobby to speak to their manager and I did (again with no shoes no bra and I didn't have my glasses to see) it was very humiliating and insulting. I told them I don't have anything with me I asked them to just let me or escort me to get my stuff like my wallet ID or phone to call my family but again they didn't let me in. Does that make any sense? How am I going to help myself if I don't have my stuff not even my shoes I was walking around the hotel looking stupid. The hotel staff weren't even kind enough to assist me they had me run around the hotel and figure out how I'm gonna get in the room. With their policy I also have my rights! But they disrespected me and humiliated me. That was a bad experience. I've been to Vegas countless times and stayed at every hotel even the nicer ones but I was never treated badly and poorly as I was treated in this hotel maybe because I'm asian or not the same color as them? Idk I thought I live in America where people have rights. But I guess not in this hotel PARIS LAS VEGAS I will never stay or even gamble in this hotel ever again.

ONLY complaint: Room service STILL had not cleaned our room when we arrived at 2p from our excursion. Therefore, we called the front desk and was told room service has until 4p to clean your room. This was a great inconvenience since we had planned to come straight to our room and clean up after horse-back riding. We were extremely tired and "gross" feeling and smelling. WE HAD NO CLEAN LINEN OR BATH PRODUCTS....ugg!!

Other than that....We asked for an upgrade upon our arrival (our room was originally on the "mountain side"\/parking garage [as opposed to the strip side] ) and for only $55 more we received a "vegas strip view" [opposite the bellegio fountain and the water works show AND eiffel tower!!] on the 22nd floor and VIP lounge privileges (complimentary breakfast and dinner buffet and alcoholic beverages) on the 31st floor.

NOTE for Gamblers: The casino area is smaller than most I've seen. (Thank goodness I'm not a gambler, so this did not hinder my enjoyment.)


DINNER: We ate at the expensive Les Artistes Steakhouse. Expect to pay $90 for dinner and a glass of wine per person. I had the twin lobster tails and wine winner. (other meal was the special of the day) Both meals were great- although you could find the same quality of food for half that price. We were only couple number 4 of all the patrons eating in the restaurant [there was a private event on the 2nd floor of the restaurant- business types only). So if you want "privacy" and quietness this is the place...lol. I guess at these prices many people eat elsewhere... The service was good too!

Stayed here a few times this year and both times have been awesome. Every employee I either saw in the hallway or elevator were super nice and gave a great impression of the other hotel workers. I don't know about how it is to check in and out because I had it done for me by someone else, but I am sure its easier when you're a Diamond or Seven Star member (they have such nice lounges too). The room it self was very nice, I got just a classic room and the beds were very comfortable and the whole experience was great as always.
Great place to eat and stay! I don't recommend you gamble here though. The dealers are real stuffy... unless you are into that.... then hey, here is your place!

I spent only one night here and then moved to Ceasar's Palace the next day. The room was "clean" and everything. Nothing to complain about for its price and everything. 

I entered the room, took my flipflops off, opened my luggage to organize my toiletry and makeup bags, went to the bathroom, and then I felt irritation on my right foot below my ankle. Well, well, well, I found a flea-bite looking red bump. Some time later like less than hour, the red bump became bigger and turned into like a blister.

This happened on 9\/19\/13 and today's 9\/23\/13. The bite is still there, often irritating and tender\/sore. I think I'm allergic to dirty carpet???

Well I heard other will soon follow but for openers, 20 bucks to park the car!

The casino looks nice. Nobody winning at all:  it really only draws tourist as its kind of trendy.

The room was upgrade to 375 a night and it was horrible. Definitely on the low end of all the other Hotels.  Small, uncomfortable, half pillows. You can hear everything and I do mean everything being said in the rooms on both sides of you.  

If you bring. The wife and she tries to wash her hair, you're in trouble cause  he water pressure is non-existent.  Horrible: 

Circus Circus will give a his place a run.  I have stayed just about everywhere on the strip, looking for nice Hotels and Casinos.  This pace is horrible!

I am so disappointed in the hotel. We have stayed here before and have never had any problems until this trip. We were put on the 16th floor and our hallway smelled of wet carpet and mildew. The wall paper was peeling off the wall and you can see water damage and mildew on the wall. We woke up to no hot water and did not have it for the entire morning.

As far as hotels on the strip go, you can do far, far worse than the Paris. I had the "Luxury" room, which is the lowest on their scale (it was a free comp stay). The room was much larger than I expected, especially the bathroom. Real nice bathroom with a separate tub and shower.  It might be a little dated, with the old school tube TVs, but for the price and location you won't get much better. If you need a very nice, newer room with all the little extras you won't enjoy this, but if you just want a room similar to a Holiday-Inn right in the middle of the strip, you won't regret this choice.  The check-in lines can be long. I arrived on a Monday at 2pm and it took around 30 minutes to get the keys in my hand. Room service is a plus, not terribly expensive and it was always quite prompt. The servers were always very pleasant and made sure we had everything we needed.  The restaurants are decent, but I found if you walked the Paris street on over to Bally's (attached to Paris) and take a right, past the Bally's casino bar, you will find a sweet mexican food joint called Tequila Bar & Grille. It's great for late night snacks for sure!

Paris is one of the places to dine and hang out with your posse. It stayed the same throughout the years with some minor changes but still leaves you lasting impression.

Finally got the pleasure to check out this hotel! To celebrate my sister's bday, we got comped two bedroom suites and club passes.

Our rooms were clean and spacious with connecting doors. Our bellman and guest services were attentive and efficient. Our cousin got the pet room and was provided with additional pet amenities.

Pros:
*right in the middle of Las Vegas Blvd
*value
*Across from Bellagio fountains
*Mon Ami Galbi

Worse old room ever... Horrible view... Am very disappointed...Had stayed here before, and never gotten such a room with old carpets...when I asked about it, they told me I was in one of their old rooms.. But if I wanted an updated room I had to pay 40.00 more a day.....nobody asked me if I wanted an old room when I booked it... Nor did they mention it...all I was asked was how many people and how many bed .. There is 2 of us and we asked for 2 beds...and I gave her my card.... .. I used to love this place... Owell everything else is nice and I love the food... But I won't stay here again...the stars are for the food and the hotel area....

Decided to try this hotel due to its location. We usually stay at MGM properties (Delano, Mandalay, Excalibur). I have to say this was the worse hotel I've stayed in on the strip. Check in was at 4pm via a kiosk, if you wanted to check in any earlier, it was  a $20 charge. I've always checked in early at the MGM hotels, sometimes as early as noon with no charge. The resort fee includes wifi, but only 2 devices. More than 2 devices are an additional 10 bucks. We stayed near the pool on the 4th floor and it was so loud we couldn't nap in the afternoon. To make it worse, the Gardner started up right outside our window at 7AM! We tried to complain but the staff was so rude. Never again...going back to MGM.

I expected better. We were very itchy sleeping on the bed, the pillows gave me a stuffy nose, may be this room was not occupied for a long time, I dont know how so much dust accumulated on some of the furniture. The AC would cool the room only if I set the temperature to like 68f the room was too hot when I set the temperature at 74.

Village Buffet not worth it. The long wait is to be expected but once in, the place is chaotic, very noisy with dishes clanging, cleaning carts sounding like jets taking off rolling on some kind of stone floor. Food was not that good and the plates the offer are saucers. King crab legs should be called king spider legs and they don't give you implements to crack them open to get to what meat might be in there if you can crack them. I had the feeling they were offered so they could advertise king crab like the other buffets in Vegas. Rest of the dishes were run of the mill, nothing special, so overall, not a good place and service was bad as well.

I've stayed here once or twice before...decent size rooms, usually a beautiful view for the strip view rooms. There are so many on the strip to choose from but I really enjoy the localized shops and places to eat for this side of the strip that is connected with Paris. Plus the pool is beautiful and almost always available. Try at least once.

Ah Paris!  Maybe not quite the sameas heading over to France, but the Paris hotel of Vegas is a fun, romantic, sexy place. Nothing like looking at smoking hot girls dance above your blackjack table! The rooms at Paris really are not that bad. The suites are interesting. The one I had , had two bathrooms. One with a shower only in it and the other near the living room area of this small suite had a hot tub in it. Don't see that everyday or at any other casino i have stayed at in Vegas with that type of setup.. The dealers and employees at this hotel are very friendly and the restaurants were excellent. The gambling area at Paris are not very large and can get crowded but that smaller area is really visited frequently by the beautiful cocktail servers. I literally never waited once for a drink. This is a fun place and is a great place to take your significant other!

I'm gonna be honest, the only reason why I'd give this place 4\/5 stars is because I won $45 with $3 at the penny slots and the cocktail waitress introduced me to an awesome drink which will probably be my new starting drink-L.A. Water...mmmmm!

Oh and this place was GORGEOUS inside! Even though I didn't get to explore much of it, but still-Paris Las Vegas left an AWESOME impression on me and I'll come back whenever I get the chance!

Paris was our abode during our stay in Vegas. It was my first time here and I picked it solely on looks, call me vain, and because we planned on purchasing a buffet wrist band ( more info to follow in the Le Village Review). Although I booked the room, I can't in the slightest remember the price. We stayed mid seek (check in Wednesday - check out Friday) with a AAA discount; maybe $250-300? The room more than adequate and I loved its short walk to the garage, reception desk, and buffet line. When passing through the gambling floor there was relatively little to no smoke, a biggie for someone who wears contacts.
We selected the luxury two queens non smoking. It came with two queen beds, of course, flat screen TV, dresser\/closet and a large bathroom (a necessity with 3 women staying in the room). The beds were comfy and the sheets warm without being rough on your skin. The TV was placed on the left side of the room, next to the window, but it wasn't difficult to watch from the right side bed. The bathroom was something I wish I could have at home. It was warm, light amber marble through out with a his + hers sink, a separate jacuzzi tub and shower. The commode was placed behind a quarter wall so there was some privacy but not if someone showering. Heads up if you have bad balance, the marble becomes slick from the shower. I thought it was just me but everyone had this issue even when we turned the shower head to the far wall. Slip hazard!! We went through two bath mats each day while bathing. Paris needs to better seal the bottom of these shower doors. 
We made the mistake of ordering Wi Fi for $15 thinking everyone could use it. Wrong. The Wi Fi is only good for ONE DEVICE. Want to add another? That will be another $15, uh no thanks. Unless you are here for work you don't need it and even then I doubt you want to be working after hours in the city of sin. I would definitely stay here again but I would love to try out a Red Room Premier and see the pool. Need to verify if the pictures do it justice.

Stayed in Vegas for one night with my family. Was upgraded to room on the 32nd floor. The rooms were clean and views were spectacular but the furniture was too big for the room and the bathrooms were not very nice. Did not care for the dÃ©cor but the views made up for everything else.

You've got to love it when you get in to Vegas at midnight, check in, and on the ride up to your hotel room, you're in the elevator with a hooker. 

At least at the Paris, she was a high-class hooker. Ha! The hotel overall is nice - not amazing, but nice. Room service was spot on - we got breakfast twice and lunch once and they actually got it all right, special requests at all. And, not that all I think about is food or anything, but the eclairs downstairs are really good too.

I'm not a gambler, but have heard that the Paris also has tables great for casual gamblers where you don't have to bet your first-born to play blackjack on a Saturday night.

Paris is ... OK.  Stayed here back in January 2006 during a vacation with my co-workers, courtesy of the VP at my office.  That was over five years ago, but I do recall that my hotel room (standard, two queens) was kind of disappointing.  I had expected more from a hotel with a French theme and a construction cost of $785 million.  It reminded me of  a typical room in Downtown LV, but with a much heftier price tag.  TBH, I'm glad I didn't have to use any of my own money to stay here - but I still felt bad for my boss.

Despite this, my roommate and I (both non-gamblers) enjoyed doing a walkabout of the property and its various decor.  We didn't eat any of our meals here but I did discover the tiramisu (with an edible chocolate bowl) at one of the cafes.  I enjoyed it so much that, during my last LV trip earlier this year, I visited (but not stayed at) Paris once again to eat it again.

When I go back to Vegas in July, I'm most likely going back to Paris for the tiramisu.  I've actually never checked out the Eiffel Tower yet, so that might also end up on my to-do list when \/ if I stop by the hotel for the third time.

J'aime Paris ... la vie est belle ...

I have visited the Paris casino several times, but have not stayed in the hotel yet!  Definitely planning on it for my next visit back to Vegas :)  I have enjoyed gambling in the casino, dining\/eating, and shopping here.  They have tons of Paris memorabilia, Eiffel Tower souvenirs, Tshirts, and more cute stuff in the gift shops.  I have been to Paris, France, but there is something so cool about Paris Vegas, probably because it's in the United States and everyone speaks English, plus it's so exciting and all kinds of tourists everywhere on the Strip day or night!  It's in a GREAT location, right across from the Bellagio Water Fountains.

My #1 FAVORITE place is Mon Ami Gabi, I am sure I could eat here everyday of my vacation and not get tired of it!  I loved my Breakfast experience at this restaurant which has an awesome outdoor patio.  I recommend going up to the Paris Eiffel Tower.  It's smaller than the real Eiffel in France, so why not check it out in the evening, but be prepared to stand in line for awhile.  I think there is a fee, don't remember how much it costs?  I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant several years ago and had a wonderful Romantic dinner experience, but back then I wasn't on Yelp :(  Definitely would return again and I recommend making reservations in advance at any fine dining restaurant in Vegas, since it is constantly busy everywhere on the Strip!  Recently I went to Hexx Chocolate & Confexxions, I tried my first "chocolate tasting", very cool experience and you can see the people making the chocolates right in front of you.  They sell desserts, drinks, gelato, Vegas stuff, it's a neat shop to visit!  Right next to it is Hexx Kitchen Bar, it's two separate places with separate entrances.

Can't wait to plan my next Vegas trip, stay at Paris, and have fun being a tourist!  I never get tired of the Vegas excitement, there's so much to do and see, always enjoy my vacations here :)  Just try not to gamble all your money in the casinos ha ha!  It's waaaay more fun to go shopping, sightseeing, and eating at new places!

Meh. It took over an hour to check in.. That was my first impression so it kinda set the tone. When I voiced my concern to the lady checking me in, she apologized like it's pretty common to wait that long :\/ 
Hotel rooms were nice, nothing to right home about though. Overall, I was pretty satisfied with my stay.

I may come off as a bit biased, as this was my first ever trip to Vegas, but Paris is my favorite hotel in Vegas. Ha! The staff were impeccably wonderful, at any hour of the day or night. I don't think I've ever slept as well as I did in that bed, I couldn't believe the comfort! The hallways were clean and very quiet, which is always appreciated, especially in a town like Vegas. 

We even had a date at the Spa, a large group of 11 of us ladies. They got us in on time, kept us relaxed, and offered some of the best services I've seen in a spa. I was very impressed, and would recommend the massage to everyone!

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will certainly be staying there again myself. I may or may not have even considered stealing a pillow.... but hey, that would be frowned upon, now wouldn't it?

I used to be a long-time loyal customer of Paris Hotel. I stayed here many times during the past. I wanted to find out if the hotel provided fee wifi in the room. Because I couldn't find any information online, I had to call up the hotel. They told me that the rate was $14.95 per day (24 hours). 
When I checked into the hotel, my husband used wifi on his PS Vita and I used wifi on my iPad. We were staying for one night. I was assuming that we would only be charged $14.95 for wifi because that was what I was told over the phone. When it was time for me to check-out, I found out that they charged me TWICE for wifi! I went to the front desk in person to dispute the charges. The receptionist told me that wifi was $14.95 PER day PER apparatus. I thought that it was very misleading. I told them that I was told over the phone that it was just $14.95 per day, and we only stayed one night. No one made any mention to me that it was $14.95 per day per apparatus. The receptionist kept insisting that their policy was $14.95 per day per apparatus. I made it clear that this type of information could not be found anywhere online and not even when I inquired over the phone. I even told her that the LAX Marriott only charged one flat fee per day regardless of how many apparatuses you use. The receptionist told me that Paris Hotel was part of a different company (which was Harrah's) which I thought was a lame excuse. It was clear that they treated their customers worse here than Marriott. Way to go. I concluded that this was their cheap way to make a quick buck off a customer which was very unfair. 
Word of advice to all hotel owners: NEVER punish your most loyal customers unless you NEVER want them to come back.
By then I was very upset of having to pay another $14.95. I was starving and was planning to eat at Paris Buffet. But because of what just happened, my husband and I decided to eat at Wicked Spoon instead. We will NOT bringing back our business to Paris Hotel ever again! This is what they get for ripping off a loyal customer. There are plenty of better hotels on the Vegas Strip.

i hate you, stupid sports book.

no, i'm sorry.  i didn't mean that.  really.  i promise.  i'll be back, with lots and lots more money.  i'll even buy crepes next time i'm here.  and i'll eat at the burger place again.  we love the burger place.  i've never had pancetta before.  please, don't walk away...

le sigh.  i love you.

About to check out :) this hotel was pretty cool to stay in given the fact that its right on the strip. My fiance and I didn't have to drive anywhere besides to downtown. We usually come out here and further down the strip so it was pretty cool to stay on the actual strip for once. I recommend this hotel. Everyone here is super friendly. The front desk takes a while to respond, but when they do, they're very friendly. Will stay here again
The absolute worst heck in process anywhere ! It's not worth the hassle. It will take you an hour to get through a line to check in. Customer  NO SERVICE !!

I stayed here last year during a girls trip. I was a bit hesitant since the hotel got mixed reviews but I was pleastanly surprised. We arrived late thursday night and the check in was easy. We were able to get a free upgrade and were excited when we entered our room. The first thing we see is the view of the bellagio fountains, we were right smack in the middle, so every few minutes we'd get a free show. The room itself was tucked away from the other rooms which was nice when we'd stumble back on late nights.

The beds were comfy, the room was clean, and service was speedy. My friend locked her keys inside her suitcase and the front desk was able to get it taken care of immediately. My favorite part about staying here is the location. It's smack-dab in the middle of the strip, walking distance to Bellagio, Ceasars, and Forum Shops. It was also nice staying in a hotel where more families and older people stayed at. After a night of partying it was nice to come back to a quiet, clean, place to stay. 

I'd definitely recommend staying here again. Good price, great location.

This is a nice casino, not huge like caesars that takes forever to go through yet more than big enough. 

They have a really nice pool area behind the casino.  It's not extraordinary like Caesar's but nice pool and nice area to just lay down and read a good book. 

The room we stayed in was nice, not anything special. The only thing that stinks is their crazy WiFi policy to only allow one device per person staying in the room and you're still on the hook for the expensive resort fee. 

They have plenty of good restaurants and cafes. It's mind boggling that I couldn't find any good coffee inside the casino though.
All i can say is that they treat high rollers better at any other casino, the bartender at the diamond lounge on 3\/27 has no manners and is completely rude. No class at all.

My husband and I, and a group of our friends, stayed here during our trip.  The room were nice enough.  It was clean and comfortable.  The outside of the hotel is so beautiful with the Eiffel Tower and the balloon. We loved the Eiffel Tower shaped souvenir drinks--$17 and so fun.  Also strong so don't underestimate them.  The Eiffel Tower restaurant was very good.  The Cafe Il Saint Louis was awful so stay away from there. Chateau and  the Sugar Factory are fun.  You can get free passes to Chateau if you are a group of ladies.  Also they open up the Eiffel Tower as a club on Saturdays.  We stopped by and it was very fun.  The pool was quiet, like very quiet, but it was early March so that could change.  The staff was friendly. All and all it was a nice place to be and very convenient on the strip.  I would stay again for sure. Just stay away from the cafe.

My association held a conference here recently, which I helped to plan.  I will say that the conference staff is fantastic - very professional, eager to help, and obviously focused on giving you a great experience.  Our conference went very well - the banquet rooms are beautiful and while borderline gaudy, it is Vegas after all.

The food is quite good.  I'm a big fan of French food, and while of course this wasn't exactly authentic French, the catered food was great.  The crepe shop was always packed, but I managed to get one during my stay - packed with Nutella and powdered sugar - and it was spectacular.

The accomodations are very nice.  Rooms fan out in 4 hallways like a cross.  My room was a double (stayed in by myself - thank you company credit card) and it was a lovely room.  I got a good view of the mountains in the distance.  The bathrooms are beautiful - separate bath and shower, and all marble countertops.

My only big gripe was the check-in.  I had a late flight in and checked in around 11 or so, and only 2 positions were open, and there were obviously a lot of people from my flight staying there, so there was quite a line.  Check-out, as I understand, was also pretty crazy (some of our attendees complained) but I checked out using the TV service, so I recommend doing that if you can.  Also, wireless internet is like $14 a day.  Yuck!
