Casino is decent - I really only got 1 night to myself while I was in Vegas, but the casino is spacious, with nice waitresses and lots of bars.  All in all, I recommend, but more for vacation than a conference.  The place is HUGE and so it can be a little impersonal for a conference.

I remember being in Vegas when this place was brand spanking new, or very newly opened, and it was a big deal. OHHH, THE EIFFEL TOWER RIGHT HERE IN VEGAS! 

Now it looks and feels like a really cheesy version of what a Midwesterner who never left home imagines France to look like. 

The crowd here is an older set, so if you are young you're SOL. However, I doubt a bunch of rowdy party going twenty somethings are really going to be interested in staying here. It's kind of a downer and it's not really much fun.

The rooms are really boring (read: everything is totally basic) and I've been to Holiday Inns that felt newer and fresher. Nothing here felt Parisian. In fact, it looked oddly similar to a room in an Embassy Suites I used to go to often. Same boring neutrals, basic layout of the room. No frills whatsoever. The carpet is visibly worn in some areas and both in room and in the halls the wallpaper was torn or peeling. 

The beds were borderline awful. The mattresses were obviously cheap and old. Not only were they thin, the bed itself squeaked whenever you turned over or moved. The pillows were lumpy. Underneath the beds there was trash from a few other customers--I counted 4 discarded water\/soda bottles and some wrappers (not condoms) and a few clothing tags. The staff obviously just don't clean that well, because these were not our items. The linens were cheap and the blanket was probably standard issue in a prison before it came to Las Vegas.

The internet here is way too expensive and they make sure you pay for it wherever you are--you pay depending on in room or all over their structure and either by day or hour. No thanks. 

The bathroom was a little nicer than a run of the mill hotel bathroom, but the amenities were chintzy. There was no fan in the bathroom which is a big NO-NO for me. 

The staff were average to friendly and service was quick when we did need something. 

The cafe downstairs is incredibly overpriced. For one person to eat a sandwich and a soda is $20 without tip. Sorry, that's ridiculous for Vegas. Sugar Factory is downstairs in the main gaming area, and it usually gets crowded, their store is fun, whimsical and colorful. 

I saw Jersey Boys here on my trip, which was a treat and it was enjoyable. The theater is pretty small considering, and cheap seats will still get you a good view. However, it doesn't sell out as they tell you. There was an entire row of seats completely empty in front of us and all around as well. The shop for Jersey Boys was pricey, and nothing was under $10 (as in $10 for a magnet).

The rooms are cheap, but in this instance, you're getting what you pay for. Consider spending a little more and stay somewhere with more oomph. I know I will next time I go to Vegas. Honestly, the newly refurbished Flamingo looked a lot more appealing than this place. It is badly in need of a facelift and some sprucing up.

We reserved a room for 6\/25\/12. After entering our room on the 16th floor, I noticed a spot on the floor. When it started to move, I realized it was a cockroach, a big one. I killed it and dumped it in the trash can. When I asked the concierge what to do, she quickly gave us a new and better room, with no apparent insects. Although both rooms were nice, they hotel needs some work. The furniture in both rooms was chipped, the carpet in the first room looked soiled. Since the public areas are so nice, this was a surprise.

Additionally, the hotel charges $14.99 per day for internet access. This may be a new trend, but it is the first I have come across.

Paris used to be a beautiful hotel but when you're not in the main casino area with the shops and tables, you can tell that they've let the place get run down. I've stayed at Paris years ago and remember it being a much cleaner than it is now. I stayed recently over the weekend and the hotel room was pretty disgusting. There was hair on the floor, the sink was backed up, and the shower was dingy and dirty, one of the beds had very small dark spots\/stains on the sheets as well. Also, the beds were very uncomfortable and worn out!

Other items:

Food - The food is ok, nothing to write home about. Their buffet is probably their saving grace but it does not stack up against the newer places like Wicked Spoon and Caesar's. 
Casino - Didn't spend too much but they have at least all the basic tables and slots, but it is much smaller than other places
Entertainment - Did not watch anything this time so I can't comment
Pool - Didn't go into it but it's incredibly small compared to other places 

When you take a vacation, you expect to go to a nice, clean and relaxing environment and not go somewhere where you wish you were back home in a nice clean bed. Sorry Paris, you were a huge disappointment and I would never recommend you until you fix all of the problems.

Celebrating my last days of being 25 y\/o, decided to stay at Paris in Vegas to try it out especially since it was right in the middle of the strip. 

Upon walking into Paris from the parking garage, the air is smokey and it was hard to breathe. If you have asthma, stay away from here!

The casino was nice and small. Lots of cute shops, pizzerias, bakeries. Cobble stone floors and the decor transforms you to Paris. One thing I did not like was the casino, it was small, full of smog and the slots robbed you. Didn't win a single dime here. If you want to win big, there's a long walkway from Paris, past the parking garage and into Ballys (:

Tried the $20 dollar sandwich after Christmas 2011 and it didn't work. Primarily because 1) it was the holidays and 2) we arrived at 6pm. Asked politely if we could have an upgrade from a Red Room Luxury to a Red Room Premier, but the receptionist said it would be a $40 upgrade. So we took whatever rooms were left.  We were given a Red Room Luxury in the 28th floor, Room 48 & 46. It was alll the way down the hall. Room 48 was tricky because you see two doors: 2848 & 2848P. Don't get your hopes up when you think your room is the Petite suite\/Corner room with two windows. I did. Had to double check which room was correct. Room 2848 was smaller, with two queen sized beds. Room 2846 was larger, still with two queen sized beds. Everything was red! Rooms had a large flat screen. The beds were sooo comfy, but the pillows were flat. The tub was not large enough to be a soaking tub, as advertised on the website. However, the separate shower was sufficient. Rooms comes with complementary coffee with the coffee maker of course. Refrigerator was hidden under the television. Glad it was not filled with beverages that you had to pay for if touched. Kept the Bouchon Bakery macaroons and drinks there. 

WiFi was not free in the rooms. WiFi was an additional $15\/day. It was only free in one of the bakeries downstairs.

Overall, trying a new hotel was fun for a change. Probably will not return to this hotel in particular. But being a TotalRewards Member allows me to try out all the other hotels.

Hotel had mixed reviews but decided to
Give it a try ! Check in was at 4pm upon arrival the lines were super long with only 2 employees working the check in!! But they ended up getting more employees and it started moving fast! Got 2 rooms and was very very impressed, rooms were spacious clean and smelled good! Had no issues staying here, perfect location to walk onto strip! Will defiantly stay here again as it's my new favorite hotel on the strip .!

I am in love with this hotel. The first thing I noticed was the intricate architecture and decor. Whoever designed this hotel did a great job in recreating a Parisian atmosphere. I loved the color scheme in my room so much that I am adopting it for my new apartment when I move later this year! I stayed for two nights last week while attending WWD Magic. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. I got room service for lunch and dessert the first night I was there and was pretty impressed with the quality of the food. And, I loved, loved, LOVED the Sugar Factory. Even if you don't stay in the hotel, you must make a stop there while you're walking down the strip. The casino area isn't as big as some of the other hotels I've visited (e.g.: MGM Grand, Bellagio, Caesar's...but I don't think anybody's is as big as they are!). Chateau is a pretty nice nightclub, I really liked the outdoor area (the beer garden). If it wasn't so hot when I was there, I would've hung out there a lot longer! The thing I appreciated the most was the price. Considering that it's across the street from The Cosmopolitan and The Bellagio, you'd think it would be expensive. That's totally not the case! I was able to stay in the red room suite, and it was just barely over $100 per night after taxes and such. Thanks for a great time Paris, I'll definitely be back! You make a nice substitute for the real thing! ;-)

We have stayed at many properties and we find Paris to be our favorite. The reason? The buffet is good, the nightlife is exciting, The Sugar Factory is fun, Gaming is good with fine variety. Staff is mixed but in Paris it would be much worse. You simply have to try a bit of everything here. We love playing at Bally's best and that is just a short walk through the casino without having to go outside. The only bad thing is the Anthony Cools show, we hated it but others love it. It just felt fake. 

Make sure you take the time to walk through the Arc De Triumph (near the balloon) and take the Eiffel Tower ride. The view is incredible. Just don't go when it is very windy. 

The best reason for five stars, location is everything. Directly across from Bellagio and a short distance to all of the best places including Caesars Palace, The Quad and High Roller, Flamingo, Bally's, Planet Hollywood, and the Cosmopolitan. Save your feet by staying here center strip.

Hotel is about 12 years old which is ancient in Vegas time but is in very good shape and you can't beat the location. Price was very reasonable and they have early check in for $15 so you don't have to wait till 3 or 4 pm if you get in at noon. Room was decent size and clean. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. Pastry shop was hard to pass up every day and the Eiffel Tower restaurant is truly 5 star. Small enough to navigate around to the shops and restaurants and casino without getting lost like in some of the other hotels.

While the room itself was nicely done, the bathroom had a nice tub and separate shower and I had an awesome view of the Eiffel tower lit up at night, I was kept up till 4am because the Eiffel tower now has a club in the middle section that blasts music till 4am.  The rooms aren't even that close but yet it felt like the club was in the very next room. HORRIBLE! Tried going to sleep with a pillow over my head....didn't help.  Also with all the awesome pools that the hotels in Vegas have now a days the Paris pool is a big let down. Just a plain octagon shaped pool nothing special or cool about it.  Would possibly be willing to try here again in the winter months when I'm not interested in going to the pool anyway.  But would definitely request a room away from the loud noise!

First: I made our rez online and didn't realize that checkin was at 4pm! If you wanted to checkin early, there would be a service fee. Secondly, the checkin lines were HORRIBLE! We waited at least 40 minutes in line and they had only 5 counters opened. I could see the manager come out and see how things were going several times, and didn't even consider to open another line. The set up with the tv and frig was strange. The wifi was free, but for only one device. And if you wanted to add another device, it would cost $14.99. They offered us a strip view room for an extra $40. Skipped it. The swimming pool was great and the Eiffel Tower added some much needed shade in the 109* day we had.

I'm not a Diamond high roller, but I am also not the new Vegas tourist who fell off the turnip truck.  I maintain a higher level of casino play here, to where I get free rooms, free food, and other comps that some people may not get.

According to Caesars Entertainment, the people who own Paris,  the hotel Paris is considered more upscale than the other properties ( Flamingo, Ballys, Rio, Quad, Planet Hollywood, Harrahs) with the exception of Caesars Palace...  Yet, the past 2 times I've stayed at this property as a "comp" I get treated more shabby than the other properties.  Their front desk people who work the Platinum desk must be the punished ones... they don't get the Diamond \/ 7Stars desk, so they're demoted to help low rollers like me.

3 months ago, when I called to booked my room, I was transferred to a special VIP Marketing Department to take care of my free room.  WIth the 2 nights free room I also received free money to play on the slots.  The person booked me the "Red Luxury" room and told me that I'd be getting one of the nicer rooms in the HIGHER floors of the hotel.  He kept gushing how much fun I would be having.  

Fast forward to the arrival date.

When I arrived to check in,  this older lady who couldn't even smile asked me a string of questions like "smoking?" "King or queen?" which I replied Non Smoking, King, and a higher room with a view please.  She replied "Of course", and then promptly tried to give me the FIFTH floor, smoking.  WTF!?!   

5th floor is only 1 story higher than the ground level.  It wasn't a view of the pool, it was the pool!

I handed her back the key and said I'd like a higher room, please, non smoking, and with a view.  I also asked her if it was a Red Room and she replied "No, its a request only, and  comp rooms are only by request.  So, you got a classic room".  

Come on, you couldn't even LOOK to see if I could get a nicer room?  

Apparently anything I said, she gave me the opposite.  If I said blue, she'd say green.   I told her that I'd wait for a nicer room, and she said come back at 4.

The Classic room was "Just OK".  It was on the 12th floor (Room 1223) and it did face the Paris ball, overlooking the pool.  The room, however, smelled strongly of cleaning detergent, like they just shampooed it.  For a free room, it did the job.

I get it that I got the room for free, but I didn't like how the front desk treated me, like I don't deserve VIP treatment.  I dump a lot of money at their property (and it shows, since I'm bombarded by free offers every single week!) and yet Paris is the worse hotel when it comes to front desk courtesy.

In December I was in Flamingo, and they gave me a stunning 24th floor room with a magnificent view.  The rooms were actually nicer than the "Classic" Paris room I got, and location on the Strip was just as nice.  Even Ballys once gave me a corner suite, and I didn't even ask to be upgraded.

What gives, Paris?? Is recycling $20K not enough?  I guess not.
The restaurants were awesome! But the bartenders at the bars didn't care about you at all. Few of the dealers were cool. The hotel rooms need updated.

Wedding Package DO NOT DO IT!
The entire package sounded great online. We went in months in advance met our wedding coordinator all was good...so we thought. We paid in full and communicated with our coordinator via email to plan the details. It was like pulling teeth to have her respond to our questions. The Ceremony it's self was great the Pastor assigned was awesome. The penthouse was nice, but the A\/C did not work during our reception! We didn't get to ride the Eiffel  tower ride due to maintenance. We didn't get the free limo ride as promised. And the worst of the worst was the picture package...what a rip off. You only get  20 5x8 pictures out of the 400+ they took. If you want all the pictures that's an additional $850. The photographer captured loading docks in most of our pictures. When the lady showed us our picture she literally rushed us out as my Wife was crying. She said we only have 5 minutes left because her next appointment was soon. This entire process was so cookie cutter and not worth the money. I'm happy my wife and I are married, but given what we went through what nightmare. Ballys\/Paris do not get married here.

Probably some of the least impressive rooms I've ever seen in Las Vegas. The casino and Paris vibe are decent, but not happy with the rest of my experience.

The rooms are standard hotel rooms. They must've decided not to carry the Paris theme into the rooms for some reason. And there seemed to be a lot of wear and tear in the rooms. The TVs are old and the remote hardly worked.

The worst part was the nickel and diming. They wouldn't let me check into my room a couple hours early without paying an extra $25. Wouldn't be so bad, except their check-in times were like 4pm. Also, internet is not free.

I guess like everything in Vegas, the whole purpose is to get you there and then slowly take money away from you. For some reason I expected more from the Paris.

Never stayed here, but always a good lively vibe at atmosphere at this smaller casino. Cool to catch a drink in the bar area and people watch or drop by one of the pastry cafes in between Paris and Bally's for a nice snack. And for some reason, I usually end up winning money here. 

And for more cheesy Vegas fun, go to the top of the Eiffel Tower. Or grab a table along the street at Mon Abi Gabi and people watch over lunch.

Bottom line: Like it. Good vibe.

Me and my hubby stayed at this hotel many times. The room is not as nice as years ago. And if you are facing north and south you experience none stop music and noise. Our last experience was horrible. someone came into our room early in the morning and stole our money and jewelry. 
We came back to the room 5 in the morning and fell asleep right away cause we both tired. We woke up a few hours later and realized the money out put on the desk is gone, I checked the wallet in my purse, also gone. We lost 4K cash and two diamond rings right there in the hotel room. Of course we called the security and police, made the report. But nothing this hotel can do. They have no security cam in their hall ways. Yes. The don't. 
Weeks later, they just sent us an email saying they don't hold any responsibility for this crime happened in their room. 
They are not responsible for you lost either. 
Stay away from this crapy place.

I and my wife stayed 3 nights at magnificent Paris Hotel and we loved everything about this hotel especially Le Boulevard. Eiffel tower, Pool area, Gordon Ramsey steak house, Le Cafe, Napoleon, Mon Ami Gabi, La Village Buffet, La Creperie and many more were part of our wonderful experience over there. We won't forget our joyful stay at Paris Hotel not only because of the beauty of the hotel and it's wonderful atmosphere but also because of one of their front desk staff and her unforgettable customer service and care. A French (I guess) lady called "Corinne" who shines bright like a diamond on their front desk\/concierge area with her amazing work attitude, kind & caring personality and the last but not the least, unbeatable customer service. I would like to congratulate Caesar's Entertainment for having such a great staff like "Corinne" in their team. IMHO, she definitely deserves to be in the higher places since she really knows and understands the actual meaning of CUSTOMER CARE.

This was a fantastic hotel! It was my first time in Vegas so I can't compare it to other places there, but I really can't imagine a better hotel at that price, in a prime location, and with full amenities. 

The hotel itself is cute and right on the strip, which makes going to any of the other casinos very convenient. However, if you don't want to leave, there is more than enough to do within the hotel.

The rooms aren't anything special, but they were clean, stocked, and had awesome black out curtains.

The fitness center and women's lounge is great. I always appreciate when hotels have an actual gym with a nice locker room stocked with hair dryers, straighteners, lotions, etc.

I didn't ever get to the pool, but next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely stay here and report back.

I stayed here for 4 comp nights in a "Red Room."  I was a bit hesitant to book here because of a lot of negative reviews lately here on yelp.  But I'm glad I used my own mind and went for it.  

The room was stylish and clean, though a bit run down in places...but that's why there are currently renovations going on.  The bed was comfy and it was dead quiet every night, which is really important for someone (like me) who has trouble sleeping to begin with.  It is a standard room, so it is small, but still bigger than the standard room I had at Harrah's LV last year.  The shower was good: water pressure fairly strong and got hot right away.

The casino is very in keeping with the "French" theme, lots of nice details and plenty of photo opportunities.  Unfortunately, like most strip casinos anymore, the slots are very tight.  I played here every day during my visit and A LOT of $$$$ got sucked up much to easily.  My only other complaint about the casino is that is entirely too dark.  I know this is intentional to set a "mood," but someone needs to up the wattage on the light bulbs a bit.

I ate at Le Village Buffet here for breakfast and lunch.  The breakfast buffet is adequate (can't do too much damage to eggs, bacon and sausage), but lunch was kinda meager and disappointing.  The Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood has a MUCH better selection and quality of food presentation for the same price range.

The biggest negative here is the Diamond Club.  Service is great here, but the selection of food...oh, forget it, there is no selection!  Hot dogs and tortilla chips??  Harrah's in Atlantic City always offers several dishes, pizza, cheeses, meats and a good selection of desserts.  And it's Atlantic City for goodness sake!

Anyway...I have to give the overall service here a solid "A."  From the moment my friend and I arrived, to check-in, to ordering drinks, dining, room service and housekeeping, we felt so welcome.  Not something I'm used to at a Caesar's-run property.

I'll definitely be back, especially after all the renovations are done.

i stayed here but don't remember much else. there were gambling opportunities once you got out of the elevator.

the gambling area is covered by an all weather bubble permitting gambling all the time while giving you an expression you were outdoors.

that crazy sound that reminded one was in a gambling environment i was a sould i didn't like.

The location on the strip is perfect. We have stayed here before several times with good experiences; but this time, not so much.   We checked in online and waited only 10-15 minutes to pick up our room key.  Just stayed in room 727 for 3 nights.  Upon first arriving on 7th floor, we found a dirty sock and beer bottle in elevator area...these items remained until the second evening we were there.   The room was outdated.  View was standard bad view-rooftop\/side of next building over.  Thermostat was clearly not accurate and we had to adjust it down to 65 to be comfortable.   Tv worked well. Beds were clean and comfortable enough, though sheets were cheap, pillows cheap, comforter old and flat.  Bathroom was not clean upon check in- dried toothpaste on bathroom counter, dried foundation makeup (?) globs on floor, thick dust on top of mirror frame and mold all over the inside of the shower.  Room was in noisy area-we were awakened 3-4 times per night each night by people yelling or banging on doors.   The open bar near registration was redesigned and busy...we waited 30 min for the server, then my husband went directly up to bar to order.  Casino was pretty standard.   Mon ami gabi was great, as always.   Online checkout was convenient.   I doubt i will stay here again, given the options.

I love this place, Paris (the actual city) is one of my favorites in the world, and this hotel really does a decent job capturing its essence. Aside from the aesthetics this place is a huge pain in the Brie rind! My cell service is horrible, there is a modem in our room but a $15 per day charge for wifi (not to mention is only available on one device even after paying and horrible service), the cable is shabby and lacking of the most popular basic cable channels, and room service is full of fees and bogus charges. We are here on business and supposed to be given Diamond Club access but it will take them 3-4 days to "process"??? our info? Am I wrong to see that as completely ridiculous? And I know my cell service isn't the hotels fault but if I was allowed wifi I don't think my cell service would be such an issue. I shouldn't have to be dealing w my cell provider while away on business in Vegas. I feel almost trapped and kept from all basic conveniences in order to be lured downstairs into the casino and do not feel that my needs as a guest away from home have been considered at all. Also as stated, being here on business for a full week I would like to take it easy and relax being able to watch regular cable tv as I would back home after a full day of work. I feel at over $150 a night on the Vegas strip that it isn't far fetched to expect what the local Motel 6 offers and some.

Been going to the Paris for years but sadly it's gone so far down hill that my wife and I won't be staying there again.  Went there last month and again this past weekend and that's enough.  First let me say that the staff is as friendly and welcoming as they can be and it's rather the disrepair of the facilities and poor managing of room inventory that are the issues.  For each visit, despite paying in advance we did not get the room we reserved either time.  Neither did any of the other individuals in our party.  And yes, we booked through their site, not a third party discount site.  In fact in chatting with other guests at the bars and tables, it's clear they have a problem managing inventory as the frustration is a common topic of conversation in the casino.  I understand they can't guarantee every room upon booking, that's common.  But when check in is at 3pm and one arrives at 4pm, to be told they have no rooms available that night matching the type we reserved, speaks to poor management, especially when it seems to be a common practice.  They invite you to attempt to move rooms the next day which is likely why they can't ever seem to be caught up on availability.  Even this they can't get right as we were told we would have to be available in a three our block to wait for a room to become available and move our things.  I've traveled all over the world and this is the first time I've encountered a refusal of bell staff to move your luggage when the room I reserved was not available on the first night.  One guest services person we spoke with told us you can call 72 hours in advance to guarantee your room type but when we checked in we were told that wasn't actually true so we were at a loss there.  The gentlemen who checked us in, when pressed on why online check-in didn't hold our room casually commented the system "means nothing, I'm not sure why we have it."  Well done reservations management!  This however isn't nearly as frustrating as the state of the rooms.  Last month our room had dirty sheets, thin\/worn towels that had been used far too many times, and a funny smell.  This however wasn't nearly as bad as the leaky shower, leaky sink, and leaky toilet which caused water to pool on the bathroom floor any time any of these were in use.  My wife made the rather terrifying point that the towels are probably so worn from people using them to mop up the leaky toilets.  They indicate on their reservation system that some rooms have been remodeled so we decided to give them one more try and book one of those rooms for our trip this month.  SEE THE ABOVE ISSUE.  Someone needs to tell their marketing team that by publicizing newly renovated rooms which can't be guaranteed, that they are emphasizing the disrepair of the old rooms when you can't get the new room you thought you had booked!  On this most recent trip the safe was broken, the mini bar had been emptied and appeared to have been cracked or broken open, the bed head boards were so warn down that the stuffing was coming out of the covering, and once again the towels were awful.  I suppose at least this time the toilet and shower didn't leak.  Also, and I appreciate this is nitpicking, but the coffee bar in the casino was "out of large cups" on both visits.  On two weekends, a month apart, they ran out of cups by Friday.  This tells me either this is once again poor management or that they eliminated the "large" size due to profit margin and don't want to update their menu boards.  They want me to stick around and gamble but can't make even the tiniest investments to appropriately serve their customers.  There are too many places in Vegas now with nicer facilities that manage their rooms better to keep giving this place my money.  Moving on from Paris and all Caesar's properties for the time being.

This hotel is really beautiful from both the outside and inside. 

But it's so complicated to navigate inside. No signs. It's like being in the real Paris. A big mess

My stay at the Paris Hotel was surprisingly pleasant.

1 star for the location - proximity was close to everything\/everywhere that my friends and I wanted to go. 

1 star for the cleanliness - although the room itself was a bit out dated, the size of the room was more than enough for 4 people.

1 star for the restaurants\/shops inside of the hotel - extremely convenient for breakfast\/coffee.

Lastly, 1 star for the pool! If you don't want to spend money going to a day club, I would say that the pool here has a great ambiance\/music.

Checking-In was easy, and checking-out was a breeze. The view from our room was spectacular! Not only were we able to see the Eiffel tower, but also the water show in front of the Bellagio Hotel. I would recommend this place!

This was the absolute worst hotel we have ever stayed at. From the awful customer service to cleanliness to things being broken, it ruined my vacation and my best friends. The room was dirty upon arriving, our keys didn't work and the ice machines didn't work. Our water in the shower and sink was freezing and we called the front desk with no help, so We had to take cold showers for 2 days,  We received 6 wake up calls at 7am the first morning and 4 wake up calls the next day at 5am... none of which we asked for or ordered. This woke us up early and we weren't able to enjoy our stay and sleep in. The disrespect we received from each employee was unbelievable, they were so rude and didn't help with anything we were having problems with. The housekeeper saw us leave our room to go get ice... which was broken so we couldn't even get any ice .......and when we got back to our room our door wouldn't open and she said she wouldn't let us in even though she saw we had just came out of the room...
Security finally came 30 minutes later to say that our battery was dying to the key thing and we had to wait over an hour to get new keys. And no, we did not have our keys next to our cell phones where they might have been deactivated.
When we first checked in, the front desk associate automatically charged my card for the parking fee for 3 days without asking me and my friend was going to pay for that at the stand alone stations outside the parking garage, so thanks to him he charged my card without my consent when i wasnt even the one who was going to pay for the parking. The concierge was rude and smirkey when I asked about the Buffett, which we didn't end up going to because of the 100s of negative reviews towards it.
The beds were hard as a rock and cheese it crackers surrounded the beds which we noticed when we first got there.  We ended up leaving and staying at the flamingo for the rest of our vacation instead of extending another day at the paris hotel because of how rediculous the hotel and staff were. On our way out, my parking ticket wouldn't work and it was asking me to pay for the days again even though it clearly shows on my receipt that the front desk charged me (without my consent). After holding up the parking garage line, someone finally helped and opened the gate for us to leave. 
From the dirty room, to the cold water and broken key lock, the extremely rude workers, 5am wake up calls and everything else on top of that, I can say without a doubt this was the worst vacation I have ever had. Which is really unfortunate because my friend and I have been so excited to finally stay at the Paris hotel with high expectations. We have stayed at the mirage, the flamingo, Venetian, Excalibur, Mandalay bay, planet Hollywood, desert resort inn, circus circus, treasure island, new York, new York, and luxor, and this was by far the worst experience we have ever had. This is sad to say I would prefer going to circus circus or Excalibur over the Paris hotel, ever again. When we called the front for help with any of our issues we were constantly put on hold with no resolutions. The lines downstairs were so long to speak to someone to voice our concerns so I am doing it here. I would very much appreciate a manager to contact me, as I have also emailed the hotel to contact me, since they don't seem to have a complaint section. I have never made a negative review, nor thought it was necessary before. However this was the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. I have never felt more disrespected and the lack of service and kindness was not what we wanted for our summer vacation. 
Do not stay at the Paris hotel unless you want to ruin your vacation and waste your money.

Eh. But I guess we deserve that because it was one of the cheaper hotels. 
The sheets are like sand paper. The carpet in the entire room was wet -- not sure why...
Nothing special.
I just don't feel this casino is a good value. For the price of the room, the quality just isn't there. Our room had a broken lamp, no shampoo, lukewarm water, and dingy decor. Not impressed.

If you're going to Vegas for the first time or not stay here! I went for the first time to vegas and stayed with 3 other girls for 4 nights and it cost each of $160 including taxes! 
PRIME location! Seriously!! The staff was great, the hotel was beautiful and clean and close to SO many things! You won't regret it!

HORRIBLE customer service at the front desk by Youngmi. Let her name be known. YOUNGMI. 

I came here for work to attend the MINExpo at the Convention Center and was having trouble checking in because my name on my DL (my legal name) didn't match the name that the room was under (my nickname).

She was completely rude and condescending. She told me that her manager told her to call the lady organizing the MINExpo to verify that my name is indeed such and such.

I have no idea what the organizers of the MINExpo have anything to do with verifying my legal name. And I'm pretty sure it is not one "lady" organizing an event of this size -- 1,800 exhibitors and 45,000 attendees and you think one lady is going to have my name on a list?

She told me that she called the lady at the MINExpo and she was out to lunch. It's 2pm. Really? She's out to lunch? 

Had she been smart, she would have said I need to call the government to verify your name. Oh, I'm sorry the whole government is out to lunch.

I asked her, "Why do you need to call the lady organizing the MINExpo to verify my name?" and she says, "You don't understand what I'm saying?" NO I don't understand what you are saying because your excuse to not check me in makes absolutely no sense.

I asked her for the hotel number and this is the number she gave me 712-946-7000. She watched me write down the number and she looked at the paper when I asked her "Is this the number" and she nodded saying yes. Come on now this isn't a misunderstanding! Youngmi is giving me completely INCORRECT information for the hotel!!! The Paris Hotel wouldn't be so bad if it weren't for a shitty employee named YOUNGMI.
  
So Youngmi tells me because the lady at the MINExpo is out to lunch its going to take awhile to verify me name and she adds, "I highly suggest you check in your baggage and come back in a couple of hours."

Instead, I decided to stand there and make the situation awkward by lingering in front of her and made a mental note of her name YOUNGMI for writing reviews like this.  
 
Anyway the lady that helped me check-in once the name on the hotel reservation was changed, was completely polite and courteous. Until they decide to fire Youngmi I wouldn't recommend booking a room at the Paris Hotel.

I didn't stay here but we spent a little time at the machines at the bar and really liked it. I don't like gambling, find machines boring and tables expensive and sometimes boring too.

We were just sat having a beer, with the Parisian surrounds and a wonderful atmosphere. Whoever designed all of this has done a wonderful job because it feels absolutely magical.

BUFFET. (and SECRET TIP) 
If you are a fan of buffets I highly suggest the buffet at Paris hotel. It's a little pricey, but the food quality is great. It has a Euro\/ French theme. Here are a few items I liked: 
 1. Crepe bar. (made to your liking)
 2. Champagne served 
 3. Tons of shrimp and crab
 4. Ham, prime rib, roast lamb
 5. Good cheese selection
 6. excellent desserts

SECRET TIP: If you dont want to wait in the sometimes long line, pay the extra 10 bucks at the VIP line and get served immediately. It'll keep your stomach and wife happy.

Beautiful themed hotel but HORRIBLE HORRIBLE customer service 
First off I arrived at 8 pm and there was a huge line for check in. I'm sure this hotel has enough staff to put on duty for register\/check in. Yet they had two older women who looked like they dreaded coming to work and try to rush through every guest .
One older woman with the name of Jenny with horrible etiquette "helped" us but she had the WORST customer service. 
I only left this place one star because I have to but I definitely don't recommend this place .
And AVOID THE JENNY AT THE FRONT DESK with the horrible English (and I am Mexican myself too this is not a racial issue) & avoids letting you speak to her manager when you have a complaint by saying "I don't know where he went " 


OH AND ASIDE FROM
EVERYTHING THEY OFFER NO BELLHOP 
WE HAD TO CARRY ALL OUR LUGGAGE ON OUR OWN AND THAT INCLUDES MY DISABLED FAMILY MEMBER 

NEVER AGAIN!!!! 


TOTAL NIGHTMARE! 

JENNY YOU RUINED MY VEGAS TRIP 


FIX THAT ATTITUDE BEFORE YOU GET FIRED

We didn't like our stay. No coffee maker or safe in the rooms? Our first room was haunted and freaked us out! When we arrived our TV was on. We thought it was the maids so we turned it off and didn't think anything of it. My girlfriend and I unloaded everything off our backs and went down to play some games. We heard an alarm going off in the hall so we quickly went into our room. The alarm clock was going off for no reason so I turned it off. When we came back our suitcases were unpacked and we never opened them. The television was turned back on. My girlfriend was freaked out and did NOT want to stay in that room. The room felt eerie as if someone was watching us and it was cold. Our room was the color red as well, not sure if other were? When I went to call the front desk there was a note next to the phone and said, " Enjoy your stay, God bless :)." Okay, that freaked me out big time! "God bless?" Why would they say that not knowing the persons religion and a happy face? I'm religious but still...creepy. We went down and told the front desk about everything and they just laughed kind of knowing that it was haunted which I didn't like. They moved us to the 6th floor which was much much better and had a good stay after that. zWho knows what happened in that room. It was the room with the big hallway at the very end of the 18th floor so if you get that room peace be with you my friends.
Amazing place! We had a seminar there with thousands of people. It was well laid out. Lots of people in the Paris Hotel. But very much enjoyed the convenience of everything in close proximity.

To make a long story short, during check in the receptionist could not find my last name and refused to help because we booked through Vegas.com. She then refused to look up my confirmation number and refused to let us speak to the manager telling us "go call that company we can't help you. There is no room" and then throwing my ID at me. After waving down the manager when the women stormed off angrily because I refused to leave without speaking with a manager, he typed in the confirmation number and behold my room was there. On checkout the receptionist was busy arguing with a different guest

3 years ago i stayed for 5 days in the Vdara Hotel. A very beautiful hotel near Bellagio with access to the Strip. This time when i was booking my trip thru California, Nevada, Arizona and Utah i decided to stay 1 night in Vegas again. On booking.com there was a fair price for 1 night at the Paris Hotel in Vegas. After my arrival at 9:00 pm I parked the car in the garage and checked in at the lobby.  The nice lady gave me a great suite. After dropping my luggage I immediately went down for asking to stay another night. The room, bathroom and view were unbelievable. The Paris hotel is on his own already an attraction. Great, big and joyfull casino. Lovely stores and live entertainment. The second day I've visited Death Valley. It's like 2 hours to drive. In the afternoon relaxed at the swimming pool of the hotel. Paris hotel, I will be back

This hotel had it's ups and downs. Checked in late on Friday night and the non-smoking room we requested was given away so we had to settle with a smoking room. They told us to come to the front desk between 12-3pm the following day to change rooms since they gave our room away so we agreed. 

Next day rolls around and after a great time at the pool and gym we called and they kept pushing back the time on when the room would be ready. We wasted 5 hours of our day not being able to leave and waiting for our non smoking room to be available. For someone who comes for the weekend and hours are limited it really sucks to waste time. Finally they gave us a non smoking room after complaining for 5 hours and sounding upset. It was a big disappointment. I'm giving three stars because that was an awful experience but the hotel itself wasn't too bad. The room we got upgraded and it was really nice. 

On a positive light the hotel is in the middle of the strip and it's across the street from Cosmo and Bellagio. Had fun shopping and eating at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr place.

I enjoyed our stay here. It was a beautiful room and the staff was super friendly!! I'm not sure why some reviews are so negative, I guess it's all about the attitude you walk in with. Try to be more positive and maybe your stay wouldn't be so negative.

This hotel is a must see in vegas, I've stayed here once, but it wasn't a suite or anything so it was no big deal. Inside is cute since it has the bottom of the eiffel tower's leg inside the hotel. They sell crapes inside which gives you the whole french feeling. I haven't been up the tower but my grandma tells me it's just like the real deal! The restaurant outside in front of the hotel looks really good, since it's always busy. Playing the slots here is nice since they give you espresso shots and cappuccinos while you play. If you don't stay at the Paris Hotel, go visit since it's a vegas must see!
